reviews.review: Nice piece of history. If you are looking for something a little different in Thailand, this is it. Tours were available in a variety of languages. Interesting part of history. Great collection of artifacts.

A nice museum. It is interesting to see an oriental house of mid XX century, well maintained and with a lot of interesting things collected by the original Owner. The visit is well organized with good guides

Excellent tourist spot to check out one of the finest local cuisine and private art gallery. Peaceful and magnificent traditional thaï house that displays arts from South Est Asia. Easy to reach. I was wondering a bit why someone's house could be interesting, but it is definitely worth a visit. this is a house built by an American with much love & taste. Has some artifacts of Buddha that are way old

Very fascinating attraction. I had a wonderful experience there. This attraction is very popular for tourists. I spent time quite a long time there because the architecture and culture are mesmerizing.
Nice house!. I visited him Thompson house during my uncle visit Bangkok, and he really enjoy the show, dancing show and the staff show us how to get the silks from

Simply Amazing. One of the highlights of our day and half in Bangkok. The house and complex are built using historic building techniques. The gardens are lovely. The tour was well done. Great store, but things were quite pricey!

A beautiful home with a wonderful story behind it.. Jim Thompson, an American, began a silk trade in Thailand that still prospers the people of Thailand today. The home is very beautiful in the heart of downtown Bangkok. You can purchase beautiful silk clothes at the store on the home complex. They have a terrific first class restaurant in the complex as well. If you want to purchase silk thread to knit with, ask for it at the restaurant check out counter. The price for food, visit and silk thread is reasonable.
Pretty and calm. I'm not a lover of Jim Thompson products and designs but this was a bit of a green oasis in Bangkok. We ate in the restaurant- nice
Really cute . The house is very cute The staff in very welcoming and kindThere are plenty of flowers and tree It is worth the visit

Not that worth. I joined their English guided tour but the group was so big and could not hear the guide much. As they do not allow visitors to see around by themselves so no choice to join the group tour there. No fun.

Nice house tour :). A good place to visit to understand more about Thai architectures. It is located in the end of the alley so you'll need to walk a few mintues. Its alley is also on the BTS route so you can catch BTS or walk here. It is aslo near MBK and Siam DiscoveryTicket price was 150 bath included tour guide in different languages.

This place surprised us. We didnt know what to expect and were pleasantly surprised at what we found.A house full of antiques qith a great story behind it.The guides were very informative and entertainingRecommend you go
Historically old. Not allowed to take pictures inside house guided tour that finishes quickly there is a restaurant and bar if you want to stay on

Lush gardens, interesting tour and great food. The lush gardens are around the buildings that make up the 'house', tour is really interesting, the shop is quite expensive, and the restaurant is a lovely retreat from the heat, serving great food at reasonable prices.

Must go!. If you wanna learn about Thai, it is definitely the place to check out, you can learn a lot there about old Thai houses or a silk, the atmosphere is nice, like out of the would, would recommend anybody to go there.

Loved this place. This was one of the unexpected highlights of our 3 day stop over in Bangkok. We loved this place, it's like an oasis I the middle of a bustling, gritty city. Gorgeous gardens and his house is just beautiful. The tour guide was very informative and we enjoyed all the history around the house.
Very interesting history . The guided tours of the Jim Thompson house are well worth the cost. Was very reasonable for the rich history of the silk trade Mr Thompson set up.

Slice of life attraction. Great recent history attraction in central Bkk. While Jim's disappearance is still a mystery, the story told of his life in Bangkok and Sth East Asia is worth getting to know. His blend of Thai and European designed architecture at what was once his residence, is well worth the look!!

A Must visit in Bangkok . Really must visit this lovely museum / home full of his personal Thai collection of art and antiquesTour only takes 30 minutes and right in centre of townEasy to walk back once you get your bearings Not expensive entrance fee

Interesting. Really loved this place. The story of Jim Thompson was intriguing. The house was full of his personal collection, which made it more interesting. Building was quirky. Guide was excellent. Worth a visit.

Very interesting. Booked a tour around the house to learn more about it. The tour isn't very long, but is interesting. Shoes aren't allowed in the house, so lockers are provided for shoes, bags etc for safe keeping. The house is made up of several smaller houses and very 'wonky', but quirky too. Highly recommend a visit.
Gave me goosebumps! . Don't miss this! Very affordable and definitely will give you goosebumps! Great history and beautiful architecture. Friendly staff and great mandatory Tour!

A must in BKK. If you have a few hours in bkk make sure you visit this place.It's near National Stadium but far enough to disconnect from BKK.They have tours in english, japanese french and i believe german.I'd like to ask to the visitors that when the guide politely asks no pics inside the house , nobody tries to avoid this! Our poor guide had to stop 3 times to tell visitors off as they were trying to take pics of the house in front of her!

All about Thai silk. A lovely oasis of calm in the middle of this vibrant city! Wonderful restaurant on site plus a souvenir shop, Learn how to weave silk from the cocoon, and about Jim Thompson who revived the Thai silk industry. A great day out!

A Close Up Look at Asian Textile History. The home is a unique collection of eastern and western design. See silkworms make silk, walk through the homes of an iconic silk exporter, Jim Thompson. This is a unique way to experience Thai history and culture.

If you're interested in Thai architecture . Jim Thompson was a US soldier and architect who build 6 houses in old. Thai style. You learn about his history and Thai architecture. If you're interested in this it is nice, if not it is nothing really special.

Slick, informative tour of famed trader's residence. Principally set-up to promote the legacy of silk retailer Jim Thompson, this well organized and informative tourist destination has what many Bangkok sights lack: well-informed guides, a carefully maintained offering and a holistic approach; providing a one-stop destination with quality cafe & bar, retail, tour, demonstrations and courtesy transportation. Located near MBK and Siam Discovery shopping centres, Jim Thompson House was the residence of an American trader who introduced Thai silk to the western world in the middle of the 20th century before making Bangkok his home and creating this striking riverside compound complete with private jungle garden. Tours run every 20-30 minutes, take about 30 minutes and provide respite from the concrete and chaos of the nearby streets. Photos can be taken in the lush garden but the House interiors have a no-photo policy.The adjacent restaurant, overlooking a tranquil koi pond, was able to prepare a tasty meal of pad thai and spicy fried chicken with enough time to eat in the 20 minutes we had before our tour commenced, so if you're hungry take advantage of the speed of service. Spoiler alert: Thompson disappeared in the 1960s without a trace, which begs all sorts of questions, but don't look for them here. The tour is very reverential of the trader, but this can be overlooked given the quality of the experience.
35 minutes tour!. Interesting facts about the history of the house and Jim Thompson. Nothing much! Kinda boring, just a traditional wooden house.

Nothing to rave about. The Jim Thompson House & Museum is located on Soi Kaseman 2, only a short walk from the National Stadium BTS station, so it is easy to access via the Skytrain. The Hua Chang Pier is even closer, making access via the San Sap canal boats very easy.Jim Thompson was an American who set up home in Thailand after the Second World War. He revived the silk industry in Thailand. Initially an architect by trade, Thompson combined six traditional teak houses (each over 200 years old), that he sourced from around Thailand, and combined them to create his home – now the Jim Thompson House & Museum.Admission to the facility is 150 baht. The main house can only be accessed as part of a guided tour, so I had to spend almost 30 minutes waiting for my allotted tour to commence. The tour itself lasts 40-45 minutes but is a rather slow-paced affair as it ambles from room to room. The house and contents are interesting but the long wait for tours and the restrictions on access negatively impacted my enjoyment of the place.Photos are not permitted within the main house, but can be taken in the garden and outer buildings.In short, it is a relatively interesting place but nothing to rave about.

Love this place!. Not so many times that you will see a traditional Thai house especially right in the city of Bangkok. Do yourself a favour and visit this place. There is a guide tour that is also worth to join. There is a restaurant and silk shop. What more do you want?
Beautiful House. Really beautiful house!! We were really lucky and had a great tour guide. She was very funny and made the tour interesting! Gift shop after was surprisingly good, not the usual tat!!

You must see Jim Thompson house of how things were. Jim Thompson house is very easy to get to, if you are going to shop at MBK then just walk down the road and around the corner it is very easy to find, otherwise take the BTS to National Stadium, which is a terminal station so you have to get off, then walk to the opposite side of the road to MBK and walk down the road and follow your map it is very easy.He was a man that served in the US forces during WW2 and stayed in Bangkok after the war,he then exported Thai silks and worked in Bangkok, this is the house he lived in so you get a very good idea of how western people lived here in those days, he also collected statues but you need to see them and not have me give away what they are like, his collection is very interesting.I was taken back by how beautiful his house was when he lived there and how things would have been in those days, the people giving you a guided tour are very interesting to listen to, there is a charge to go into see the house but the money goes for the upkeep as you will see the house is in beautiful condition.When we were there, there was a man taking the silk off the pods and getting it ready to be woven into the items you see for sale.I am sure you will come away from the house as we did thinking about how things used to be in JimThompson days here in Thailand.This is something you need to see when you are in Bangkok after that you can walk back to MBK for shopping.

Serene Place in the middle of Bangkok. This is again a great place to visit! The wooden house(s) with all the Asian art which Jim Thompson found around and in Thailand is beautiful to see.Somewhat hidden but an easy walk from BTS skytrain National Stadium, not more than a 5 minute walk. Enjoy it!

Interesting. This is a beautiful house and gardens and well worth a visit. The story about Jim Thompson is intriguing. The staff were very accommodating as one of our children was unwell so we went inside in 2 shifts. The cafe was lovely and they allowed us to order mango for the children, which was not on the menu. There is a tour of the house, which is full of antiques and has been left much the same as when Jim went missing. We did not visit the shop. Well worth a visit.

Really interesting visit!. I knew very little of Jim Thompson's story before going here, but finally after many visits to Bangkok I decided to take a look. It was a little oasis in the city, with lovely gardens, and such a beautiful house! The artefacts collected really are outstanding and for only 150 baht per person it's not an expensive place to visit either. Very easily accessible by BTS or Taxi and they do a free shuttle back to the BTS station afterwards for those who wish to use it.

Amazing architecture! . If you like Thai culture and architecture you must go to Jim Thompson house. It looks like a paradise in the city centre, beautiful garden, very traditional decoration, friendly guides, nice silk shopping! I strongly recommend!

Nice place. I'm not as ecstatic about this place as some other people, but I really enjoyed it there. It's nice to see the house, how it's built, and what's inside, and cool to listen to the story of Jim Thompson. You get a guided tour in English or in French, which is quite interesting. I would recommend to go there, in comparison to some other places in Bangkok, it's worth it :)
Interesting piece of history. The Jim Thompson story is a very interesting one. When you arrive they will assign you to a guide who speaks your language.

Run by American suits. Interesting place well worth the visit. Shop mega expensive and you get the feeling this whole enterprise is there to promote the Jim Thompson brand. Cheaper silk products available elsewhere.

Peace and beauty. When you are in Bangkok it is really compulsary to visit Jim Thomson House . You can reach it very easily on the train .The gardens around are rich in vegetation , you pass from house to the other to discover everywhere good taste , beautiful furniture , paintings and decorations .If you are interested in buying silk visit the shop on your way out and for sure you will find a lot ot items you will love .go on a guided tour .

A place of calm in hectic Bangkok. An interesting place to visit. The tour focuses on the architecture of the buildings and not on Jim Thompson himself. Might have benefited from a bit more about the man. Worth a visit to while away an hour or so.

Interesting. This was a place I would not have thought of visiting until I came across positive reviews about it. The tour of the house came with a compulsory guided tour which was necessary to understand and appreciate the architecture of the house, the artifact collection, the Buddha figurines and etc. It was amazing how well the structure of the building and teak wood furniture in the house have been preserved all these years.

Quality. Just around the corner from Lumphini Park. Lovely silk items at quite a bit more expensive prices than most of the silk shops around Bangkok, but the quality of the stock is a class above and makes it good value

Step Back In History. This is one of those great little sites in BKK that shows how the legendary spy & silk industry innovator lived while in BKK. Off the beaten path and a little difficult to find, the house is a treasure.

If you are interested in architecture, modern history, Thai history, East Asian textiles and history you must visit!. It won't require a special sensibility for art, architecture, traditional folk art, South East Asian culture, history or a penchant for mystery (Jim Thompson's vanishing in the strangest circumstances) to appreciate this place, but if you have any of those you can't fail to fall in love with it.Our guide was a young Thai lady full of sense of humor and sense of history and the visit was a real treat and the highlight of my two days visit to Bangkok.The place is extremely well looked-after. Is fascinating observing the respect that Thai people have for the quasi-mythical figure of Mr Thompson. Don't miss it if you are in BK.

Surprisingly interesting . We visited Jim Thompson's house only because my mum was interested. I thought it would be pretty boring to be honest, but the house was just beautiful and the tour was really interesting. It's not the kind of place I'd visit again but I'm really glad I've seen it.

peterborneo. This is a MUST visit when in Bangkok. Make use of the guided Tour and learn of the development of the Thai Silk Industry in the country.To make it more interesting, take a boat ride to the JT house.the restaurant can be recommended.

Boring + complete waste of time. I am not really sure what to say about Jim Thompson House that is exciting. Put simply, this is just a nice house of an american spy who lived in Bangkok. (There must be more than one of those) Once you buy your ticket, you have to wait for a tour guide to walk you through the house. Once inside the house, well, what can I say? Lots of furniture, lots of wood panelling, nothing really else. What else would you expect ? Once outside the house, they are ready to sell you silk scarves, there is also a restaurant on site and lots of other tourist traps. The question I was continually asking myself was why I went, and why should anyone go there....
Museum of intrest. Museum of intrest on a Bangkok rainy day . Wooden buildings , Guided tours etc .. There is a restraunt on site ...
Lovely morning. A trip by boat to the house, plus a tour. Lovely way to spend a morning. Interesting, and great value.

Jim Thompson House visit. My wife took me to JT House as she has always liked the silks and clothing. I have to say the visit was very enjoyable and made easy by the excellent tour guide and the lovely weather. Very interesting collection of artefacts and Buddha statues. JT obviously left his mark and the shop is worth a visit for a new T-shirt.

Good place for all over the world . Good place for visiting Bangkok , it very nice to write here specially for the traveler to Asia 努力！加強宣導影片都有自己的生活環境優質產品都是在說是因為我們有很多種的菜不是我的話語是以顧客為了⋯⋯Good place for visiting Bangkok , it very nice to write here specially for the traveler to Asia 努力！加強宣導影片都有自己的生活環境優質產品都是在說是因為我們有很多種的菜不是我的話語是以顧客為了⋯⋯
Very interesting tour. This is a interesting and informative tour around these quaint buildings. Allow between 1-2hours The restaurant there also serves lovely food.
Historical and charming. A good place to visit. Our guided tour was informative without being overbearing. Recommended for those interested in the history of a city.

A little gem. Not everyone knows about this place. It is well worth a visit and you have to take a tour....or you don't get in to the house. It is an excellent tour and very informative. I will not spoil it here other than to say Jim Thompson helped create the international silk market for Thailand.

1st Timer. UNBELIEVEABLE.What this man did and built is amazing.The tour I did with an English speaking Thai girl was very good and informative.The restaurant was very good and the souvenir shop the same.I left with a silk shirt under my arm with the price not being an issue to me.Jim Thompson's house is simply a beautiful work of art that you could/cannot put a price on. The gardens are quite beautiful that have a typical tropical theme.A MUST SEE.10/10

interesting journey back into past. It is very well preserved where you can see the traditional construction and items. You can join the short tour to gain a bit more knowledge about history. There are traditional dance show on site and its souvenir shop has some of best silk and cloth products you can get in Thailand.
thai culture atmosfere. easy to get there by bts, very beatiful old house with unic atmosfere, old furniture, pictures and silk sumpels.
Unique house complex. An interesting house complex turned museum. It showcases the history and development of Thai silk industry. It may be a little hard to find for first-timer.
Keep going back. An step back in time.Interesting back story about him.Amazing buildings and art collection.Imagine living there?

Interesting house. A Lot of history here. Interesting story. Beautiful architecture and pieces of art.
You get a 45 min guided tour included in the price. Tour guides very informative and perfect english speaking.
There is a restaurant on site also.
Free shuttle To main road after tour.
Worth a visit.
historical place maybe not worth the price. it was a bit expensive for what they showed. but is a nice place to see, and it was spaces with climate so its refreshing

Jim Thompson's House . Jim Thompson House - The lovely garden-enclosed compound sitting on the bank of the Saen Saeb Canal would have gone completely unnoticed, had it not been for a legacy left behind by a middle-aged American man named Jim Thompson. His elegant residential enclave, comprising six traditional Thai teakwood houses transported from Ayutthaya and Bangkok’s Ban Krua community, echoes Jim Thompson’s 30-year love affair with Southeast Asian art and cultural heritage. Jim Thompson decided to settle down in Thailand, where he dedicated over 30 years to reviving Thai silk – then a dying cottage industry – and introduced it to the world’s most respectable fashion houses and catwalks in Paris, New York, London and Milan. One day in 1967, while at the height of his success, he mysteriously disappeared into the Malaysian jungle, and thus began the legacy of Jim Thompson…
Charming . What a lovely tour. The staff were lovely and the building was fantastic. I would go again was very calming and really got to appricate the orginal Thai architecture with a western twist.

A nice house, but not much to do. It's a nice house and place to visit, but there isn't much there. Small, beautiful garden with some outbuildings, and then the main house. I must say though, I wish we all lived in houses like these!
Nice attraction. It tells & shows a bit of Thai History from the angle of a foreigner, that lived the country's culture & was the leading businessmen for silk.

beautiful. very peaceful and beautiful placewe could feel the soft and creative atmosphere aroundalthough place was packed of tourists but the organisation is perfect so you never feel the place too crowded

Good but expensive. We had to wait quite a while (>30min) for the tour.I suggest making a reservation for the tour, if that is possible.The tour was good and informative.The house is small but the items on display are exquisite.Don't eat here: expensive.Don't but anything from the shop: highly expensive.

Good to see. I like the Jim Thompson brand so was excited to visit his house. Walking there can be shortened if you wait by the roadside for the dedicated grey buggy (it looks like a golf buggy) to fetch you from the waiting spot (unmarked) just off the main road.There's an entrance fee. There is an attached shop next to the house as well. The guided tour was informative and thorough. The house proper is beautiful and filled with antiques. I liked the styling of the furniture as it showcased perfectly the beautiful lustrous silk of the brand. Worth a visit certainly.

Such a lovely house, a great mystery, and great shop too!. I loved the atmosphere at the Jim Thompson house, and the mystery behind his disappearance. The place gives you a real sense of what it was like to live in Bangkok before all the skyscrapers arrived, and the silk shop, although it's expensive, has some of the nicest offerings we found in Thailand. My husband has a shirt with pink elephants all over it, and I ended up with lots of beautiful scarves. A really nice respite from the city chaos.

Lovely Garden. The tour reminds me of going to the Hemingway house in Key West. It is a look into a man who chose to live a Western style life in a very Eastern country. No photos are allowed on the second floor (the living area) of the house. The 45 minute walk through was not worth the admission price.

Nice little escape from the big buildings of Bangkok.. Worth the tour to see a little piece of history. Never knew anything about Jim Thompson before hand. The house is pretty interesting to see and it's got a lot of Thai antique furniture. The museum silk shop is pretty pricey. Afterwards, for a nice stroll through old Bangkok explore the narrow alleys of homes along the canal behind the museum.
Very mysterious. Highlight of Bangkok for us. Great art pieces to buy In shop at reasonable prices. Tour guide was brill

A nice way to get a little history in a very modern city. The tour of Jim Thompson House was easily my favorite day in Bangkok. It's kept much as it was in the early 1900s as Jim Thompson was enamored of Thai culture and history. I highly recommend it.

Awesome introduction to Thailand culture . A friend recommended a visit to Jim Thompson's home, to help us understand something of the Thai culture.It was very interesting blend of Thai and other styling, and also helped us understand some things about the silk industry in Thailand

A way to spend an hour. The tour was 150 baht and we received a little formation. The house is interesting but the tour was over very quickly. If you are in the area then it is worth a visit and you could have a light lunch to warrant the detour.

Great way to spend 2 to 3 hours.. Beautiful gardens and amazing traditional Thai buildings tucked away in the middle of a busy city with a great story of how an American Business Man fell in love with Thailand. We had a few hours to kill and hadn't really planned on visiting Jim Thomson House. However my wife and I were really glad we visited. Guided tours from very knowledgable guides, great way to see Thai culture and the way that they live. Only 8 mins walk from the National Stadium Station at the end of the BTS Silom Line. Tie this in with a visit to fantastic shopping centres which are within a reasonable walking distance or drop back on to the BTS and get off at Siam Square.

Quite a surprise, beautiful place. I had never heard of Jim Thompson before, but was looking for somewhere to visit on my quiet day - where to go? It was suggested by a friend that I see Jim Thompson's House. Who is he? Well managed to get there by Sky train with the help of some friendly locals who pointed me in the right direction. Certainly recommend a visit here to view this beautiful old teak Thai house and outhouses. The tour was well conducted though the English speaking guide was difficult to understand most of the time. I needed to be up close to her to fully understand her.After the tour we saw some lovely Thai dancers perform in the courtyard along with some demonstration of silk weaving and how to extract the silk from the cocoons. Most interesting. Had an enjoyable light lunch in the restaurant before heading back to hotel.

Amazing guy and a fun stop. The tour of this house is ok, and it's great paired with reading a bit more about Jim Thompson. A key figure in Thai and US history, he was the head of the CIA in the country and then the head of the silk industry. The museum is his home, which had one of the best private collections of Thai art in the country. I bought a ton of presents at the attached store, which is fantastic.

Beautiful home!. I felt that the guided tour is a bit too short. I would love to linger a little longer at each rooms and admire/study the exhibit. However, the place is filled with visitors. Worth mentionining that there were french guides too! I

Feels like a Jungle in middle of city. This is quite a surprising place as you feel like you are in the jungle and you forget your in the middle of a city. Cannot remember admission price but was not much. Guide took you around and told you the story of Jim Thompson. Very nice restaurant in grounds. Curtsey tuc tuc that will take you to Sky Train.

I' like this as my home. I love this home. The tour is fun--take your shoes off and lock up belongings to go on tour. The gift shop is very expensive although it has nice silk items, but you can get way way cheaper if you go to weekend market. I would love to have a home like this. it is a mixture of western an Thai. Very serene. REally worth seeing.

An oasis in a busy city. I visited the Jim Thompson House in late July 2016 after spending a couple of days in Bangkok viewing temples and markets. The house is now a museum and offers guided tours in several languages. You can buy the ticket at the house. I think the tour was including in the entrance ticket. The price was very reasonable. I saw a few tour operators online offered this trip at a very high price. I suggest you buy the ticket at the house. The guide was local, spoke English and was very informative and pleasant. Jim Thompson was an American architect. He transported the traditional Thai homes from their place of origin to Bangkok, and rebuilt them to fit his needs. It seems Jim had an eye for design since the house is full of beautiful furniture portraying a fusion of West and East. There is a lush garden with fishponds in the compound and a restaurant (I did not visit the restaurant) . Very relaxing atmosphere. It is easy to get to using the sky train. I highly recommend this visit to anyone interested in traditional Thai architecture or just looking for a breath of fresh air in this busy city.

A must see!. This is definitely a must see in Bangkok. The tour gave an interesting overview of how Thais lived in their traditional homes. The guide was a fountain of knowledge and pointed out a lot of interesting artefacts and info. There is also a restaurant and store on site (and also at the airport) where you can purchase Thai silk items for ladies and men.

One of the Main Highlights in Bangkok. Walking distance from the BTS National Stadium station, it is easily accessible. The entrance fee is THB 150 and very much worth it.The complex has a few traditional houses bought, disassembled from other parts of Thailand, transported to Bangkok and reassembled again. There are many antiques which the tour guide helpfully explained and pointed out during the short tour. You are allowed to go around the grounds in the end, relax at the restaurant or shop in the store. The old architecture is fascinating and gives a peep into the old lifestyle.Highly recommended!

My fantasy home in Thailand. If I had my choice of any home to live in regardless of country or style it would be hands down the Jim Thompson house in Bangkok.Set at the end of a narrow street (soi) on a canal in Bangkok the Jim Thompson is completely and authentically of cultural Thai design. Made entirely of wood raised high above the ground using no nails of any sort the home in true to early Thai architectural home tradition that the home can be disassembled and moved in hasty fashion to flee danger or migrate to greener rice fields.This is a must see on your Bangkok schedule. The visit may make a mind shift in your desired lifestyle.

Mixed feelings. You are not allowed to take photos inside the house which is a bummer because there is not much to see other than that.they give you free tour in english showing you the rooms.not a must see.could visit if you dont know what to do imo

Impressive place. He was a remarkable individual, and the house and the eclectic mix of artwork collections is really amazing. True quality in everything in the house, well worth visiting. Quality goods for sale in the shop, and a beautiful house.

Beautifully presented. I recommend paying for one of the guides to take you around the house, as they are very informative. We had a small group on our day so it worked well. it's not air conditioned, so take a hand fan, it gets hot. It is very well taken care of & beautifully presented. I would recommend a visit to the Jim Thompson house for the history. There is an air conditioned restaurant, gift shop & a lovely garden there too. The toilets there are clean & western.

A little disappointed . Not as good as I expected. Even though it was he was an integral part of the ealy silk trade in Thailand and the history behind it is interesting I found that if I had my time over again I'd not go there

Astonishingly Beautiful. I agree with Fodor's Travel Guide -- this was a must-see attraction in Bangkok! Even though the founder was an American/expat, hislove of Thai culture is obvious and the collection is magnificent. Their website gives you excellent information on everything which is helpful, because once you're in the house you are not permitted to take pictures. **WATCH OUT** for the tuktuk drivers and other scammers in the immediate neighborhood near the skytrain stop. They will give you a runaround, try to sell you ripoff jewels, try to take you to other attractions or restaurants, etc (I saw several tourist scams both before and after our visit to the Jim Thompson House). Our tuktuk driver took us on a 10-minute ride *away* from our destination and tried to tell us that Jim Thompson was closed until 1pm (it wasn't). Tell these idiots you're on a schedule. Use a map and signage to get where you're going - go right down the street to the canal - and you'll be fine.

A good surprise. I really didn't know what to expect but it was a pleasant surprise and a truly class about Thai art and the silk industry. What a great property, very well mantained. It's a must for every BKK visitor.

More interesting than I expected. Just a short walk, 10 mins, from national stadium BTS to therethe entrance fee is 100b and you will have a guided tour, there are some antiques in the house and the guide will briefly tell you the story of Jimand he disappear at his age of 61not very attractive but worth a visitThere are some souvenir sold and even a restaurant and random art exhibition thereAnd a 4 seat shuttle bus may be able to give you a ride back to bts

Visit if you plan to buy something or is nearby. I personally like buildings with history so I made the trek down to check out the house. But if you are like my friend who don't really like this sort of places or want to buy anything from the souvenir shop I would say give it a miss unless you are nearby.

Great History. The setting of this attraction in the heart of Bangkok is forgotten when you walk through the front gates. the very traditional buildings are an eye opener to a by gone era. whilst not super large it was very interesting none the less. Fully recommend the great restaurant on site. The food was exceptional.

Interesting. This was more of my girlfriends idea. It was pretty cool to see though. For those more interested in art and stuff, I would recommend. (You can walk here from the National Stadium stop, don't listen to the tuk-tuk guys)

Moneymakers . The house is beautiful and big. But it is only with a guided tour. 40 minutes they said but it last only 20 minutes. The woman who guided it was very rude and unproffessional and here english was so bad. After the tour you can visit the shop. It's a lot of money the see the house.
Interesting Story. I had never heard of the Jim Thompson House. A friend I visited took me there and it was very interesting to hear the history behind it. Mysterious disappearance

I love this house!. While it mightn't be everyone's cup of tea, I loved this place. The house is just beautiful and a brilliant example of Thai architecture. One warning though, if you are disabled it's all steps and gravel paths and the likes so probably not suitable.Otherwise a beautiful afternoon.

Very Intresting. it was the second time that i had been here but even though it was the second time i still learnt things that i did not learn the first time as there is so much information to take in and so much historical artefacts to look at

8 Nights in Bangkok. Interesting story, but wouldn't rush there. If you miss going to see it, don't overly worry. There is not a lot to see. The tour takes 35 minutes, as they explain about the American Thai silk merchant and his teak house.

A nice and interesting little oasis in Bangkok. This is a lovely, quiet and interesting getaway in the middle of Bangkok. It's quite amazing that this is right in the middle of one of the worlds largest cities actually A visit to Jim Thompsons house is definitely a good way to spend an hour or two. It's really nice, full with history and Jim Thompson was an interesting personality indeedPhotographs are not allow inside, only negative I have to say really. Very interesting person Jim Thompson!
Tourist. Tourist trap not nearly as nice as it was all paths lead to the shop. I was there many years ago and it was nice now I paid and left I would not recommend this attraction

Interesting Story of Jim Thompson... We spent one Sunday morning at Jim Thompson House. This is the museum where you can study the history of Mr. Jim Thompson and his silk products. There is the shop inside the museum that you could buy some finest silk products from Thailand. One of our relaxing day in Bangkok.
Take the free tour!. Educational and interesting! Guides can speak Nihongo, French, Spanish and British English! Bring citronella patches. There are a lot of mosquitoes in some parts.

Interesting Man, Interesting House. At the end of a Small Soi near National Stadium BTS this collection of wooden houses and antiquities have been converted into a museum. Entry price including guided tour, available in four languages, 150 THB. Interesting to hear about the life of the man who introduced Thai silk to the west and look at a Thai style house, albeit with a few western touched. Allow about 40 minutes for the tour then 30 minutes to look around other areas.

Beautiful . Worth a visit. I went at 12pm and wasn't crowded. They offer free shuttle to National Stadium. This is a guided tour which I don't prefer but our guide was nice. This place is beautiful and well maintained. The only thing that bothered me was some of the guides there who are clearly in high school and the way they were looking at me made me feel so uncomfortable.

Good way to spend an hour or so. I had no idea who Jim Thompson was, but his aesthetic was remarkable. The home is stunning. The one bummer is that they do not allow picture-taking inside, which kind of negates the entire reason for going. Not sure why non-flash photos are banned. And they don't tell you that until you're already on the tour.

Great place.. If you are around Bangkok.Then a visit to Jim Thompson place is worth a visit, although it's been some time since I visited in 2007. Easy to get to by bts.Footwear needs to be taken off before entering.
Mr mc carthy. The Jim Thompson tour is one of the most enjoyable and interesting places to go in Bangkok . I think it is a must if you are visiting the city

Guided tour was too rushed. This is a lovely reassembled house full of beautiful objets d'art. It was just a pity the guides rush you through so you don't have enough time to appreciate them all. But well worth a visit.

Very interesting. I had my doubts about visiting here but my wife had been before and dragged me along. I must admit I loved it from start to finish. The guided tour is very interesting and the house beautiful. The tour is well organised and english excellent. It takes about 20 minutes to go through the place. We went at 11am mid week and only had to wait 15 mins for our tour. I bought my wife a bag in the shop but couldn't get in the restaurant because it was busy. Use the free shuttle from the main road and do not talk to any Thais that approach you in the street. There is a scam jewellery shop nearby and they are very subtle in their approach. My parents went a couple of days after me and got caught out. You have been warned!

Peaceful and quiet in central Bangkok. This is the original house that the famous (and mysterious) silk dealer, Jim Thompson, built and lived in.The tour guides speak many languages and know their stuff.Incredibly convenient access as it is walking distance from the National Stadium BTS station and MBK shopping mall.Amazing that it is so central in Bangkok and yet is such a quiet and peaceful place.Definitely worth the time to visit.

Very good. An excellent tour, it is three old jouses made intoa household. If you dont have time for the tour just visit the shop and check out the traditional silks, beautiful. Top tip is turn left out of the gate and salk to the canal side. There you can buy fresh coconut milk for very little. More refreshing than the drinks on offer at the bar in this establishment and much cheaper. Enjoy.
A must to see . What a great place to vist full of history of the Thai silk trade ,what a great man he was ,rip Jim Thompson,another era it was history

Put in your list of things to do in BK. In the heart of modern Thai shopping area, there's a place of a legendary American whose love in Thai silk had played a big part introducing our country to world stage. If you get tired of our uprising brick & mortar nearby, jump to this fascinating place to dip yourself into the past cherishing this legend's life & work in his real traditional Thai house.

Jim Thompson House. Escape the busy city for a while at this beautiful small museum. Photos from the exterior only, no photos allowed from the inside. The building itself is the Gem however. Traditional Thai House with lots of art, this place is good for an hour at least.

Nice Place to See!. My suggestion is that you visit the place if you appreciate Thai Silk, The King and I and have little information about Jim Thompson. The place is nice gives you an inner understanding on the creativeness of Jim Thompson who pretty much introduced Thai silk into the fashion world. If you are not really into Asian antiques, fashion history and or architecture, you might want to skip this place. But if you want to learn a little about Jim Thompson and how he became a fashion powerhouse in Thailand then this place is a must!

Intrigue and beauty! I loved it!. I didn't know about all the history behind the Jim Thompson label and found the guided tour of the Jim Thompson house very interesting and informative. The house was beautiful and the gift shop had a lot of cute items to take home with you. This is a lovely way to spend a couple of hours.

An oasis of calm. Amidst all the bustle of Bangkok here is an oasis of calm and tranquility. A real fusion of the Best of the East and the West. All very tastefully built and planted. The tour gave just enough information and despite there being many visitors it was organised in a sensitive way so it never felt too crowded. Restaurant very good too especially as it wasoverlooking the pond. My second visit there.
Terrific place to see art and architecture. We really enjoyed our stop here. The houses were lovely--a window into a world of casual and elegant entertaining. Beautiful gardens as well.
should be visited. \If you are interested in the history of Thai silk and to see a real local house you should visit this place
Great. Great place! Thanks to ajarn Bunsoong for inviting us to this place. History, art n good food you can find here.
interesting place......Good to go many history. It was very nice to visit. You can see a lot of interesting things. Happy to recommend.Great place......
Always a good stop. Have been here several times. Guide was very informative and the setting with Thai house on the canal is amazing. Miss Thailand was doing a photo shoot as well!

Best place to get to know that culture. For the pieces of Thai culture that are getting lost with the 21st century, this place might be a refreshing class on what drives Thai culture. Jim was really up to something when he started this.

Interesting, unique bit of Thai history. In the middle of the Twentieth Century, Jim Thompson helped revitalize a sagging Thai silk industry. His house is now a kind of museum filled with artifacts and objects he collected. He had exquisite taste and, one imagines, deep pockets. Structurally, the house is very interesting--some half-dozen Thai wood houses that Thompson connected into a kind of mansion. The tour guides are informative, the site is well worth the time, and the story is interesting. There is a very nice gift shop and a good cafe attached.

Eye opening tour. Great tour. Very informative. Guide very knowledgeable with lots cool fun facts thrown in. It's a bit short but nice little break from busy hectic days. A fun must do. Price maybe should be a bit less.

Beautiful escape in the city. If you like interior design, architecture or history this stop is perfect. Even if those things aren't you cup if tea it is worth the 100 bhat or so to have a quiet escape from the city for an hour or so.
good place to go to with a lot of history. as mentioned it was a nice visit and had a lot of mystery and history in the visit, will definitely recoomend to visit

Hi end quality silk and bags. They have many boutiques in practically every mall. Prices are not inexpensive but it is value for money. Try the outlet, you can get great deals, especially for upholstery. Best bet are handbags, scarves and place mats.

Beautiful House, Fascinating Tour. The Jim Thompson House was a short walk away from the hotel which I was staying which is next to the National Stadium BTS station. Admission fee to the museum is 150 baht and you have the option of taking the English or French tour.The house was built by an American Jim Thompson who fell in love with the Thai culture and had almost single-handedly created a global market for Thai silk. There's also an unsolved mystery surrounding his death as he went missing in Malaysia shortly after turning 61.The tour begins every 20 minutes and you are not allowed to take photos inside the house. The guide for our small group that day as a bespectacled young lady called Nim.The tour of the red-hued house begins at the garden. The house comprises six houses joined together and was connected to a canal at the back. The garden also houses a small house for the spirits.Inside, the house is an eclectic mix of modern needs and Thai and Asian arts. Jim collects antiques like Buddha statues, chandeliers, maps and the likes from across the region and tastefully blend them into the interior design of the house. The house structure was put together like a puzzle without nails which explains why the walls were slanting. Another interesting feature of the house is the raised entrance to each room which Nim explains the reason as to "keep the baby in, and the spirits out".The tour was fun and I would highly recommend a visit to the Jim Thompson house. The guide was very knowledgeable and explained very well the historical details behind the house and the artifacts. The visit would take approximately an hour.

Lunch. Found this place by accident around the corner from our hotel. Ended up having lunch there 3 times during our 7 day stay. The price was a little higher than at the local restaurants but the food was amazing and we tried a fair bit of the menu

Beautiful . An interesting place that gives a bit of insight into the historical aspects of this timeframe. Jim Thompson also seems to have been a very interesting person who still has your mystery around his life and disappearance. Careful of the shopping, stiff is "nice" but expensive.
Nice tour. Well organized 40 min tour. Place is interesting. Would not travel far for it but worthwhile if you are nearby. Easy access from train station. They also have gift store and cafe.

Taking a rest. If you are already tired of going around Bangkok, this is a good garden. The restaurant has a nice freshy pond, beautiful background atmosphere and a good menu.The entrance is 150 Thai Bath and you are integrated in a group with a local guide. The tour with the guy takes about 45 minutes, being the guide rather in hurry and explaining things like a robot. Questions are not welcome, "after I tell you" or "you can search in Google", showing lack of training. You can take photos on the garden but not interior that is a pity because there are many interesting things.There are not enough information about the interesting biography of Jim Thompson and his mysterious dissapearance. Just a couple of photos in hid bedroom and the authomatic vanal explaination of the guide. Would it be better to produce a video documentary.Thompson was an American architect and military advisory that was sent to Asia to help in the liberation of Thailand from Japan during the World War II. But he came late after the rendition of Japan and the official end of the war. But he got in love with Thailand and saw a bussiness opportunity in the then decaying Thai silk industry. He is the responsible of its revival thanks also for his big connections with powerful figures in Asia, Europe and US. To settle in Siam, he put also in play his love for architecture and antiqueties, bringing old traditional Thai houses from different regions and setting them as a living facility integrating the traditional Thai architecture with some Western comodities like the dining room. Then he brought several artifects, some of them really ancient like some stone statues from China, Laos, Cambodia and Thailand. Although a loyal Luterant, his Thai house, now this beautiful museum, is filled with a Buddhist inspiration and the harmony of the garden.In 1967 he traveled to Malaysia for what was to be a short vacation. He was with friends in Cameron Highlands, when on March 26, 1967, after attending the Luteran Church Ministry, he took a walk on the evening at about 4PM to never return. Thanks to his fame and good relations, a huge search was organized for 7 days with no clue whatsover. He enters like this in the history of mysterious disapeared people letting pages of speculations. Some months after his disapearance, his sister was murdered in US, but no connection with both events has been succesful. About this context no guide at the museum will tell you, but you can contemplate this beautiful house, the remaint of a very interesting man.

Interesting History. Visited this site during a Followme bike tour of Bangkok city, not a history buff but it was an interesting experience to see a place like this in the middle of a City like Bangkok.

A couple of hours to spare. The Jim Thompson house is rated quite high as a must-do/see activity in Bangkok and even though it was not a highlight of our family stay in the Thai capital it wasn't half-bad. The property is really nice, the staff is very competent and nice and the tour is rather interesting albeit short (it IS a house after all, not a palace!). You can get there by Skytrain (also a highly-rated "activity" in BKK) so that gives you a twofer! So as the title says, if you have a couple of hours to spare, go for it!
Beautiful and peaceful. This is a highlight. Good back story, beautiful items to purchase (although there are Jim Thompson shops in many of the big malls) and cooler(!) than many of the other sights.

Surprising historic house in Bangkok. My husband and I are historic architecture geeks and when we discovered that the Jim Thompson house was within walking distance of our hotel, we couldn't resist. The exotic house and its magnificent art are sheltered from the Bangkok city environment by lovely, mature gardens. We knew nothing about the American expat until we took the tour which was fascinating and was led by a knowledgeable and charming tour guide. Visitors can choose to go in a group led by a guide who speaks either Thai, French or English. This attraction is appealing for its architecture, history, and art as well as the mystery surrounding Thompson's disappearance. The compound also contains a very nice, upscale restaurant where we returned that evening for dinner.

Fascinating house! really worth a visit. Jim Thompson really knew how to live! I fell in love with the house and enjoyed the mixture of traditional Thai style with very good Western taste. The guide who showed us around made it interesting and fun. The silk demonstration was very interesting too.

Learn Something New Daily. As we finished a half-day tour in Bangkok, our guide suggested several ideas for afternoon fun. We chose the Jim Thompson House. We had lunch in its restaurant which was very good, if a bit expensive, and then joined an English-speaking tour of Thompson's home. What an interesting man who led an interesting life and disappeared in a most interesting way. I was happy to learn about him and realize why Bangkok preserves his home and the memory of the good he did for the country's silk industry.

Very interesting . First read up about Jim Thompson the US ex-CIA agent who fell in love with Thailand and built his "complex" in Bangkok- he developed the silk trade - I may have this wrong but he then disappeared in Malaysia and was presumed killed. He owned much beautiful art and there is a guided tour of his house. If it fits into your sightseeing I would recommend it.

Well managed attraction. Located a short distance walk from BTS National Stadium. The entrance ticket includes a guided tour as you will need a guide to enter the house. The guide that I had was great and knowledgeable, able to explain every single thing in the house. she even walked with my sister and I for another round as we were very much attracted by the inner decoration, even though the house was quite busy that day. A must visit in Bangkok.

worthwhile visiting. Jim Tompson house is located near BTS National Studium. The tour system was very nice with different languages. We joined Japanese language tour, the guide lady could very speak Japanese very fluently and clearly answered our questions. There is a restaurant and we had a yammy mango there.
Marvellous . I would recommend this as a finishing event of your Bangkok trip. This can be visited while on your way to airport. Total duration is 90 minutes. Wonderful guides and thai house build.
Great Attraction. This is one of our favourite attractions in Bangkok.Good price and helpful staff, we felt we learnt a lot on our tour and would recommend to anyone visit Bangkok.

Great story, not that great guide. I was really excited to go here after reading about his story how he brought the houses from other barts of the country to rebuild it in Bangkok and the house did not disappoint. It was really good to see the traditional thai style houses and all the art he collected. The entrance fee is a little bit high comapred to the size of the exhibition but if you are interested in art and architecture it worth it. You can only visit with a guided group so you have to wait 10-15 minutes for your group to start (it start in time and if you are late you have to wait for the next group in your preferred language). The biggest problem was the guiding for me. The story of Jim Thompson is very interesting also the story of the houses and art but the guide's english was really hard to understand and she also sounded very bored. Taking photos inside is not allowed.The fabric store is very expensive but the tiny souvenir store has better price. If you have to wait more than 15 minutes for your group you can have a quick drink or a slice of cake in the cafe.
Interesting history. This was an interesting place to here about a foreigner settling into the life of Bangkok. The house and gardens were lovely and watching the ladies spinning silk was fantastic

Very Well Organized. We went to this place as part of the iterinary and it was very informational. We paid for and entrace about 100-150baht I think and what we like about the place was that it was vety well organized, they have a lot of tour guides where in you can choose the langauge that they speak from Chinese, english, french and so on. They have a restaurant there and a souvenir shop that it nice but a bit pricey of course since most if the products are really made from Silk. The tour will take for about 30minutes and you would just be amazed as to the culture and history of Thailand. You are not allowed to take pictures inaide though and they would really ask you to leave your things in a locker that they provide. The plce is a bit far but worth the walk and money, people would really flock this area. They have other shops as well like the airport or other areas in Thailand but if you want the tour then go to the Main area

Lovely oasis in the city. While it is more expensive than your usual Bangkok attraction, it provides a wonderfully calming couple hours away from the bedlam of the city centre. The buildings are beautifully crafted and the tours are run very professionally. It provides a fascinating glimpse into the past and the Thai silk industry. Another highlight was the fabulous food in the cafe which is worlds away from the usual fried rubbish that tens to plague these sites. A super delicious salad washed down with a lush Thai dry white wine and the afternoon was complete.

Organization makes it!. Jim Thompsons Hact is a very small place. Same time it is the mother of all farang dreams about a house in Thailand. It's told that Thompson is the father of the Thai Silk Renaissance - however the money he earned with his many official and inofficial jobs he spend for this little gem and the people working for the foundation taking care it are doing an unusualk professional job in explaining it to their guest. Leave the dusty, noisy streets and walk a few meters inside a little soi. It's unbelievable what a few square meters of Garden and plants can do. If their wouldn't be the engines of the public boat service on the klong - nobody could imagine not to be somewhere on the countryside. In my eyes it's the perfect place to finish a day of shopping and sightseeing (and our guests thought so too) before having a sundowner f. e. at Banyan Tree Hotels Moon Bar - Taxi shouldn't cost much more than 100 THB.

Surprisingly interesting. Made a visit here because it was recommended in Fodor's, but didn't have high expectations. It was an impressive house and a really informative tour. You learn about the silk making as well. Afterwards, stopped for a drink at the cafe which was good and did some shopping in the store. Really nice silk scarves and ties.
A little bit boring. Thought this would be a lot better but actually a little bit boring - and the silk is overpriced. Try getting on canal boat outside if you want some good clean fun!
Definitely worth a visit. We visited the Jim Thompson House on a previous visit to Thailand. It is certainly exquisite with it's garden and river location. A must-see in Bangkok
Nice tour. They offer very informative and interesting tours. The architecture of the house is amazing and we had a great time.

Impressive. Some people have mix feelings about this house. However, it is worth going there and taking the tour. The entrance fee is 100 bath and the tour is another 50 bath, so it is a total of 150 bath. which it is no bad, the tour guides are incredible sweet and funny. The house has some contemporary things, but it is wonderful how one person have so many wonderful objects. You cannot take picture inside the house, but you can everywhere else. Thompson is mysterious and unknown, however, his passion for the culture create this wonderful house now a museum.

Neat museum of sorts to see near downtown. It can be a little hard to find, but follow the directions carefully and you should be able to get there. I seem to recall that it was down a sort of alley, and we actually got a little lost on the way, but asked an employee of a nearby hotel, who could not have been nicer. We chatted with him for a bit and then he directed us to the house.Jim Thompson's house is a sort of collection of Thai architecture and culture from different parts of the country. We stopped at the restaurant for a quick drink before the tour, and though expensive, the drinks were very good. A tour guide is included in the cost of admission, and will answer any questions you may have. The tour is good and I would definitely recommend putting this place on your list of things to do while in Bangkok.

Great location and friendly service. Truly beautiful restaurant, amazing history. Food was excellent and shareable as well. Enjoyed the variety of choice that was there, especially for kids and vegetarians

Surprising favourite. Loved this place! It was recommended to me by a friend of mine and the story behind the man and the house is just fascinating. Our tour guide was very informative and engaging and the house itself it breath-taking. Such a change from the steel and concrete of bangkok streets!

The most beautiful home in Bangkok. The only way you can see Jim thompson house is with a tour - which takes 10-15 min -divided up by language. The house, the antiques, the art, the koi swimming in containers and fountains - oh, and the silk - are all fabulous (sorry, there is no other word). By the shop are women spinning silk, sold inside. It's all beautifully done - with a small restaurant next door to have a bite (and a rather good - if expensive - glass of wine.)

Beautiful. The destination is easily walkable from the National Stadium BTS stop. It is on the opposite side from MBK shopping mall. Same side of the street as the Thai cultural center. The home and grounds are beautiful. Plan on spending about 1.5 hours once you arrive.

A "must-do" for visors. I always enjoy bringing my out of town guests to visit the Jim Thompson House. It's so easy to do as it is just off the BTS and the tour is concise and informative. It's also located on a canal (klong) and is usually fun to take visitors on the canal taxi to your next destination.

Fascinating glimpse into the past. My cousin said this was the highlight of her Bangkok trip, the NYC guy at Chef LeeZ said it was the most boring useless thing he'd done. I thought I'd fall in between and I did. I like seeing how folks live and entering the story of Jim Thompson. I liked hearing about how traditional Thai homes and customs contrasted with what Thompson did. The 25 minute tour was sweet.
Great experience.. One of the must see attractions of Bangkok when you are here. Fascinating to hear of the story of Jim Thompson and to enjoy the stunning location and architecture of his home.

Don't Miss This. JimThompson worked in Thailand for the United States Overseas Service during WW2, saw local injustices and stayed on after the war to hopefully correct some of them. He established silk spinning and weaving cooperatives where the artisans were rewarded fairly. If for no other reason this institution is deserving of support. However you'll get more out of it than you can give. In terms of Thai architecture and culture the complex is spectacular. Part of the strength of the memorial to Thompson is his death was an enigmatic disappearance that remains unsolved.

Complete different to Bangkok outside. When we arrived in the area of Jim-Thompson-House we enter in another world of Bangkok. The area have a lot of tropical plants and the Houses are different to that what we saw before. For the visit you need a ticket and a group-guide for 45 Min is included (you cannot exclude it)! The house inside is very beautiful and it is great to hear the stories about Thompsons life connected to the house (no photos inside the main house, but in the other one). It was worth to go there and escape a bit the hurly-burly of Bangkok.
Must see. This hidden paradise where Jim Thompson lived is a must see. He was the person who sat Thailand on the map regarding the silk and turned it into a huge success.
Amazing place. This is a fantastic place. You feel like you are entering a different world in the heart of Bangkok. The house is amazing. Well worth a visit.

A world lost in time.. The Jim Thompson house is a great place to visit, with guided tours around the house created by Jim Thompson the American "father" of the modern Thai Silk industry, Interesting to see the antique buildings and furniture and the gardens. Just wonderful. Also a nice restaurant/coffee shop, reasonably priced, A little bit difficult to find but worth looking for.
Great Thai Food. Great ambience...Thai house style of decoration. Good authentic Thai cuisine....Service is great and location is easy to find.

A must visit when in Bangkok.. A must visit when in Bangkok. Centrally located and gives a great view of life in a local home, and into the life and history of Jim Thompson. An oasis in the centre of Bangkok and of geat historical benefit which has been wonderfully preserved.

Well worth the effort to get there. A really interesting place to visit but we found it a bit hard to find because it is down a lane. You get the skytrain but then its not easy to see where to go next especially when your phone runs out of credit. Even when google maps works it can get confused if you travel by boat and train and then have a massive intersection to navigate. So if you cant easily find it jump on a tuk tuk for a dollar (ridiculous as it sounds as it is quite close). You dont need to pay for an organised tour to take you there.

professional tour guide and management. Small house. It won't take long to look around, but Jim Thompson was interesting. Their tour guides are professional in accomodate tourists and management was good. The tour took about 35 minutes. Ideal to gain overview of Thai traditional house and life.

Off the beaten path but worth it. Interesting tour of the grounds of the person who reinvigorated the Thai silk industry. While rumors swirl about his disappearance He was instrumental in promoting silk in Thailand. The gift shop is a bit pricey but in an interesting neighborhood. I think a must see in Bangkok..
Very classy. It was very well maintained, classy place that is well worth a visit. Traditional Thai houses are beautiful and little gardens and pond were great.
Interesting visit . Enjoyable way to spend a few hours, the tour was very interesting and the guide was informative. Lots of pieces of art to see. Would recommend a visit.
Interesting place, fantastic collection of art and relics. This was so interesting, and gives a great understanding of the history of Bangkok with a spectacular collection of art from around Thailand
Escaping Bkk's busy streets.. All in One! Get a litle peice of Bkk history, nice peaceful cafe, a little shopping. A nice escape from the busy streets of Bangkok

Good example of Thai architecture/history. Tour is brief but provides a good overview and you can tour the outside at your leisure. Interesting to see the Thai architecture and learn about the history of Jim Thompson.

Nice!. Nice place to go if it's raining or if you're done with your Bangkok main visits.
The house is really pretty and interesting. The guided tour helps you to understand well how Jim Thompson lived and worked.

Fascinating to see, worth the stop. The tour I took wasn't as detailed as I'd have liked. It was quickly paced and left me with so many questions about the architecture and Jim Thompson himself. It's a necessary stop when in Bangkok as the beautiful history preserved there is one of a kind. I'd do some reading online about the place if you're looking for a more satisfying amount of knowledge though.

Original, Clean, Nice to See. It was a bit raining so we decided to have this tour: what a surprise!It's an amazing old houses place into the heart of the cahotic bangkok. The entry price you pay is worth, and there's the guide too.

Interesting bit of Thai history. You have to take a guided tour and although thats not my thing it was intetesting and only 40 minutes..You get the history of Jim Thompson and have a tour of the house. Some really lovely pieces of art on view... kids would probably get bored.There is a restaurant which is fine but a little expensive for what you get

Clean, Beautiful, Informative. Three of us traveled to the Jim Thomson House without really knowing what to expect. Unlike lots of Thailand the place is keep pristine. Upon arrival everyone pays to see the house which includes a tour in whichever language you speak. During the tour they show you all the different aspects of the house pointing out the traditional Thai featuers as well as the American featuers Mr. Thompson brought with him. The tour also tells the story of Mr.Thompson and his importance to the area.

Relaxing atmosphere. Nice and beautiful lace to visit in busy Bangkok! You can only follow guided tours (35min.)but this is understandable given the small and beautiful artifacts on display. We also had lunch in the restaurant. Lunch was good but somewhat expensive.

Good place to visit. else than the admission ticket (150 baht), maybe this is the only traditional thai house that can be visited in central of bangkok. good to know history, some is interesting, some is average.the jim thompson products are eye catching.camera not allowed only in the main house (jim thompson's). the other building and from the outside is allowed to take picture.

Culture, history in the middle of Bangkok. This small complex is a rare mix of old Thai wooden houses, antiques, garden, restaurant (not cheap) and shop (souvenirs, also not cheap).The tour is well organised and with guides speaking decent various languages (cheap fee).After a long day walking and travelling across the city, it is a short trip by boat from the old Rattanakosin area. Great garden (free access) Refreshing and really must see.

If you get a tuk tuk, moto, anything you will go here. But is it worthwhile? Yes. Don't buy the silk, you can get cheaper if you want to "work" a little: your call. Save money get better, or take it easy and buy here. Too expensive, but quality is fine.
Lovely snapshot of Thailand. Jim Thompson's House offers and very interesting view of what houses were like in Thailand. It is not expensive to visit and the guides are very knowledgeable and funny.

The biggest tourist trap. This is probably the biggest tourist trap in Bangkok and not my kind of attraction. I found it really missing an opportunity to be an excellent attraction. It is simply a place to buy overpriced silk products. The tour of the house is hot and crowded and photos are not allowed.
Beautiful house. Very interesting tour included in the entrance fee. Nice and relaxing thing to do to escape the hectic city for a few hours.

Memorable hour in Bangkok. I had a few hours hanging around in Bangkok before my flight so I and a friend decided to spend our time at Jim Thompson House. We took a tuk tuk from Hua Lamphong Railway Station. Not very far. It is open at 9AM so we walk around and had something to eat at 7-11 near National Stadium BTS. Ticket for a compulsory tour in JT House is 100 - 150 baht. We were instructed and led by a well English-spoken female guide. The tour around the house took 35mins. After that you can go see around for shops/books/photos freely. A quite nice visit for a peaceful morning in Bangkok.

Beautiful and interesting place to visit. The very beautiful original house of Jim Thomson has been transformed to a museum where you can learn all the interesting facts about silk industry in Thailand and Jim Thomson s personal story.You get a free guided tour from the friendly and knowledgeable guides and watch the process of silk making.

Definitely worth a visit . Based on good reviews (and friend's recommendation) I decided to visit Jim Thompson House. Admission fee was reasonable (I think it was Bht 150) and then there was about a 30 minute walking tour of the grounds and buildings - which was very nicely done with a very nice, professional and pleasant guide (who smiled the whole time). Pleasant grounds - nice cafe - nice shop (items are quite pricey). Interesting to see and learn how Jim Thompson had build architecturally interesting homestead.All in all a pleasant stop for a couple hours.Easy walk from National Stadium stop on BTS. I'd recommend to combine with visit to Bangkok Art and Culture Center ...where you can have a nice lunch at little shop (second floor just opposite escalator is little shop where I had very tasty bowl of noodles) and see displays of art and crafts
Something different in the heart of Bangkok. Really enjoyed the short informative tour at this oasis in the heart of Bangkok. Beautiful house and artefacts. Excellent restaurant / cafe and shop.

Surprised by the scope of this tour. I was very surprised that this tour was solely about the life of Jim Thompson, and not at all about the silk. There is no mention of how silk is made, or the business of silk; this is strictly a tour of his house and a history of his life (other than the shop in the entrance, where you can buy his products).

Visiting a great icon. We walked to this museum and a great deal of walking we did. The route takes us along the river and thus, indirectly, we get a feel of the late Jim Thompson when he started his silk business and built his house, now a museum. The museum staff are very friendly and we were even accorded a tour of the house. She was very friendly and explained in great deal of how the house come about and it's rich history. It is an amazing museum.

A peaceful escape in the city. The grounds and garden are an oasis in the midst of bustling Bangkok. The guided tour, provided in numerous languages, is an enjoyable way to learn about the history of Jim Thompson and his influence on the textile industry in Thailand. Each step of the silk production process is showcased with some demonstrations - this can be a great learning experience for children. The traditional Thai architecture transports you back into a simpler time - a wonderful escape from urban Bangkok. Extend the feeling of tranquility by having a glass of wine in the restaurant. The shoppers will enjoy the wide range of goods at the shop - a greater variety than other outlets.

Serene Environment & Fascinating Story. A woman silk weaving, colorful spools of silk thread, and the beautiful gardens of the Jim Thompson House immediately takes you into a world of tranquility. The story of Jim Thompson and his reintroduction of silk to the US is fascinating. The collection of artifacts from all over Southeast Asia in the house is worth seeing. The tour (included with ticket purchase) takes about 35-40 minutes and requires you to remove your shoes and place belongings in a locker. The total time doesn't take much more than an hour and your ticket allows re-entry for that entire day. I went here in the morning and it was a good time -- wasn't busy at that time.Definitely recommend going here especially because it's so near to many other attractions/activities and shopping malls.

Tranquil break from busy Bangkok. I had some time before checking out of my AirBnB down the lane, so I decided to check out the Jim Thompson House. I didn't really know any details, I just new it was a collector's house. Now I know that Jim Thompson was an important figure in modern Thai history. His house and art collection is enchanting, the guides are charming, the garden is tranquil. And it's just a few blocks from the crazy shopping of MBK and Siam Sq. Worth a visit if you like history and design. You will need to remove you shoes and leave your bags in a little locker. No pictures inside. Tours available in many languages.

A place of sanity and tranquility surrounded by shopping frenzy. This is really a must see: gorgeous traditional Thai home large enough to be interesting but not overwhelming. Also the location of a goodish restaurant and of course the ubiquitous and quite expensive Jim Thompson skills...
Peace near the centre. This is a beautiful silk merchant's house where you can have a guided tour included in the reasonable price and enjoy good quality food in relaxed setting

Very interesting tour in a lovely house. This was a very interesting account of the beginnings of the commercial Thai silk industry. Our guide was very pleasant and the tour itself was very informative. The house, furniture and art were all really pretty and transported you back in time to the 50s and 60s. The shop was stocked with beautiful silk goods, but quite pricey.

Wonderfull Teak House. Wowwwwwwwwwwwwww what a house, JT sure know how to build a dream house, everything in that house is one of a kind, very meaningfull and full of art For adult the entrance fee is 150B n children are 100B, the provide english, france, japanese, and sorry I forgot the other language guide. You can only take picture of the outside area, you are not allowed to take picture inside the house. The tour probably takes 30 minutes.

Thai meets West. We got to this site at 9am on a Sunday and we were fortunate to have an almost private tour with an English guide at 9:25am. There are guides waiting who speak many languages. This attraction is the bringing together of various homes owned by Jim Thompson, an American who settled in Thailand after the war. His fascination with Thai silk, at that time a cottage industry, resulted a good business for him - he brought the silk to New York where he showed it to business people and Vogue editors, who fell in love with it.The building is a lovely representation of Thai tradition meeting Western sensibilities. Thompson was passionate about collecting Thai artifacts and did not want to see them poached or leave the country. There is a 7th century statue that is very beautiful that exemplifies his passion for collecting - it is without a head, but he did not care about perfection, it was still a treasure.The gardens of the house are lovely - it is like Eden in the middle of a city. There is a well rated restaurant that has a view of the garden and a koi fish pond. Not to be missed are the bookstore and a store filled with silk products (and very welcome air conditioning). In the courtyard there are explanations of silk production, along with a beautifully dressed woman providing an example of how to weave silk. I was very happy with the scarf that I bought, and grateful for the knowledge that I gained during my guided tour. I would highly recommend this site.

Wonderful antique home and gardens. I loved visiting the Jim Thompson House. The gorgeous gardens are a quiet haven in the middle of bustling Bangkok. The home is elegant and stately, actually made up of antique smaller homes. It allows a look back into historic Bangkok housing, along with some lovely antiques and sculpture. It's a quick visit but well worth the trip. Lovely gift shop and two restaurants. The causal restaurant had one of the best noodle dishes I had in Thailand. My daughter loved her massaman curry too. I'm so glad we visited.

Not so amazing. Maybe I expected too much from this place, by reading previous reviews. Quite a normal place, surrounded by horrible buildings, which seems to have lost the atmosphere created by its original owner. The guided tour is fabric-style and groups of people are running one after the other. I have seen more attractive heritage houses somewhere else.

A beautiful relaxing journey back in time. Definitely worth a visit. Reasonably priced and includes a tour so you get some insight into the life and vision of Jim Thompson. Really close to the shopping centers and an easy walk. The merchandise is exxy but enjoy a fruit drink in the cafe by the koi pond before you leave. The lychee mint was aroi!

Peaceful oasis. I really enjoyed to visit jim thompson house and to learn more about this fascinating man. The 35 min guided tour is sufficient and you have time to re visit the garden and some of the other houses. No pictures and on your own visit of main house. Superbe selection of thai and chinese art. Restaurant and bar good for a stay.Excellent visit when need a pause from crowdy bangkok

This man had seriously good taste. Jim Thompson was an American soldier who moved to Thailand in the 50s and had a significant impact on the traditional Thai silk trade. In making his house he imported art and traditional structures from all over Thailand and put them together really beautifully. There are also dancing girls, silk weaving demonstrations and a really good restaurant on the premises.
