Good short guided tours. An interesting place to visit, especially if you're looking for something a bit different. I got a short guided tour there with a lovely Thai lady who told us all about the architecture and Jim Thompson's life. It's quite small so will only take up a couple hours of your time. There's also an art gallery there which you can visit for free.

Very interesting and worth a visit.. Without giving too much away, Jim Thompson was a US operative sent to Thailand, post World War 2. He fell in love with the Thai culture and was pivotal in creating the silk industry in Thailand. The Jim Thompson house was set up by his foundation after his mysterious death creating an interesting illusion and fascinating back story behind a very beautiful site.The Jim Thompson house is a very satisfying couple of hours. The tour guides speak very good English and their knowledge of the man and the house itself is exceptional.The house contains fascinating antiques and images each with their own individual backstory, explained well by the Thai tour guides. You are really given a feel for the place that the unique businessman and individual called home for several years.Overall, the Jim Thompson house is a nice, quiet place to go to see some eye catching antiques away from the hustle and bustle of Bangkok. Although I would stress an interest in history, a love for antiques and beautiful houses is required or else you might find it a little underwhelming

A quiet place in the midst of BKK. We went for several times to BKK but only now we could make it happen to visit Jim Thomson House in Bangkok. It was very interesting from our tour guide to hear the whole story about his life and how he mysteriously disappeared in the highlands of Malaysia. We just can recommend to take some time out for a visit of this place and maybe have little snack there as well.
Bit lame. Not much to see and full of tourists. Don't bother.Suan Pakkard is more worthwhile or Vinmanmek Mansion.

Waste of time.. We visited this store which was advertised as a part of the 'Amazing Thailand Sale'. Spread over four floors, the experience was a complete disappointment. Poor customer service, and a mish-mash of products. Good, perhaps, if you are looking for draperies or furnishing material.

The spy house. I found very interesting the story behind the man. The house is beatyful and interesting, expexially the view of old Thai and mixed architecture but the garden is just stunning amazing. Are collection is great but I found a new guide not so good to speak and to explain. For the rest is wveryhing so well organised. I found really good value at the outlet selling in the propriety. Nice visit!

Well-worth a Visit!. Went here on a lark on a one-day trip to Bangkok. The museum house is well-maintained and with the help of the guide's description, you can bring yourself back to the days when the house was in use. Also, when I was there, there was a fabulous video art installation above the gift shop, was as good as the museum.
Easy to see. Nice place to see. Easy walk from the BTS. Go if you are close but don't make a special trip. It is in a very safe part of town. .

Worth an hour or two. The nearest BTS is the National Stadium. For the life of my I can’t remember what exit it is, but the signs are quite clear. Bear in mind there is actually a little tuk tuk service that takes you all the way to the Jim Thompson house, which is good for the lazy ones like me:)Entry is THB 150 for adults.There are tours in multiple languages including English, French, Chinese, Thai and German from what I could tell from my trip. I’m sure other languages are catered for so don’t feel left out.The main house itself is made up of a number (6?) Thai houses joined together with a bit of a redesign, and is located right on the river/canal. This clearly used to be an entry point for visitors but is now sealed up and there is no obvious quay.You are not allowed to go into the main house without a tour guide and if I recall correctly, you can’t take photos while on the tour. To be honest, the tours are too short and quite perfunctory. I didn’t feel like I had sufficient time to enjoy each room. There are many other rooms in the house which I would love to have taken longer over. Maybe it was because I had arrived in the afternoon and it was busy, but I did feel a bit rushed. It is difficult to take in all the art, sculptures and unique furniture in the 5 odd minutes we had in each room (in some cases less).Outside the main house are several service quarters where the house help used to live. These are now extensions of the museum – with each showing particular aspects of Jim Thompson’s collection.On the way in/on the way out, there is a little areas where there is some traditional Thai dancing, and also a small (unguided) exhibition as to how to extract the silk from the silk worm, and then put on a yarn.There is also the store and a restaurant. I have been to the Jim Thompson restaurant in Singapore, and if that is anything to go by, this one is probably expensive.
Should Be On Your List. Very well taken care of the estate. One can really see how he lived. The restaurant was very good as well. I would happily visit again.

Interesting Museum, more architecture than silk. It is located just a short walk, or complimentary ride from National Sky Train station. Small Utah interesting gardens housing 6 teak traditional buildings made by the architect, Jim Thompson into his home. Good restaurant to use as well as the Thai Silk shop ( expensive).

A little out of the ordinary.... This is a really interesting place to visit, especially if you are interested in silk and history. We went on a tour of the houses which took about an hour . Our guide was great with lots of little stories and happy to answer questions about the house and Jim T. You can shop at the end of the tour in the gift shop if you want. There is no hard sell, which is nice!

Beautiful Thai architecture and introduction to Thai silk rennasiance in a small museum. Very interesting historical introduction to Thai silk renaissance with some intrigue thrown in. The style of architecture preserved is beautiful and practical for the local. The shop has very beautiful silks (no pictures allowed) and quite high priced too. This house is right on a canal so you can get there by water taxi and a short walk or by car. There is a restaurant on site that is reputed to have a good Thai buffet. Tour groups do come through and people get grouped by language so that the guides can speak to a particular language.

Definitely worth a visit!. We had not planned to visit but having heard a lot about it we decided to drop in whist passing. There is a discounted entrance fee for students which is great (Identification required). As well as entrance to the house you also get an english speaking tour guide. The tour takes about 45 minutes. There are some really beautiful things in the house and it is definitely worth a visit if in the area.

A must visit. Jim Thomson is the American who helped Thai Silk industry on a global level. His owned home served as a museum today. The house in located in the city but once you enter gardens you are transported to another world. They do spun silk in the garden do my children got to do it as well. There is a large Jim Thomson store where you can buy all kinds of silk stuff. I highly recommend the cafe as well. It has a beautiful setting. Food and fresh juices were excellent. They have a shuttle that drops people of to main road where BTS station is.

Jim Thompson Museum. This is an interesting little museum in that it has a fair few Thai and Burmese pieces. Buddhists consider it bad luck to have broken statues in the house. As a consequence a lot of the their heritage has been consigned to the dump. Jim Thompson collected some of the very old statues which invariably are damaged. Jim Thompson also resurrected the Thai silk trade and made it famous through its use in the film "The King and I". Jim Thompson has been developed into a brand and I had Jim Thompson water in the coffee shop. I dont think it was passed by him as he has been missing since the early 1960's, vanished without a trace except the whiff of gunsmoke
Good. A grand place to visit in a good part of Bangkok. The museum is educational and the traditional Thai dancing a hoy to see.
A Must See .. you really need to have a visit here . A little Thai intrigue . History, charm and Thai architecture and style .

Good Place to visit but don't buy any clothes. This is an excellent place to visit as it offers history and tranquility. The food in the restaurant is great, particularly Thai food like Pineapple rice and mango sticky rice and ice cream. The oriental dance show which takes place at dinner is fabulous. Even though the shop has excellent quality silk items, it is advisable to buy it at Jim Thomson shopt at the airport, which is 10-15% cheaper.

Love it here. The ticket price is 150 baht includes a free guided group tour with an easy to understand tour guide. They offered the tour in several languages at a given time so, while waiting for the tour to start, you can browse around the place. The tour was interesting but visiting this place is a must. It also has a nice cafe serving best Thai dishes and if you choose to sit outside, you can enjoy the view of trees and fish ponds and the frog sounds (^_^)

Interesting Place. We stop by the Jim Thompson house on the 3rd day. The tour provides multiple language options and my family and enjoyed traditional thai architecture with a twist. A peaceful garden and a demo on making silk from the cocoon. They provide shuttle from the house to the main road.
Second Visit. A small green oasis in the middle of Bangkok. Wonderful cafe with the best Thai dishes. The gift shop offers unique men's and women's clothing and accessories.

Jimbo's joint. An excellent example of old style Thai architecture. Well well preserved and presented. Gives you a very good feel for what these old places were like, especially as you'll be hard pressed to see anything like it around. Great gardens and the guides are very good. The amusing part is the lack of info about Jim himself, especially his personal lifestyle, it may be amusing to ask your guide about his private life.But it is very much worth a visit, especially if it's a rainy day. Brilliant.Then wander down to the klong for a long tail ride, even more fun if you haven't done a klong ride yet.

Interesting tour, a chance to see into Thailand's past.. The tour was very interesting, i enjoyed see the house and gardens and learning more about traditional thai architecture. A good tip is that there are tuk tuk's that will take you from the bts stop down the road to Jim Thompson's house, it's not far, but helps with accessibility for people that are not up for the walk on a hot thai day.

Interesting visit. Stopped by Jim Thompson house on our first day in bkk. Tours are offered in several languages, when you arrive you're given a start time and are free to browse the shops and watch the silk demonstrations (very interesting!) while you wait. The house is well preserved and tour is detailed. There are no written signs, you are taken around personally by one of the ladies and told lots of anecdotes about the people who lived and stayed in the house and the artefacts in it. They do ask you not to take photographs.Food at the cafe is quite reasonable for an attraction and is delicious. Lovely setting by the pond and impeccable service.Prices of the silks in the shop might alarm you, but they are beautiful quality. Hang on for the markets elsewhere if you're not so fussy! There is an outlet shop in koh samui airport if you're passing that way!

Really Worth a Visit. Our tour guide gave an in depth but upbeat tour of the house so that it was not boring at all. There is a lot to see and ponder. Also the mystery of his disappearance. It's easily a 2-3 visit with the tour and walking around.
Peace and quietness. A haven of tranquility in the middle of the noise and dirt of Bangkok... really worthy. Totally Recommended.

Tranquility in a busy city. Every time I visit Bangkok I have a meal at the restaurant. It's also a great place to just have a coffee. The service is brilliant and the food on the dinner menu is superb. Admission to the museum has a charge but the restaurant is accessible to the public.

A lovely museum and restaurant. I loved to learn more about the Thai silk and see a traditional Thai house here in the heart of BKK. The gardens are so tranquil and the shop is great to buy your last minute gifts.

Interesting tour. The ticket price includes a free guided tour which I thought was excellent value for money. The guide was easy to understand and made it interesting. It was good to find out about this interesting man and his love of Thailand! There is a free shuttle tuk tuk from the station to the house although it is not far to walk.

Loved the history here. This was an excellent tour and very informative. I was nice to see the collection of the facility. It was beautiful to admire what a person had put together for his own desires to preserve history. We really enjoyed it. We also ate at the restaurant, pricey but good food.

Beautiful piece of Bangkok History. Old Thai teak house dressed as homage to the creator of Thai silk, Jim Thompson. A lovely place to visit, beautiful gardens and a quiet retreat in the centre of Bangkok

A glimpse into one mans past..... A chance to view the variety of artefacts collected by Jim Thompson during his time in Bangkok. Entry includes an informative guided tour. This attraction is best visited as part of a city tour as alone it's only likely to take 1-2hrs.

So happy our concierge recommended this. We would not have discovered this house on our own. Even as it pops up on TA as a highly recommended destination, the name sounds so blah that we would have passed it by. I'm so glad our concierge recommended this for our last full day in Bangkok. We took our 4 year old twins, and all of us appreciated the gardens and beauty of the home. The tour was a perfect length, and every detail of this house was fascinating. Our children loved the "mouse house" in the bedroom, which really captured their imaginations. It was also fun to pick out some Thai Silk souvenirs to take home.

Interesting Architecture & Awesome Interior. From MBK/Chit Lom BTS station, it just about 5 minutes walk. There's a shuttle service provided from the station too. The house is interesting, if you're expecting to learn about silk. It only 20% about silk and 80% of it is about Jim and his passions and commitment put to develop the house. The tour guide mostly explain about the house, Jim's antiquities collection, some history about him and the house. Nevertheless, I enjoy it even though I know the facts is available on Wikipedia. What else better than physically being in the site of historical place isn't? The house is full of architectural fusion with interesting artifacts and antiquities collection of the late Jim. Right next to the Jim's house over the Ratchatavee Pier is the Muslim community of North Bankrua, the old known weaver of Thai silk. The first sample of Thai silk Jim brought to Hollywood comes from them. Jim's old factory or the main supplier is in the community. Hence the reason why he choose to build his house on the estate.

good guide, good building. you can take shuttle car from street end to Jim Thomson house. guides are professional and kind. The house is unique and full of antiques.한국어 가이드는 없습니다. 영어 가이드와 함께 가야하는데, 영어 발음이 좋아서 잘 들리는 편입니다.

Interesting and worthwhile visiting. Close to BTS National Stadium it is easy to find and its well worth seeing. You get an insight to the way Thai's lived and there are many old artefacts and museum pieces to admire. It is very busy but well organised with visitors included in groups of about 10 with a guide to show around and give information in the groups language. We were in an English group and the Thai guide spoke very good English I understand they also have Thai Chinese and Japanese guides. You have to remove your shoes to go inside the houses and also you have to leave your bags in a locker to which you retain the key Small handbags are allowed. You are not allowed to take photographs whilst on the tour which lasts about 35 mins. After the tour you are able to walk around the house alone and walk through the gardens too The admission fee is 150baht and it is money well spent Be aware that there is no a/c in the house with only fans to circulate the air so on a hot day you might feel uncomfortable hot

JIM THOMPSON - - - THE FATHER OF THAI SILK. Historically, the house is remarkably located across the street from MBK (shopping center) and easily accessible by the BTS (skytrain).THAI SILK is absolutely admired and elegant for Thai women and men. Visiting this historical location allows you to take a step back in history (1950's and 60's) when the businessman, Jim Thompson was a member of the Office of Strategic Services (OSS).The architecture, art, and furnishings are along the "klong" (canal) where the Thai people made the Thai Silk attire that is known around the world today.There is a great gift shop and nice restaurant located on the property that will bring you to the part of history that was never solved when Jim Thompson traveled to the jungles of Malaysia and disappeared.
Interesting!. Make sure you read up before you arrive.Interesting house, with interesting assortment of antiques!Not air conditioned! Not allowed to take photos inside!

Ur imagination is better than the real thing . I was in Bangkok, 20 or so years ago, and as a poor backpacker I couldn't afford to go in. Fast forward and now with my children I came especially to see it, for my wife as we couldn't afford it back then. I let them read all about it before we went in plus collating the TA reviews we decided to visit it from the outside as at 150 Bht without being able to take pics is way too high to expect. I bought a momento in the shop for my wife and left. As my headline says...I was really expecting a whole enclave experience and not it being in a busy side street off National Stadium MRT. So disappointed

Nice place to visit. It is an old traditional house in the center of the city, near national stadium metro station. The small restaurant serves wonderful traditional food and there is a nice souvenir shop.

Very beautiful old thai house. After a few walks in the wrong direction, we arrived at the jim thompson estate. The staff is friendly, but not overly so. Our guide was very enthusiastic and the tour was very interactive and interesting. The house itself was very beautiful, with loads of antiques and beautiful wooden floors. The garden was very tropical and beautiful as well. If you only spend a short time in bangkok, I wouldn't recommend it, but if you have the time, nice to see!
Interesting genuine historic place. Excellent guide interesting storey and artefacts. A well organised place with many interesting things to look at.

Beautiful site with immensely interesting history. Jim Thompson was an extremely talented designer and visionary who revived the silk industry in Thailand. The Jim Thompson House is a compound of traditional Thai houses that Mr. Thompson had assembled together on a lovely site. It is furnished with traditional Asian art and antique artifacts and furniture. The tour is incredibly interesting as is the mystery associated with the home. Jim Thompson went on a trip and never returned. No one has ever solved discovered what happened to him. But he was an American, Princeton graduate who fell in love with Thailand and made a great contribution to Thailand's silk industry. There is a charge for the tour but it is well worth the small fee. Gifts and clothing are available for sale in the shop. A warning: Jim Thompson silk clothing is expensive. It is very high quality, made beautifully and the fabrics are incomparable, but this is not for the budget shopper and the styles are very traditional western styles (some are a bit dowdy for my taste). There is a restaurant on site with elegant Thai dishes, a great place to stop for lunch before heading on to your next Bangkok destination though it also has rather touristy prices.
Not Interesting. Guided tour of the grounds and house. 100 Baht. The guide presumed we already knew the significance of JT.

A Hidden Gem. We were unsure about whether we should visit Jim Thompson's house but we are glad we did. For only 150 THB each you get to wander round the gardens as well as receive a guided tour. The guide was very informative and friendly. We got inside the house and learned a little more about who Jim Thompson was and how important he was to Thailand. We spend a few hours here and it wasn't too busy when we went. They offer tours in a variety of languages too. I would recommend this tour to adults and families with older children. There's not much for younger children to do. We enjoyed our drinks in the cafe next to the house too.
Interesting. Interesting and worth a visit if you have extra time. It's crazy that he disappeared and was never found! It's cool to see how he created a unique style for his house
Great . Only 100bht to get in a good 45 minute tour with a English speaking guide lovely grounds great bar who could ask for more. A must see

A very attractive and peaceful place, a must visit. I visited Jim Thompson House with my family during my stay in Bangkok. It is located close to the National Stadium BTS. They provide a free shuttle service from the entrance of the alley to the house. The price of the tickets is quite nominal. The house itself was quite beautiful and peaceful, located amidst lush greenery. The people there were nice and friendly. We were allotted an English guide for the tour of the house. The guide was quite knowledgeable and enthusiastic. The tour is great for the ones having an interest in history. It is a highly recommended place for everyone who travels to Bangkok.

Unusual and beautiful. It's easy to lose sight of the real Thailand when you are in Bangkok, it’s such a busy, high rise city in places. Then you visit the Jim Thompson House and it takes you to another time and place. Magical. Loved it.

Beautiful house full of beautiful antiques . This house is quite easy to get to. You can either get off the BTS skytrain at Siam or change lines and get off at the National Stadium. Jim Thompson's house is then up a side road on the right, about 5 minutes from the National Stadium station. The cost to get in is fairly reasonable at 150 bhat each (about £6 at current exchange rate). You must go on a guided tour though, you are not permitted to wander about the house on your own. Bags must be put into lockers and you cannot take photographs inside the house. However considering the house is full of priceless antiques and artefacts you can understand why they do not leave people unattended. The tour lasts about 35 minutes and is quite interesting and worth doing just to see inside the house. Group sizes are quite small too and there is a choice of languages - English, French and Chinese.You are allowed to wander around the grounds. There is a nice restaurant and an exhibition hall. There are ladies demonstrating how silk is spun and woven. You can purchase silk items in the shop, they are beautiful but very expensive- scarves were from 1500 bhat upwards (about £35).I would say that this is worth visiting just to see the collection of beautiful antiques. It is fairly commercial and regimented but in a nice way!!! They do have a free Tuk Tuk shuttle to and from the end of the street so if you don't fancy the walk it would be worth looking out for that.

Beautiful place. We stayed at Mercure Bangkok Siam, so the house was next to us (via a narrow street). If you do not want to walk the narrow street, the museum runs a tuktuk from the house to the main street.The museum was not crowded, compared to many other attractions in Bangkok. The house tour was informative and pleasant.
nice. nice to visitthe guides ar just guides but have no hart for the house. Is pure comercialnot expensive
Check it out if you have time.. Check it out if you have time. Nearby Bangkok Art and Culture Centre. Walking distance from BTS National Stadium

Worth every baht. Located close to National Stadium station - the setting is not very nice, but once you get inside the yard all the noises and smells from outside are forgotten. Very well structured tours, the house is beautifully decorated, Jim Thompson had an exquisite taste for furniture, architecture and way of living. We got an English tour, but the guide's English was difficult to understand. We heard the other guides were much better though, so it was a matter of luck. Highly recommend!

A must do. This can be found down a side street from the main road but is fairly well signposted. Or you could get a metered taxi from your hotel for very little, which is what we did.Although the complex is quite small the compulsory guided tour and taking some time to look around afterwards means you need to allocate about two hours to get the most out of this. Be prepared to have to remove your footwear for the tour of the house!The architecture, furniture and art work and the reasons they were brought together are fascinating, the conspiracy theory style disappearance of the man himself makes it even more so.
Nice way to spend 2-hours. It won't blow up your skirt, but it's a nice collection of old relics in a nice traditional house. Well done.

Good tour. Was intersting to see all the stuff he collected. But felt a bit scammed. We got there all hot and bothered, surely more than 40 mins could have been had for a 150 baht ticket? Lots of info about small artefacts. Would have been more interesting to talk about the 5 houses that made up this one big abode!

Amazing house-museum in the heart of Bangkok - a must see. This is the house of the American icon Jim Thompson, who is known for his works in making Thai silk known to the fashion industry worldwide. What a great place to visit. In the heart of the busy Bangkok, this place seems to be in the middle of the jungle, far away from the busyness of the city. The gardens are amazing, filled with lots of tropical plants, producing a dense and beautiful vegetation around the house. Well trained guides will tell you the stories of each art piece ever collected by Thompson, including one of the best collections of traditional Thai paintings in the world and a vast array of arts and craft from Southeast Asia.Guides will also 'speculate' about different versions of Jim Thompson's disappearance in 1967, of this during a trip with close friends to Malaysia, and about his passion for Thai silk and Christianity.When in Bangkok and its vicinity, this place is a must see - no doubt.

Nice and relaxed piece of thai history . I visited the house last week with a thai friend not knowing anything about Jim Thompson. The house is lovely...very picturesque amongst the hustle of siam. The shop there is quite pricey but if you want a relaxed couple of hours strolling through Jim beautiful house and admiring his art collection, then you'll have a great time. Free tours are available in different languages.

Thai silk and memory of Jim Thompson. The mystery story about Jim Thompson, made this place even more interesting. Very nicely maintained house, respectful to original design. Beautiful garden, well preserved antique, art work and so much more. Well organised and managed place, as tourist, you will enjoy this special place of Jim Thompson.Make sure purchase the Thai silk from the store, it is just so smooth and high quality.

Mr THOMPSON highly thought of here. Mr T was an American who settled in Bangkok after the war. He revived the Thai silk industry and lived here. The tour is around his house and gardens. He disappeared in the 60s under mysterious circumstances.... Interesting.

Lovely place to visit. I was so Glad we went. It was a last minute decision - and we didn't regret it. You get assigned to a tour group (they set off every 15 minutes) ... My boys were given brilliant little handmade origami animals to amuse them while we waited 10 minutes for our tour to start. Very informative - we learned things about Jim Thompson we didn't know and also about Thai houses and particular western features he chose to incorporate. Some lovely art and antiques inside. Great shop and cafe too - set in the tropical house and courtyard.

A 'must do' in Bangkok. A really well organised and presented Bangkok attraction. Every week it seems another authentic wooden Thai building makes way for more concrete in the city, meaning that this one is even more to be cherished. Arrive by water taxi on the Khlong San Sap to complete the experience.

Serenity now!. The history and mystery of Jim Thompson lives on through his beautiful, serene, Thai house in Bangkok (not far from MBK). The tour of the house in guided groups is 150baht per person. The guide is informative but relatively quick and little time to look at the deatail. The house is lovely and the gardens beautiful. The artwork and buildings are unique and an opportunity to access and see some unusual pieces. A great collection.The restaurant is reasonably priced and food good. Lovely spot of serenity in the midst of the hustle that is Bangkok! A must see!
Beautiful location. Such a beautiful location The tour is annoying and rather look around by myself without a tour guide

A very famous silk establishment with an eerie story. If you like the best silk in the world this is the shop for you - Caters to men and women with the best ties for men, scarves and Thai clothing for women

Good tourist visit. Not easy to find. Learn about Jim Thompson. Very interesting museum. Not easy to find. Worth the effort.A mystery what happened to Jim Thompson. Products produced under the Jim Thompson Label Excellent. Buy at the Jim Thompson shops.

Silky Smooth. A professionally run attraction with an interesting tale to tell. Although I had never heard of Jim Thompson his house and the artefacts he acquired paint an intriguing hour or two. I'm not sure whether I'm fully convinced by the faultless persona presented of Jim there is no doubt that his legacy is impressive.The "Foundation" that now owns the Jim Thompson house and brand is no doubt a money making enterprise but its all done with in a silky smooth style.

So much time spent in Bangkok and had never come here, why?!. Being obsessed by Asian design and architecture, I loved this place. It is to die for gorgeous and I coveted everything in it lol! Beautifully kept and for sure worth a vist. My only complaint would be that after the tour, nor during, do you actually have any time to go around alone. I love really looking at everything and you only have time to do just a quick scan really.

Nice way to spend an hour or two. Jim Thompson collected a lot of Asian art and built a nicely-designed house and garden in which to display it. In order to see inside the house, you need to pay for the guided tour, which lasts about 45 minutes (and you might have to wait a bit until there’s one scheduled for your language). Our tour guide was informative but clearly had given the same talk (including jokes) many times, although she was good at answering questions. However, the tour (by necessity, given the number of people) has to move fast, and so there’s really no time to find out much about the individual art works. You can’t take photos in the main house, but that’s allowed in the garden and in some smaller buildings with additional art. The house is at the end of a narrow street about 10 minutes’ walk from the main road (with a nearby SkyTrain station), but there’s a free tuktuk shuttle if you don’t walk to walk that much. (Note that the tour involves a few flights of stairs.)

Marvellous feel of living well,Thai traditional, in an earlier generation. I was fascinated by Jim Thompson's House (he was a silk dealer in the 1950's-60's) who built this wooden (teak) compound in traditional Thai style and furnished with Thai antiques and some western style furniture of the 50's-60's.It gives you a wonderful feel of the times and of Thai living for a wealthy foreigner and is a change of a more homely kind from the temples,the palace and the other tourist attractions of Bangkok.I would put it in the "Don't Miss" category.

A beautiful place - a sad tale behind it. I had read about the place in the tourist guides but was still surprised at how sad the story is behind this extraordinary place. Jim Thompson must have been a special individual to setup this workplace for the Thai silk workers and I am very glad that his legacy live son after his mysterious disappearance. Well worth a half day visit. The place is extremely well run with multi lingual tours available all the time - plus the freedom to revisit parts of the ground at your leisure once the official tour is over.

Enjoyable dinner. I went here for dinner with a friend on a weekday. It was not that busy so staff were quite attentive. Thre was a short Thai dancing performance while we were eating, we enjoy the dishes in general. Recommend: Tom Yum soup.

It was so so. I visit jim thomson because many people recommend it. For me it was so so. Yes the house is nice and some antiques things from southeast asia. But just it. It takes only about 30 minutes to walk around with the free tour guide.. I prefer vinamnek mansion instead. Admission fee is 150 thb for adult dan 100 thb for children. My 8 year-old son is free of charge. Free shuttle available to take you to the main street

So many antique things here. The Jim thomson house located in the middle of bangkok, we pay the admisson 150baht for adults, but its worth because we get a guided tour, the tour guide explain anything and everything about the House and antique things, overall i like it, its worth to visit

Insight into expat opulence and art treasures. A visit to Jim Thompsons House is an enjoyable if tightly controlled experience -One must join a group with preferred language guide and No photographs inside the house and certainly no touching of objects . This is understandable in light of preserving the exhibits

Great History. This is such an easy and rewarding destination. Only takes a couple of hours to immerse yourself in the fascinating Teak Buildings and history of one of Thailand's legendary characters. Easily reached by skytrain and very close to MBK Paragon Siam etc.
Very interesting attraction. The house is very well manteined, with rich and ancient furniture. It's a teak wood house surrounded by a tropical garden, rare to see in Bangkok.

More Interesting Than You Would Think. At first I wasn't going to go because it didn't sound that interesting. It was actually pretty interesting to see how he lived, especially his art and décor. if you have a free couple of hours I would recommend it.

The house of the mysterious business man. Marvelous house with a unique collection of South-East asian antiques.
Unfortunately, due to its success, it is now too much commercial since a shop and and a restaurant have invaded the premises of the museum-house
Get into the Mystery. If you are in Bangkok and not going to Jim Thompson House then you never been to Bangkok. The place is such mosaic in every room and corner.

Read This Review For Sure!!!!!. The Jim Thompson House is well worth visiting to experience one of the few remaining intact old Thai teak houses. There are Jim Thompson stores all over the city and abroad but few know about the Jim Thompson Outlet Store. It is located on Sukhumvit Soi 93. Three block walk from the BTS Bang Chak station.There are 5 floors of significantly marked down items. The first three floors are silk and cotton fabric and upholstery by the yard. The 4th floor is clothing and the 5th floor is home accessories. Well worth the trip. Great mark downs.

Nice Thai house in the center of Bangkok. Thai architecture in the central area of Bangkok. The ticket is 150 baht for Thai and Foreigner. That price is ok. However, the collection in this house is not Thai. It's the collection from Burma and Cambodia.

Very cool place to visit. this is one of my favourite places in bangkok. i love walking through the gardens, touring the house and hearing the mysterious tale of how jim thompson disappeared without a trace in malaysia.

Nice Museum, Excellent Shop and Dining. The museum itself is nice enough, though maybe a little sparse on individual items of note, and more a general experience that supports a relatively interesting life story. The guided tour is mandatory, which can be a bother if you get there at the wrong time.There is also an art exhibit above the store, though we forgot to visit it after having a very satisfying and relaxing lunch at the Jim Thompson Restaurant and Wine Bar. The store is also very good for souvenirs at most price levels, though weighted a little more towards the mid-to-high-end.The museum obviously has no AC as an historical building and you have to walk outside briefly at a few points in the tour, so maybe not the best choice in the rain or hottest part of the day. Try to come in before noon and then enjoy a lunch before leaving.

Very interesting tour. My husband and I visited the Jim Thompson house and were very pleasantly surprised by the house.The tour guide was very informative and the house itself was wonderfully carved and filled with interesting pieces. Well worth a visit.

Cheap and interesting - a must do when in Bangkok. 150 baht for adults - 100 baht for under 22 so take your passport! Very interesting tour with lots of history and beautiful artifacts from the ancient Siam and more recent Thailand
A trip back in time. A lovely setting with very interesting tour by our informative guide. Learn about the history of Jim thompson and the use of silk in Thai clothing

We Love Jim!. My hubby and I came here after being recommended by friends.After getting off the BTS at the stadium you take the top exit out onto the main road and follow the signs to Jim's house. The house is located down a 10 minute side street filled with local rickshaws, local market stands and the most unbearable sunshine heat known to man.You walk into the Jim's front yard and pay 150 BHT to get access to the rest of his beautiful home.You then proceed to the garden where, on the left hand side, is registration for the free tour.The tour explains in detail why some of the artifacts are broken, why you nearly trip over every door ledge, and why you can't wear your shoes indoors.The tour is really insightful and the English-speaking guide is great.His house is beautiful and you really get to see a variety of Thai and Buddhist culture through the eyes of a humble silk trader who did so much for Thailand's silk trade.We were truly fascinated by all we learnt and the whole experience was great.Eat downstairs in the restaurant as the food is amazing but the gift shop is a bit expensive!We love Jim and his story will amaze you!#FindJimThompson
Good fabric and demis. Want to see how silk is made? And see time of the best cloth? Visit this place. You will be amazed and have a real consideration for what the process is.
Interesting place to visit. This was an interesting little place to visit, and beautiful grounds in a busy city. A cool story, learned a bit about silk. Worth an hour or two.
Great stuffs are here . Once you got on the buggy, your enjoyment of filling every single minutes. The house is beautifully maintained and the history of Jim is amazing.
Classy. It is a classic place for thai silk. The products or the set up of the shop are warm and welcome for any shoppers. Top quality of the products especially for furniture products.
Interesting History/Architecture. We really enjoyed the tour of the Jim Thompson House. The architecture and cultural artifacts were amazing!

Nice place, lacking information about the art and the man.. It was so so. The house and grounds are pretty and the story is a "made for tv" movie. I just wish they had the people to tell it. If not the people then a pamphlet or a booklet. There was so much art that remained unexplained to me and my crew. Additionally, we could not see everything. My wife will kill me but I wanted to see Mr. Thompson's design of the bathroom. He had taken a traditional Thai house and rebuilt it as well as making some modern Western additions. This is interesting to me. He added balconies and we could not see it. All closed. Too bad. For me it was average and I wanted to leave. Oh and the prices for the clothes were rather high. The quality was there but it was a bit much.
Simple place . It is just a house built by a foreigner .... It is not really big place .... Just a fine short trip since you are around the town area .
Beautiful grounds. Unfortunately, no photography is allowed inside, but don't let that turn you off. The grounds are lovely and the treasures left behind by Jim Thompson are well worth the visit. Go!

A top favorite for all of our guests. All of our guests for 10+ yrs say this is one of their top experiences in Thailand. This historical tour leaves the guest with a clear visual of what Thailand was before and after Jim Thompson began his project. The home is filled with beautiful artifacts and the tour is short enough to to keep your attention and long enough to fill your mind with visuals and knowledge you will actually see all of over Thailand. The restuarant is the perfect place to cool down and enjoy Thai fare, next to the beautiful pond.
Nice bit of History. Our tour guide was very quiet, so I couldn't hear her over the thunderstorm outside. The house is cool to look around and their is a nice shop too.

Tradition.. Beautiful and very well maintained. Lovely in each particular, the guides are polite and speaking good english, they easily introduce you on the life of Jim Thompson through his house and collections.Everything is well organized, there is also a buggy to escort you from the beginning of the street untill the house and viceversa, a panacea for legs and feet.Recommended and inexpensive!
nice. nice artwork, good vibe, store is interesting have a lot of beautifull stuff in there. surounding is amazing.

Surprisingly Interesting. Historical aspect of traditional Thai architecture very interesting. Easily accessible and quite cheap. Not sure teenagers appreciated it but what the heck , cannot always be about shopping!!

Spinning a Yarn. Use the BTS and alight at the National Stadium BTS stop. You have to exit the station and cross the road.It's about a 5 min to 10 min walk. Jim Thompson House is located in a nondescript lane off the main road. Thankfully, they provide a complimentary buggy shuttle for ferrying visitors to and from the main road. There is an option to explore the house further by purchasing a ticket worth 150 baht for adults and 100 baht for kids. Those who prefer to just visit the place can hang around and see the white and yellow cocoons. There is a fascinating equipment which shows how the cocoons are boiled over a fire and the yarn extracted from it. When we were there, a young lady was performing a traditional Thai dance to lilting music. The biggest draw is possibly the store with it's unique collection of souvenirs. The scarves and tee shirts are recommended as gifts and they have intricate patterns in bright colors. Some of the adult tee sizes appeared to be geared towards larger built folks versus the average slim built bloke. So please ensure that you try out the outfits prior to purchase. The staff are polite, attentive and more than willing to patiently assist. You can easily spend about an hour here and take shelter if you are caught in a sudden downpour.

Nostalgia and good decoration.. Nostalgia and good decoration.With the mystery of disappearance of Mr. Jim. There's a charm of this place,Good decoration,The foods and beverage are too normal.But, good place to chill out and talk and someone beside you.
Very informative. A very interesting part of Bangkok's history, located off the main road. It gave me an insight into Thai culture. Lovely to see the house so well looked after.

Exotic. Excellent museum containing old Thia homes.Shop sells exotic produce. Lovely resturant. Excellent access via Sky train National Stadium stop. Free transport on offer to venue.Beware of gold touts trying to entice one away to other places.

An oasis in the middle of downtown Bangkok. This is absolutely worth a visit if visiting Bangkok. Just take tim out to sit in the garden and imagine life before the high-rises and the busy life in the city now
A Bangkok highlight. This tour offers an insight into an interesting man and the Thai Silk industry. It is a really beautiful house & grounds that are only a short walk from MBK shopping centre.

Worthwhile central attraction. We visited Jim Thompson house without much prior knowledge of his life or work. The house has been well preserved and the 40 minute guided tour including in the entry fee is informative and interesting. Well worth visiting and easily accessible being a 5-10 minute walk from National Stadium BTS.

Traditional Thai . Came here almost 20 years ago with friends from US. Quite amazed with the improvement and tourists friendly atmosphere. Amidst the high rises in central Bangkok, this place is totally hidden. With the old trees covered, it is like an oasis in the middle of Bangkok. Highly recommend even for local. The guided tour was excellent. Didn't have a chance to try the restaurant. Will do if have the opportunity. Believe it's going to be good.

Nothing important, just ordinary place. Just ordinary place to wider knowledge about one of the biggest textile industry in Thailand. Although the front place is full with trees but inside the houses is hot. They should place portable air conditioning inside.

A little bit of paradise in the middle of Bangkok. This is my second time to visit the Jim Thompson house. It is an oasis inside the hectic pace of Bangkok. Take the tour, wander around, sit on the benches and imagine what it might have been like 50 years ago to live there. Stop in and have an iced tea in the restaurant and go through the shop. I have to admit that on this trip I went to the Jim Thompson Outlet. It would be great if you were looking for inexpensive souvenirs or if you needed beautiful upholstery fabric but for up to date scarf designs go to the source - the Jim Thompson House or the Jim Thompson Shop in Siam Paragon.

Good breaks from the malls . As soon as Bangkok starts to appear as a concrete city without and soul, head to this place. Very close to the hectic mall area and a sharp contrast to everything else. Right in the heart of the action is a place that is so beautiful that it can transport you into another land . Must visit. Takes 1 hour total. Costs nothing

Amazing green inside the heart of Bangkok!. The museum has different group tours in some popular languages. Moreover, if you are under 22 years old, you can have discount on the ticket fee. When you go inside the house, you will be amazed by the greenish and tranquil atmosphere in here. The wooden house of Jim Thompson has been reserved in a very good conditions. Lovely flowers around the yard everydays !

Definitely worth a visit if time allows. the entrance is not free, only costing 150Baht for adults and 100Baht for those below 22 years old. entrance ticket includes guided tour with several languages available. The house itself is not big, guided tour takes around 30minutes.

Good place to peak the history and nice rainy day activity. We visited this place on the rainy day. Whole things took about one hour and most of the time were indoor so rain didn't affect much. Our tour guide was not good in English and couldn't answer many questions that some people asked but she was trying so hard to accommodate her group. It was nice to know some background of Jim Thompson and saw his priceless artifact collection. Restaurant next to museum is nice atmosphere ( bit pricy though ) and tuck tuck ride from National stadium station is available.

Very nice tour to know the man and the house. Jim Thompson is interesting enough all by himself, so just seeing the house he built and the stories behind it are very fascinating and worth the time and small admission price.

Wonderful museum. This was a little gem tucked away in the bustling city of Bangkok. Had just a few days in Bangkok and this was well worth the visit. Nice tour of grounds and lovely cafe to stop for a drink or bite to eat.

Beautiful place and interesting guide. This place deserve the price! I really like this place which has beautiful Thai traditional buildings and interior properties. It is organized by group tours and the guide was really helpful and interesting so that I could understand this place's history.
Quite interesting . This is a nice little stop to make in Bangkok. It provides lots of interesting and colorful contemporary history to this great city.

All my bows ties are brought here . The best and classiest Silk brand along with a cafe on the top .
Very helpful staff , who always go that extra mile .
I always buy my bow ties here .
The best in the world 😊

Nice traditional Thai home. This is a famous historic house and is a nice tour an hour or so. There is a nice explanation and demo regarding Thai silk making which is what made Jim Thompson the previous owner famous worldwide. The house itself is very nice and worth a visit.

Amazing glimpse into the exotic life of an ex pat business man... Beautiful and informative site that allows for intimate tour of incredibly maintained and preserved Thai architecture from the mid and early 20th century. Forget the modern glass and steel downtown and come here to see what Thailand looked like before the crush of the modern world invaded. Very busy on the weekends. Hot, so dress appropriately. You will need to take your shoes off. Very nice gift ship with high quality silk goods for which Mr. Thompson is rightfully famous.
Exceeded our expectations . Definitely worth a couple of hours for a visit! The guide does a nice job and the history is quite interesting. Be sure to stop in the shop! Lots of great silk items.

Quite interesting for 2-3 hours. I found this visit to be a pleasant surprise since I am usually not so much into visiting places such as the JT House. Mind you, it turned out to be an interesting afternoon trip away from the usual Bangkok frenzy.

Just beautiful. I am happy that I finally went to see Jim Thompson's house. Everything in this Place is just so beautiful. It's an oasis in the middle of hectic and sweaty Bangkok. You can see the whole place in an hour or so, so don't have to spend your whole day there. I'd say it would be a good idea to visit this place when you get tired of shopping in the nearby malls, like MBK and Siam Center. If you don't want to wait any extra check what time they are doing the guided tour in your preferred language. I think they had it in Thai, English and French at least.
Interesting. Great antiques and curios, amazing teak house, beautifully kept and maintained. Staff are very informative, well worth a visit.

I had bigger expectations. but it is on the must see list. The tour itself lasts 30 minutes and the house contains interesting art objects. In the end we had dinner at the restaurant, it was worth it.

Don't book a tour!. We arrived at this location on our own. You don't need a tour guide! We ended up visiting the shop, but not paying to go through the house. We had seen so many textile workshops during our travels that it didn't seem worth the effort. However, the contemporary art installation on site was outstanding and well worth the visit.

Fascinating story.. Spent a couple of hours here. Very well organised. Entrance price includes a free tour. The house is lovely and houses a unique collection of Asian antiques and art. Wonder if the truth about Jim Thompson's disappearance will ever be discovered v

amazing story, very nice housing. Amazing story of this OSS Officer who retired in Thailand and spent the rest of his life in manufacturing silk. Then, vanished at about 60 in Birmania during easter.The visit of the house was about 35 mn during which we visited the house and the garden. Wood everywhere. We just regret we were too many people at the same time since the rooms are not that big.
A must see. Experiythe life of Jim Thompson, how he lived and worked. Amazing collection of fine art in the house that this amazing man had constructed in the middle of Bangkok
Fascinating! . Read up a bit about Jim Thompson before you go- I highly rate this attraction if you enjoy art, architecture, history and beautiful gardens- this is for you! Very worthwhile

Interesting and an oasis. The Jim Thompson House is one of the best tourist attractions in Bangkok. It's peaceful, beautiful and informative. The Grand Palace is opulent, and the numerous Wats and Buddhas are interesting, but Jim Thompson's house is unique - make sure you go.
Worth at least one visit. A beautiful colonial house. A bit touristy but honestly , it is worth a visit at least once if you are in Bangkok.

Beautiful Experience. Amazing place! My husband and I had an amazing time! No need to book tours as they provide various language-guides tours of the house, free of charge and pretty much mandatory! The restaurant there was also great with some european dishes available for the less adventurous, and bathroom are clean :D a not to miss experience!

Good story, but guides have an attitude (maybe tired of the heat). Guides seem like tired parents, same old jokes... and get visibly irritated quickly. Suggest you have more guides and give them a cool aircon place to sit in between shuttling groups. Otherwise, their smile turns into a frown and doesnt suit the place/ambience. Otherwise a good tour.

A gem in the middle of chaotic Bangkok. This is a great place to see a beautiful architectural gem in the center of the city. The tickets are a bit expensive, but you get a guide who will take you on a tour (with other guests) of the entire compound and inside the house. There are tours for many different language speakers. I learnt a lot about Jim Thompson, the silk industry and also about history. There are many nice pieces to look at, including what was the equivalent to today's TV: a rat box (a box in which rats run around). The guide said this was very "exciting" for children back then.I was disappointed, however, that they didn't let us see Jim Thompson's restroom. I think that's the only room that was not shown. Also, you have to take your shoes off to go inside the house, so be prepared. I can imagine that it can be quite busy if there are many groups, so try to go early to avoid the crowd.The restaurant is super expensive, but I didn't eat there so can't comment on the quality and taste.

Beautiful house, knowledgable tour guides, perfect first day activity. Bangkok is overwhelming at first and visiting the Jim Thompson house is a nice calm introduction to Thailand. Its a beautiful place easily accesible by the Skytrain. The tour guides greet you and sets you up on a tour. While we were waiting for the tour we wandered around saw the giant carp, crocodile fish and turtles. The house is an Oasis in the middle of a busy city. The tour takes you round the gardens first followed by the dining room, living room and bedrooms. Nattya was our guide and she was very knowledgable on all the pieces in Jim Thompsons house. The tour lasts about 20/30 minutes but then you can remain in the gardens as long as you wish. There is also a restuarant and gift shop which look lovely and if you've got the money go all out! The tour costs 150 baht each, completley worth it! Also went on a rainy day and it didnt affect things.
Awesome . Great place to visit see all the architecture and design of Jim Thompson, his ideas and the style of the home is amazing. The tour is worth every penny.
Worth visiting . The place was intriguing with the tour. By visiting, you can understand a typical Thai house architecture and also how Jim Thompson lived.

Unique Architecture - A glimpse into Thai culture. One must not miss a visit to Jim Thompson's house. The Architecture of the house complex,the beautiful gardens, ponds filled with koi fish will be etched in my memory for a long time. The attraction is very well organized with tours in English and Thai by very friendly and patient guides. We were given a tour of each room explaining interesting details about the artifacts or anecdotes about Jim Thompson. I have really come to admire the effort the architect had put into the place to acquire all the rare and beautiful collectibles.

A beautiful learning experience.. I stepped out of the chaos, smells and congestion of Bangkok into the shaded, fragrant gardens of the Jim Thompson House and was delivered into the competent hands of a knowledgable tour guide. One of the best tours I've been on - foundational information about Mr. Thompson, his house(es) and his evolution in Bangkok at a unique time in it's history. My first exposure to the Thai aesthetic - granted, through the eyes of a western ex-pat! The guide comfortably riffed on any topic our group asked about, but didn't over inform - she let us feel, think about and imagine the times in which his collection was created.

Fascinating. What a fascinating couple of hours. Taking a guided tour around the house was my first tourist activity in Bangkok and I was not disappointed. Apart from learning about the silk trade I also learnt something of Thailand and Bangkok. The only downside is that the items for sale are really expensive, even if they are great quality.

A must-see attraction in Bangkok. The Jim Thompson house offers views into two aspects of Thai history. First, the traditional architecture and art collection of the house is spectacular. While Mr. Thompson collected several traditional homes together to make his house, the traditional architecture still shines, and the tour guides are very good at explaining the construction techniques.Secondly, Jim Thompson revitalized the Thai silk industry through his marketing efforts, and a visit to the House and associated store is a wonderful way to understand what Mr. Thompson did for the silk weavers of Thailand.Lastly, the mystery of his disappearance is fascinating, and be sure to ask your guide what their theory is about what happened... Everyone believes something different!
Relaxing and pleasant. A peaceful little corner in a busy city....We enjoyed our tour and walking in the gardens.....Worth the visit.....

Delicious food!. I enjoyed several shareable entrees with a friend in this beautiful restaurant! It's tucked away down a street with other art galleries. This was a great alternative to the other, busier tourist sights.
Excellent!. We loved our visit to Jim Thompson house. It is really well laid out and the guided tour was informative and our guide was lovely. Highly recommend this tour.
Must See. A beautifully curated and preserved glimpse into a time past, of a fascinating man long gone. The tour guides knowledgeable and well trained in a number of languages.

Nice place and very informative . Place is amazing with many things to learn. The your guide is very good in speaking english. If you have many pillow covers and curtain made from jim thompson silk for sure you want to visit this place to know about the history. Do not forget to check out the jim thompson factory outlet. I did not have time to go do not forget to visit if you have time .

A pleasant couple of hours. We enjoyed the gardens and tour of the house one afternoon, it's not huge but it is very pleasant and the guides speak good English. The gift shop is large and well stocked, air conditioned too!

I love this place.. Very interesting place. I visit this place every time I am in Bangkok.Very highly recommended.Tip: If you're hungry after the visit, then walk 100 meters along the river east toward Hua Chang Bridge. There is a lovely street food at a cheap price.

Great stuff . Like the silks, had a great variety of curtains available. I purchased four silk pieces for gifts. Prices were high but quality is there. Ready-made options are also available.Great for gifts.

Very Interesting. Really enjoyed our visit to Jim Thompson House and found guide and history regarding Jim Thompson, his house, the silk industry and of course his mysterious disappearance fascinating. We also purchased a number of items from the lovely shop and had lunch at the restaurant which was excellent.Please make time to visit whilst in Bangkok.

A lovely house to visit. The mysterious story of Jim Thompson was, honestly not as intriguing as his lovely apartment in Bangkok. (previously not) Just to make sure you have put on enough mosquito spray before visiting.

Very nice houses and a small tour. Lovely house in the woods just at the center of city. They have a lovely restaurant with good food and good prices. They have a shop also which sells silk and cashmire.
Nice side trip to visit. If you are interested in an expat's life in Bangkok, this is the place to visit. After visiting a few rooms, you might want to buy a place in Thailand.
Great. I've been there twice now - small but informative. A quiet little jewel with a restful garden. Thai dancing outside and a full explanation of the silk making process.

Beautiful and well preserved. Walking around the beautifully preserved space you can really see how much Jim Thompson was well loved by the locals. Well worth a visit if you love architecture, nature and history if you have an hour to spare

Beautiful but not a necessity. My time here was unplanned, so it was a nice surprise; but I wouldn't say you HAVE to go here during your trip to Bangkok. It's a lovely quaint home and surrounding area and if you have the time it's a great city break!

A relaxing and worthwhile tour, good lunch and shopping. Take a couple hours to tour Jim Thompsons house, and enjoy the preserved teak home built and decorated by the silk industry icon. The tour guides are good English soeaking, the setting is peaceful and pretty. Good restaurant onsite for a snack or lunch. The gift shop offers lots of fine shopping (Westen prices). There is a smaller shop across the courtyard with nice large greeting cards for about $1 US ...good souvenirs.

A perfect wedding venue as well as a great museum. We had two pleasures of getting married at Jim Thompson House, one was the experience of getting married in such a beautiful venue. The Ayara Hall and Thompson Bar were perfect for our needs giving our guests a truly authentic experience. The service was excellent and the food was also delicious, from canapés through to dessert.The second pleasure was working with Suthida Angkinand the Events Manager. Suthida epitomizes being genuine and was forever helpful and accommodating to our needs. She has worked with the Jim Thompson company for many years and it really impresses as though she part of the Jim Thompson family. Thank you again Suthida you amazing, perfect, in fact words cannot express gratitude.The Museum is also fantastic.

Really great Site. We went here on a saturday afternoon after visiting MBK. We took the BTS back to National stadium and walked to the house - 2 touts along the way told us it was closed :)The house is really worth an hour or two and it is a relaxing tour

A bit of social history tucked away.. Easy to find by taxi or tuck tuck. Not so accessible by foot with uneven surfaces to negotiate, busy traffic. Interesting home and a clearly laid out tour providing access to all rooms and area of a small enclosed garden backing onto the canal. Share this trip with one travelling up the canals to get a real sate of comparing life in the last century with that of today. Tours are rather quick and you feel a bit rushed when there is a lot of detail to absorb. Be prepared to be in bare feet for the tour.Interesting carvings and an assortment of exotic plants.An excellent gift shop at the side. Rather prices but a bit special especially for those wanting goods made from silk. A cafe opposite offer refreshments at a reasonable price, seats in the shade and a ticket office at the entrance.

More about Jim Thompson then silk.... ...but still very informative tour (you must take the tour). The shop is very basic (much larger choice at the shopping malls). The restaurant serves authentic Thai food - bit pricey, but very tasty!

Nice quick, and cool, tour. Guided tour, included in price, was very informative. He was an interesting figure, and the house is very cool. The tour takes about 30 minutes I think, and there was maybe 20 minute wait once I got there. You have to take off your shoes for the tour, so recommend something easy to remove (sandals) if you can.
GO. Start your trip here. You get a good sense of Thai art. Then walk around the corner to the government run art/craft shop if you need souvenirs.

Great place to visit with an interesting story. This place is well worth a visit. You get a tour guide who shows you round the house in which you have to take your shoes off. They are very informative and there English was very good. The house is great with some interesting artefacts in and different as was owned by an American not a Thai. You cannot take any photos inside the house. When we went there were just the right amount of tourists there. There is a free tuk tuk at the bottom of the street which takes you to the house which is near the skytrain. We ate at the restaurant at the site and the food was very nice too.

Good time filler. Went to the Jim Thompson house to pass the time one afternoon. Good time filler with some interesting artifacts and a cool story about the man behind the house. If you're in the area it's worth a visit.
Nice place to visit. Easy to travel by skytrain, charm and unique if anyone look for something cool and nice please come and join here

Mr Thomson is a person with great taste - try hanging around his Living room ;-). Wonderful combination of East and West.
If you only have 3 hours and want to have a taste of South East Asia culture, this is the place for you.
The tour available in Thai, English, Japanese, Chinese and German (and a few others) will give you a feel of what Thailand is through the eye of a foreigner.
Real Thai history. Jim Thompson was known as the father of the Thai silk trade..his home has been beautifully preserved..excellent tour guides....well worth seeing

Intersting. We visited here on a 4 day tour of Bangkok. It's strange as this was an Americans house. Not a Thai man. They have a great deal of respect for his work. It's a nice place but strange as they have used this as one of their top attractions. Tour takes 45 minutes or so. Get off sky train at the National Stadium station and it's a ten minute walk. There's a free tuk tuk to take you back to the station

Historic Thai Housing. Did the tour with my daughter in the beautiful house and gardens. Amazing collection of paintings, antiques, and gorgeous porcelain collection. Had lunch in their restaurant and the food and service were wonderful !

Get a drink by the pond after buying a Thai tie. The tour of the house is really neat. You learn how traditional Thai houses were constructed and how Jim Thompson encapsulated some of the marvels of 1700s Thailand with Atomic age sensibilities. The store is flashy and it was impossible to walk out of there without getting a tie.

Beautiful home, tour a bit boring . The home is so beautiful. If you like architecture, gardens, art and collectables, this is a great place to go to. But, it kind of ends there. We went to the tour with the impression we would learn about his past, his company, why he went missing, but realistically it was all a bit blah. You can't take pictures in side the home, only the garden which takes 2 minutes to walk through and the entire tour took about 30 minutes. It would be great if there were activities, a better script and more info!

Interesting History . Our hotel recommended we visit Jim Thompson House as we had a morning to spare. As soon as we arrived we were so suprised at how peaceful it is considering it is in the middle of such a busy city. Included in the entry fee of 150 baht is a guided tour offered in a variety of different languages. We enjoyed the tour. Learning about the history of Thai architecture and Jim Thompson. We found it quite interesting.We would recommend it if you are in the area and have a couple of hours free.

Take a break from shopping. The story of Jim Thompson is not only exciting, but it also feels close in time for us that were born in the fifties. Jim Thompson was not only a spy, but he was an architect by profession and this is very much reflected in the house. Since you are bound to do shopping at Siam Square this is not a detour and the place is easily reached by Skytrain end stop National Stadium.

A hidden oasis among a concrete jungle. The attraction is tucked away down a street & although it's not the most obvious place it's relatively easy to find. If using the BTS train you can get off at Siam or at the National Stadium and it's around 15 minute walk. We only realised on the way back that there is a complimentary tuk tuk from the top of the road that the house is on. Worth it if you are struggling with the Bangkok sun. Once at the house you are assigned a tour guide and taken along with a small group to view the house. The guides are very friendly and informative, whilst we knew nothing about Jim Thompson when we started we certainly did at the end. There is a gift shop selling Thai silk scarfs clothing etc, albeit rather pricey. The cafe is air conditioned, most of the house is not. The house is well worth a visit.
Not worth it, unless you are really interested in Jim Thompson. Went for the tour, thinking it would be informative about the Thai silk industry or thai customs, but it was all about Jim Thompson.

A must-see attraction in Bangkok. This is absolutely a must-see place inBangkok. The house is very nice with a lot of unique decorative items. Jim Thompson's life story is amazing. The entrance ticket costs 150 bahts which includes a guide in English or French.Many beautiful items in the shop but pricy.
Interesting bit of history.. The tour is not long but it is quite interesting, and we enjoyed seeing silk being spun onsite. Our tour guide was very fluent in English.

A beautiful oasis in a crowded city. Jim Thompson House is a must see in Bangkok. Easily accessible by BTS to National Stadium station and then a short walk down the Soi. Guided tours in many languages, a delightful coffee shop and restaurant serving quality food. The Jim Thompson story is fascinating. The house a treed landscaped oasis in a noisy, crowded city is a great place to calm down and relax. Traditional homes joined together to become a living museum of art treasures. A must see, after visiting The Grand Palace. After the visit , cross the rail line and shop at MBK.

Great place. I actually loved this place so much. It was full of traditional Thai cultures but at the same time it's not intimidating as there's free guided tours around the premise. It might be too sterile (too westernized) but i had some pretty bad experiences in Thailand before and now i stick with the popular tourists places only. Really really recommended. And it was really cheap, only 150 baht for adults above 22 and 100 for people under 22.

Aa piece of history in downtown Bangkok. If you want to see some of the finest merchandise Thailand has to offer, then this is the place. They offer some amazing fabrics especially silk and cotton and classy home decor A must visit for all those who want to get some quality gifts for their loved ones and at the same time know more about Jim Thompson, the man who played an important role in helping Thais produce world class mechandise.

Beautiful teak home with lots of history. This home is very unique . The guided tours are done in multiple languages at scheduled times . The groups were small allowing me to ask lots of questions and take time to view the antiquities. The gift shop had beautiful items of great quality to bring home as souvenirs. I loved the cafe . The food was fresh and light . The restaurant and lounge were sunny and comfortable . Plan to spend a half day to check out all of the elements of the home .
English speaking tour . Pleasantly surprised at how interesting and beautiful this is! Highly recommend for anyone interested in the area or in history. Very well kept, and displayed.

Interior design. Asian antiques and garden. Very peaceful . If you love to look at interior design, have a passion for Asian themes in gardens and accessories and a love for style this is worth an hour of your time.We did a meal at the restaurant then walked around. It was lovely peaceful and beautiful. The restaurant tasty but wasn't cheap and what I would pay at home.A walk from the Siam centre get your google maps it is not such an easy find as it is down a laneway.

Very pretty. Very pretty and quiet house in the center of the city - you would never know! The tours are short (about 30 min) and they walk you through the main house and some gardens. Good way to see some traditional Thai architecture
Something different. I stopped at this site as it was recommended by my hostel staff as just a way to kill time while staying the afternoon in Bangkok. Interesting back stories and relaxing.

Convenient to Asian malls and interesting. It was raining during my new wife and my visit to the Jim Thompson house. The property is a ten minute walk from the Siam malls and at the entrance to the side street you can get a quick shuttle (4 seater tuk tuk is unique) to save a five minute walk. The house itself includes English and French tours with admission. It has a shop and a cafe/restaurant. Lots of antiques and a bit of architecture to explore.

Good Fun. A little break from the frantic pace of Bangkok. Jim Thompson's House is a popular attraction not too far from the Skytrain.Very tranquil, serene... decent tour guide and worth the time.Beautiful house and the story behind that and Jim Thompson himself is interesting.Check it out!

Nice history and architecture . Really nice and enjoyable tour. The tour guide really explains on the architecture and the Jim Thompson company. The Jim Thompson gifts shop is must go for Jim Thompson fans. More variety.
Beautiful grounds. Not terribly impressed, but it is certainly beautiful. Don't go out of your way, but if you're close by its definitely worth a look. No pictures allowed inside. Compulsory tour.

Okay. Convenient place to visit close to BTSBut if you are trying to escape the summer heat not a good idea as this place is not air conditioned (besides the restaurant)You get to choose if you like your tour conducted in English or ChineseBasically it's just a house with some old statues which Jim Thompson collected not much to seeMost interesting was the pee pots for male and female and a toy house for mice to run through Had lunch at the restaurant. Flavor was okay. Not the best meal I have had in Bangkok. Wifi password provided did not work on my phone

My Favorite Place in Bangkok. The Jim Thompson House is a beautiful oasis in the midst of a chaotic city. The house itself is a wonderful combination of Thai and Western architecture. Visitors learn about the mysterious man who consolidated the formerly home-based silk weaving businesses. The restaurant is lovely with good (but overpriced) food. I have purchased several wonderful t-shirts and pillow covers at the elegant store. One can spend at least half a day in this complex. Most recent added feature is two lovely Thai dancers in front of the store. One warning: ignore the guys near the entrance to the street on which the Jim Thompson House is located. Their scam is to tell you that the Jim Thompson House is closed. They propose a different activity instead--one, of course, they'll take you to for a small fee. Not sure what this activity is but I suspect it involves gem shops.

Silk regenerated. Bit of Thai history and a guy that helped get the silk trade going again Worth a visit take 1/2 hours out of your schedule have a coffee there...Be ware the products are not cheap but the quality is top notch

Pleasant and Interesting. We found the range of products interesting and good design. It may be pricey but the quality makes up for that. The restaurant serves good food of a good standard and the service is above average.Avoid the times when tour groups are there as this would mean having to wait for service.

Nice, short tour - can't take any photos inside. Charge 150BHT to enter per person, the (English) speaking tour is over in 15 mins, we were only allowed to take photos of the garden. Apart from that there were some nice collectors pieces that were hundreds of years old, the house itself is beautiful and has that old feel. Worth checking out if you are in the area and want to know a little bit of history.
Nice. We had a pleasant afternoon at Jim Thompson. It's a nice place with interesting story and some nice pieces for sale at reasonable prices.

Interesting place. A very nice place to visit. A tour is recommended, else you just get to see the gardens, which are also very nice. Our guide was very friendly and explained a lot of things about the house, its previous owner and Thailand in general. I assume other guides do that as well as we over heard another group guide. Place is extremely crowded during high season, and you have to expect very long queues.The restaurant attached to the house was also very good, even though the prices are a little above the average prices for Bangkok.

Pretty cool oasis in busy bkk. Nice area and great guides showing you around the house with all the artwork. Price includes guided tour for approx 1hr or more. Doesnt inform you much about his actually life though and dissapearance, mainly info about history of art in house, very interesting still tho. Free shuttle to road if you are lazy like us :)

Worth a visit. Love the houses and furnishings. The tours are well organized. I wish the tour would spend more time discussing the house design, construction, materials, and less on the furnishings, but just a small quibble. Easily accessed by BTS Silom, but beware of touts that surround the area.

Amazing piece of history. Great bit of local culture and a must see. The guide spoke good english and was very enthusatic about her role. Down side its not ideal for a small family as the guide was trying to explain and young kids in our group were crying. When we first arrived the staff were very friendly but went to the desk stood in a que for tickerts and then counter assistant just put up sign saying counter closed and walked off with no explanation. Bad impression.

A nice alternative to the other sites in Bangkok. Upon recommendation from a friend, we visited the Jim Thompson House and did the tour. It was a lovely example of classic thai architecture and an interesting tour. Interesting to watch the silk extraction process as well

Nice place but a bit less information during the tour. You can only visit the museum while a guided tour. The price of 150 THB per person is fair, but the information given during the tour could be more. Definitely a place worth to visit in Bangkok, but not a must go.
