Check to get a tour which just had started know, than you will miss probably all information about the person Jim Thomson. Rather wait 20 minutes until the next tour starts.

Beautiful house and history. The house and gardens are beautiful and so is the artwork. The stories of how it all came together are really interesting. I wish there had been more on how he developed the silk industry but it's overall very worth the trip.

Traditionnal wood Thaï house at the heart of Bangkok.. Refreshing place to discover whenever you have a little time in Bangkok. You'll sure appreciate this cultural and historical dive in this gorgeously decorated authentic teck Thaï house.After the short tour in company of a guide, spend some time in the Jim Thompson shop where you will find nice articles for you or for offering, and/or enjoy a drink, lunch or dinner at the restaurant, nestled close by a soothing fish pond.
Jimbo's House. Enjoyed our visit. The guide spoke excellent English and was quite funny. Its an interesting house with an interesting history. Good value for money.

Very Little about Jim Thompson's Life. Jim Thompson was a legendary figure in the modern Thai history. The tour guide will tell you that this former residence of Jim Thompson is a blend of Thai and Western architecture. The exhibits are mostly his antique collection and very little about his life or the Thai silk business although there is a live demonstration on the museum ground of silk spinning from cocoons. The museum is 5 minutes walk from the National Stadium BTS station. I don't think this is a must see in Bangkok but if you are here for a few days and have already been to the major tourists spot, the Jim Thompson House is a good place to spend an hour (but no more than that).

Secrets of the silk trade. The house is found amidst the hustle and bustle of Bangkok, a nice little quaint building (or a set of buildings spread out within a compound) that tells the story and secrets of Thailand's silk trade. You can see the tedious process the silk makers go through to bring that wonderful fabric into your hands. The story of the man, Jim Thompson, makes fascinating reading as well. All in, an educational visit for all of us.

Definite tourist site to visit. The location of the place is hidden.Lucky we found it.Our tour guide at the place,provided us with interesting facts about Jim Thompson and the house he stayed.Never knew he went missing in a jungle in Cameron Highlands, yes, we are from Malaysia.There' s a shop & restaurant over there.Must visit.

Nice place for visiting. I saw in to do list in Bangkok and I just came by. Nice place. Little history and take trip those years. Excursions has to be with guide. Enterence is 150 bht and guide service is free. I think u should see as well.

History and food. The JIm Thompson House and Museum is tucked away by a canal in central Bangkok. The museum tour is interesting but the old teak houses Thompson collected and re-assembled here are superb examples of yesteryear. The restaurant, by a koi pond, serves excellent Thai food.
teak house. well maintained old house guides who know a lot about the buildings and contents is possible to arrive by canal boat berth at rear of property

Different attraction and a great stop in Bangkok. Really enjoyed the tour and the architecture. The place isn't hard to find and the tour isn't terribly long so I found it to be an informative, enjoyable experience with little reason not to visit. I can see why it is a popular stop; given the gardens and everything it is a welcomed sanctuary from the busy streets of Bangkok.

A Very interesting House. Jim Thompson House is quite an experience, it has historical significance to the Thai people, and many of the artifacts on show are ancient and interesting and many depict the life of Jim Thompson. There are guided tours available, and possibly private tours also. The tour guide on our tour was very knowledgeably, but we passed many paintings and wall hangings that didn't rate a mention even though they could have been mentioned, maybe it was a time factor. The shop attached to Jim Thompson House has amazing Thai Silk clothes which is well worth a look, as that is what Jim Thompson was famous for.
An oasis in rural Bangkok. Enjoy the beautiful home with amazing plants and flowers, old furniture and beautiful ceramics. An oasis in rural Bangkok.

Beautiful House. Take a couple of hours from looking at Temples to spend walking round this amazing house which belonged to an American who revived silk making.He brought Western style ideas to a Thai house never before had a formal dining room be thought of. He also has a wealth of antiques on show brought from all over Asia. After the tour enjoy a meal in their restaurant which is very resonably priced or visit the silk shop. Be a little suprised at some of the prices but remember this is pure silk you are buying, but there are some very good cotton T shirts for 950 Baht if you want a little reminder of your visit.

Unique attraction. I never knew of Jim Thompson but thoroughly enjoyed the tour of his home and the history of the man. The restaurant on premise was very good but I would highly recommend reservations. We had to wait quite a while. The J.T. products are wonderful. We ended up visiting their main store as well to do more shopping. Overall an enjoyable experience. Easily accessible with the train.

It's REALLY GOOD. At first I read that it's recommended to go there and didn't get why !!When I went there and heard the story of the house and Jim Thompson himself, I got fascinated.You HAVE to go there, loved it.

A break from the chaos. A calm break from the activity of Bangkok, we really enjoyed our tour. Very informative, yet low key. The garden typifies the many quite areas throughout the city. A pleasant surprise.

A restful haven in a hectic city. It's hard to believe this is central Bangkok. It's a beautiful, peaceful place even with tourists. They control numbers with tours and whilst we waited they kept the kids entertained with origami and animals around the gardens.
Interesting in many ways !. A tiny experience of Thai Architecture here ; our guide was really good, we learnt a lot about silk, J. Thompson, the Thai culture and the quality of the place is amazing.

Unexpected curiosity. The tour of the Jim Thompson House was about 35 minutes long with a guide that spoke and understood English very well. The house is intriguing as are the simple collection of Buddhist art from Jim Thompson's personal collection. Photography is welcome in the gardens but prohibited in the house. Best way to get there is to take the skytrain to National Stadium station. There are two shops to purchase literature or silk products.
Interesting tour of the place. Guided tour was informative, with the hosts commanding a strong sense of English. Be prepared to take off your shoes pretty often during the tour to enter the house.
Great place to visit. The house is well maintained. It preserves all the items in the house. The guide helps me visualize the life of Mr Thompson in the old days.

Yet another interesting attraction!!!. This is yet another of Bangkok's worth a visit attraction. Enjoyed immensely and the tour guide made it very interesting. A good place to go on a rainy day, but it was very hot when we visited. Tour guides speaking many languages are available and we were kept well informed of when the next English speaking tour guide was to start her tour. No Welsh tours unfortunately, but fair play, didn't expect it :-)

Interesting and educational. The Jim Thomson House's guided tour was very educational. We enjoyed learning about Jim Thompson's life , how he helped build the Thai silk industry and the mystery of his disappearance.

When a Plan comes together. Jim Tomphson wanted to join the real action with the US army during WW II but fortunately missed the real combats on both war theatres. Finally he arrived in Bangkok and decided to return there after his service ended. Jim Tomphson moved into the silk industry in Thailand and managed to revitalize it. Jim Thompson, an architect, build the Jim Thompson House out of five separate traditional Thai houses which were dismantled in remote spots, transported to Bangkok, and reconstructed. This sounds no so easy nowadays but in the Fifties it was a real challenge, I guess. The plan was to unify traditional Thai culture with western ideas of housing. The plan came together perfectly. My Thai girlfriend did feel like in the old house of her grandmother. Every details fitted. The arrangement of the rooms, kitchen, dining room, living room, study, bath room and sleeping room was like in the west. The house is filled with a lot of Thai and Chinese art which are fitting especially well. The man knew what he was doing.

Historical site and the mystery of Jim. This is the last residential house of Jim Thomson, before he disappeared in Cameron Highlands. He was an architect before he became the Thai Silk King. So, the architecture of his house showcases a certain rustic charm and a mix of heritages, which is situated by a canal. Worth a visit if you have some time!

Lovely green oasis in the centre of Bangkok. Such a well organised tour through this complex on a canal. Authentic buildings with beautiful silk furnishings and treasures collected from many places. Like a small scale museum. Shop there has some beautiful silks to buy but very expensive for the average tourist.

Southeast Meets West at Jim Thompsons House!. Jim Thompson helped with commerce in Thailand through the silk trade. His home is a reflection of his love for the country. If you're into home decor and design, JTs house is a must when you are in Bangkok.We were led by a guide who spoke perfect English, viewing each room one by one, each truly a treasure adored with beautiful statues, tapestries, fine china and more. Truly a wonderful sight for inspiration.
Worth a visit . Very good tour guide funny and spoke good English!! Lovely food at the restaurant and free tuk tuk shuttle ride which was a god send in the down pour!
beautiful place. atmosphere...hourses in wood, near the canal...great story... the spy who desappearedworth a visit... without any doubt
Beautiful Traditional Thai Home. Love this beautiful house, nice atmosphere. Excellent services from the guide and interesting history.

Unexpected and interesting.. Jim Thompson's House is at the end of a street near National Stadium. I love the service in that place! The guard (?) opened our door when we got off the taxi and then let us to the small booth where we have to pay the entrance fee of THB150. There's a guided tour conducted in the house and you have to tell them in what language you prefer it to be done. Of course, it's English for us. After paying you have to go to another counter where they will brief you on what time your tour is. Ours was at 12:35 PM. It was about 10 minutes before that time so we just sat on one of the benches and waited till they call our group.We started the tour not too long after and first order of business is to leave your bags inside a locker. We only brought our phones with us and the key to the locker. Also, we were told that we're not allowed to take pictures inside the house. Also, once we tour the interior of the house, we have to take off our shoes and leave them in a shelf. It's very organized and educational. Our tour guide (I forgot her name) was very gracious in entertaining questions and it was very interactive. The people in my group really asked her questions about Jim Thompson. Jim Thompson's life is very interesting. Definitely worth getting to know this guy.

Oasis in bangkok. A very well maintained house with a garden that looks more like a little jungle. Beautiful everywhere! The restaurant is expensive compared to the prices in Thailand but it's worth it. The guided tour in English was very helpful

A piece of history in the modern metropolis. Nice place for to escape from the hustle and bustle for a few hours.A great lack of space in the ban on photos and video during the house tour. It's possible outside only :(I like theirs Thai and Europian food restaurant, its worth a visit for lunch!Big shop with Jim Thompson factory products. I think that shawl from this shop is a best gift from here!

Charming house with an interesting history. My friends and I decided to check out the Jim Thompson house as we had read about his mysterious disappearance in Cameron Highland before. Upon arriving, we were greeted by some traditional dancers who entertained us with a dance and some demonstration on how the silk is woven. We were then ushered into the courtyard where we were given a time for our tour. Pictures are only allowed in the gardens surrounding the house but not in the house itself. On fact you are asked to keep all personnel belongings in a locker before the your begins. The tour itself was very interesting. Our guide was very informative, charming and funny. Overall, we spent around 40 minutes touring the house and learning more about its owner. After the tour, you may visit the silk shop that sells various items such as shirts, handbags and scarfs. The prices are very high end but you can appreciate the quality of the items. Overall, a very nice place to visit and learn about the history of Thai silk and Mr Jim Thompson.

An Oasis in the heart of Bangkok. It's not a must see, but a beautiful site especially when you had enough of temples. It is even nice for kids as there is a tropical garden and fish pond with turtles and a relaxing restaurant (indoor and outdoor) for lunch or snacking. The guided tours start frequently in different languages and reveal interesting stories of Jim Thomson's life in Bangkok and in this complex of Ayutthaya style wooden houses at a Klong. Of course you can find the latest JT collection in a bright modern shop too. The house is easy to reach from the BTS National Stadium. Best to be there before 5pm and ok when raining. They can host weddings and events in the building above the restaurant and have a kind of exhibition / gallery above the shop.

View of the Past. Some of the best Thai Silk in all of Thailand....expensive but worth it! All housed in the original residence of Jim Thompson, an American OSS agent who came to Thailand after the war and was responsible for promoting the Thai Silk industry world wide. He disappeared in the middle 1060's while on a vacation in the Highlands of Malaysia!

Beatiful calm place.. I lasted visited the house abut 26 years ago and the return visit did not disappoint.A beautiful piece of Thai history through the buildings and antique items amassed by Jim Thompson during his time in Thailand. A Foundation manages the property since his disappearance so some of the proceeds go to good causes.Lovely and cool on a hot day,The guided tours are well organised and informative.A must visit once you have visited the "main" places such as The Grand Palace and a few temples.

Cool oasis. Nicely presented little piece of Bangkok history. There are only guided tours which run every 15/30 minutes and last about 35 minutes. Just a reminder you have to remove you shoes when entering the buildings. Would be nice to know what really happened to Jim Thompson.

Worth visiting when you are in Bangkok. We went to the Jim Thompson House by boat; we hop on the boat at Nana Chard Pier. It was a cool experience taking a boat trip from one place to another (for example: from Nana Chard to Jim Thompson House). Jim Thompson House consists of the JT House (Museum), the JT Shop and a JT Café and Restaurant.

Fulfilling . Thompson House in Siam Central has been in the top 10 Popular tours for sooo long .. Excellent brief on site history tour of traditional up country Thai home and this ex CIA agent's success in the Thai silk industry and his mysterious dissappearance. Then enjoy lunch in their garden restaurant, transfer via BTS (skytrain) or local canalBEST HASHTAGS#JimThompsonHouse

Informative and Quiet. I loved my trip to this museum. There are tours through the house in different languages throughout the day- so make sure you check times etc. I thought it well-priced for how much you get to see inside the house. The mystery of his disappearance leaves you feeling humbled after- the guide had lots of information about his life. The house is exquisite- and the artefacts inside are so beautiful. So peaceful in the middle of Bangkok!
Interesting. We just loved the guided tour of Jim Thompson House, it was so fascinating. What an incredible story and beautiful artifacts. Don't forget to check out their prints and paper store.
elegant. while returning from the lumpini park, we sttopped at the jim thompson house which has a large collection of expensive silk garments, scarves, shawls, etc
something to do in bangkok. love going to this place...very informative and had a shuttle to the national stadium BTS...The entrance fee 100bath seems reasonable.
Excellent attraction. Great attraction where you can avoid crowds. Tour the house. Nice restaurant serving Thai cuisine and shop where you can buy silk goods. Highly recommend.

History Right at the Heart of the City. Located right in the heart of the city, we saw quite a number of visitors taking public transport to get to the Jim Thompson House.Visitors are taken into the house in batches. Before entering the main house, we were taken around the garden and exterior of the house. No photos are allowed inside the house, but it didn't matter as the tour guide was very effective in sharing details and trivia about the house and its owner. If you want photos, there is a book and a couple of post cards available in the souvenir shop.The Jim Thompson merchandise is very impressive. Quite luxurious and a far cry from the standard tourist fare you'll find in the night or weekend markets.
Second visit. Second visit for me - but will go there a third and even fourth time.... Is a little piece of heaven in this busy city. And to learn about jim his extraordinary life is a bonus.

Beautiful museum, nice break from busy city. A wonderful museum in the heart of the city. Easy to take a tuktuk but they will try to say its closed and take you on another tour. I'd suggest arriving early as it gets busy in the afternoon. I had a wonderful English speaking guide. Until September 2016 there is an interesting (& air conditioned) video installation upstairs. I also suggest the restaurant-very good and inexpensive. Must see!

Great Thompson house. Thompson was a genius and his home is quite a beautiful oasis in this chaotic yet wonderful city! DO NOT miss this place! This place is an architectural masterpiece. In addition to that, the hostesses are truly classy and they have a wonderful museum restaurant and shop. The restaurant is a great way to break for lunch and you can get a table by the giant koi fish in the pond next to you.

Unusual and interesting. We went there by tuk-tuk just to escape the crowds and the noise of Bangkok and spent an hour on a guided tour of the house. The house is quite different from many other attractions in Bangkok and it's worth a visit. We went after 4pm and it wasn't too busy then.
Interesting. Very interesting to see how Jim Thompson settled and lived in Thailand. The way of life has been nicely preserved for all to see.

Loved it – well worth doing. Though it doesn't sound especially exciting, Jim Thompson's house is not only beautiful – and a peaceful oasis from the hustle and bustle of downtown Bangkok – but also really fascinating. He lived a pretty amazing life, and his house reflected that.My tour guide was polite, funny, friendly and knowledgeable (she answered any questions we had), and the house itself is stunning. You'll come back home with some new interior design ideas, that's for sure.Went for a drink in the restaurant afterwards overlooking the river, which was a lovely way to finish the trip. Recommended.Much of the tour is indoors or sheltered, so if the weather's a bit drizzly one day this is a good option.

Not Impressed. I wouldn't consider this house a must see. It was interesting they have a 30 min tour that give you an idea of every piece inside the house. It also give you an idea of how a Thai house will look in the inside. There was a lot of information on the decoration and on every piece on the house and how does it related to the Culture in Thailand. You cannot take pictures inside the house. If you have some spear time then definitely go by, but if you are short of time just skip it. We had lunch at the restaurant as well and it was average not amazing but not bad. Service was good.

Excellent tour and history of silk in Thailand. Walking the gardens and taking the tour of the house is a wonderful way to spend several hours. It is very informative and you will learn a lot about Jim Thompson who was really an incredible person.

Interesting History. I had never heard about Jim Thompson before I went here and I thought the house and history was very interesting. It rained while we were there so as long as you can stay dry on your way there you can visit this on a rainy day! The English speaking guide that we got was a little difficult to understand but it was our first day in Thailand and we were not used to the accent yet :)

An oasis. Although there is a shop at the end of your visit there is no pressure to buy. The house itself is a delight and I could imagine living there. It is a veritable oasis in a bustling and noisy city. Certainly worth a visit

Traditional Villa in the heart of modernBangkok. Jim Thompson was an American who revitalized the Thai silk industry. He built this house using traditional Thai principles of design, which makes it a beautiful window into the past. The visit takes a couple of hours, sheltered from the hustle and bustle of the city and includes a brief education into how silk is produced, from the mulberry leaves, through the silkworm to spinning and weaving. The tour is self guided and, to no ones' surprise, there is a shop and restaurant.We thought that getting there by taxi would be best, but when the taxi driver had no idea where we wanted to go, the Hotel Bell Captain got us a car and driver. The cost was 600 baht or about $20 and we had it for the entire day, which allowed us to visit additional locations.
Nice to because f the history. Nice to see. Nice history about Jim Thompson, wherever he winded up. Some nice gifts from abroad that are show. Still the story is the best not the house.
Traditional house. Mom and I really enjoy walk in. And you could also do a quick shopping in the shop inside. More choices than the one in city

LOVELY PLACE WITH BEAUTIFUL MUZEUM AND GREAT SILKS OF COURSE. only if you are a label queen. Terribly and unneccessarily expensive silk here.A simple cushion cover will set you back quite a bit. Rather buy it in most other places in BKK. If you do plan to buy something from Jim Thomson, dont head all the way here as the store does not carry the whole range. There is a bigger store in town (9 Surawong Rd., Suriyawong, Bangrak, ) One would think that you could visit the muzeum if you at least bought something from the store. Dont forget to buy the mandatory ticket. Service in the store is lacking as staff hardly speak english.However a must visit and lovely place to have some food and visit the muzeum. The landscaping and architecture here is nostalgic.
Very Interesting place. Old house turned to museum. A very nice place to visit. Guide was very nice and knowledgeable. They also have restaurant and shop.

Amazed . First I didn't think this gonna be fun for solo traveler. Then when I start im begun to enjoying how the guide explain it to us. The behind story is very interesting and after that I started to google it. You should visit while in bangkok. It won't be long

Surprisingly interesting!. If you think you've seen everting in Bangkok but you've never been to the Jim Thomson House, you haven't seen Bangkok at all!
This picturesque House with a lovely garden has its own secrets and stories youll be told on a guided tour. Very interesting and amusing!
Highly recommended!
Fascinating history. The Jim Thompson house provides a glimpse into the life of this extraordinary man who disappeared without a trace. It was a very good visit while in Bangkok.

An interesting piece of Thai history..... We visited on Thursday 19/05 around 2pm and the complex seemed to be in full swing!The tour was relatively cheap at 200TB, which included an informative 40 minute guided tour. Our guide was lovely and very polite; whilst she had a thick Thai accent, her English was excellent. We did not bother getting any food/ drink at the complex as it seemed a little more expensive than the local shops/ food vendors that are located near by. The intricate details of the house and furnishings are just beautiful! I think it was worth the visit and short time it takes to get through the tour!
Traditional. Great place to visit ,beautiful house and garden with traditional Thai architecture ,with very interesting story

Nice to come back. I was first here in the 70's and was glad to see Jim Thompson's creativity is still thriving today. His home is a unique opportunity to see traditional Thai style living in the heart of the city and the tour brings a sense of nostalgia for a visionary who loved Thailand and its people. The beauty and quality of his brand is still unmatched

Amazing ... Stunning . A must tour when in Bangkok ... The Jim Thompson complex is truly amazing.The grounds are superb and the history of Jim Thompson and the house complex is amazing.The gift shop has some amazing and beautiful products. I also recommend going to the Factory Store is you are adventurous. It's easy to find but not in downtown but easy to access from the BTS.

What a cool place. I really loved this place not expensive accessible by bts and a short walk nice restaurant take the tour to fully understand just how special this place is after that take a stroll down to the shop and small art gallerie I will come back when I have friends in town!

Worth a visit. After fighting crowds and scams all over bangkok, this was a nice and interesting stop. Beautiful houses and nice presentations on the making of silk. Free shuttle back to the skytrain although taxis are even cheaper and easily picked up. After the grand palace, wat pho, and the river cruise, a must see.
What a beautiful house!. Wonderful 40 minute tour of this beautiful old house, a friend recommended it and I was disappointed! A little hidden gem of Bangkok!
great place. If you love history, mystery, design, western and Easter culture melting together you can't miss Jim Thompson house. must to see.

Boring for me. I arrived at 8.55 am and although the staff are inside the ticketing booth, they would not sell me the entry ticket until 9.00 am sharp.Even then, I had to take a Q and my guided tour only starts at 9.30 am. There was nobody demonstrating the art of silk weaving nor dancers performing as we seen in our photos. They probably had that on during the peak seasons. We were left to wander on our own in the court yard, nothing much.We had to put all our bags into a locker and shoes are not allowed upstairs. The guide speaks with a very strong Thai accent and I could see the other tourist and myself included trying to understand her English. We were guided up the steps to the main house which consists of some rooms, the main hall which we could see from outside, the guest room and Jim Thompson's bedroom. So, what can be said about the rooms except for what are displayed inside, his collection of 'imperfect' antiques. The guided tour was over in 40 minutes. Was I impressed? No. Was there much for me to relate about the 'house', No. Would I recommend my friends, sorry, again No.

Treasure Trove of Asian Art. If you would like to see a beautiful traditional Thai home stuffed with exotic Asian/Thai l'objets 'art, this is the place. Great gift shop with the best of Jim Thompson products to peruse.
This is really beautiful. Not a very long visit but if you like beautiful wooden house and furniture...you will be astonished.

Colonial. Had a tour around this museum. Very pleased that we did. Calm and quiet as a contrast to bangkok in general. Attractively laid out and an interesting afternoon spent learning about the silk industry

Amazing visit . My husband and I arrived in Bangkok and hit the ground running and chose to go to Jim Thompson house first. We went on the 5pm tour (tours can be in English or French) and our tour guide was lovely and incredibly knowledgeabl. She walked us around the garden first (you can take photos outside but not in the house). Then we were shown around the inside of the house and it's honestly the most beautiful house we have ever seen, built in true Thai tradition. Jim Thompson collected art pieces and statues, one which is over 1,300 years old!! Do not miss this off your itinerary if you are in the city, you wont be disappointed

Lovely Bangkok Oasis. All praise to Jim Thompson for his finely crafted touches to his beautiful legacy home and gardens in the heart of teeming Bangkok. The teak wood structures, beautiful furnishings and amazing silk artifacts and native objects really make his home look more like a museum designed for living. The articulate guide gave many interesting back stories about Jim Thompson and how his advocacy for Thai silk created worldwide appreciation for such fine craftsmanship. The grounds are adjacent to a very active local canal where longboat water taxis carry locals and tourists to other areas. We walked to a nearby stop and took a very inexpensive canal ride to the Golden Mountain Temple for more Bangkok adventures.
interesting site. jim thompson has much interesting historical story. he did a lot to bring thai silk into the world. they have great shops of jim thompson silk in bangkok.

Worthwhile tour of a well-preserved historic residence. The Jim Thompson House is a wonderfully preserved estate and museum. Guided tours are required but the cost of admission. The tour takes about 30 minutes and our guide was informative. The original pieces in the house - from the teak floors to Burmese statues to Chinese ceramics - are exceptional. The oldest statue in the house is well over 1,000 years old. The gift shop is primarily for high end shoppers, but the Jim Thompson clothing line is well known for its quality. The bathroom facilities are clean and modern, much nicer than many of the main tourist attractions in Bangkok. I highly recommend a visit.
My personal favorute. Very interesting enjoyable experience. My personal favourite. Restaurant was also good. Guide was fun and knowledgable.

Insight of traditional Thai house!. I was brought there by a couple of my Thai friends to understand more about the thai culture and traditions. The place has been beautifully preserved and you can enjoy a pleasant walk in the garden. The location of the place was surprising as it was peaceful but at just some 300m from the bustling Siam Paragon. The wooden architecture of the house as well as the collections of Jim Thompson was patiently explained by the guide along some superstitions. Overall it was nice visit.
Nice place. Nice peaceful place amidst the hustle of the city.. good small toyr to something historic.. very warm and friendly staff to take u around

A Beautiful House. This place is well worth the trip.Only 150 baht per person for a guided tour of the house and gardens. It gives a great insight into the life of a very interesting character and avid collector of asian art and artefacts.The interior of these original 200 year old houses is spectacular and really needs to be seen to be fully appreciated.Its easy to get to, is only a few minutes walk from the MBK shopping centre but a taxi will know where you want to go.
Interesting. I enjoyed the house and architecture but it was quite commercialized and the visit is extremely controlled

Picture perfect!. We took a tour guide on our walk through the house. It was a very interesting story. Jim Thompson helped the Thai people and became a successful businessman in Thailand. He was awarded the White Elephant award for helping the Thai people. His house was a collection of things he bought from all over Thailand. His story is a mystery, as he went out for a walk in a jungle and was never seen again!

Interesting. We rocked up on a Thursday afternoon. Booked a tour. While we waited we had a wander around the obligatory shop - very expensive but lovely and cool! The tour was interesting - what a fascinating man. Some lovely artifacts on display. Will need to read up on Mr Thimpson when I get home .

Beautiful interior had stood the test of time. A quiet enclave in the middle of a bustling city. The best time is early in the morning as soon as it opens - you then get the feel of the house and its peaceful gardens.The guides are knowledgeable with good English.

A little getaway within a bustling city. We were looking for something short and sweet and indoors. The skies were threatening and sprinkling a bit. We took the skytrain which was ultra convenient and comfortable. A tour was mandatory but very affordable. The tour was very sweet and we learned about Jim Thomspson and his legacy. The gift shop was very interesting and had many things that I chose to buy. Not junky. High quality and pretty too.

Lovely Look Into Bangkok's Past. I arrived in the morning. Just about 10am. We took the guided tour which comes free with the ticket. I recommend taking the guide because many of the stories of the house, it's owner, and the era have nuances that only the guide can reveal. The house is simply gorgeous, cafe was fancy but accessible. and the aircon shop and gallery were a lovely respite from the BKK heat. Take their free shuttle to and from the main road to avoid baking under the sun.

A Gorgeous Piece of Thai History. This is a must see for anyone visiting Thailand. I have long been a fan of Jim Thompson’s elephants and silk scarves, but had not visited his house which is now a museum, until recently. Jim Thompson, an American architect who came to Thailand following completion of his service in the military became known as the American of Thailand. He was responsible for starting the Thai Silk Company. During his 25 years in Thailand, he built the house that is now a museum. There are 6 different structures that came from various parts of Thailand. Constructed mainly of teakwood the house was completed in 1959. The walls are lined with beautiful art work. One of the interesting facts about these homes is the fact that the walls are all slanted/inclined inward, thus giving an illusion of height and providing for good airflow in order to keep the house cool. Jim Thompson taught the Thai people to build their homes on stilts in order to protect against the monsoonal floods that often come each spring and summer. This also prevented evil spirits from entering the homes and kept the home's much cooler due to better air circulation. This home is beautifully maintained. The gardens throughout lend to the forest like nature of the setting. There are illustrations of silk making from the silkworms, a shop with art work, paintings and postcards, as well as a shop with silk apparel and the well-known and whimsical elephants.

Nice Story. Good place to see in slow down phase.. There's a restaurant in Jim Thompson house and the food was great. All Thai food and really presented well and taste great. To walk around is nice. Many things to earn history and culture.
Worth going but food disappointing. A trip to JimThompson House is a must when visiting Bangkok but the food is just okay and not worth it. Take the your, shop away but maybe eat somewhere else.

Love the architecture and story behind this place. I love this place, and keep going back time and again, the house and grounds are fabulous, great to see in the centre of Bangkok. The story of Jim Thompson is very interesting, and the silk amazing, great little store and restaurant too.

Tranquility in the City. Very peaceful and pretty place to visit to escape the heat and noise of Bangkok!
The ticket was well priced and included a guided group tour - the guide was very informative, had a very good level of English and threw in several jokes for good measure.

Beautiful artwork . I'm not usually one for tourist-y stuff, but I decided to walk a couple miles to this(so hot and sweaty) and it was worth it. 150 baht gets you the tour which has a bunch of beautiful artwork and artifacts, some of which are 1400 years old. There's a great restaurant there, try the green curry(200 baht) 👌🏻

Fascinating and gorgeous . Beautiful place filled with old Asian art and gorgeous antique furniture. Jim Thompson had good taste! His story is mysterious and you might want to read up on it after.The process is that you have to take a tour -- you can't just wander -- and the tour guides have to get each group through the house within a time limit. This means there are many beautiful things that you pass along the way. It's not rushed, and you can ask questions, but it's brisk and directed. The guide was very knowledgeable and pristine-professional. There's a small green garden that you can walk in. A cafe that gets busy at peak lunch time and some little shops selling silk and art books/postcards. They had traditional Thai dancers in the courtyard. Good experience.

Excellent Guide. Interesting place that Jim Thompson has built and left behind. Although it was not very big, the excellent guide had made the guided tour a pleasant and captivating one. Not very easy to locate, as it is off the main road. The free shuttle tuk-tuk out to the main road was a nice touch.

Such a calming atmosphere. This series of houses on the river where Jim Thompson lived and worked creates a wonderful calming atmosphere. The staff are well trained and the English tour guide very well informed and presents a great tour. The service in the restaurant is not great but that's not why we came here. Easy to arrive by train and short walk down a small road to reach. Highly recommend as a tourist destination, a must to do in BKK.
Something interesting.. JT house was quite close to the holiday inn express that we were staying plus we got some time, so visited there. Opens at 9am. Tour was not FOC. Interesting place.

An interesting piece of history. Thoroughly enjoyed our tour of Jim Thompsons house.the architecture and the antiques were truly beautiful. This place transported me back in time to another era.A beautiful refuge from the hustle and bustle of the city
Awesome. If you like historical or museum you must visit jim Thompson house. It's an awesome home, with nice home. Nice garden and awesome all the things at Jim Thompson house

"Very informative". We went to this place through the recommendation of other travellers. It was very beautiful &good way to to known about past Thai life. We wish that tour should be a bit longer &slower.
amazing history. It's a beautiful Thai house previously owned by Jim Thompson himself. It's a nice house and the history / story behind it was very interesting

Great little escape from the city. This is a great gem inside the heart of Bangkok. If you like arts & Crafts this is the place to go, for 100 baht you get a small tour through the house and see what it's all about. The silk part is actually a really small part of the trip, most is about Jim self and his house which I really love.

Beautiful house and museum. Jim Thompson's is an oasis away from the hustle and bustle of the city. Well worth the hour you will spend here and 150 Baht entrance fee. The tour (mandatory to see the house) was informative and the antique collection beautiful. Afterwards you can enjoy looking in the boutique store or a meal at the restaurant.
Worth visiting . It is worth the visit and if you are an antique lover, you will definitely enjoy the tour but sadly picture taking is not allowed inside the house.

Was he a spy?. We couldn't help but think Jim Thompson got all his money in a shady fashion. This house is worth seeing for all the artwork. The shop is unique and worth checking out. I bought a jade prayer bead bracelet that was very different from what I had already seen. Silk products are first class

Interesting, but disappointing. Whilst it was interesting to visit the home that Jim Thompson built, there was little about the story of silk. The guide had a difficult accent to understand and one felt that it was more an opportunity to sell Jim Thompson labelled products, even if they were not made of silk! Rather too commercialised and a difficult place to get to.

Probably the best sightseeing attraction in BKK. Fantastic place! definitely a must see in Bangkok. Its an amazing mansion, which used to belong to the Godfather of Silk, Jim Thompson. Nowadays its turned into a small museum. Would recommend to take a tour guide around for extra infos.

worth a visit!. I'm glad a friend convinced me to go there! The house is beautiful, the garden is truly a small green oasis in Bangkok. The tour was nice and informative, although I wish it could be a bit longer and a bit slower. We actually learned few things about former Thai way of life, it was not only focused on J. Thompson.

Tranquil and amazing: a highlight of our 3-day stay in Bangkok. A must-visit attraction in Bangkok. Stunning historical houses beautifully preserved, an excellent restaurant and great gift shop. The mystery surrounding Jim Thompson and his life and work evokes a very special atmosphere.

Well worth a visit.. Thi sis a lovely house put together from five different houses by the late Jim Thompson. The grounds surrounding the house are fell of tropical shrubs, trees and flowers and it is very restful to wander around if it isn't too hot! The guided tour was well organised and informative; shoes have to be removed and bags left in a locker to which you are given a key. In the courtyard there are ladies giving a demonstration of silk making and cultural dance The restaurant has a good choice of food and drinks and is reasonably priced.Tha same cannot be said for the shop however, the items for sale are very beautiful and rather expensive. Watch out for the little man at the end of the roadway who will try to make you visit another shop, where there is a sale on just for one day, and tell you that Jim Thompson's son sends all the profits from the shop to the USA and Thailand does not benefit at all. The guide informed us that Jim Thompson did not have any children and left his property in trust to the Thai people!

Interesting Place to visit. A bit away from the city rush, it is a worth to find time to visit this place. It is a home-like museum. Original Thai houses were brought here by Jim Thompson and rearranged into his new house. The entrance ticket includes a tour with a guide, you are free to roam around the gardens freely, but entrance to the buildings are only allowed with the guide. One can learn some interesting facts about Thompson's life and a bit of Thai history. Very cozy place, we found the tour informative, and had a bit of rest in beautiful gardens, away from Bangkok traffic. :)
A quiet oasis in busy Bangkok. A great place to unwind and learn the history of Thai silk making. Situated in a quiet street in bustling Bangkok. The architecture is the traditional Thai teak house.

Great place and a very interesting tour. The place was tranquil. The house was beautiful. The tour guide did a great job and explained things very nicely, especially Thai customs and tradition in making and decorating of the house.A tranquil place at the heart of Bangkok.

Nice House. The house was beautiful. Unless you have a lot of interest in architecture and understanding of the historical background and importance of Jim Thompson I would say that a visit here is not necessary.
Different one. A different experience as the Architecture of the house is good and Eco friendly and a small canal is nearby.It is not an outstanding place to visit.

The legend didn't live up to the experience. Maybe it is just me, but considering all the amazing things to see and do in Bangkok, this would not top my list. A nice series of several traditional buildings connected into one housing art; a great background story of an adventurer farang who was ex-CIA, entertained the famous, helped promote Thai silk and then mysteriously disappears. He also seemed to have a lot of little girl and little boy's chamberpots around for a single guy. But at the end of the day, it amounted to a small collection of art in a famous dude's house. It wasn't that it was bad, it's just that there is so much else out there. IMO.
Peace Tour right in the centre of Bangkok. The tour is good value and a great break from the hustle/hastle of central Bangkok. The food in the Cafe is very good but "tourist" prices

Nice gift shop with house attached. I thought it was overall a waste of time, the tour though interesting was long and very hot. First, though you pass through a gift shop with nice-ish silk products. They even sell Jim Thompson water.The house was beautiful. I felt it was very over commercialized.If you like antiques you might like it. I would have rather gone to a proper museumWould not repeat.

Always a pleasure.... Went back to the Jim Thompson House for the first time in several years yesterday and despite having visited on numerous occasions since the late 1990s, it never ceases to delight me. Our tour guide was amazing and delivered the history and stories with precision and humor. This house/museum is really a treasured piece of Thai history in terms of art and culture. Over the years and compound has grown and improved and now has an excellent restaurant and of course the shop with amazing Thai silk products is a great way to cool down after the tour! I highly recommend.
Too crowded. I arrived here and the entire place was swamped with Chinese tourists. I tried to join several guided tours without success due to queue jumping. Eventually I gave up and left.

Lovely house. This house is an excellent place to spend an afternoon. You get to hear the history and life of Jim Thompson, find out about some of the local believes and if the weather isn't too hot, the klongs backing on to the house offers a great view. Have lunch there, it is very nice.
Beautiful oasis in the city. Such a lovely respite - cool and inviting, nice restaurant, beautiful fabrics - I wish I could have visited longer.

Lovely meal but very touristy. The evening meal was lovely with several small dishes for each course. As good to look at as to eat. The only downsides are the lighting which is very atmospheric (dim) and the tour groups who seem to spend their time taking endless selfies

Very interesting. It was a very interesting place to visit and the history behind Jim Thompson is fascinating, but be warned there are scams around the streets leading up to the house, like you might get told that it is closed and then the man will offer to take you somewhere else, more annoying then anything else

Beautiful architecture & artifacts. 150 Baht per adult, +- 30 min (mandatory) guided tour of the main house included (our group was small - 7 visitors + 1 guide; no idea how big a group usually is); you can explore the (small yet luscious) garden on your own tempo; nice-looking restaurant & bar (didn't eat/drink there though); beautiful combination of Thai architecture and antiques (Ayutthaya - and even older - Buddha statues (stone & wood), furniture, porcelain,...); easily accessible / within walking distance of National stadium Skytrain station; last tour starts at 18:00; if you have an hour to spare (30 min tour + shop browsing + garden exploring): worth your while!
Traditional Thai architecture . Beautiful house and garden in the middle of the city. Traditional Thai architecture, from Ayuttahia. Amazing man with a very interesting story!

Nice place to visit. Great place to visit the collection of mister Thompson. The different items and the story of this man is nice to hear. Visit in different languages. The visit is 40 min long approx.

Beautiful Grounds. Went here around 4:30pm for a tour. We signed in and paid for the tour, then walked around the shop. Items were impressive quality, and also quite expensive. The tour started at about 5pm, and lasted for about an hour or so. They take you inside the house and give great information on his life. It's quite interesting, especially considering his disappearance. There is one air conditioned room in the house, where the giftshop used to be - so its quite warm in there. Be prepared, wear light, loose clothing. Also, quite a bit of it is outdoors, so be prepared to sweat!One thing of note - before entering the house, you are asked to put all items into a locker. There's a key that you keep with you, but be aware so you may decide to not go with many shopping bags.

Arts and Crafts House in Bangkok. This is a great opportunity to enjoy a quiet haven in downtown Bangkok. A ten minute walk or three minute free ride in the museum's tuk tuk, this lovely wooden house is situated beside a canal and in the midst of a lush garden with beautiful trees and a peaceful pool. The house itself is full of beautiful pieces and authentic furniture. Guided tours in different languages are included in ticket price and there's a relaxing cafe and shop selling Jim Thompson silks, bags and t shirts at reasonable prices.

Not worth 450bhat. We really did not see the point. I took my elderly parents to see this place. It was around 2:30pm and was really warm. It was a very short 30 minute tour but honestly, we did not get it. Unless you have absolutely nothing to do, and have 450 bhat to blow, then go ahead.Sorry, just a one star from us.

Slightly disappointed.. Easily accessible by sky train.The house is well maintained and has many items on display and well worth a click- which is not allowed( Within the house photography is prohibited). Else it gives a good idea of what a traditional Thai home would have looked like in the earlier days. It is cool and shady. The guide is open to share information and answer all questions. The shops around are touristy and high-priced.Once the guided tour is completed you are free to spend as much time you would wish.There is a drop service upto the main road for returning visitors.

interesting little small space!. Jim Thompson is very famous for products from silk. The price is pretty high and the style is quiet one's personal taste. HOWEVER, Jim's traditional style house which is also a museum is incredibly fascinating. It's not really big but full of stories since Rama II time (if I didn't get it wrong). Very beautiful and I'm pretty sure it's hard to feel this kind of unique architecture up close these days. Personally love it! So, don't forget to check it out! English guide is also available.

Urban oasis. I would definitely have this in your top 10 list of things to do in Bangkok. The main train from the airport drops you off about a 10 minute walk from here and there's several Skytrain stops nearby, so it's easy to access. Plenty of nice, reasonably priced lodging in the area as well. Once on the peaceful and well maintained grounds you'll forget how close you are to the hectic Siam Square. Everything is well organized, so it's easy to spend your time here efficiently even if you don't have much time (as was the case with us). Overall, time and money well spent.

Out of Sight?. Not many people know of Jim Thompson, never mind where his house is. Tucked away in a small Soi (lane) off the main Sukhumvit Road lies a wonderful surprise; the home of Jim Thompson. I have read up on Jim Thompson and to actually be in his house and understand exactly what he did for the Thai silk industry is truly amazing. The 40 minute or so guided tour, takes you through his house (which is actually six houses from around Thailand and constructed as one) whilst being sublimely educated about Jim, his manner, his aspirations and his unexplained disappearance. This is a very pleasant educational trip, but probably not that interesting for the little ones?: However, they could relay this education back to their teachers and pupils alike back at school.

Nice tour, friendly, amusing guide. Jim Thompson revitalized interest in the silk industry, and this area is where he lived. The museum has the first wood block used to made designs on the silk fabric, and there is an amusing display of the life of the silk worm. A woman was winding the silk threads onto a swift--a fascinating process to watch for me, since I knit, but had no idea how fragile the silk threads really were. Tours of the place are by guide only, and ours was great--made several very funny comments, esp. on the women's indoor toilet facility. A nice gift shop is located on the premises.

Go if you love Chinese pottery. Zero history of Thompson's contributions in the early silk industry. Had a very genial and English fluent guide, but her banter had nothing about the early silk business

Splendid. Visited the Jim Thompson home fir the second time. Such a peacefull place hidden in central Bangkok. Our guide (for French speakers) was a bit difficult to understand but was knowledgeable to make the visit interesting. A beauful shop awaits with several silk products but very pricey and coffeshop too Well worth finding the time to visit

A jump in the past. You can go there getting off at the National Stadium Sky train stop. A few steps, and you will see a moped that will take you to the House. House is beautiful, you will have to pay and wait for a guide to visit it. The guided tour last around 30 minutes, then you are free to visit the rest of the place. They will tell you the story of Jim Thompson and describe the different rooms. No pictures and no shoes inside the main house. The shop has some silk products for sale, all extremely expensive.

Visited on 25th April. Our tour was scheduled for 11.35am. The guide for our tour was pleasant and humorous and we were disappointed that we didn't get to take a photo with her. The Jim Thompson house is truly a gem and provides insight of Jim Thompson's mind and his innovative ideas at that Era. Loves the rat maze antique in his room. It will be great if we can take a few picture of the insides of this magnificent building.

ancinet siam. i love this house it'sa part of ancient siam already gone.
Personeel was friendly and place is so nice and great, full of old things bought by jim thompson. i really envy him for seeing and lving in old siam time

A Pleasant Historical Discovery. Our visit to the Jim Thompson House made me admire Jim Thompson even more. His passion for Thai silk was a great contribution to the country and the lovely Thai people. I love his house and I adore the Thai silk products that have been developed.

Interesting. I was unsure what to expect but had been recommended to visit . Jim Thompson's house is lovely and really interesting to see and learn the history. The are silk products to buy there but they are expensive however they are beautiful!

You should Thai the Thompson house. Beautiful and well groomed historical house. Also offers a beautiful lush garden and accommodating staff. English or French tours available as you must take a tour to see the house. 150 THB for foreigners, but this also include free shuttle to and from BTS.

Must visit for the 1st timer in Bangkok. Just strolling down from my hotel in Siam, this such beautiful place to visit. Very friendly and organize staff. Touching memory of the owner. And don't forget to try the water taxi , another unique experience that maybe only you can find in Bangkok. Just few meters from this place, for few minutes ride touches down Platinum. Free hassle and traffic jam.

Fascinating Step Back into History. Great idea from hotel to visit this. Compound is a bit touristy but has a unique opportunity to learn about the man and what he built and the company he started. Main house part and the storytelling that go with it very unique.
Great lunch beautiful serene atmosphere.. I love this place and come here every time I come to Bangkok. The food is beautiful and a good opportunity to see a well maintained period home.

Quiet, tropical oasis in steamy Bangkok.. Affordable entry fee.Beautiful and stunning architecture and artifacts.Green, luscious and tropical gardens.Excellent guide, great information conveyed.A very special place to visit particularly given the intriguing mystery of the disappearance of Jim Thompson.Just keep a close watch for 2 separate very helpful, well dressed, middle aged Thai male and female down the Soi from Jim Thompson House.So helpful in separately directing us to a great sale for one day only at the local gem shop!

Idyllic place in the middle of Bangkok . Idyllic place in the middle of Bangkok. So if you are looking for a qualm place in Bangkok to take a rest of the rushing city, go to Jim Thompson House.The entrance fee include a guided Tour. Our guide was english speaking but i know that there are french guides as well and probably more other languages to choose from. You learn a lot about Jim Thompson and the history of this house.
One of the most magical place in Bangkok!. If you love history, mistery, design, western and easter culture melting together you can't miss Jim Thompson house!

Something a bit different . The experience here is very well organised with regular tours in different languages. Our guide was very clear and the life of Jim Thompson was very interesting. The information about silk making in displays around the house were also interesting.

A most beautiful place. For those of you who love Asian artefacts, buildings and gardens this place is a gem. The timber buildings that make up this compound are antiques, some as old as 200 years. They are linked together in a way that looks quite modern and suited to Western living. The artefacts such as statues and ceramics are beautiful and well displayed and come from many parts of Thailand. All this is set in a tropically delightful garden. The whole place is a visual delight. There is a small display of weaving and a wonderful gift shop with beautiful and interesting garments and scarves. The house is very close to the National Stadium BTS station. I urge you not to miss this beautiful house and garden.

Nice and Historical place. every one should know jim thompson to learn how to follow our dreams.nice and peaceful place you you can see a lot of antique accessories.there are a contemporary art gallery that links new artist to old one.

Hot day in Bangkok. With guide during 45 minutes we get good information about Mr Jim and his houses in Bangkok. Quiet place in the middle of the city close to Siam Square if you need shopping also. Wooden houses with lots of old furniture. Not alowed to take pictures inside. Take the air con sky train to National Stadion. Not need to take taxi.

A must see. The Jim Thompson House is easy to find. A 5-10 mins walk from the National Stadium BTS. For the entrance fee of 150 baht you get to see the house, garden, souvenir shop and have a small tour inside the house. Outside you can see how the silk was made from the silk worm and at times Thai ladies dancing their traditional dance. There's a free ride to bring the gusets back to the BTS station.
A nice and quiet activity in noisy BKK!. A nice and interesting place. The Jim Thompson House is perfect quiet break from noisy, smelly Bangkok. Be sure to spend some time exploring the gardens.

Stunning Historic House Museum. A fantastic little, well maintained and clearly loved historic house museum featuring the King of Thai Silk's chic take on gardening, antiques, interior decoration and textiles. Great guided tours, a chic shop and excellent restaurant. An easy walk from BTS station "National Stadium". Highly recommended!
Excellent day out. What words can you use, tranquil, quiet, peaceful, beautiful. Words cannot describe this setting. Please visit and enjoy the experience.
Don't miss this!. One of the most interesting places in Bangkok. A great house..a great story...and a great restaurant. A real oasis in Bangkok!

Worth a visit . Almost feels strange trying to find this attraction down a side street but it is worth it when you find it.The grounds of the home are kept immaculate and are a testament to the history of the place. The guided tours are a must and are regular in many languages.This is a great way to see traditional Thai architecture. The gardens transport you to a topical oasis.The attraction is quite a commercial operation and we felt a little rushed as we went around. Overall very good and worth visiting.

Brilliant place.. I have been to Jim Thompson House several times. It is a lovely, peaceful place, easily accessible by BTS. The gardens have some attractive plants and the teak houses are full of interesting artefacts. The guided tour is well run and informative.

Great history. The story of Jim Thompson touches on war history, architecture, traditional Thai silk making and unsolved mysteries. The house is also in a cool spot by the river, the former main mode of transport.
Real good!. The place exceeded expectations. John seemed to be quite a man to collect such artifacts and build a rich beautiful wooden house. Close to mbk and siam paragon malls.
I do love a good mystery. Where did Jim thompson go? No one knows... interestint history though. Lovely architecture. Tour guide was very well versed.
Very interesting. A must visit when in Bangkok. An interesting story of Jim Thompson and a very interesting house and gift shop (believe it or not.)

Unless you're a History Buff Already.... Skip it. Unless you have a lot of interest in architecture and understanding of the historical background and importance of Jim Thompson I would say that a visit here is not necessary.

Certainly worth a visit. A very handy insight into the genesis of Thailand's silk industry with CIA dimensions!
Shopfront is worth a look.
Silk products are good quality with prices to match.

Its a house.... It is a house. It was owned by Jim Thompson. It will take up around 20 minutes of your time. Its vaguely interesting.
And if its hot, it will be really really hot. Like really hot.
Maybe one for the more mature traveller.

A must go place to visit in Bangkok. Discover old houses and how a great man came to Bangkok and build up a unique history. If there is one quality souvenir to buy it would be Jim Thomson silk products. The restaurant there is very good as well but better book in advance.

If you love the 19th century history it is a nice place to visit. This is a very nice place with quite impressive exhibition of antiquities 100 years ago especially from chine, the story of Jim Thomson is interesting, enjoy.

Great House & Restaurant. Combine a visit with lunch or dinner or just snacks at the attached restaurant which is very comfortable during the week, non public holidays, otherwise when crowded and busy the service is no good. Thai food is best, go and book a tour of the house and then have lunch or drinks before hand.
Times gone by. It was a view into the past with beautiful buildings and displays. Also the silk was amazing in the store and the lunch we had a the restaurant was delicious and value for money.

Nice way to discover thai culture. Jim Thompson's house is a really nice place where you will be able to discover more about thai culture.
The guide speaks your language and will help you have a great time there.
So peaceful. I highly recommend visiting this beautiful home decorated with interesting pieces. Away from sprawling Bangkok.
Great Tour!. Our guide for the tour was very knowledgeable and professional. Wish we had alloted more time to walk the grounds.

Bit of a theme park. I had been here before but with 150 baht entry just to see some Koi and shop in their elective m expensive store, I won't be recommending this place to anyone in the future. Just too many tourists there and quite underwhelming really.

Pleasantly surprised. Wasn't sure what to expect of this, though I'm familiar with Jim Thompson silks, so figured if nothing else might be a nice house to view. But its a really interesting property and look into the lifestyle of a rich white dude with great taste living in Thailand. It's a quick an simple tour, and fun to fantasize living in such a mansion on the river (not so keen on fantasizing peeing in those little fancy chamber pots though...) The best part was the store - you can get pillows and scarves and pocket squares for a fraction of what they would cost in the US ($60 for a Euro Square Pillow Cover? $10 for a Pocket Square?) In retrospect we wish we had purchased more...

Classic Thai home of expat silk magnate. Awesome and easy thing to do. English tours available, be prepared to remove shoes, lush grounds and an art filled home of a collector. Great backgrounder on lots of Thai topics, and interesting as an American. Take a taxi or tuk tuk.

A wonderful introduction to an amazing story. This is a must do visit while in Bangkok. Beautiful and interesting in itself, the house is a rich introduction to an amazingly interesting life story. Check it out! And the next parallel street up, houses the government shopping centre with the best value jewellery in Bangkok.

Forget the Wats. Jim Thompson was an American posted to Bangkok after the war as CIA precursor. He became interested in Thai silk and helped re-establish its reputation. He was a great collector of eastern antiquities in the old style.The museum is essentially his collection housed in the old teak houses he transplanted from the north and rebuilt to a newer design in Bangkok.There is a mix of textiles, wood carving, sculpture and all is displayed well. His very colonial furniture is in place.You go with an appropriate language guide in small groups and the explanations and knowledge were good.The house and gardens themselves are fascinating and some of the sculptures are displayed there.For us this was every bit as worthwhile as the grand Wats and worth taking a tuk tuk to see. It is at the university so handy if you are downtown but otherwise a distance.

Facinating. Mr. Thompson certainly made his fortune out of the skills of the Thai people but it would seem that he at least tried to preserve and promote Thai culture without exploiting it. The house and garden are beautiful with a good guided tour.

serene. nice place to see traditional Thai old housing. Off the road a touch and quiet inside. From my memory (was there in 2012) it was interesting but not crammed with things to see. Thompson shops a re always nice to visit too and have lovely silks and other products of highest quality for sale. I bought a pair of lovely cashmere winter mens scarves there and they are still perfect and always commented on.

Great venue steeped in history.. If I am hosting a visitor to BKK this is my must do as it is a little oasis right in the heart of Bangkok. The Jim Thompson story is amazing and you feel like you are walking back in time. The restaurant is really good and reasonably priced so you can enjoy the ambience. After jump on a long tail and you can get to the river very romantic.

Hidden gem. Very happy that I ended up going to see Jim Thompson's House in Bangkok. Whilst I didn't know anything about Thompson, your friendly and knowledgeable tourguide will tell you about both him, his works, and his house.Admission and guide was about 600baht for 2 adults. There was also an exhibition adjacent to the main house showing some local art installations.A free tuk tuk operates from the site every 15 minutes, but is a walkable distance from National Stadium BTS
Beautiful place. Beautiful grounds, knowledgeable staff, interesting history… read a head of time about Jim Thompson, come prepared and you’ll see the museum from another point of view.

Worth your time, though definitely a touristy spit.. Jim Thompson's appreciation for the culture of Thailand is well reflected in this beautiful home. He "westernized" some aspects for his comfort, but it really is lively. His eye for art was superb - the pieces on display are excellent. The overall compound has been corporatized: there's a westernized Thai restaurant and while the quality is good you do feel you could be at a Disney restaurant. There's an expensive gift shop - really just one of the many Jim Thompson shops you see in Duty Free around Asia. BTW: House has no AC, but shops and restaurant do. You'll need a cool retreat, as one does in Bangkok!
Gorgeous museum. Such a gorgeous house in beautiful setting, all visitors to Bangkok should go. The history is so interesting and the artwork truly gorgeous.

Beautiful heritage. Still nice to go there. First take the tuk tuk from National stadium BTS station. Then enjoy looking at the people working the silk and meet with fishes and turtles. Then you can have a visit. My favorite item is one Buddha's statue. And then you can chill around the cafe/restaurant. You will sometime hear speed boat from the canal (klong).

Jim Thompson House: the HIgh Point of Our Bangkok Trip. The Jim Thompson House is a wonderfully interesting place, very well exhibited and discussed by the guide, that puts you in touch both with aspects of Thai culture and the personality of the adventuresome Jim. Beautiful architecture, artifacts, and gardens, and a serene yet stimulating atmosphere. A must see.

Interesting window into 19th century colonial lifestyle in the 20th century. The grounds are beautiful. The building architecture is a fascinating blend of traditional local styles with an unembarrassed nod to Western and American preferences.I was a little uncomfortable at what seemed to be veiled references to the wealthy American seemingly looting local castles and temples for antiquities, including ripping the flooring out of one place to bring it to the compound. It didn't seem wise to inquire too closely.It was easy to imagine the wealthy foreigner restoring prominence to the Thai silk trade and invigorating the local industry and economy. I had the impression Mr Thompson really did love Thailand and the Thai people and his heart was clearly in his new home with them. There's a touch of mystery around his disappearance which was even apparently predicted by the astrologers he consulted for auspicious times to start building and to move in.The guided tour is well rehearsed and informative. You'll learn a lot. Recommended.

Architect of Thai Silk Industry... Jim. I read about Jim Thompson in internet hence I decided to visit the Jim Thompson House . The museum is located centrally at Soi Kasemsan 2 on Rama I Road, is accessible by bus, taxi and the sky train. I reached by alighting BTS Train at Siam Station. The museum is situated in a residential area, by the banks of the river. Entrance fee is 100 baht. The museum opens daily from 9.00 a.m. to 5.30 p.m. with Jim Thompson, an American serving here, decided to devote his energies to develop a thriving Thai silk industry and due to his tireless efforts, Thai silk is now famous all over the world and justly renowned for its quality, colours and patterns. Thompson, trained as an architect and gardener, also built a fine collection of traditional Thai houses where he lived during his lifetime. These house has been shifted from city outskirts and is assembled here to retain the traditional work of Jim Thompson. After his mysterious disappearance, the house remains preserved as a museum containing a priceless collection of Asian objects and arts and belongings of Jim Thompson. There is a guided tour available and a souvenir and silk shop with dress and garments made out of silk for sale. When I visited there was Thai cultural traditional dance performance by Thai artists in the garden with lovely Thai dance moves..

A must see in Bangkok. Visiting the Jim Thompson House and Museum is a must in Bangkok since it is a major history site. Take a guided tour and learn about the work of Jim Thompson and his life and buy some thai silk.
Commercial and predictable. Don't pay the entrance fee, it is only a shop! Have a look from the outside and eventually see the free exhibition upstairs.

Thai Silk. The best place to get your quality Thai silk clothing, and souvenirs. It is conveniently located in downtown Bangkok, only a stone throw away from the mega malls of MBK, Siam Discovery and Siam Paragon. A peaceful, tranquil Thai house amidst the bustle and hustle full of beautiful furniture and decorative pieces.
Interesting Insight To Local Legend. frequent tours, take socks as have to leave shoes to walk round the house. Fine art and lovely house.

Must see!. The Jim Thompson how is a true gem of Bangkok. So much culture and history there. For 140THB you can view his home and appreciate his appreciation for Thai culture. The home is beautiful and filled with art and precious furniture. Outside of the home they have a great restaurant and gift shop! While we waited for the tour there were demonstrations of Thai dancing and the silk making process. Very interesting to see!
Thai Silk at its best. If you want Thai silk, the quality and variety cannot be beaten. The prices are fair; the service is excellent. Accessible by Skytrain.

Track back the life of Jim Thompson.. It is a nice place equipped with six rooms and many precious furniture. The museum provides tour guides for free in English, Japanese, Chinese and two other Languages. Free shuttle bus service is also available. It is interesting to listen to the stories behind each room.

Worth the time and better than I expected. Have thought about visiting here on a number of trips to or through Bangkok and finally got to do so and glad I did.The tour was very well organised and our guide was impressively knowledgable.Had to strong arm my traveling companion into visiting this site but the story of Jim Thompson the OSS agent piqued his interest.The grounds are a tropical oasis in the hustle and bustle of Bangkok and the house is very very interesting. Certainly some lovely art on display.The shop has some lovely items for sale but were a little more than I hoped to pay - traveling on a tight budget. I didn't visit the cafe but it seemed very busy, which is a good sign.Will go back again with family if the opportunity presents.

Old world charm. You will get a nice overview of traditional Thai living on the guided tour here. Located in a soi near MBK, finding this place is can be a little difficult - use Google maps/similar. After the visit to this place, take a walk along the Khlong that runs behind it - it is nice.

Fantastic ! Loved this tour!. Perfect way to start the day. The grounds are beautiful and walking down the dusty round I was surprised at how this place was so well hidden. Once we purchased our ticket we were escorted on a tour through the house. Very informative and was impressed at how beautiful the house and gardens were. We were able to see how they make silk .The shop had beautiful silk wares to buy and was relaxing to have a coffee afterwards at the restaurant .

Beautiful property with an interesting history.. I had read the book about Jim Thompson and finally made it to this place. The tour of his house took approximately 30 minutes and was very interesting. The gift shop has beautiful silk items; expensive but worth a look...almost a museum itself.

Interesting and unique. I don t think there is anything else like the JT house. It's unique history and perfect location along the klong drip with authenticity,Especially magical was the call to prayer from the nearby Muslim community, who were the early workers in his silk enterprise,
Very interesting. We came across this place by accident. Well worth a visit. Interesting the see the story of Thai Silk.

The house is lovely!. The house is worth visiting, a great example of a traditional Thai home. I Just would not go there to buy your silk. I thought that would be the place to go, unfortunately their prices were very high and not all item were made in Thailand let alone there.

One of the best sights in Bangkok . Charming historical house tour of the fabled silk man Jim Thompson. The house and gardens are compact and perfectly maintained. The tour is quick paced and informative. Do wander through the gardens after the tour for a second look. The cafe is a good spot to rest and enjoy the lively surroundings. There is also a small gallery that features revolving exhibitions throughout the year included in the admission ticket. Easy to find and a short walk from the last BTS stop.
A MUST IN BANGKOK. This is one of the musts in Bangkok and is really one of the best things to do while in townGive yourself at least 2 hours to go round and take a guide

Nice well organised tour. I'm glad we visited Jim Thompson house but I would definitely get their for opening as I think it gets really busy!There is a free shuttle tuk tuk style organised by the attraction itself from the end of the main road which comes in handy in the heat.You buy your ticket and are allocated a tour (many languages available) you have to take a tour otherwise you cannot see inside the house. Whilst waiting for the tour to begin you can wander around the gardensNo photos are possible inside the house but the tour is interesting and the guides enthusiastic and knowledgeable. Tour takes about 40 minutesThere is a cafe on site and a shop and art galleryYou can also see silk being made

Not a priority. The Jim Thompson House is interesting and you should see it, but only if you have plenty of time in your schedule. The house is mentioned in almost every discussion of places to see in Bangkok. It is not a large place and it is tucked into a very industrial area. You will sign up to take a tour with a guide provided by the institution. If you have a guide, they will wait while you go through. The tour is short and it is interesting. You can easily do the whole thing in an hour if the wait isn't long for your group to be called. It is not a highlight of the day and you should not prioritize it that way. The house is authentic and represents the period and architecture. The gardens are pretty and very unique. Fair warning though, if you live in America, your house and garden is likely to be bigger than this place. We were a group of two with a private guide and driver. Thankfully, we were able to see it, enjoy it, and move on. There is a restaurant attached and it is somewhat busy. It is very touristy and you may feel guilty having a meal there based on that fact alone.

Went to see if Jim has come back or not ?. Interesting way to find out how the old style wooden Thai houses are built and reason for some of the features.At the end of the trip I figured out the truth behind why Jim never came back from the Cameroon Highlands.....
OK. Beautiful Teak building but not worth a special visit - disappointing attraction - not much to see - sorry Jim!!!

Fascinating. One of the highlights of a Bangkok trip i think - you have to see it. So well done, absolutely fascinating and such a mystery in the end too. A real insight into old school Bangkok life. Really recommended!
An idyllic charming spot on the BKK list of "must do". Dont leave out this historical site which jump started the Thai silk industry.The koi pools are worth a visit alone
Oasis. Very well run. Great guided tour. Absolutely stunning. I am very grateful that Jim Thompson's incredible legacy has been so faithfully preserved.
