See for yourself.... One would not appreciate very much the place if there would be no guide who would give information on each area. It's the story behind each part that makes Jim Thompson interesting to some. But there one sees and learn about the Buddhist belief and superstitions that are shown in the style of the doors and other things.
I love many designs and the materials. JT has become one of the label my husband loves. He loves the color and comfort of the material. I love many designs and function of the small stuffs.

I loved it. Came with my Girlfriend for a week to Bangkok for relaxing and shopping. From the cultural sites we visited i must say, that the Jim Thomson house was my favourite. The house it self, as well as the the amazin garden were just stunning. Truly amazing and i would go again.
Super house and garden but expensive. This is great place to rest, lots of stuff, nice view and quieter than in the city, but it's expensive place to rest :)
Something different . If you want to have a little break from the temples this is a good way to do something different. Lovely to see how Jim Thompson lived and how he designed his home.

Lovely architecture and a great tour. With admission, you get a tour of the house. While scripted, the tour was very informative and had a few jokes. The tour mainly covered the life and business of Jim Thompson with some allusion to how Jim incorporated Thai culture into the architecture and design. Very interesting tour and interesting life. Quite honestly, I would recommend this site simply for the superb architecture, art collection, and wood carving. Everything else was a cherry on top.

VERY PLEASANT PLACE AT THE HEART OF BANGKOK. Very attractive visit structure art and smiles.
Very riche historic place and try to see the manufacturing of the silk (unfortunatly : no schedule)
Visite en français possible.
Trip to the Jim Thompson House. Simply amazing, beautiful, spectacular, interesting, fabulous thing to do. The shop is great, the tour was informative, it was a highlight of our time in Bangkok.

Good Attraction. It is a nice house and a view into the way of life of the elite many years ago.
Good selection of silks, cloth(e)s and furnishing.

Very cool. The complex itself is very tucked away and rather hidden. Tour was very informative, the house itself is magnificent. But the whole story is riveting. The grounds are beautiful and a highly recommended stop off when your in bkk. Only 150 baht per. Family friendly.

Great way to go back in time. Might just be me, but felt a little like visiting a Frank Lloyd Wright house in Thailand :-). Loved the architecture and the design of the houses that were joined to become one. Everything in the house seemed to be left as it was when he disappeared.

A place full of mystery. His house is mesmerizing. I learned a lot about who he was and how much he loved Thailand. Our tour guide may not be not that fluent in English and speaks low but still understandable so I just always stayed closed to her whenever she speaks. You have to remove your shoes on most parts of the house and leave your things including cameras and phone in their provided lockers.The food in the restaurant is good too so I recommend to eat there after the tour to cool down.

Interesting visit. Beautiful house.. I wasn't sure what to expect upon my visit, however I can say that my expectations were exceeded. The house is amazing, and very nicely kept. The architecture is impressive and thoughtful. The tour and history of the house and its previous owner is fascinating and some of the artworks that adorn the house are very impressive. A local Dance Troupe also performed on the day of my visit which was great, and there is a small shop that sells books, silk clothing and accessories and other items. Not hard to get to either, being close to a BTS Train station. I would highly recommend a visit for a couple of hours. :)

Tour mandatory but interesting. If have any interest in architecture, history, interior design or otherwise aesthetic things, I truly recommend you to visit Jim Thompson House. You must attend a tour with a guide, but it is not very expensive and the guides tell interesting things about the house's story.

Over rated avoid visiting.. Visited this place with family. Selected this place by reading reviews on TripAdvisor. Avoid if possible. Not worth, West of money not time. I am not saying it's a bad place to visit, but by paying (adult - 150 Baht and child - 100 Baht) not worth it.

Historical. This is a must visit place to understand the founding father of Thai silk. Very clam and relaxing and yet educational for this historical building. A must if you have a few hours to spend!

A nice slice of history. I always love coming to the Jim Thompson house when I visit Bangkok. It is a beautiful location tucked down a soi with nice period houses and antiques. Makes you envy what it was like to live here 50 years ago. Learn about the man who was responsible for starting the commercialization of the silk trade in Thailand. Nice restaurant here for lunch as well.

Pleasant. Definitely worth a visit!Went without the kids, but will bring them next time. Interesting, learned quite a bit about Thai culture, nice surroundings and the restaurant was great. They have free tuk-tuk service.
great. I really lived this place. weird story how he just disappeared but the house is great a but of history and can catch the canal boats just behind which are really cool.
beautiful place and a good restaurant for lunch. its a very nice place to visit if you enjoy design and architecture, and the café is very good and well worth the visit.

FABULOUS!. We've always been meaning to go to Jim Thompson House and so on our last trip, we took a day and went. We took the Sky Train (which is SO easy and cheap) and walked to the house, passing Thai food vendors... Oh it looked and smelled so good! On arriving we booked our tour of the house and waited to go through, but this was probably only 10 minutes or so. The gardens are lush and tropical and there is a Jim Thompson shop, as well as Thai dancing and silk spinning, so it's no hardship to wait. The tour is quite lovely and the house and gardens are spectacular! We are going back with friends this Christmas, and we'll be taking them there, as it's not to be missed. It's an intimate tour, and you get a real feeling for the house and the man. We'd decided to book a table at the little casual restaurant within the complex, and so finished off with that. Yum. Fab food and love the Lemongrass & Lychee drinks.

Worth the effort. Take BTS to National Stadium, follow the signs when you exit for the Jim Thompson House....about a 20 minute walk. Buy tickets upon arrival and then they will assign you a tour time. We did not have to wait long, maybe 15 minutes. Wonderful tour, but must be done in bare feet. There are racks and racks of places to leave shoes and free locking lockers to leave personal bags. Very informative.

Must see while in Bangkok!. it's easy to get there using the bts skytrain. We enjoyed visiting the Jim Thompson house. A real haven of peace and tranquility in a crazy city. It is a very romantic house telling you everything you need to know about Jim Thompson. Jim Thompson must have been quite an extraordinary man to have assembled the houses and art collections into what it is. We had lunch in the restaurant which was delicious. Highly recomended!

Staffs are professional.. I went to this place, the staffs are very helpful and give a good information from the front and inside staffs. They provide a wide range of language for tourist, I went there with 3 Chinese friends and one staff explain during tour the house in Chinese language, my friends were very impressive about story and the way she told the story. The design and composition of the decor are attractive and mysteriously.

A delightful and peaceful retreat in the heart of a crazy city.. Jim Thompson was an American born in Delaware in the early 1900’s. He served in U. S. Army in the Far East, fell in love with Thailand and decided to live there permanently. He became interested in and effectively commercialised silk weaving which at the time was a cottage industry.He became very wealthy and built a wooden house in, what is now, the middle of Bangkok. It comprises of six beautiful, traditional Thai buildings into which he added western facilities. It is beautifully furnished and contains a large number of historic artefacts including ancient spiritual statues.Unfortunately, his life came to an abrupt and mysterious end. He disappeared in whilst trekking alone in the Cameron Highlands of Malaysia a few days after his 61st birthday. It is assumed that he was eaten by a tiger because no remains were ever found. He had no wife and so the house is maintained by the government as part of Thailand’s rich artistic and cultural heritage.To find the place, take the MRT to National Stadium (by the famous MBK mall) and it is an easy walk to the house. Just follow the instructions on the signs or watch out for the dedicated Tuk Tuk that will take you to and from the door on 6 Soi Kasemsan 2, Rama 1 Road, Bangkok.Admission to the house is by compulsory guided tour only. Although this limits the time one is able to spend soaking up the atmosphere, the overview by the smartly dressed Thai tour guides is very informative and entertainingThe grounds are open from 9:00 a.m. to 18:00 p.m. every day and here one can see the beautiful gardens and ponds. Also there are displays of Thai dancing and you can see demonstrations silk being ‘unwound’ from cocoons. Admission costs are a very reasonable 150 baht for adults and 100 Baht for under 22 year olds. The last guided tour starts at 18:00 p.m.Contact information: Tel: (662) 216-7368 Fax: (662) 612-3744

Not as it used to be. I've wanted to return to the Jim Thompson house since I first visited about 15 years ago. It's still wonderful and I do recommend it, but some of the charm has been lost as they've changed things to accommodate more visitors. Lunch is very good and the tour guide was excellent. Items in the gift shop are expensive but worth it.

Secret garden house. We were so excited to visit here since we arrived in Bangkok and we weren't disappointed at all. Lovely place and interesting to visit! Also nice cafe complete with coconut cake 🌴🌷🌸🌺

Decent but not amazing. If you're in the area worth checking it out. You're taken in a 40ish minute your of this guy's home. The tour is pretty boring to be honest, but the house itself is really neat to look around.

Jim Thompson, I never knew?. Lovely way to spend a morning in Bangkok learning about Thai Silk and seeing the most beautiful architecture. Never knew the story of Jim Thompson so was very interested to learn about him and his visions. Highly recommended.

Well worth a visit and a nice change from the shopping malls. It's the Wandering Yank here. Mrs. Yank and I recently spent a few days in Bangkok, and I kept seeing mentions of the Jim Thompson House. Since it was walking distance from our hotel, and I was a bit tired of the shopping mall scene, we took it in for maybe a total of 2 hours.It's very interesting! It's like a little oasis in the middle of the bustling city. His home on stilts on very airy and authentic (read the story of how it came to be here and you'll understand why). His collected artwork is beautiful, and the home is completely furnished, so it gave us some insight into how traditional Thai homes were constructed and filled (albeit for wealthier Thais). The gardens are beautiful as well.The gift shop has a lot of Jim Thompson merchandise, much of which you can see at the Jim Thompson shop in the Central World Mall.Well worth a couple of hours of your time in Bangkok.

Interesting design and cracking restaurant.. The House and gardens are very interesting and the guides well read. The design and the reasons behind the designs were made clear and the place was beautiful. The restaurant on site was excellent.

Wonderful house. Jim Thompson personal history and his achievements in the development of Thai silk industry are more than enough reasons to visit the very beautiful house the he built and where he lived. We did not spend time enough and, unfortunately, we were not able to use the restaurant. Nice shop, with high prices.
Enlightening. Nice visit to Jim Thompson's house, well worth the 150 THB entrance fee. Guided tours in a few languages, to have a better understanding of the life in Thailand in the past century

One of the highlights.. We went here after the Grand Palace and the Temple of the Emerald Buddha. I would recommend as it was very interesting and the house is beautiful. Make sure you see the art exhibition and have a nice lunch in the restuarant there. You can see a Thai traditional dance and see how they make silk. Good afternoon.

Thai Silk and Thai fusion food. A lovely place to visit in downtown where you can see how Thai silk has been made. Also you can buy high quality souvenirs. The restaurant serves Thai fusion food with good quality and well prepared. The staff has good service. Second floor, there are rooms for Thai Wedding. The place is in street but they have service transportation
Nice tour of the Jim Thompson Home. It was very interesting to see how locals would live in Thailand. The tour of the grounds gave you a little taste of a traditional home in Bangkok.

Very worthwhile visit. Recommended to us by our daughter who lives in Bangkok. Really engaging and interesting. All visitors shown around the house by a tour guide. You are not allowed to take pictures inside the house but are free to take pictures outside the house whilst in garden grounds. Great opportunity to look around buildings designed using Thai traditional building methods. There was also staff on hand to show you the traditional art of spinning silk straight from the silk worms along with Thai dancing. Once the guided tour is over you can spend as long as you want looking around the gardens and additional areas of the complex. Really interesting and very enjoyable.

Very nice and relaxed place to visit!. This is the perfect day to slowly get used to Thailand on your first day. The atmosphere is calm, people are relaxed and it is a very nice place to visit and to hear about the owner, Jim Thompson.
PRETTY LITTLE LUNCH PLACE. We had lunch and afternoon tea there after doing the tour of the lovely homes.The lunch was really tasty with a beautiful chicken curry and fresh juices.
Interesting. I'd not heard of Jim Thompson before so it was fascinating. Guide was really good and informative . The restaurant did great phad Thai at a hood price. Lovely place.

Quire surprising. I wasnt really interested in visiting the Jim Thompson house as I had never really heard about the man before hand, the visit however was quite educational and was enjoyed by the entire family. A bit more relaxed and less crowded than some of Bangkoks other attractions.

Nothing to get excited over. Found it boring. Couldn't understand the guide. Her English was better than my Thai but at end of day I didn't understand anything she was saying so couldn't get the history of the house

Peace haven in a bustling metropolis. A 4-minute stroll from our hotel (Holiday Inn Express), Jim Thompson House is truly a lush, tranquil haven in the midst of bustling Bangkok. You could also take the BTS till National Stadium - it's a 4 minute stroll from there too.Beautifully manicured greens, lush tropical plants, gorgeous Thai architecture greet you as you enter. You have a choice. If you'd like to take the guided tour, it costs THB 150 per person. If you wish to visit the store or the restaurant only, you can do that too. No entry fee is levied. We weren't aware of the fact and purchased tickets, but upon informing the staff that we only wanted to visit the store, they were helpful enough to grant a refund right away.The courtyard has an impressive display of the silk making process and traditional Thai dances every few minutes. The store is on your left. Beautiful scarves, stoles, couture and bags, displayed with efficient staff, always ready to help, you'll be itching to take home a piece of Thailand with you.Tip: there is a factory outlet somewhere on Sukhumvit - reduced prices - worth checking out.

Thai Beauty. This is third time to visit here. Whenever I come here I always satisfied the atmosphere. His sprit still live through his house and treasures what he collected all over the country. Beautiful wooden house and small but nice green garden make unforgettable color harmony and very special things inside. If you didn't have enough time in Bangkok, you should choose only one place here. I strongly recommend here compare with other Wat or palace. They offer several kinds of language docent and shuttle service as well.

Top. A fantastic place to visit. Not so far away from National Stadium skytrain station. I appreciate as this American man helped my Country to recover the best textile tradition. The house is a Museum at the highest level.Have a look

Interesting . Real interesting history of the production of silk and a Nice green spot in the centre of Bangkok, this was a real interesting guided tour we took. A lot of history about silk and Jim Thompson him self. You are not aloud entering the house without a tour guide, if you not want the tour guide your only aloud to visit the garden and surrounding smaller houses. The entrees fee is 150 b/ person including the guided tour.
Great story line. Its marvelous how a person's life can end up as such an interesting story. Please avoid visiting during summer as inside the house can be really hot

Good place for visiting. After the temple tour, I went to Jim Thompson House to see something different from the traditional temples.
The guides tour has a reasonable price, is fast and informative.
The restaurant is very good !

Another one of Bangkok's top attractions. A bit different to the temples but this is a great opportunity to see some authentic Thai architecture and learn a bit about the history of the Thai silk industry, and in particular the eponymous Jim Thompson. I think you have to take a tour; at least if you didn't you wouldn't get much out of this other than some nice gardens. The tours are very regular and in various languages, but you might have to wait for up to 10-15 minutes. It's informative and interesting, if a bit museum like, and the site isn't huge. But overall I thoroughly recommend it.
Classic Thai Home. Very interesting visiting and touring the Jim Thompson home and grounds. We enjoyed seeing the compound with it's classic Thai buildings and interior decor.
A hidden gem. Using the Skytrain to get close, Jim Thompsons House is a delight, its beautiful simplicity is a far cry from the rest of the city.

Interesting and peaceful. I had absolutely no idea what to expect when visiting this house. What I found as my first site 29 hour flight from the US, was an absolute blissful peaceful respite from the rest of Bangkok. The house itself is architecturally interesting. The shop though pricey offers fabulous AC. Walking the grounds is a peaceful and introspective experience. And stopping at the restaurant before you leave offers great traditional Thai noodles (a little pricey) in a glorious setting over looking a spectacular koi pond. This is a don't miss. Give yourself time to really relax and enjoy it
Interesting, informative. Interesting story, very nice house, great restaurant. House is very interesting, tour is done in very proffesional way, restaurant serves great and affordable Thai food
A must visit if you're in thailand. So very interesting, amazing gardens and house and the tour guide was excellent, would recommend this place to anyone who visits

Lovely place to visit. We enjoyed our visit to Jim Thompson house. The tour of the property was really interesting, although our tour guide struggled to answer any extra questions we had about things as we walked around. The gift shop was huge with lots of lovely items to take home. We didn't eat at the restaurant but it looked lovely. Another great touch was the free shuttle service that take you along the road to the main BTS station to save you walking.

Great venue. Fascinating. Very good tour in several languages, with time to wander through the gardens afterwards. Jim Thompson was an interesting character with mystery thrown in too. His impact on the Thai silk industry was huge. The house is wonderful.

Very-nice. This house it's was very nice and luxary ! Many things in the house are old. You can do the visit with a guide ( in your language ), it's inclued in the price. It's a quiet place. Just a little problem, but anywhere in Bangkok, it's a group of the tourists.

Really cool place must visit . This attraction is really not too far from Siam square and it is a must visit place on your trip to Bangkok. The architecture of the building is very nice. They also have a restaurant on the property. They run frequent tours in several languages. It is nice to see the history of the modern silk industry here

A Wonderful Place!. I'd say this is a must-see when visiting Bangkok. It was on our list of possible places to visit and I'm very happy we decided to see it. Walking through the house on the short guided tour you'll have the sensation of being inside a private little paradise. After the tour you're free to wander around the small garden. The shop wasn't of much interest to us because we're not big shoppers (I was also disappointed to see merchandise there that was made in other countries, given that Jim Thompson was famous for reviving the Thai silk industry). Upstairs from the shop is a nice gallery space that had a great sculpture installation when we were there. We also had a very nice lunch at the on-site restaurant.This is not a large place so your visit won't be a huge chunk of your day, but it's excellent and should be on your itinerary when you're in Bangkok!
Awesome . Great attraction and less crowded then the temples. The tour was very informative. Also in a good area for a walk after the tour easy access to Silom Sq

Beautiful oasis of calm . The visit to the house and gardens a real highlight of our trip - excellent guided tour included in the entry fee with an additional video art exhibition at end well worth visiting.Cafe on site for food and drink with easy access via sky train.
thailand. shows what he did to revitalise the silk industry that was was in decline and to get the world to see the designs that Thailand has to offer and also gives an overview in Jim Thompson

Beautiful Garden House with a Great Story. This house was located right next to the hostel we were staying and so ventured in to see what all the hype and was mesmerized by the garden as well as the grand house.We took tickets and waited for the tour to start and the guide was very good,she took us to every nook and corner of the house and explained the contribution of jim thompson towards Thailand's Growth and also how the house was built in complete Thai style.Loved the shop here which was selling various silk items and there's also a very busy cafeteria.There's a free tuk tuk service from the main road to go to this house.

Nothing else like this in Thailand. This is very different to the temples and other attractions in Bangkok. There is a free tour included with your ticket price, and there is some demonstration of silk weaving as well. It's a great way to escape the hustle and bustle without leaving the city.

The history of silk. Great tour..knowledgable guides ..then your free to wander the grounds, orchids..ponds..beautiful gift shops and restaurant! A lovely history of Thailand's silk industry..and a style icon!

Very Informative!. This tour was a great surprise! Jim Thompson is an America who lived in Bangkok and built a silk empire. This is a tour of his home, which is so interesting. The tour guides give great insight into his life, his home and the furniture.They also have great silk products in their gift shop!Definitely something one should see!
Nice organised place. It is a nice organised tour provide with a guide, quiet cool place to walk around without the Bangkok heat.

Go for lunch - outstanding - and then for a guided tour of the house - nice!. Delicious food at the cafe. Have lunch al fresco and then go for the guided tour. Perhaps good advice if you want to plan it to go smoothly not to waste precious time while travelling in bkk is to buy tickets for the tour first and then go over to the counter for the guided tour to book a guide. You cannot visit the house alone. We had to wait half an hour for availability...

Take in if you have time.. Interesting place to visit. Nice house and grounds. Jim Thomson was someone who built up the silk business before the CIA bumped him off in Malaysia. They are better things and places to see so go there if you have time.

Interesting Thai style home and gardens. The Thai house of Jim Thompson ‎set in lovely gardens is located close to the downtown shopping areas. The home of Jim Thompson is comprised of several structures built  in the typical traditional Thai style of the last century. The museum also on the grounds  showcases the Thai silk industry, which Jim Thompson was largely responsible for developing. A store on the grounds offers visitor lots of choices of Thai silk products.
Not for young children. The decor and presentation are stunning, but not really suitable for young children - boredom crept in very quickly from their perspective!

Very Interesting and well Presented. I had never heard of Jim Thompson and was totally ignorant of the ways of the Silk Industry and it's place in Thai Commerce.The place is well signed and is a short walk from the Skytrain stop at National Stadium.Entry was inexpensive and included a guided tour in groups, divided according to preferred language. The tour lasts approximately 30minutes after which you are free to browse at your leisure.A peaceful restaurant is on-site to provide refreshments.I left a more knowledgeable man.

I like so much. Collections of beautiful art objects, except that dream house, and a guide for any comment: critical business and! The garden itself appears out of nowhere, preserved from the bustle and concrete of the city. Shop for shopping is available while waiting his turn to visit in your native language.
Many better options. While this house is "fine" and we did our best to enjoy it, it was basically a waste of money and time ... compared to other options.

Interesting . Good for a quick visit. Great price and under 25 were free. A very interesting story behind it all. Gorgeous pieces and the store there had some amazing stuff. The bangkok arts and cultural center is just around corner and is a great free place to visit.

Very good, interesting and peaceful. Very good visit (in many languages) with good content. The restaurant is very good and it's a peaceful place to have a breack after the visit. Silk craft are expensive there but they also have an outlet boutique (Sukhumvit 93, check their website).

Tranquillity in Bangkok. Unusual museum. You have to book a tour, included in entrance price, to look around the buildings. Bags and shoes are left in lockers. You cannot take pictures inside the buildings. We felt we were hurried round and could not look at everything that we wanted to. We also expected to see a lot about silk and silk manufacturing, but it was mainly an explanation of the artefacts that Jim Thompson had acquired on his travels. Gift shop is very expensive.

Something different in BKK. Located very close to the National Stadium train station line. Very convenient to get to. The house is absolutely gorgeous and definitely worth the visit (especially the guided tour). The tour lasted around 30-40 minutes and a lovely guide tells you the story behind jim thompson's house. The interior and exterior decor is stunning and different to your average thai house. Interesting background and the tour was not too boring. Tickets were not expensive, would recommend spending a bit of time around here as I think this is more interesting than visiting all the temples as they are all similar but this was pretty unique.
Jim Thompson House was excellent. The Jim Thompson House was great. We had a tour of the house and our guide was excellent and spoke English well. Very interesting and the silk shop was lovely.

an oasis of calm. Bangkok is pretty full on and the sites are well spread out. Jim Thompson's house gives you a distilled taste of Thailand in one place. Good guided tour and lovely restaurant- more expensive than some of the more local eateries, but makes a calming change in this huge and busy city.

Better than expected. Hiding in the heart of the busy city. Very close to the famous shopping area. For foreigners, it is so nice to start the day with morning visit to this place before walking to the shoping area nearby (Siam square, MBK, Siam Paragon...)
Wedding at Jim Thompson House. Attended a wedding here and service, food, atmosphere and decor were all of the highest order. Recommend a visit if you're in Bangkok.

Great Restaurant. Now the home is great...full of lovely antiques, statues from ancient temples that were naturally legally obtained by the honorable ex-cia agent!!! The restaurant is a MUST-GO..one of the best restaurants in the magic city of Bangkok at very reasonable prices. The architecture and the general atmosphere of the place is definately worth a visit.
OK I guess. Went there with a friend mostly because she wanted to go. Deals were ok, but nothing special. Probably wouldn't go again/

Brilliantly done. We spent the afternoon here. Very friendly and attentive staff. Feels like a green, shady haven from the bustle of Bangkok! Entrance fee is 150 baht, you then get a 30min tour in your language from one of the knowledgeable guides. Jim Thompson was famous for bringing back hand woven silk to Thailand, so they have a lady there demonstrating how it's done. All proceeds go to helping the blind in Bangkok. A very well put together museum.
Hot. Surly influenced by +39C - but still not that interesting. You will see a house and garden from the 60is, and yes, it is nice - but this is what it is. Bangkok probably have better sights...

Well worth a visit. We visited as part of a self arranged day trip around BKK using public transport - a river taxi stop is close by and this is a good way to arrive. Well organised tours do a good job of telling the JimThompson story

Very interesting!. We weren't sure if this was going to be fun or boring, but were pleasantly surprised. This was a short tour and we enjoyed seeing the house itself. It was set in a lush green environment. The gift shop did not have any deals, but there were pretty items offered for sale.
Interesting place to visit.. Visited Jim Thompson House with a small group. The history of the house is quite interesting. The house is a beautiful teak house. The grounds are very nice as well.

A pleasant surprise. I hesitated to visit this place on many occasions whilst staying in Bangkok, hence only visited it after running out of options for local sightseeing places. And what a pleasant surprise it was! Although I am not interested in silk and stuff, the house itself is rather impressive and you can learn a lot about Thai history, as well. Knowledgeable guides. Definitely worth a visit.

A nice break from all the temples. If you've had your fill of temples I'd recommend the Jim Thompson House. It cost 150 baht but an English speaking tour guide was provided (tour guides are obligatory). It was quite relaxed, gave some interesting information and was a nice way to see some Thai architecture and antiquities in the middle of Bangkok. I just happened to visit on the anniversary of Jim Thompson's birthday so there was a Hindu/Buddhist ceremony ongoing with some seemingly important people which was an extra interest!

Brilliant...really didn't expect that!. My wife and I stayed at the Lit Bangkok hotel which was like a 5 minute walk to Jim Thompson house, so we thought lets give it a visit!Entry fee was 150Baht each, we got assigned to an English Translator. After about 10-15 minute wait we were in a group with other tourists with our Jim Thompson guide.It was a Thai woman who spoke great English and went the extra mile when explaining the house. The tour itself lasted for about 35 minutes but it felt magical! The house is beautiful and some of the myths and facts we learnt were really interesting. To be honest I just went to visit the house as it was down the road from the hotel but it was so worth it! Before stepping inside the house we had to take our shoes off as well as lock our bags away. Once the tour had finished they have buggies which dropped us off to the main streets. I would recommend visiting the Jim Thompson house if you have time, was quite magical!

Nice place, quiet and tranquille in the midst of busy Bangkok. Just a very nice place to go and enjoy the wooden buildings and perfect garden. Ofcourse you find some souvenir things but they are not so pushy

A great escape from the hustle and bustle of Bangkok. I've visited Jim Thompsons House on a number of occasions when showing friends the sites of Bangkok. It's worth doing the tour to get an insight into the life of Jim Thompson and his legacy in the silk and textile design industry in Thailand. If you are a koi fancier there are some amazing koi including butterfly koi in the pond next to the cafe / restaurant.
Beautiful place. A great trip to do in the afternoon for an hour or two. Beautiful home and the tour was very good and informative.
Nice and relaxing. The guided tour takes one around to see all the interesting bits of the house and to give an idea of the life of the owner.Good for an hour or so.

Interesting. The Jim Thompson houses and tour was an interesting way to spend a couple of hours in Bangkok. The house and the antiques inside it are very interesting and definitely worth a look. The tour was informative and wasn't too heavy going. Definitely worth a visit.

A lovely oasis in the city. Unlike other cultural attractions in Bangkok, this one seemed to mostly appeal to small groups of Westerners, which isn't surprising considering the history of the home's owner. The museum is very close to the BTS and offers a free tuk-tuk shuttle back to the main street for anyone who needs it. All visitors have to tour the home with a guide (35 minutes), and the main building is quite interesting inside. Jim Thompson had many interesting design ideas that blend Thai traditions with some Western preferences. Also, the museum's gift shop has beautiful silk that is actually more affordable than similar options in Chiang Mai.

Meh.... It looks better on pictures than once you're there. It's an interesting visit but I waited a long time for the tour to start, and it's like a 1 hour tour....I have done it, not sure I'll be back.

A traditional Thai house converted into a museum. Jim Thompson’s House is a popular museum that houses the collection that the American silk merchant built up from across Thailand and South East Asia. Jim Thompson disappeared in 1967 and despite a massive hunt, was never found. The house has Ming ware, Cambodian carvings, Burmese statues and a lot of other works of art. Photography isn't allowed inside!

A lovely museum just a few steps from Siam and MBK. Nice place to visit with friends, family with teenage kids or when you walk around on your own. Besides the museum itself you can find there a small art galery, Jim Thompson shop and restaurant

Nice place to be and see. We had the chance that they were not so much tourist because some day you can have up to 1800 persons......Said our guide.The visit cost 150 bath per person and is not so long but provides in most languages.Garden is just an oase in this trepident city.Is to see.It is close from the MBK, so that 1 hour between 2 shoopong tours.

A fascinating traditional-modern property. It is very interesting to see how people lived in Thailand before. Jim Thompson house is a good place for you to imagine the past. One thing that struck me in the heart is the fact that he went missing travelling in Malaysia... What the heck happened to him? :/ Nobody knows...

Funny and informative tour. The grounds are gorgeous and the decor in the house is amazing. What really made the tour though was the hilarious tour guide we had. She was pretty serious and all business, but then would crack jokes about chamber pots that were straight up hilarious. I don't want to ruin her material, but really, it was quality stuff. All too often tour guides take them selves way too seriously, but this woman really had the ideal mix of information, fun, and jokes.I panicked when they said you couldn't bring your bag into the building, but was happy to see they had lockers on hand for you to stow your belongings.Be sure to bring water (there are a few places to buy on the alley)!!

Not that good. If you have all the time in the world, go. If not you can easily spend your time and money better in Bangkok. Take the little boat a few stops further up the river and visit the golden mountain. When we arrived we had to sit around and wait for 45 minutes for a tour before we could enter the house on a guided tour as it is not allowed to walk around freely.

A little forced and sanitised. Photos not allowed. Set tours every x minutes in a various languages. Really a nice location but spoiled by the throngs of tourists. Like everywhere. Visit if you have time.

beautiful history in the centre of Bangkok. I visited here 20 years ago, all that has changed is a now charming restaurant and shop. The house is still beautifully preserved with a tour with interesting information. Lovely gardens and flowers, art collection and easy to get to.

A beautiful attraction . We loved looking round the house and gardens - the guided tour is included in the entry price and is very informative,
Get there if you can....

Visit to Jim Thompson House. Mr Jim Thompson was an American who moved to Thailand after the war. He reinvigorated the silk industry by creating new designs, paying weavers to make the silks and exporting the silks to sell in the USA. He built the Jim Thompson House to live in; these days it is a museum.

Thailand as it was in the 60's original homestead. Jim Thompson's house and grounds are beautiful. Very original to Bangkok in the early 60's. Home is lovely, many interesting features. The gardens are magnificent. Beautiful shops to purchase Thai silks and other items. There is a restaurant on the premises that has a fish pond that is just beautiful, very relaxing, food is good, great place of sit for a bit after touring.

Surprisingly interesting :). We spend a few days in Bangkok after having toured South-East Asia for a month. Having already seen the major attractions in Bangkok we decided to visit the Jim Thompson House and were very surprised to see how interesting the 'museum' was. For people who are into art and architecture this place is a quite interesting place to go. Besides, the guided mandatory tour was excellent and our guide spoke English very well...

Definitely a must see and know about museum.. Jim Thompson's House is one of Bangkok's gem of a museum to visit. It is incredible to learn about Jim Thompson and his work and his contribution the City and to the Thai People. It will interest all visitors to walk through his house and attached buildings, to delight is his incredible garden and learn about how he promoted silk and the value of utilising this fine material. The museum's shop is worth at least to visit, though it is almost impossible to resist the urge to purchase some of the many items for sale.

Worth a Visit. A short walk (or shuttle if you wait) from the BTS sky train stop at National Stadium, and you will find this oasis in the chaotic center of Bangkok. Jim Thompson was an American Architect who, after world war II, found a home in Bangkok and is considered one of those that save the Thai silk industry. His home is just stunningly beautiful an is full of wonderful antiques and antiquities. Your entry ticket includes a guided tour. The tour guide we had spoke excellent english. There also guides speaking in French, Spanish, Chinese, Japanese and of course Thai. You can also buy some Jim Thompson silk items at the well appointed gift shop. The prices were higher than we would have liked, but they are high quality.

Nice surprise!. My wife wanted to go here, so we did! To be honest I wasn't super excited about it in the beginning but it turned out to be so interesting. Our guide for the tour was charming, funny, and very informative and the grounds/ house beautiful & well taken care of.Really interesting and would recommend anyone making the visit!

Great place for short visit. If you have 1-2h available you should really visit this delicately maintained museum. The guided tour takes 1/2h and gives you a nice impression of the way Jim Thompson lived in Thailand. The circumstances around his disapperance remains mysterious to date. We visited the place exactly 49 years after his disapperance (26 March). Nice place and restaurant.

Great way to spend a couple of hours. On our last day in Bangkok it decided to rain so we decided to go out anyway. This museum was easy to find and nearby. The tour was very well organised and the numbers not too large. Excellent value for money at 150 Bhat / person. Our 9 yr old son found it interesting and loved looking at the fish in the grounds. Tour lasted about 30mins, lots to see. Coffee shop was very nice and relaxing too.

Stop if you're in the neighbourhood but don't drive there specially. A nice to get in stop while passing by. The system request you to have a booked mini tour around the Amrican Jim Thomson. Nice but no what and only good for people interested in .... euh... in what? ;-)
Interesting Place . Good value for the tour which lasts just over half an hour. Nice to see such an old and interesting property preserved in its original setting in the middle of the city.

Fantastic tour. Steeped in history and culture.
Shows the house of a remarkable man, he cared deeply about Thailand and it people.
Too much to list but what a tale of mystery leading his demise.

Jim Thompson House. Really enjoyed our Jim Thompson House experience. Very well organized tour and imformative staff and there were so many things i didnt know about him and the mystery of his disapearence. Well worth a visit! .

good. Yes, Jim Thompson House was once basically a house of Sir Jim Thompson which is now a museum. This museum, I think, is the most antique museum as it consists of different Thai structures collected from various parts of Thailand. It was like the World ofArt in which one would like to walk in never want to come back,at least not me. After visiting this place I wished of me being Mr. Jim Thompson and then I can proudly say that it’s my creation.

Interesting and informative tour!. Me and a friend availed the tour at Jim Thompson's, and we're amazed by how informative the tour guides were. What I loved the most is how they cater to different foreigners because of the variety of languages available for the tour.
Amazing property. Very interesting regarding architecture and life style of the past. The museum is very well organized. On the other hand the property is not very big and can be crowded.

Great hosts. The tour guides are fluent in whatever language you require and the system is very organised, making sure not to clash groups together. The house itself is interesting and there's even an art gallery above the shop. Speaking of, the shop is very overpriced so bring cash!

Great little museum . Great little museum we visited today on anniversary of his dissappearence.Something for big people as little one will probably get bored.It wasn't long so that's plusEntry was 150 bhat per adult and under 22's only 100 bhat and our daughter who is six was free!There is a restaurant on the site and also a shop

Good value tour. The small entry fee includes a guided tour - they have guides with different languages available. Our guide was very informative, telling us all about Jim Thompson and why his house has been preserved. The house itself is fascinating - a blend of cultures, mixing the Orient with Western styles. Jim Thompson was a collector and the furniture and objects are diverse and interesting.

Interesting back story and nice house! . Tours are compulsory here before you are allowed to wander yourself. Tickets are pretty cheap at 150 baht for adults. Our guide had good English and was informative. Lots of interesting objects dotted around but all are quite worn and falling to pieces! The story of Jim Thompson is more fascinating than the house though in my opinion! We didn't stick around after the tour which lasts around 35 minutes. If you are prone to mosquito bites be sure to get your bug spray on just in case as there is quite a lot of greenery it's better to be safe than sorry! They have commercialised the area some what with a restaurant and souvenir shops but the exteriors are at least in keeping with the original look. There is a free shuttle taking your the short distance to and from the BTS Skytrain every 15 minutes but it's such a short walk, 5-10 mins it's hardly worth it! MBK mall is a 10 min walk from Jim Thompson house with plenty food options on the 6th floor "foodies" food court if you are looking for lunch or dinner options or if you just fancy a shop! Lumpini Park is also nearby.
Quick stop for a drink .... We stopped in for a drink and to look at the store. The grounds look lovely and we enjoyed our drinks. It's a quiet stop in a bustling and hot city.
Excellent Dinner. The Jim Thomson House Restaurant is an excellent place to relax. The ambiance is A1 and they pick you up on a golf cart if you like next to Ibis.

Great lunch with family. My eight year old son said best mango sticky rice ever - and I agree. Noodles were a standout. Nice to find a fresh lime juice that tastes of lime with only a small amount of sugar.

Something Beautiful to Visit in Bangkok. I missed seeing this on my past trips to Bangkok and finally got to see it this month. It's like an oasis in a chaotic Bangkok. The rooms are decorated with Mr. Thompson's collection of Thai relics. The guide was very informative. The koi ponds and lush greenery make you feel like you are in a garden. Right next to the museum is the Thai Silk store, which has beautiful things but on the expensive side. To forget to visit the his restaurant next door. Best Pad Thai.

Beautiful gardens, nice tour.. The title sums it up well. The tour was nice, and the tour available for different languages. The art treasures in the house and architectural details were wonderful. However, no pictures are allowed in the house, it would have been nice to have a lovely book about the house containing nice photos available. If it exists, I didn't find it. The merchandise in the gift shop is lovely, but may be out of reach for some budgets.

It is a tourist trap. They elevate this guy almost to godlike proportions and all he was was an American entrepreneur who thought he could make a buck selling silk. The place is is boring. I'd rather see a real vernacular Thai house than this thing.

Beautiful place, interesting and educational.. In my ignorance, I'd never heard of Jim Thompson but beefed up on him prior to staying in Bangkok.I'd describe him as an eccentric, successful entrepreneur.His house is absolutely unique and beautifully furnished with a variety of furnishings from decades if not centuries.Famed for his revival of Thai silk, you can see the silk been spun, (fascinating).The gardens are surreal considering you are in the middle of the Capital of Thailand.They are a mouth watering experience for any horticulturalist.You can have a guided tour (recommended) in small groups.There is a Jim Thompson retail outlet on site but items tend to be a little expensive, but then it is pure silk and holds the Jim Thompson name.Certainly worth a visit, quite an experience.

BEAUTIFUL! Worth a visit. It was raining on the day we visited. A perfect way to spend a wet afternoon. The house is a relic from the past with some truly beautiful pieces in it. Our guide was a wealth of knowledge and brought the Jim Thompson to life. The shop has some beautiful silk products, not cheap but very beautiful

Lovely outing. I visited the JT house with two friends. It was lovely. In the courtyard there were two Thai dancers performing plus an exhibition on how Thai silk is made. Pretty grounds, walking distance from the BTS & an interesting tour. Enjoy!

An oasis. Beautiful....snuggled in a side street near national stadium in Silom area of bkk. Don't give up trying to find it!! The place is worth the effort I was there on a boarding duty.. so it was work for me...but was with teenagers...the house is stunning...the guides efficient and had good english and knowledge of subject matter ...it is an oasis in a hectic Bkk. also recommend the cafe excellent if one has the chance there is also a restaurant in Sala Dang which is a bit more up market with fantastic food and outside has a showing of old movies..but I think when in rain season they stop doing that! Any way enjoy!

Interesting Visit . Wouldn't be on my top list of things to do in Bangkok but was definitely worth the visit, the tour guide was very informative and the house and grounds were beautiful. Jim Thompson and his influence on Thai silk and his aim of preservation of Thai and Buddhist culture really showed through his house and his work. Very interesting.

An oasis of calm amidst the madness of Bangkok. Each time I visit Thailand, I come here. It brings me immeasurable joy. Sed amidst lush greenery, it's 2 houses made into 1. Well-informed staff take groups of visitors by spoken language. The largest group I've been in was about 8 people.The house, the furnishings and the Jim Thompson story will take hold of your heart and you won't want to leave. The wood in the house, be it a beam, a door frame, a floor board, or an item of furniture is just beautiful.Food in the restaurant is fantastic, and not at all expensive - if you arrive in the morning, it's advisable to book a table for lunch, it's always busy.Lastly.......the gift shop. This is not just any gift shop....... this is Jim Thompson's gift shop. Need I say more ?

Wow wow wow. Dont miss this little slice of history right in the middle of bustling Bangkok. Well worth taking the guided tour to hear about the collection and some of Jim Thompson's eccentricities.Excellent experience for the whole family.Make sure you check out the Jim Thompson warehouse if you have time. Not walking distance but you can get a taxi very cheaply. Have the address written in Thai if you can. Most taxi drivers will need the address.

Interesting left field place to visit if you have a couple of hours to spare. Didn't know anything about Jim Thompson until I read about it here so decided to pop over for a visit. The tour takes an hour or so and was worth the visit alone just to see the house, with a guided tour of the house and gardens included. The restaurant food was also top quality and the site was well laid out and organised for tourists. Worth a visit if you're in town just to see something in different and learn about this American whose love for Thailand spread to the growth of the local silk industry. Believe the hype.

Fascinating. Amazing story of US man who came to Thailand after WWII and loved it and stayed. He revitalised the Thai silk industry and made an amazing house with a huge collection of Thai art and statues in it. Well worth your time.

Brilliant insight to the life of an enigma. The house has been preserved in the condition it was in at the time of Thompson's disappearance. Wonderful artifacts and the atmosphere of his having just walked out the door made for a fascinating visit.

A Tranquil museum available. Mysterious story happened to its original owner, Jim Thomson, who loves Thai silk and the That culture.Built with teak wood and marble by the canal not far across today's National Stadium, reachable by BTS Sky Train system with little walk.Well organised tour available included in the ticket in different languages.It's bar also a chic place to cool down after the visit and shopping spree.

A beautiful place to wander around and dine. Jim Thompson a man of international intrigue. He mysteriously disapeared leaving behind a thriving business. His legacy is still very much in place. The business is Thai silk and food. Have a browse you will not be disappointed unless,of course, you are there for the sex trade.

An interesting story and house to visit. Finally managed to find time to visit this place. There is a guided tour for the visit which is excellent. The story of Jim Thompson and his house is the focus of the visit. It is an interesting place to view the architecture of the house beside the river. The interesting mystery of his story.

Lovely visit. I loved visiting Jim Thompson House. The guides were really good, full of knowledge and willing to share it. The architecture and history was fascinating as well as being a really serene location.

The Ultimate Authentic Thai House!. This place will show you authentic thai houses but re-build with western architect. Not only the house but the artifact in the house is also amazing and rarely to find it in nowadays.
There is tour guide for you, they can speak many languages. So, don't worry to get lost.

A short walk from National Stadium BTS. Although I have visited Jim Thompson House several times, this time I took my lunch there. The Thai food which I ordered was spicy as requested and quite unjoyable when accompanied by Singha beer.
Worth visiting. After many trips to Bangkok we finally visited Jim Thompson House and thoroughly enjoyed the guided tour. Note - it is a compulsory tour, you can't just wander through the house.

Good visit in between shopping. Went here with a friend. Entrance fee is 150 baht for adults and 100 baht for children.If you have young kids I wouldn't recommend doing the tour with the guide since there is a lot of fragile and old items that can easily be tipped over. However, if you are interested in architecture or just want to see something else than shoppingmalls this is a good stop. The location is great too, easy accessable.Recommend!

Surprisingly informative and enjoyable. Nice little green oasis. We thoroughly enjoyed our tour, which was quite interesting. The kids enjoyed it as well. It was interesting to be in a traditional Thai house modified by an American. We took the tuk-tuk that goes from the street to the museum, only a 2 minute ride, but the kids thought it was fun.

If you like architecture, then visit this. This place gives you a glimpse into traditional homes in Thailand, albeit recreated by US-expat Jim Thompson. He brought his architectural training into the mix while creating his own home in central Bangkok. Acquiring a trove of antiques, he has left behind a treasure of a place for all to admire.

Excellent, worth visiting. Great museum, there is a silk shop, its quite pricey but its original , i will definitely don't be bored of visiting again and again.Great collection of Asian art items, make sure you are wearing easy to remove shoes as you are requested to remove it before the tour of the house
Very interesting!. A great way to see some beautiful Asian art pieces all very well laid out in this gorgeous Thai house. To make it more of an experience, take the water taxi to get there.

Nice to see but not a "have to see" in Bangkok. If you are interested in art an architecture, this is a good place to visit. The traditional Thai home Jim Thompson created is beautiful, as are the furniture and art inside of it. There is also a store on the property to purchase silks made by the company Jim Thompson founded.

Interesting. This was interesting to visit and it was well presented by the guide that walks you through the house living area. I enjoyed it because I've purchased from the main store in the past and really enjoy Thai silk. I wouldn't put this on the top of my "must see" list for Bamgkok, but it's a pleasant stop if you have time.

Silk stories and a mysterious disappearance. Wow, what a life he must have had in this amazing house. Jim Thomson of silk fame lived here and decorated it with wondrous items he found around Bangkok. A pity the guide had only memorized one version of the text and couldn't pronounce things well or answer questions. Nevertheless a memorable visit.

Beautiful home, gift shop, restaurant. I loved walking around to see the home and gardens, learn the history, and seeing how silk is made. There were posters explaining the process as well as staff on the ground spinning silk from the hot vat of silk cocoons. I spent a lot of time in the gift shop as it was difficult to choose from the scarves and purses/bags and shirts, and I indulged in the restaurant which had pretty good food and was very crowded.

Oasis of Calm. We visited this house and had a good lunch in their cafe prior to the official escorted tour around which lasted about half an hour. Fabulous place and well worth a visit. There is a large gift shop there too. They have a courtesy tuc tuc to take you back to the sky train.
A must, if you like beauty and history.. We were very lucky to have an excellent guide. She was funny and full of knowledge. One of the BKK attractions I would like to see again.

Short and sweet. JT revolutionized the silk trade in Thailand. This was his personal residence made up of 6 traditional wooden houses. You tour a few of the buildings and see the grounds for 30 min. If you haven't seen a traditional house this is your chance. The restaurant was great value and quality. The best part is there is a woman actually making silk from the cocoons and then another spinning the silk thread.

Good for 1 hour. Price was 150baht including a small tour inside the house. It was worth it for me as the guide talked about Thai culture, religion and architecture. There is a store where you can buy expensive luxury goods made by silk.

A unique, peaceful experience in Bangkok. Very peaceful place with an interesting story behind it. The tour through the house was super interesting, priced right, and lead by a knowledgeable, English speaking guide. There's a nice looking restaurant on site (did not try) and a gift shop with crazy expensive silk scarves and shirts.

If it's hot, maybe not!. We were here on a very hot day. The tour takes about an hour. You are barefoot a great deal of the time. It involves climbing and standing in small areas. Interesting story and Jim Thompson continues to live on through a very aggressive merchandising program throughout the area. Some nice purchases can be made in his store.

A brand to explore. Created in Jim Thompson's old house, is a shop that stocks all the latest gents and ladies clothes....mainly tops, shirts etc., cushion covers and some accessories made under the fast expanding jim thompson brand.The complex also houses a very good cafetaria and has sceduled visits through the property, relating the history of Jim Thompson.Their products are up market and focus on the inclusion of elephants. To that extent they offer a limited range of options but are very good.Must buy some cushion covers, dining table cloths and small accessories.Please try on the shirts etc. As the sizing of different designs is quite varied and it is not unusual the while in one style or cut, a large would be adequate , in another one may need a xxl !

Great place . Very interesting and informative tour. This place it's a most see when you visit Thailand . We took the English tour and although our tour guide had a very strong accent it was nice. Don't forget to visit the silk store where you'll have the chance to purchase some of the stuff made out of silk and other materials . Make sure to bring socks since they don't allowed shoes inside of the house .It's very well preserved.

Not as quaint as it use to be.... Great place to visit with interesting history of the owner and the silk industry. Feels like an oasis in the middle of all the hustle and bustle of BKK. It has expanded a lot and it feels like it has lost some of it's quaintness and has become very commercial. The house itself is situated off a canal where there is a Muslim community. And in the evening, you can hear the calls to prayer from a nearby Mosque. Pretty cool to hear when in the middle of a city that has 13 million people who are mostly Buddhist.

Nice and Relaxing. This is a nice little sight to see that gets you off the hot streets and enjoying a nice bit of Thai art and history. Great place to buy silk products, but they are a bit pricey. The house itself is lovely with a great collection inside.

Beautiful Treasure hidden in Bangkok! Must SEE!. I had never heard of Jim Thompson until I went to the Museum. Incredible story of this American Architect who helped to revive the silk industry in the 60's in Thailand. His disappearance has never been solved and continues to add to the mystery. The house he built in the heart of Bangkok, is a treasure. Antiques from many places in S. E. Asia that were acquired before antiquing was popular fill the house. Visiting this beautiful place gives you a look into the past, before all the big buildings were built up around here and the river was full of garbage! There is a gift store and a nice restaurant where you can have lunch or a snack while waiting for your tour to start. This place is very easy to reach by the Skytrain. It is a short walk. I highly recommend a visit!

House of Jim Thompson. Thjis is not worth a visit. They make you wait for a guided visit, pay the entrance fee, and then they only show u small pavillion. You can walk along the small garden.They have shop there which seems to be the only thing to visit.
A Surprise. We came here after reading about it in a guide book and were very interested, even though we'd never heard of Jim Thompson before this point. The tour was comprehensive and informative.

A garden with house - back to Europe. I sew a story about this house and garden in the TV and I love it. To see it on my own eyes was nice - it's a good mix of American and Thay architecture and garden culture. I was sed, that I do not make pictures in the house, than I do not have memories from the sculptures, paintings and other nice things what Thompson collected. It is good to see it. The entrance ticket was 150 bahts and it is a possibility pay by card, at the shop and at the restaurant and for the entrance ticket, also.
Very nice . The tour guide was really good and knew what she was talking about. Very good price and very picturesque location
Nice. :) I would say this is a really nice place to see and learn how to make traditional thai silk in traditional thai style house!

Sanctuary in a bustling city. The complex is a real sanctuary in a very busy city. It comprises of a retail outlet, restaurant and the house. We joined the English language tour and it was very informative. We thoroughly enjoyed the tour. The house is beautifully maintained and has a lot of artifact which makes it very interesting. Would recommend this place to any visitor of Bangkok

An American in Bangkok. The museum is located in the heart of Bangkok, a short walk from the National Stadium BTS station and the MBK shopping center. It was the former residence of American businessman Jim Thompson who setup a silk business in Thailand and has now been converted into a museum.The museum is a collection of several traditional Thai houses which the owner had bought and relocated to this compound. The wooden buildings are set amidst extensive gardens located next to a canal. The traditional entrance from the canal has now been blocked and the main entrance is from the road. Some of the buildings are set on stilts and the space below them has been re-purposed to display traditional Thai artifacts.The buildings have been well preserved in their original style and take us back in time showcasing the lifestyle of the owner and his vast collection of traditional Thai silk, art and statues. Unfortunately photography is not allowed in a lot of the buildings housing the most beautiful works.One of the buildings displays the traditional sericulture (silk making) and features a live demonstration of making silk thread using traditional equipment. A building near the entrance houses a restaurant next to a shallow pool.Frequent guided tours are available in Thai and many international languages.The museum provides a glimpse of a foreigner's lifestyle in old Thailand and is definitely worth a visit. Budget at least half a day to fully enjoy the museum and its gardens.

Tranquil gardens and fascinating house,. A lovely place to visit as a respite from the heat and chaos of Bangkok. The organised tours( obligatory) are very interesting and well organised, There are some amazing antiquities in the house which give you a picture of the life he must have led. He acquired many beautiful objects. The tropical gardens surround the house, lush and lovingly tended. Definitely well worth visiting. Any tuck-tuck driver will quickly find it.

Interesting History of the Silk trade, Great place to take visitors. Jim Thompson house is one of my favorite places to take visitors while visiting Thailand. The tours guide do a wonderful job guiding you through the house and grounds, explaining the history of the silk trade and Jim Thompson. All our visitors come away very happy that they visited. The teak house is beautiful the gardens are delightful. You can shop after the tour and even eat lunch. We usually spend 1-2 hours touring & eating before we move on to the next destination. A must see for visitors.
Fascinating way to spend a morning. This place is a n opportunity to see traditional Thai architecture and arts & crafts all on one site. Well worth visiting. the restaurant is good, too.
Very interesting visit. Beautiful house in a magnificent garde in the middle of Bangkok. We enjoyed the guided tour with a nice youg lady who spoke very well french.

Interesting house yet over rated.. We were suggested to visit this monument when we had a few hours to spare in Bangkok. The house itself is beautiful and very interesting. It has really beautiful artifacts and are truly rare. It is great to learn about the life of Mr. Thompson too. The problem is that the house is a little difficult to get to as it is a bit of away from the touristy bits, and one has to almost certainly get a cab which is almost certainly stuck in traffic.

A little european feeling. Very intersting pleace in Bangkok. If you are full with the thai tempels and monks you can visit this haus. The guides are well built like a robot, but kindly. You can't take photos unfortunately.

A stunning monument to the unique beauty of Thai art and architecture.. A great deal has been written about Jim Thompson by many different people. And yet not one person has ever put Thompson's achievements in the proper historical context. Jim Thompson belonged to an amazing group of American men who did incredibly important work in other countries in the late 1940's and 1950's. During this period General Douglas MacArthur led a social and political revolution that transformed Japan for the better. Western Europe was rebuilt under the Marshall Plan. The American military saved South Korea after it was attacked by North Korean forces. While all of these dramatic events were happening Jim Thompson was quietly resurrecting the silk industry in Thailand. This achievement was, in its own way, tremendously important. The silk industry has become extremely important for Thailand. Over the years it has created tens of thousands of jobs and brought millions of dollars into Thailand. In 1959 Thompson completed his world-famous Thai house. This residence is a magnificent example of traditional Thai architecture. In addition, it is filled with beautiful works of Thai art. These include statues, ceramics, traditional furniture, illustrations, tiles and so much more. It is a one of a kind attraction. You can't see anything like it anywhere else in the world. Jim Thompson had much in common with Douglas MacArthur, George Marshall and other Americans whose accomplishments had such an important impact on other countries in the 1950's. These were all tough, ambitious, talented, principled men who were imbued with the spirit of public service. Their achievements should never be forgotten. The Jim Thompson House is not only a glorious monument to Thai art and architecture, but also to certain important personal qualities that should be cultivated by everyone.
Nice. Top floor overlooking the pond is nice. Food very nice and staff are attentive and friendly. Regular visitor here.

High end Thai silk and other products. Jim Thompson flagship retail store carries a large selection of Thai silk items as well as imported items from India, such as Cashmere products. Designed clothing are also very nice.

Great afternoon. We really enjoyed our trip round this historic site. Our guide was enthusiastic, entertaining and educated well. Drinks in the cafe around the fish pond in the garden were great and service excellent

Interesting place to visit. Easy to get to you pay on entering and are shown through by a young guide who explains all you want to know and see, the shop sells items as all the other outlets do at the same price

Interesting and different . A well run and inexpensive venue. The whole Jim Thompson story is fascinating. His compound is a small architecture folk museum housing his collection of beautiful artefacts. Guides in English or French throughput the day. Our English guide was very clear.
The cafe is good and prices like our hotel.

Interesting!. I found the guided visit very interesting and the house is really beautifully decorated! Easy to get there by BTS. Jim Thompson Shop on this spot has a good choice, but not as much as the one in town.

average quality but over rated. I visited Jim Thompson but was not very much impressed with their quality and services. Silks are over priced. People are not very friendly. Its just like a brand which has got famous may be by mistake.

Interesting piece of history. Very educational, however you need to listen closely as the thai accent can be very difficult to understand at first.
Guided tour comes free upon admission.
Amazing. The history, his history, just fascinating. And the house is beautiful so that it is easy to imagine how he was so inspired.

Jim Thompson House- a hidden jewel. Travel along a narrow alleyway mid city and you'll find a hidden jewel that could be missed easily. We arrived early in the morning about 9am to be quickly ushered into a small English speaking group led by a very hospitable guide who spoke excellent English. Having no idea of who Jim Thompson was and his contribution to the development of the silk industry in Thailand, it was a truly inspiring story of one man's dedication to Thailand and his unique approach to preserving Thai architecture culture and Asian including Thai antiquities, combining both western and Asian design. A green oasis of Thai structures surrounded by extremely well maintained lush gardens, Jim Thompson House is well worth the visit. Please visitors respect this site; it must be maintained for its contribution to history. It would not be suitable for hordes of buses filled to the brim with tourists to visit as it is quite small and one of the positives about visiting was the intimacy and peace that could be felt by the small group interaction.

money making exercise. fairly dull. Only good thing about it is as a refuge from the city, but could spend the day in Lumpini park for free. No fabrics on display (what he's meant to be famous for), very little on silk production (just some posters aimed at very young children). A/c turned on in some of the wooden structures, with doors wide open all day, really bad for the planet.

Jim Thompsons House. House well worth a visit and the guide who took us around was very knowledgeable. Beautifully laid out house, a sea of calm in a frantic city.Not so sure about the products offered for sale in the shop. Lots of products had Jim Thompsons name but nothing to do with his history. The silk, which is relevant, while undoubtedly lovely seemed very expensive. Seem to be cashing in on his name.

Quite Interesting. You can get there by BTS, alight at National Stadium [Exit 3], you will first see ibis/ Mecure hotel, walk along the pavement towards Holiday Inn Express direction. You will pass by a souvenir shop, then you will notice an alley that turns to the right. Walk pass by a few steps and turn back, you will see the sign "Jim Thompson", Turn in to the lane and walk all the way to the end, you will find the entrance to Jim Thompson House.I reached there at 9am. The guided tour in English starts at 9:25am (duration: 35 min).We were told to place our belongings except phone, camera and selfie stick in the locker. We were also required to remove our shoes when entering the house.If you have a little time to spare, interested in architectural, antics and a bit of Thai culture, then quite worth a visit. It cost 150 Baht per entry.

Nice retreat from the busy city. This place has a nice and serene atmosphere despite being situated near one of the busiest street in Bangkok. It is a private museum dedicating to Jim Thompson and his passion about Silk and Thai culture. You have to buy a ticket and take an inside tour with the guide who are very knowledgable and fluent in English.The silk products they have are also worth looking.

A piece of History. Jim Thompson House is a peek at the Western influence into the recent history of Bangkok. Although his disappearance in Southern Thailand is still a mystery, Jim Thompson was a major influence in the nurturing of the silk trade in Thailand. A visit to his home is an interesting insight into his lifestyle and the silk trade in general. Lots of silk products available in the onsite shop. A great way to spend a few hours in a quiet part of Bangkok - away from bustling crowd.
Another money making attraction. Although if you are sick temples it's a pleasant surprise . Sadly I visited this historic attraction a few years ago and I felt it's now lost its way

Tranquil Place. We visited after a recommendation and had a lovly time. Such a peaceful tranquil place in a busy city. The guided tour was very good and the house has a good feel.Nice silk goods can be bought for a reasonable price.

Silk house in green yard. Jim Thomson house is located half a mile from the terminal station of te sky train. it's not evident right away which alley you have to take to reach there and not every local knows where it is. A tourist pointed us to the right direction. Alternativley wait for the small airport type transport cars that carry visitors between the sky train and the museum for free. Nice green gardens that make the wait time for the next tour more bearable. Girls weave the traditional way as a tourist attraction. Then you get a tour through the house and the rooms where Jim Thomson lived and traded. The shop offers a great variety of silk products. If you aim for renewing your collection of silk ties this is the place to do. You can find nice fashionable ties in affordable prices. For women you have to look a little harder to find something that would suit your taste. However definetly worth a visit.
Nice!. Great place to learn about traditional architecture imbued with western style! Nice and relaxing break from the heat and bustle in Bangkok.

It's nice. It's not one of those things that you need to see, but if you have time go and check out. It's nice to see how Jim lived and construct the house. The restaurant is very good but the service is bad, it's the only place at Asia that I dint like the service, they never smile etc, not the usual good service in Thailand .

Nice and quiet place in a busy town. We liked the Jim Thompson house because it is a nice arrangement of old houses and gives you a little impression about living in Bangkok times ago. In the entrance fee a guide tour is includes which is informative and lasts not too long. The garden is really bautifull and the restaurant with a big garden terrasse a nice place to take a drink and relax.

Thanks, this application that brought me here. I want to do a half day trip with my mother and I want to go somewhere that's not far from siam or victory monument so I opened this application and found some reviews about this place so I decided to go there. And I found that this place is really beautiful, attractive and really easy to go. There is a complex of various old Thai structures that you can fall in love with. It has tour guides that take you visit around the place and tell about the history of the museum. Let's come here if you don't have so much time, You'd love it!

So cool. A charming house in a garden in the very center of the city. here every thing is perfect. The guides are very nice, full of charm and humor and speaking a quite good french. The shops are really at a higher level than elsewhere.

Guided Tour. The guided tour comes free with admission and comes in what seemed to be a good selection of languages. Your shoes and valuables are locked away during the tour and watched and no photos are to be taken inside the house as you will be told on the tour. The resturant is fairly pricey and so are the silk goods within the gift shop near the entrance. Beautiful jungle feel to the outside of the home upon entering
Must see.... Jim Thompson... both a myth and an institution. A feeling of Bangkok in days gone by. Easy to visit and very interesting.

Nice place with nice restaurant. I loved the place, only problem was that museo guide has very problematic accent in her English.Restaurant was great, better than I supposed, can recommend, food was very good, price were ok.
Work a Look. Beautiful worth a look at to see culture can be a bit of a wait but it's got plenary of cafes and is near the BTS sky train. Go early if you can!

Delightful oasis of calm amid the Bangkok hubbub. We didn't pay attention to our city map properly. We saw "Jim Thompson" and thought great - it's walking distance from the hotel, but it turned out to be the store which is several floors large and the men couldn't extract the women from for ages. So it was a taxi ride to the house from there. You get a compulsory guided tour in the price and it's well worth it as entry is inexpensive anyway. Fascinating history about its construction and about old Jim himself including all the conspiracy theories surrounding his mysterious disappearance. You have to put your bags in a locker and take shoes off but no big deal. There's a much smaller version of the store and a nice café. You get to see someone weaving the silk too. It's all near MBK shopping complex too if you need genuine fakes but Jim Thompson stuff is the real thing and it shows.
Disappointing. There is a lot of hype about Jim Thompson. His house has quite a few tours going at once and a shop to purchase expensive items. I don't think it was worth the effort
Great tour!. I've been here many times taking friends and family while visiting Bangkok and everyone has always enjoyed it. The tour guides are very entertaining. Keep up the good work!
