Gardens and house very tranquil - doesn't feel as though your in Bangkok. The dancing and silk weaving was very fascinating performed by beautiful young ladies. Didn't look in the shop as read many TA reviews saying its a rip off. Only improvements would be that it could be smaller group sizes as we struggled to fit in some areas and I couldn't hear the guide well. Also to spend more time as you are rushed round a bit so that the next group can visit.

Good to know, informative, beware of Oscar. When you enter the garden area you pass by at a small elevated pond on your left. One fish lives in there, his name is Oscar. Just hold your finger into the pond and you will experience the same adventure as I did: Oscar bites your finger with his tiny razorsharp teeth and you bleed. To be aware to get too close to this mini piranha. Otherwise the place is very informative, well guided by good and charming English speaking guides and the artifacts are worth seeing. Great gardening great teak wood architecture.

Very interesting and worthwhile. Did not know a lot about Jim Thompson but friends that I was traveling with picked out this to visit. It was interesting and very pretty grounds. Nice gift shop and we ate at the restaurant on the premises. food very good...service not great but I think it is typical for service in Thailand.

very knowledgeable trip.. I love the tradition Thai house. It took me back in time. Jim Thompson did a marvelous design and truly understood the culture and how the Thai people's way of life , how we lived. It is so tranquil. The garden is so tropical with beautiful plants. The tour guide lady did a good job on showing the premise It is very beautiful and I would go back there again.

Good museum . It's a house of owner of famous brand.Situated beside river and environment is full of beautiful tree and flower .There is restaurant and shop to sell production of this brand .There is some shuttle to transfer people from main road to museum.In entrance two young girl perform thai traditional dancing and show how they make strip silk from caterpillar.
Nice stop.....make sure you have room on the credit card. Very interesting setting...gives perspective to an interesting individual's life....great store for,souvenirs

A delightful surprise!. Jim Thompson house was never on my to-do list, but on our final day in Bangkok our plans fell through and we were left with nothing to do. We jumped in a taxi and came here.Boy am I glad we did as it was a real highlight. The house is beautiful and the garden is gorgeous. You have to be shown around by a guide and our guide spoke fabulous English and was really entertaining. The story of Jim Thompson was really interesting and I have been reading about him since.Do it!

Not very flexible. I was looking forward to just wandering around the house and grounds, but you're not allowed. You have to join an organised tour, and the English ones are only every 20-30 minutes. We'd just missed one so had to wait about 25minutes until the next one. The tour takes about half an hour, and you're not allowed to take photos inside the house (even without flash). It's an interesting and very beautiful place, but it would be nice to have some freedom and flexibility.

Well worth the price and the time. Very well preserved "old" Bangkok residences, furniture, decorations, art, statues - almost anything one can imagine that an intelligent (and wealthy) collector would collect. Interesting demonstrations of Thai dancing and the silk processing in the courtyard. Large restaurant and shop. The only minor complaint is that one could not take photographs inside the residence - maybe understandable because it would theoretically slow down the tours (one has to become part of a relatively small group, divided by language of the tour guide).

interesting visit. Jim Thompson. ...american entrepreneur. Made his home in Bangkok after falling in love with the city The short tour is very pleasant and our lovely guide was very knowledgeable, with good English language skills.The small and well maintained traditional house is beautiful. It has lovely gardens. You easily forget that you are in the busy city.There is a shop on site. I was disappointed to see items with "made in Italy" when Jim Thompson was reviving the Thai silk trade.The restaurant and coffee shop is worth a visit...little expensive. On the whole.....worth a visit.

Interesting but not unmissable. You have to remove your shoes and place your purses or backpacks in a locker. The house is in fact several houses, guides were good and tried very hard. The gardens were pleasant and the small restaurant on site was good. The shop was a little limited.

interesting cultural visit. We loved our tour. English speaking guide told the story well, added anecdotes and humour . We ate at the restaurant, food was good, service OK. toilets were very clean . a bonus was the courtsey shuttle bak to the main road or rail link which we took advantage of. A bit disenchanted with the shop - far too commercial and not enough silk product for which he was a legend for! also saw a bottle of water with his name on it- this was too much!
great shopping. the traditional thai silk and a variety of cotton and linen is a great feature and one must go have a look . everyone will find something for them.
Perfect Thai Traditional House. Perfect Thai Traditional House you can find in the heart of Bangkok ( Siam Area ) guide in many languages available.
Excellent attraction, very interesting. We had lunch here before having the house tour. Both excellent and great value for money. Highly recommended, great tour guides very knowedgeable

Lovely house but it helps if you know the history.. Interesting setting on the Klong with gardens and much of Thompson's extensive art collection on view.
The guides' English is good but extremely difficult to understand so do a tiny bit of research before you go.
Lovely Thai dancing exhibition, charming Thai restaurant, and, of course, extensive gift shop with the famous Thai silks.

Over rated. We visited this attraction one very hot afternoon. It is very regimented and strict no shoes no cameras inside the house and you have to leave your belongings in a locker. It was very busy and the English speaking guide was not very eloquent no expression we would have been better with an audio guide. We didn't enjoy our visit and left as soon as the short tour was over. The gift shop prices were extremely high and considering you can possibly buy similar for a fraction of the cost at a street market I felt it was a bit of a rip off!

Very easy to get there on bts skytrain and walking for few minutes. An amazing place. IOne of the must see in Bangkok. It is an amazing place . It is a must-see in Bangkok. Very easy to find. There is a tour for English speaking tourists included in the price of the ticket. Our tour guide (i am sorry that i can not remember her name.) was very knowledgeable and polite. She told us interesting facts about the house and the person who built it. The house is small ,but otherwise interesting. Sent from my iPhone

Really educational and a great tour. It's a really good visit. As part of the entrance price which is not expensive, you get a free guided tour which was brilliant. You can take as much time as you like after the tour to see everything. It's really easy to find near MBK and the skytrain. It has a restaurant which was really good also.

The Thompson House - a rare look into the life of Jim Thompson the man who introduced Thai silk to the world.. Jim Thompson House tour is well worth the time spent. Transports us to the Thailand of the 1940's to 1960's. It is a taste of History created by an American ex-pat who disappeared in the 1960's when he went into the mountains of Malaysia. It is also the legacy he left behind.
Lost Foreign People. This man who introduce thai silk arround the world. This area his former house. A traditional decorated house also have shop selling high end goods
Nice History. The staffs was nice, explaining the history and details of the place in English even though it was quite hard to understand the slang of their English. The architecture is nice.

A Piece of History. This is a great bit of history. My daughter really enjoyed the tour. The house was beautiful. It was cool seeing how Thompson put multiple traditional houses together to make one large house.

Very well done . The tour is well worth it. The house is actually 6 Thai style houses put together in a more western configuration. The home is filled with beautiful art and other treasures . The guide was very well spoken and informative. The gift shop is pretty pricey for Thailand.

interesting. Interesting place, lovely pond/garden area, lots of thai antiquities, write down the address as it took us three taxis to find one that knew where it was. Nice restaurant if you have the time and big gift shop, but not cheap.

The man who made Thai Silk famous!. Jim Thompson, an ex CIA agent, fled from America to build a life in Thailand. He is highly revered in Thailand for solely reviving the dying Thai silk industry during the 50's & 60's. In 1967, he mysteriously disappeared without a trace in Cameron Highlands of Malaysia. His body was never found.During his time in Thailand, he built his house in the traditional Thai style. The wooden house is built on stilts with steep roofs. Thompson also collected parts of various derelict Thai homes and had them reassembled in their current location in 1959. Like many old Indian houses, the toilet was built detached from the main house as its considered unclean. Today, this house is a museum in the memory of Jim Thompson containing his Asian art collection and personal belongings.

Art treasure. I was amazed with Jim Thompson's collections of Thai antiques.....some are so old and rare. I couldnt comprehend how much all of its' worth. Was quite suprised to note that Jim actually build that house next to a Muslim Thai Village due to their expertise in producing Thai Silk. Was quite disappointed that I didnt have much time to explore the village and visit the mosque.

Interesting. This was a very unique way of learning a bit more about the Thai culture. Beautiful home built by an extremely unique character. The whole experience doesn't take long at all,l (maybe an hour), but the amount of information received makes it well worth the visit. As a side, I wouldn't buy anything at the gift shop...way overpriced. You can do better elsewhere, for sure.
lovely place to visit. Take the BTS until national stadium...and walk in... they have guided tours, every 10 minutes. entrance fee is 250 thb

Beautifully conserved colonial house. I would definitely recommend a visit in this (in fact) museum. It is very well maintained, with extraordinary gardens. The tour is with the guide (included in the prices, tours in different languages). Apart form the old Thai style house you will hear more about making silk and the silk business. There is a silk shop in the museum, but Jim Thompson shops are also at the airport or at Siam Paragon mall.

Interesting visit. It is interesting to see how Jim Thompson lived, a visionary architect for the time who helped revitalize the silk industry in Thailand. The house / museum keeps some furniture, antique statues and decorative items although some areas are no longer as they were, the kitchen, today transformed into a room.I think this visit is worth the architecture of the house and the route of Jim Thompson, who disappeared in 1967 in Cameron Highlands (Malaysia), without ever finding out what happened to him.Admission is 150THB / adult, visits are made in small groups in the chosen language, the length of the visit is 45 minutes and the last admission is at 6pm.There is a restaurant in the same area and a store where you can buy goods, scarves, tableware, etc.
Nice retreat in the middle of the city.. Excellent restaurant and very nice set up. Shows the sick making process. Nice and green around the complex.

an interesting visit - it worth a visit. reconstructed and putted together in a very traditional Thai style, off the beaten track, opened to the public before Thompson's "mysterious" disappearance while visiting friends in the Malaysian Cameron Highlands.
don't miss also Jim Thompson shop in the city - exquisite silk items, including bags (maybe one of the most beautiful I saw lately)

Interesting, but you have to be in the mood for it. It's a busy spot - nice gardens and great restaurant for lunch. Lots of people and the actual tour is a bit too long - I guess it depends how tired you are after a day of visiting Bangkok.
Something different to see in Bangkok.

If you have extra time in Bangkok add this one. We had an extra day in Bangkok after returning from Laos and Cambodia and asked the concierge at our hotel for suggestions. This was a good one. Jim Thompson was an ex-pat who had been in Thailand in the 1940's. He returned and got the locals to revive the cottage industry of silk production. He built his home from several traditional Thai houses that he had moved to Bangkok from the countryside. They have tours of the home, a restaurant and an extensive selection of high end silk items for purchase. Tours are about 1/2 hour in duration.

Could be missed . If you have a tight schedule , don't feel bad about missing this one . It was interesting but I'm glad I didn't skip anything else to come here . Jim Thompson story is life changing for some . I'm not one of them , that does not mean I didn't appreciate the information I acquired there . I'm glad I went.
A TRANQUIL SETTING. I loved it here - it was busy , but you didn't notice.Allow an hour and half and add time to sit and have a drink. Lovely tour with interesting facts .Definitely worth a visit

Another attraction for history/architecture buffs. This is an extremely well-run attraction just a short walk from the hustle and bustle of central Bangkok.The former mansion of the "silk king" Jim Thompson, it was converted into a heritage site by the Thai government in recognition of his contribution to the Thai silk industry and the organization is under the patronage of HRH Princess Maha Chakri Sirindhorn.It is an oasis of tranquility in urban Bangkok...the compulsory 30 min tour (available in multiple languages) gives an insight on the life and times of ex- US Army serviceman Jim Thompson who became a silk tycoon and in the process elevated Thai silk to international renown....his disappearance in 1967 during a visit to Cameron Highlands in Malaysia remains a mystery till today.The mansion consists of several traditional Thai houses (dismantled and transported from Ayuthaya) which have been tastefully connected and rebuilt.The complex also contains a central garden with pond, souvenir shops and is separated from the weavers' settlement at the rear by a canal, through which boats still travel.

Great Lunch in tropical setting. We had a great lunch at this Museum at Jim Thompson's house. The dining area is a covered but is in a tropical setting and along with a tour of the house is not to be missed
Sightseeing . Fantastic to walk around. .. an amazing guy it's a shame he went missing so early in his life. Fantastic house and gardens..

Beautiful find in the heart of congested Bangkok. Jim Thompson was a prolific collector of SE Asian art and styled his house in that design. Now a museum, it would be categorized as a home for the rich. Tucked away in the congestion of Bangkok is this house that is paradise.

Trading on a name?. not the cheapest place to buy silk.. Jim Thompson is credited with rescuing the silk industry in Thailand. He disappeared in Malaysia in 1987, but there are people who will I've his name as a brand, and turn his house into a museum. It does have a shop, but it's seriously expensive, and a number of garments are clearly stated to have been "imported from Italy" Whats that all about?

must visit. an oasis within tranquil gardens and beautiful surroundings, wonderful architecture and furnishings. and if you are able to purchase from the shop you will have an even more perfect half a day excursion.
Unexpectedly awesome!. We didn't expect much, as, after all, this is just a house, right? But we ended up being really stunned by the beautiful inside and the artifacts on display. Highly recommend!

Charming Bangkok hideaway. Jim Thompson House is like a little jewel hideaway in the hustle and bustle of Bangkok. The gardens and the home are beautiful and tranquil. The tours are also very informative. The cafe overlooks a koi pond and is very pretty and tranquil

Nice Pad. What a gorgeous old house, but don't expect to be left to wander the house alone, it's strictly guided tours only, by a friendly and informing tour guide.However I personally would have liked to hear more about the house itself and less about the Buddha and China wear contained within.
Oh and no photography allowed seems a little unfair..

Great history and exhibits. One of a kind museum - it's pretty rare to find something like this. There was also an exhibition (the making of the golden teardrops) in one of the houses which was really interesting with an excellent video about a selection of stories leading to the origins thong yod (the golden teardrop desserts).
Great!. We loved this place so much, its very interesting story we never know about before and the lots of nice things to see.

Excellent Bangkok gem. Perfect for a peaceful relaxing lunch in central Bangkok. Then enjoy a tour of the beautifully restored Thai house and silk shop. Great food and service. Very easy to walk to and JT's also provide a local Tuk Tuk service. Don't miss it.

It's a house Jim, but not as we know it.... Yes, it's a house... but dang, it's an impressive one.The American, Jim Thompson, is well revered in Thailand as the man that helped bring the silk trade (and its many thousands of jobs) back to Thailand. He was a man that clearly loved the culture, while trying to create a home that stayed traditional but also reflected his Western roots.It's a worthy half day trip in the heart of Bangkok, with a restaurant attached, that serves top-quality food.I dare you to leave without purchasing at least a cushion cover...

Very good place to visit. I went there on Sunday afternoon. It is required that you need a guide tour to take you around the houses. The guide was very friendly and was able to provide lots of information of almost everything from history of Mr. Jim Thompson to the details and origin of many ancient artifacts. The tour was about 30-40 minutes. Jim Thompson House is near BTS National stadium. The place also has a restaurant and souvenir shop.

Relaxing place. This place is cool, and the story about Mr. Thompson is somewhat mysterious. It’s worth visiting if you visit Siam.If I’m not mistaken, I was there whilst Viewfrom22’s having his/her wedding a few days ago. It’s really cool. There were some western guys were in Thai traditional outfits and the restaurant looks really nice. Congratulations!

Step into a hidden gem. It is like a sanctuary, hidden away in the heart of Bangkok city. As you arrive, the ambience lures you in, with pebble stone foot paths, lush green garden, beautiful water features, and friendly staff. The guide was very informative and knew the the house well. There is a story in every room in the house. There is a little art gallery, shop, restaurant and bar. Food was amaaaaziiiiinnngggg!

Worth a visit. Intriguing story about by all accounts an overbearing and hedonsitic American who came to a sticky end but who built a beautiful homestead combining 8 complete traditional That teak houses in to one and started a silk empire. The place is very pretty and lovely to visit and wander around in.

Wedding at Ayara Hall. We recently held our Thai-style traditional wedding at the Ayara Hall (above the restaurant), a perfect venue for a medium-sized wedding (150 people). The event coordinator Khun Suthida and her staff were very diligent in the preparation work to make our wedding a remarkable experience for all involved. After the Thai ceremony, the hall was converted into a dining room for a buffet lunch. During the conversion (approx 30 minutes), the guests had the option of touring the JTH museum.With regards to the food, JTH has a variety of catering options including Issarn and Pad Thai food stations, and all the food was very well prepared, great flavour and nice presentation in the buffet line. They also provided waiter service for VIP tables. We also had the bar prepare a special Bloody Mary drinks station (highly recommended!) and herbal teas. The event coordinator and her team receive high marks for their efforts. It was a day to remember and all our friends and family complimented the organisation of the wedding. Many Thanks!

Great history, cute tour. A unique look into the life of Jim Thompson. A bonus during the tour is the massive amount of pottery and artifacts that Jim collected during his life, which the tour guides explain in detail regarding their history and age. However, I would have appreciated a little more history on how exactly Jim Thompson came to be in Thailand and how he revived the silk industry, but I guess there is google for that! :)

Didn't actually get to see it! . As this was a stopover and second time in Bangkok I was looking for something close to the hotel. I read about Jim Thompson's House and decided to check it out after I had checked out of my hotel. Paid for an English speaking tour and as the tour commenced they asked me to put my small handbag into an unsecured locker for the duration of the tour. My handbag contained my passport in addition to wake and travel documents. I questioned the guide and she said I must hand over my handbag as I might steal something during the tour. Ridiculous and really disappointing! Didn't go ahead with the tour.

A worthy visit. If you are looking for the answer to the mystery of Jim Thompson, it is not revealed here. However, it is a wonderful showcase of Thai architecture filled with a gorgeous collection of beautiful traditional art and antiques that include sculptures and porcelain. There is also a restaurant and the Jim Thompson store.

An inner city gem preserving Thai heritage. It was delightful to see the labours of one man to preserve Thai heritage still bearing fruit long after his disappearance.There were some great pieces in the house which still felt to be a peaceful haven in a bustling city.The tour was well conducted and a complimentary shuttle provided at the end.Cost was 150 baht adults and 100 baht for students.The commercial arm, the Jim Thompson label had a range of items available for purchase in the adjoining shop.

Nice garden and tour. It was nice visiting this oas in Bangkok a bit different compared with other parts in Bangkok. We had a good guide spoke good english and the tour was okey in time. After you can have your own walk. Well with visiting.

Must see in Bangkok. This is the beautiful Thai style home of Jim Thompson, a former OSS operative who fell in love with Thailand at the conclusion of World War II and made his home in Thailand. Jim Thompsons interest in Thailand included his involvement in redeveloping the beautiful Thai silk industry and introducing the silk to the international market. Jim Thompson's home is built in traditional Thai style and filled with S.E. Asian antiques and art. When Jim Thompson mysteriously disappeared his home became a treasure and museum. Enjoy the book, it is a great read

A good way to get away from the bussle of BKK. Situated 5 minutes walk from National stadium station this is an oasis of calm and a very interesting place to while away a couple of hours. There is a tuk tuk shuttle from the sky train. Not that much to see but has a decent restaurant and an interesting collection of antiquities although the story of Thompson is more interesting

The Jim Thompson story is an intriguing mystery and this is well worth a visit!. This attraction is well worth a visit. The tour guides recount the story of Jim Thompson as they show you round the property and you're imagination quickly takes you back into the Bangkok of the past.

Favorite Stop in Bangkok. This was my favorite stop in Bangkok. A little slice of tropical heaven in the hustle and bustle of Bangkok. The house has beautiful artwork and the tour guides are very knowledgable. There's a great cafe right at the entrance to have a cool drink at before heading back out into the city.

An interesting tail and an interesting visit. I would recommend this as a wee visit to see the history of Bangkok. It is a guided tour and the girls are lovely and happy to answer any questions. The shop has some stunning Jum Thompson pieces too.

A must, if you love art and if you don't. The information found in the internet is really limited. The amazing collection of artifacts and fantastic design of the house and the garden will cause anyone to appreciate Thai and Asian culture beauty. Don't believe the "nice" Thai on the street, telling you it opens later and try dragging you elsewhere. It's open daily as if 09:00!!!

Quaint traditional Thai buildings and historic artefacts. My wife and I visited Jim Thompson's house in January 2016. The attraction consists of several historical Thai buildings that Jim Thompson had made into his home in the 1950's. Although he was a pioneer in restoring the international Thai silk trade, there was little emphasis by the guides on the silk making industry. However, it was a nice way to spend a couple of hours.

Fabulous teak villa easy to reach . Commercial Disneyland version of Suan Pakkad Palace teak villas.Both garden and house are though extremely beautiful and impressive, so its worth a visit anyhow.Compared to the traditional way of teak villa contructing, like the Suan Pakkad palace, which consists of 8 small teak villas, all standing on pilars, Jim Thompson wanted his villa to be big and combined. Also other western style designs are visible. E.g. sofas, tables and chairs.Few items are rare and old, e.g. old Buddha statue from Ayutthaya.Dont expect the guides telling any details about Thompsons CIA-background or political intrests.Outside it was very interesting to observe the traditional way of silk spinning. Also there was a short traditional dance show.In Suan Pakkad there are far less people and you really can relax in the garden. Jim Thompson was too crowded to my taste and offered no inviting place to sit and relax. Its actually a museum complex with a big restaurant and an exclusive silk shop, art gallery and much more.No photographing allowed inside the house!

Interesting museum with good guides. See some traditional Thai houses plus interesting art works at this museum. Guided tours start frequently and explain the history and interesting pieces of art and furniture. Something different from the temples and malls in Bangkok.

A must visit. Have been to Bangkok many times but Jim Thompsons House was always something to do next time as I have been to both his main shop and factory. We took the guided tour and for the information etc it was well worth doing. What a wonderful home he created, just so sad he disappeared never to be found, his beautiful pieces throughout his home must have given him such pleasure. For me they were wonderful just to look at and to imagine the home full of his friends. Try and put it on your list. It is so worth the effort and his shop there has some lovely things to purchase.

Don't get it.. Unimpressive house and furnishings, walk through a few rooms, get the ages of some Buddha statues. Little history. Fair gardens.Its easy to get to and doesn't take long is about the best I can say.

Worth the visit. I normally shy away from attractions that I think will be very touristy. On the advice of a friend I went to JT's house and to my surprise greatly enjoyed it. Everyone has to do the tour but it is 20mins, it doesn't drag on and is well presented. His house is a beautiful oasis in the midst of busy Bangkok

An oasis in Bangkok. Jim Thompson house is a delight for those who love old things, traditional architecture and plants. The 40-minute tour is a nice intro to the life of Thompson and a few key elements of Thai architecture. Keep in mind that you can't take pictures inside the house - there are lockers to deposit your camera. Afterwards, check out the cocktails at the restaurant. The food is pretty inauthentic but may be good for those who don't like fiery spice levels!

One of the real highlights in Bangkok.. Not what I expected! It's a great historical site and very interesting. You take a guided tour through the house. Guides are knowledgeable and give a brief overview. I've been twice and will return again.

Jim Thompson House. This is must visit! A beautiful traditional Thai house and compound. Guided tours in a number of languages. Fine restaurant and store on property. I've visited this house numerous times and was a dinner guest of Jim Thompson.

A must to do if in Bangkok. This is really a very interesting way to spend a couple of hours in Bangkok and an insight into old Thai architecture and art. A fascinating story of Jim Thompson who mysteriously disappeared in the jungle of Cambodia and his contribution to the Thai silk business and Thai culture. Included with the entrance fee is a guided tour and this was really professional, clear and relevant. The gardens are beautiful too and there is a demonstration of the harvesting and collecting of the silk thread and even some lovely Thai dancing. The museum shop has some very nice cards and of course there's the obligatory Jim Thompson shop with all sorts of silk goodies to buy.

Tour guide is very helpful. Place is really nice. The tourist guide makes the trip interesting as you get to absorb the history and appreciate the details and stuff of the house. If not for the informative tour, this place will just be another boring place to be at. Transpo-wise, just near the mtr and they have shuttle service at the station to bring you in the spot. You can just stroll at the malls after the visit which is only a walking distance.

Peacefull and beautiful haven in the middle of city. Jim Thompson house is definitely worth a visit - very near all the shopping centres in Siam and it offers a nice break from hectic shopping and city life. Beautiful old wooden houses and nice little garden. It only takes an hour to visit so exellent place to visit while doing shopping.

Neat place, but quite crowded. I really enjoyed the Jim Thompson House, but man, was it ever crowded! The tour is well organized and the home is in good condition. There is some interesting history preserved here in the objects and the stories. The gardens around the home are also quite nice.Skip the gift shop unless you want to pay a couple orders of magnitude higher than the worth of the souvenirs.

Peaceful and serene. My mother, sister and I visited the Jim Thompson house in July 2015. The tour guide was great and the gardens and house were beautiful. There are quite a few artifacts that are fun to look at but I don't think this site is a must-do to the first time visitor to Bangkok.

A Must Visit in Bangkok . Really enjoyed my visit to the Jim Thompson House. It's super easy to get to, take the BTS to National Stadium and its marked on the exit. Go down the steps, immediate left and then a right when you see another signpost. Total about 10mins walk. The tour is compulsory and included in the 150 entrance. I had to wait about 10mins for the next English speaking one. Guides are friendly and informative. You can not take photos inside the house just in the gardens. On site there is also shop and cafe. There is information about silk making and also got to see a woman demonstrating the traditional process. Upstairs there is an art exhibition that I think changes every few months. A nice extra included.

Interesting story. After we paid the tickets, we were informed that they have guided tours (included in the ticket price) in many languages, so we waited about 15 min to walk with the guide.The tour took about an hour, and we strongly recommend it.Do not leave until you play a bit with the fish inside the big pots - the big ones will try to bite your fingers :))

Great place . The house has a ton of art they Jim Thompson collect from around the world which is amazing they tour guide has a long of information about the house and speak good English and the restaurant is a must

Lovely home, confusing entry. This old Thai style home, formerly owned and occupied by Jim Thompson, American silk entrepeneur and alleged spy, is a must see for anyone interested on American influence and politics in Asia in mid-20th century and those interested in Thai art and architecture. The entrance to the house and the tour confused me and i have to admit i saw the house last year. Due to a misunderstanding I was not able to visit it again this year. I and my elderly mother paid our entry fee, about 150 baht each. She walks with a cane and the ticket seller said we had to wait for an hour for the next tour. I said my mother might be fatigued by then. She told us to look around the garden and if Mom was too tired for the tour we should come back for a refund. We shopped for a while and rested on a bench for an hour then went to line up for the tour. But we were told we had not signed up and had to wait another hour. I told the manager that the ticket seller did not tell us we had to sign up. Our tickets were stamped with the time of our entry and proved we had waited an hour. She marched us over to the ticket sellers and asked me to identify the one who had told me that. I could not pick the one of 3 who were selling, so quite rudely and ignoring my elderly mother with a cane, told us we could not tour until later. We got a refund and left. My mother would have had to miss part of the tour due to stairs but she was willing to walk as much as she could. Jim Thompson house is beautiful with its gardens, canal setting and artwork, but make sure you walk the 50 feet from the ticket sellers to the tour sign up and line up. There is a cafe and gift shop, both pricey but not mandatory.
A nice last thing to see in Bangkok. Short visit, take you 1 hours maximum.Very good restaurant with Thai classicsand a lovely silk shop.

Beautiful home showing traditional Thai house. We rode the sky train to this house. Beautiful grounds and home. One can see how traditional home were built and how people lived. Beautiful art and historic artifacts in home of both Burmese and Thailand. A real treasure for the people of Thailand.We had a very good English speaking guide that was knowledgeable and answered questions very well.

Interesting History. Was very excited to go here. They offer tours in many prominent languages and its for a reasonable price. You will go through the whole house which is decently large. There are some pretty cool things to see but I found the learning experience via the tour guide to be the most captivating thing about this place(learning how he thought and lived). I'd recommend it and the gift shop is rather over priced but the shirt I purchased is of fantastic quality and I love it!

Outstanding Experience and Service. A great story and well managed. Be aware when asked to remove and leave your shoes before entering the house. A tourist took my shoes and left his. The staff were excellent and escalated the matter to management - Natteera Yumongkol, who took on the issue personally. She organised replacements and whilst we waited, offered us complementary fruit smoothies, which were delicious and also some rice crackers. I head up a service business and would love more people working for me like Natteera and her staff at James Thompson House. Thank you / Ka poon kapStuart
Nice but not great. A pleasant and attractive place. Guided tour was interesting. A pleasant experience but definitely not a must see. Restaurant had a great ambiance and mediocre food.

Back in time. I'm glad Jim Thompson was creative enough to preserve this place for the future generation.Here, one can see a typical Thai house made of wood in a relaxing garden. Visitors will not see anymore of these type of houses because the city of Bangkok is now high rises.The only disappointment is the gift store where Thai silk is sold. There was not a lot of selection and the products looks outdated befitting of an older person.

Intriguing story but not what I expected. I was kind of expecting a tour explaining the silk industry of Thailand.Nope, it's a tour of someone's house and art collection. He just happened to be a big noise in the silk industry. Still a great place to visit. And a very intriguing back story about a guy from the Agency.Very nice on site restaurant and a shop that will be more than happy to separate you from lots of cash in exchange for some very fine products. Weirdly, not that many are silk!

Authentic and appreciated guided visit. The houses are well renovated and you can really imagine the life of Jim Thompson (and envy to have a similar place to live). Guided tours are mandatory and included in the entry ticket. Available in most popular languages (we saw english, german and french at least). there are a lot of tourists so the guided tours are tightly scheduled but this is still very nice. Shop is also providing high quality products.

Lovely place but busy. A victim of promotion. It is a lovely house with many fantastic objects and the teak building itself is fantastic. It is very busy as so popular so you have a time slot and go around as part of a small tour but it is well done. To assist, there is a cafe and shop.

A peacefull Haven. If you need to escape the noise and traffic in Bangkok this is the place to go.
The site is very attractive with a good guided tour providing an interesting account of JTs life.
Catering is available on the site but we decided to eat elseware on this occasion.

Great afternoon activity. Jim Thompson was an interesting fellow who did a lot to promote traditional Thai culture (especially silk production) both within and outside of Thailand. Visiting his estate was a great afternoon activity, the tour took about 90 minutes and the houses were beautiful and interesting.

Very Educational and Tasteful.. We visited this museum with our two small children (4 and 1 year old). Beautiful architectural building, authentic Thai living explained and knowledgeable tour guides take you around the grounds. You can also dine in an air conditioned restaurant (although pricey), buy Jim Thompson silk products in the gift shop and buy some post cards. We were lucky to get there on time for a traditional Thai dance performance and silk spinning.

Loved the place !!. Really like the place. Highly recommended for tourists who like history and culture. Loved the wooden houses and thai gardens. Also place is beautifully restored and gives an actual glimpse of old thai life now lost.One can easily come by metro or catch a cab. Go have fun !!
If in neighbourhood. If your hotel is in the neighbourhood then it is very nice to visit. A guide will give you a tour of about 30 min. You can only take pictures on the outside , not inside.

Long wait to get in.. We decided to visit Jim Thompson House our first day in Bangkok. We had no direct intent to stop by but saw it was close on the map. We decided not to do the tour as there was an hour wait after you purchase the ticket. The grounds were lovely and we had a drink at the restaurant (slow service and overpriced drinks).

Thailand history, architecture and great silk clothing all in one spot. If you are in bangkok for more than 2 - 3 days, this is a recommended stop to learn about Jim thompson and how he revitalized traditional silk textiles in Thailand. After you learn about the history, visit their huge 5 floor outlet on sukhumvit soi 93 (?). Huge selection of current and clearance items as well as two floors of nothing but fabric.

Very interesting tour. The actual tour of the Jim Thompson house is literally through his house. It was interesting to learn about the person and also how he wanted to revive the Thai silk industry. I picked up several presents for family and myself and they are great quality products.

All things Jim Thompson. Understandably they are careful about visitors going round this interesting house and you will be asked to lock up your bags, take off your shoes and refrain from taking photos inside the house. Our guide had good English and a sense of humour as she showed us objects collected by Jim T while he lived here. You are free to wander the gardens afterwards. (Hint: if you are asked to identify the chamber pots in the bedrooms it is either a cat or a frog, not what you expect! )

Interesting oasis but left us wanting more. A fascinating story of an ex-pat US man who settled in Thailand after WW2 and revitalised the Thai silk industry, using the money he made to pursue his interest in ancient Thai art and architecture. He built a complex of houses in Bangkok by relocating ancient traditional Thai houses and filled them with friends, fun and art. Many questions were left unanswered by our guide - accepting that Thompson's disappearance remains a mystery to this day. The house, gardens and art are stunning, a tranquil oasis in a bustling city.
Must see. Such a beautiful place and very interesting. The tour is great and you get to experience life in earlier times in Bangkok

Must Visit Place in Bangkok. Didn't expect much before I came here. Love the ambiance, the house itself is really beautiful and it has tour guides in some languages. They also provide free shuttle to BTS station.

Third visit!. Have visited this attraction three times now, the latest being with friends who had not been before. The house is set in beautiful grounds with a restaurant and shop, and the tour is run efficiently. We have however noticed that the tours have become very busy of late and you don't get to spend as much time viewing the house. There are so many groups going round too that it's difficult to spend any real time looking at anything and commentaries seem alittle rushed before you're moved onto the next room. It's very easy to lose your group as well as you get side-tracked by the amount of people.

Interesting place but very short tour. The tour only takes about 15-20 minutes around the house. Very quick yet interesting. It is disappointing that you cannot take photos within the house (you can take photo within the compound). The silk wares are a bit of a higher range. If you are to buy souvenir, recommend to buy at other places rather like MBK.

Tranquil and beautiful . After reading other reviews we decided to check out Jim Thompson House. It's a beautiful compound with gorgeous architecture and gardens. The tour lasts around 30mins, then you can look around the garden at your own leisure. There is also a gift shop and cafe. I'd recommend approx 1.5 - 2 hours here.We had dinner at the restaurant, it was delicious Thai food at a reasonable price

Worth a visit even though very busy. It was busier than I expected, so I would be inclined to leave a couple of hours for this attraction.Well worth a visit and make sure you do the tour of the main house.

Charming. You can look around the exterior of this house without having to pay anything. Charming house that takes you back 60 years. Well organised guided tours in several languages. Just the right amount of time. Reasonable price, and you can book on a tour for later in the day if it suits you to go away and come back later. Has Ponds with fish and tortoises
Old teak houses. Worth your visit: for the architecture of the old teak houses, the the antiques on display, the beautiful garden, the silk shop, the little restaurant, ...

The Must see in Bangkok. The house is beautiful, full of arts, the surrounding garden is worth seeing, the shop sell the finest silk garmets. We had a lovely lunch in restaurant at the property, which was great as well. Admission only 150baht. Not that crowdy as other touristy places.

Alright, but a bit blah...... The home is nice, but the tour was more of a.....here is a antique, here is another antique, oh and wait another antique. The tour somewhat discussed the architecture but not in great detail.
Beautiful house. I feel very relax n nice there. Worth visiting. The tour is only 150baht. I had coffee at the restaurant and it was beautiful

Interesting tour featuring traditional Thai teak houses. Jim Thompson's house was located right near where we were staying at Siam@siam Design Hotel, so we thought we'd have a quick look around. We were very surprised at the site and it ended up being a very enjoyable visit. After paying a small entrance fee we were given a ticket and old to wait a few minutes for the next tour to start and then joined in other the group, apparently the tours start every 10-15 minutes or so. A very knowledgeable guide took us around and gave us lots of information on the house and Jim Thomlson himself, quite a fascinating story. After the tour we were free to look over the house And grounds at our leisure, there was also a nice restaurants and gift shop. Although the silk items were a little more pricy than our budget allowed, they were very beautiful and high quality. I missed seeing this place a few years ago when in Bangkok and am very glad that I got to see it this time.

Worth visiting. We got to the house just a little too late to join an English language tour and were put into a Japanese one. Not very helpful! I was persistent and was able to get a Japanese guest to translate for me some of the highlights of the tour.This is the house of the US expatriate who reinvigorated the Thai Silk Industry. His collection of Far Eastern antiquities is displayed in his amazing multi-level house built Thai traditional style but with some modifications. The pieces that stood out for me were the inlay tables in black ?ebony'? wood and abalone. There was also a rat maze in his bedroom where they raced different artificially colored rats. Apparently an import from China!

Very interesting and true Thai Architecture. If you want to see true Thai Architecture than the Jim Thompson house is a good place to see. Jim Thompson was a WWII American Vet who fell in love with Thailand and after the war decided to stay and live in Thailand. He purchased six original Thai houses and had them dismantled and reassembled on the canal. The tour takes about 30 minutes and is very informative.

How else could you see a traditional Thai house in central Bankok?. Wonderfully preserved by a private foundation, this place is well worth a visit. Jim Thompson's hose is a great place to spend an hour or two. We were given a very informative tour and really enjoyed viewing a traditional thai house in its full splendour. For pottery addicts like myself, the Asian work on view here can't be missed. A very affordable morning or afternoon that you won't regret.

Sheer perfection. Rarely have I envied anyone as much as Jim Thompson. This guy is a true life James Bond who found nirvana and lived life in exotic luxury.His home - now museum - is stunning; constructed from shiny teak and positioned in lush gardens close to a klong.Well educated, excitingly employed, brilliantly connected Thompson's life with his silk design business seemed absolutely perfect - until he mysteriously disappeared. But boy it must have been heavenly while it lasted.

More Interesting than it Sounds. I am a foreigner living in Bangkok, and it took me a year to get to the Jim Thompson House: it was worth the wait! The way this place is described in guidebooks sounded boring to me, hence why it took so long before I visited. However, I highly recommend it now, as all personalities can find something to enjoy. The courtyard is lovely, there is a restaurant, the tour of the house is historically interesting and the perfect amount of time, there is a shop selling silk clothing, a contemporary art space that regularly rotates exhibits (this part is free!), and demonstrations in Thai dancing and silk making. Also, the house, furniture, decorations, etc. are BEAUTIFUL and serene. Consider stopping here to get away from the hustle and bustle of the Siam area. I imagine most people would spend about 2 hours at the site. So, think of it as a short stop that is very reasonably priced.

Oasis in the City. Stopped by here to see the house which has been turned into a museum. He was an architect before becoming the #1 proponent and resucitator of the Thai silk industry and as such bought and re-assembled several houses from the country into one big one for himself.The house can only be seen on a guided tout and out luck was that it was one of the last of the day, so it was getting dark when we took it. Also it is quite rushed so one cannot really take the time to enjoy the house and amazing artifacts on display that he had collected. Still it is definitely worth seeing. Not only the house, but enjoy the very good and reasonably priced restaurant there as well as the gift shop. Very tasteful and lovely items of all types can be bought.

a hidden diamond. we had some time left in Bangkok; what can we do more? we grabbed a watertaxi and jumped of at the house of Jim Thompson; a local famous silkdealer. it was crowded..but with a great system we know that within 1 hour it was our turn to visit this beautiful local house. We could lunch without worry. and two lovely dancers showed us some thai dances. a nice guide told us all about Thompson and showed us the rooms. Nice!

Fascinating and well organised. We only had a few hours in Bangkok and this centrally located attraction was ideal. The house is beautifully maintained and full of history. The tours were very well organised and our tour guide was charming and informative. Definitely recommended.

An interesting sight but clearly commercial.. Who can resist the mystery of Jim Thompson and his world famous silk goods? The house is beautiful, the tour is a bit OTT but it's a lovely sight and worth a look.

Beautiful Oasis. Excellent tour, beautiful grounds very well organised
Lovely restaurant and facilities
The teak buildings are beautiful
Worth a visit. Definately worth a visit. very tranquil. guided tours in different languages. not something you would expect in the middle of Bangkok

Still a good place to visit. A little history about Jim Thompson and the brand name that defines the silk related merchandise they produce. This was my second trip to the place and still find it quite interesting. There are items in the museum which include and combine the collective no and culture of the east and west, a story of the blending of western culture with eastern culture. A different side of Bangkok which will definitely enrich your tour.

A Thailand Treasure!. Definitely recommend visiting the Jim Thompson House while in Bangkok! History wonderfully persevered and presented. . . It was a travel back in time! Particularly interesting if you like silk -- and yes, you can buy silk products on site.

Worth a visit. Good guided tour and an explanation of the Thai architecture and culture although the house was built by an American. This place is a little touristy and the restaurant isn't as fantastic as the traditional food found along the streets. It is recommended for travellers who want to know a little more about traditional Thai houses.
Worth a visit. Maybe not as mind blowing experiance as some of the reviews suggest. And I found the art collection to be somewhat limited. Still very nice and peaceful house and worth a short visit

Humorous guided tour. I enjoyed the guided tour of Jim Thompson's house, mainly because our guide had a great way of making little tidbits about the house interesting (some interesting comparisons of the house to the traditional Thai way of living). Good way to spend an afternoon. Easily accessible from the main Siam / Chitlom shopping areas.

A recommended place to visit!. This is a must go-to place if you like Thai architecture fused with western influence. The tour guides (English, French, Mandarin, Japanese and Thai), which are a must in order to enter the building comes together with the 150baht price. The guides are truly exceptional (at least mine was. Her name was Pang) and even crack jokes to make the group lighten up. Be sure to ask a lot of questions and they are ready to answer.The houses are truly beautiful and some artifacts and statues come from as far back as 200 years ago! Truly wonderful place and it makes you wonder what happened to Jim Thompson while on his trip to Cameron Highlands. Outside, you can see craftsmen making silk out of silkworm coccoons!

Highlight of Bangkok for anyone interested in elegant design, traditional Thai home and amazing ponds and gardens. I did not know much about Jim Thompson before I visited Bangkok but knew I wanted to see his house, art and antiques. The ponds and gardens are amazing and the tour guide was truly knowledgeable. I felt like we stepped back in time in the middle of bustling Bangkok. Take the sky train to the stadium. A quick, sign posted walk up a small street. Beautiful and the gift shop is full of textiles for sale!

Peaceful, Interesting, and Informative. I knew the Jim Thompson legend from when I was in the Cameron Highlands in Malaysia. This was our last "tourist" spot of our Bangkok visit. It is worth the visit and it is an unbelievable peaceful place in the middle of the concrete jungle. Very interesting to how Bangkok living was in 1940 - 50"s. Interesting interiors. Good tour guides and a relaxing cool atmosphere. Learned about Jim's life and his introduction of silk making. Nice silk shop to go shopping at (high quality and reasonable prices). Make sure to eat at the restaurant ....... not the cheapest but excellent - great AC. Could have shown, and explained more, about silk making.
3rd visit. Amazing historical house in the middle of Bangkok - very nice small restaurant attached. Highly recommend you visit this house whilst in Bangkok!

You won't be disappointed!. We love learning the history of places we visit and doing a tour of the Jim Thompson House did not disappoint us! Would have to rate this one of the best informative tours we have done on our travels around Asia.Never really knew who Jim Thompson was until visiting this place. His story comes across as though he was a visionary before his time. The location, design and layout of the buildings/property isn't really understood until you hear the story for yourself. The architecture of the main house, the servants quarters, the statues and art collections, the silk weaving and just the mystery of his disappearance make this a most intriguing place to visit.Highly recommend this tour to all.There is a free shuttle you can catch form the main street to save you a few hundred metres of walking down the narrow laneway to get there.

Must see. A must see, especially for the quality of traditional houses, furbishing and arquitecture. Also very nice garden, and the closeby channel gives you an idea of how life was upon a time. I also had a very nce rest at the local restaurant and bar. Silk shop not of my interest.
Nice but not impressive. We quite like this house, it is situated in nicely kept garden. The english guide speak quite bad english so did't really understand her most of the time. ew

Interesting but overrated. Went there upon several web recommendations. This is the house of an America. Business man who lived in Thailand and helped advance their silk industry. Entrance fee is 150 baht. The price includes a guided tour which is nice, but in the end what you end up doing is visiting his house room by room. It is interesting to see the house contents and the mans story, but the experience is less than satisfying mainly because it is not very relevant to Thailand's history and most importantly it does not speak a word about the making of silk! Apart from some women demonstrating silently the extraction of silk at the entrance and the very expensive silk shop at the exit, this experience will not satisfy your curiosity of information about Thai silk production is what you are after.

Favourite Bangkok visit. Magnificent example of Thai traditional housing in the midst of a crazy busy city. It is peaceful, the staff are extremely knowledgable. Demonstrations include extracting silk threads from silk worm cocoons, Thai dancing and discussion of the Thai traditional living and artefacts collected by Jim Thomson. It's ironic that one of the best preserved architectural and historical sites was established by a foreigner and it took an outsider to revive the Thai silk trade. Well worth a visit.
Nice Slice of History. We had an excellent guide thru the home of the late Jim Thompson. The history we learned that day was great and the kids and ourselves left impressed.

Well worth a visit. I enjoyed visiting Jim Thompson's house. I especially liked the restaurant there -- not the cheapest in Bangkok, but very good value. Much of the products in the shop are quite pricey but the quality is excellent.

Historical Location. A fantastic example of a foreigner adopting the Thai housing traditions and saving not only lovely old houses but priceless antiques as well. An easy to find site and very much worth a visit

The best of Bangkok. Jim Thompson combined the East with the West and in doing so he created a home full of collectables, curiosities and a sense of contemporary aesthetics which would be otherwise amiss in the sightseeing. This is a must in the Bangkok tour.
Beautiful thay house, interesting history. We loved the house tour! Interesting to know this extraordinary story of an extraordinary man! It realy worth to viisit

Well worth the visit.. Always a favourite, a beautifully presented and decorated western style Thai house. Jim Thompson constructed a superb home filled with his collections of Thai antiques. The guides are always excellent but it's always fun to read in advance a little about his mysterious disappearance, a conspiracy theorist dream!

Must visit for architecture and interior design lovers. Traditional Thai teak home on stilts next to a small canal. Very romantic setting. Thomson silk can be purchased in the building. Beautiful historic interiors.

An interesting tour. The Jim Thompson estate was much larger than I anticipated and far more commercial. The estate includes a huge gift shop, restaurant, gallery, bar, event space, and of course the home. The wait was around an hour, and it seems like that is done to encourage some ancillary spending, but the other amenities allow you to kill time without being bored. The tour itself was quite interesting, but perhaps a bit rushed to allow for more people to be shuffled through the property. Expect to take your shoes off before you enter, so best not to wear your most expensive shoes and bring socks if you don't like walking barefoot.

Jim Thompson's passion. A visit to the Jim Thompson House was so insightful. Guided tours take you through the 6 houses in a single compound, all assembled from teak wood mansions some afar as Ayutthaya. Jim Thompson had an extensive collection of various artefacts including rare ones of the Buddha that are displayed throughout the complex. Graceful Thai dancers and a man weaving silk from cocoons near the entrance pleasantly divert your mind from the delay in the next guided tour. JTH is a really short walk away from the National Stadium BTS where if it is too sunny, a free shuttle tuk-tuk takes you from the Rama I road to the JTH and back again.You can also come to JTH by the canal boat and hop off at Saphan Hua Chang. The MBK mall is a few minutes walk from JTH.

Surprisingly good. I feel there's such a hype around Jim Thompson's House and after reading who Jim Thompson was I expected it not to live up to it. Surprisingly, we had a really good time there. Yes, the shops and restaurant/bar are expensive in comparison to other places in Bangkok. However, it is really nice to relax in the beautiful green gardens and get some tranquillity right in hectic Bangkok. The house and the items in it are actually quite amazing and our English tour guide was very good.

Wonderful house. We really enjoyed the house. It was beautiful. Lots of history and information from tour guides who were able to speak multiple different languages. Jim Thompson made a difference to Thailand. That's what we enjoyed learning about.
Really Good . Really enjoyed this place. Although it didn't really say much about his printing of the Thai Silk, it did give good show around of the house and the restaurant was amazing too
Great historic Thai Architecture. The tour through the garden and the house was excellent! Its definitely worth waiting 60 to 90 minutes.
Guided visit. He came and fell in love with Thailand, he made business and then dissapeared. Very interesting visit, only in English or French.

Just a commercial outlet now - what was a cultural insight 25 years ago is ruined.. I had fantastic memories of visiting here over 25 years ago and thought it would be a good way of spending a spare half day before catching a plane. Wrong! Too many people to appreciate what had been an oasis and tribute to Thai culture. Best part was then catching the canal ferry to old Bangkok centre afterwards. Now that is the real Bangkok, not this retail outlet for the Jim Thompson brand. Go to the airport if you want that, dont waste your money paying to enter the house.

Calm and fun place to visit, and escape from frantic Bangkok. The house and gardens have a lot of style and history, and the guided tour is great (and at no extra cost). They event have a free tuktuk running to National Stadium rapid transit station.
Great history lesson. One of the best things to do I have done in Bangkok. Really enjoyed learning about Thai silk trade. Well run hourly tours in multiple languages. Easy to get from BTS.

Must see place , must try delicious food at restaurant. After tiring tour to palace in hot sun visiting this place was like a oasis for us. This is home of architect who turned silk merchant. This is near to National Stadium skytrain stop and there is free shuttle to station.It was informative to kids to see how silk is obtained from cocoons.Nice silk shop to buy some good stuff.Restaurant is must try and as it offers delicious food. We got nice veg treat.Coconut ice-cream is must try. Really tasty food with great ambiance.Very relaxing experience in hot Bangkok . Worth going !!!!
interesting but it's essentially a shop. the house is very interesting but you can't take any photos (even non flash) and it's basically just a promotion tool for the shop, which is a bit of a shame

Get Lost In Thailand's Most Eclectlic Expat Palace. I've been here twice in a my life and have enjoyed both visits. What I love about this museum is that it shows how timeless Thailand is, and how so much has changed in the city. Now the neighborhood is surrounded by super malls and skyscrapers, but the story remains true to the adventure spirit of the man who would go on to create Thailand's global silk industry. My favorite part of the museum is seeing how Thompson lived, and the mix of Asian, colonial and American influences. I love the open floor plan and the many little houses that make up the complex. I could imagine living here thirty years ago.

Quality Products Very Good Value of Money. If you prefer to buy quality products for special persons back home, you have to definitely visit this place. Museum, Souvenir Store and Resto in one.I bought gifts for loved ones from here. Please also consider that the price range of the products sold here are a bit pricey but if it just for chosen few, you cannot go wrong with their products. Other purchases in Chatuchak for much less prices.

If you are interested in Thai culture it's worth the visit! . This place is great if you take a tour. The guides have very good English and tell you a lot about Thai culture and history as you walk through this beautiful house (a fine example of Thai architecture). The location is convenient too- near the BAC and MBK-it's not out of the way at all. The gift shop also has beautiful products made from Thai silk. Good for buying high quality gifts.

Zen Sanctuary. You Must Go!. The Jim Thompson House has a strong recommendation from me. The history behind the house, its lovely gardens, the mystery behind Mr. Thompson, his commitment to reviving the Thai silk industry, the lovely restaurant and tour of the home make this a great visit! The simplicity of this amazing home stands in contrast to the glitter of the Grand Palace. Some fellow hotel guests recommended that we see this place and so we decided on the spot to go. Wow! Totally worth it.

Highly Recommend!. My husband and I loved this part of our trip! The grounds of Thompson's house is just beautiful! The tour was very informative as well. The shop sold so many incredibly gorgeous pieces of silk, you can't help but to buy something!
In Town. Very accessible with public transport . Great roof top and indoor reasonably priced restaurant. You learn about silk, and have opportunity to purchase great silk scarves.
Interesting and beautiful. Guided tour only scratches the surface but an interesting experience none the less. Recommended and easy to get to via Sky train - exit national stadium
A must. Please don't hesitate and try to spend some hours visiting this little jewel from the past. You will travel !!!
Need to take taxi or one block skytrain. 4 floors of very fine silk items premade and bolts of fabric. Very reasonable as compared to North America.

Very good tour guides. I found the tour very extensive and interesting. The tour guides spoke passionately about Jim Thompson's life and his works, also about the ancient Thai traditions. It made me feel that I know Jim Thompson for a very long time even if I don't have any knowledge of him before hand. The tours are available in English, Korean and Chinese language.
An oasis in the madness. after three visits we go just to sit in the peaceful garden.toilets are fabulous a world of teak worth a visit even if not necessary.
Beautiful house . Nice house near a khlong. Worth a visit when you are in Bangkok. Pay attention to the details, the art and the story of the disappeared owner.

A nice break from busy Bangkok in the heart of the city. +: Lush, green vegetationGuide in different languages included in entrance price-:Not allowed to take photos insideA pity they don't include a small exhibition about silk making.Shop is expensive and labels don't even indicate the percentage of silk and other materials

Great art and story. Was really excited about coming since I wanted some fantastic silk. The tour is great and the art he collected was amazing. It's a great few hours to go and learn about Jim Thompson, see his beautiful teak house, the great collection of art and learn more about silk. Oh and don't forget to shop, its all so beautiful just be prepared to spend a lot!

Interesting traditional Thai house + high end shop.. The houses are very interesting and nicely presented. This Is one of the top attractions and so is very busy. You have to join a official tour of the house which takes about 35 minutes. The shop and restaurant are aimed at the top end tourist market, very nice products but top prices.

Don't miss this. I nearly missed this attraction. I didn't realise how nice it really was. It was nice relief after the craziness of the city. There was very interesting information about the silk worms. They also had a lovely shop and café. I didn't actually buy anything in the shop because it was a bit pricey. The gardens themselves were lovely. The tour was a lot more interesting than I thought it would be. I really would have liked to spend more time there but I didn't have the time. There was even some dancing. I knew nothing about Jim Thompson before I arrived in Bangkok.
If you've run out of things to do maybe worth s visit. It's a teak house with a few very old statues. A very good restaurant though which I would go there for. Try the Green Thai soup. Amazing!

Intriguing story. The architecture and artefacts are intriguing and the Jim Thompson story is a bit of a mystery. I can see the link to the fashion shop and the silk trade etc although this held very little interest. Worth doing once as its not expensive....interesting insight into a bit of local history.
Interesting place. It offers brilliant information about the late Jim Thompson ..multi lingual staff for different countries .Souvenir shop bit expensive but quality is great.

An interesting part of history . It is really interesting learning about the history of Jim Thompson. I hadn't heard of him until I came to Bangkok. The house he built is in an old Thai style and plays an interesting part of the cities history. The tour takes approx 45 minutes.

Wouldn't be in my top ten for Bangkok. The visit to JT house proved on the whole to be disappointing. Whilst the house itself is beautiful to look at and some of the furnishings lovely, the whole visit was underwhelming. The compulsory tour was quite boring, our guide was difficult to understand and spoke little of how JT reformed the silk trade and spent more of the tour taking about his possessions. An experience that is ok to miss!

Pack 'em in for not much story... . Highly touted as a must see but this 'museum' and tour failed to impress. The garden's nice enough, the shop sells expensive silk goodies and the 'compulsory' tour takes 35 minutes. Basically a walk around the house - no photos or shoes allowed- only to be told how much he loved shopping and lived there for 8 years only... Ok but not hugely impressive.

I hope foreigners see this. The House itself is undoubtedly beautiful and worth a visit. It's situated in Kasemsan 2 alley.........be super careful on the way back. There'll be a seem-to-be friendly guy trying to persuade you to go to a shop that sells jewellry or whatsover that are on sales (hah....365-day sales).He/She will stand in front of a FEMALE dormitory, and will fabricate a story that he/she lives there. Liars. It's an old, small dorm that the owner reserves only for students who study in the most pretigious high school in the city.I've seen so many foreigners with good hearts getting ripped off...and I couldn't say a thing or help because there're so many of them around and I don't want to get hurt/blackmailed. If you stop and talk to him/her (most of the time it's a he) more than a minute, congrats....afterwards you'll get stalked for more than 500 m by their gang.The Government has warned tourists thousand times not to believe these people, yet I've seen so many victims... Please don't let them take advantage of your naivity or friendliness. I'm sorry for not being brave enough to warn you right there.If you want to get a genuine Thai silk/jewellry, never to such shops.
interesting story. a really interesting places where Thai silk was marketed to the world, you wait your turn to be escorted around the house with a guide who speaks your language.

Beautiful home and gardens to explore. Jim Thompsons house provides an insight to a his life and story of which I knew very little prior to visiting. The site is well operated with regular tours (the only way to visit the home) in a variety of languages and is beautifully presented. The gardens are beautiful and the restaurant food was delicious and in a great setting.

A True Pioneer. A must see for its architecture, building materials and its keeping to showcasing traditional building styles. It is also a must for its valuable historical artefacts. If you have never heard of Jim Thompson as was the case with me, you are suddenly introduced to a great man and want to know more about him and his life. Also his death and the prediction of his date of dying. My advice is to read a little bit about him prior to visiting. There is a gift shop there that will sell books on his life and worth purchasing at least one whilst admiring the shops display of silk.

Back to the past. The house gives a good idea about how it was in the early century. The place is beautiful, we had a fluent french speaking guide, she was perfect and very interesting ( you cannot visit alone).So why did I give only a poor rating ? There is a boutique and I bought 2 things : a silk tie and a scarf : I noticed at home that the scarf I offered was made in India !!?? it is better than China ok but it is not what you expect to get here (and for that price) and do not enhance the history of the house for its famous Thai silk quality and craft. A joke ! A big deception in fact....for Jim as well I guess !

Amazing. The amazing house of Jim Thompson, a spy who started to belive in this beautiful land and who started and international market of silk and favrics produced in thay.The house is a magneficent example of thai architecture. A great place to see also the wonderful statues that mr thompson collected!

National treasure. A must visit house. Tour guide is provided, relatively brief but very good. Amazing collections of Thai, Khmer and Chinese art. The house is beautiful and a wonderful design. The souvenir shop is very very good. The wine bar is also nice.

Wonderful location. Jim Thompson House is a very quick walk from the chaotic MBK / Siam Square area but feels surprisingly isolated from it all. The tour is interesting enough, but we mainly come here to have a nice (if somewhat overpriced) Thai meal in a quiet and relaxing location right in the heart of tourist central. Although pricey, the food is very tasty and always exquisitely presented. Everything is good. Get off at National Stadium or Siam station. They also offer convenient shuttles to and from the main road.

Nice restaurant . Not a great museum as such if you are unfamiliar with the history of Jim Thompson or less inclined to explore this sort of thing, as can be the case with teens, however I enjoyed the food very much.

A quiet and tranquil spot. Jim Thompson's house is a really interesting place to visit. If you're a little over all the temple-seeing this is a nice change too! They provide tours in a variety of languages which take around 10minutes. There is a small fee to enter the surroundings but it is well worth it. The tour takes you inside his home and is truly beautiful. No photos are allowed (obviously) but you can take pictures of the luscious gardens that surround the house and some of his collective pieces downstairs. Their is a cafe/restaurant (overly priced average food to be honest) and a shop which sells a lot of hand make silk clothing etc...again, very expensive but the items for sale are stunning!! Catch the BTS (sky train), follow all the signs and there is an electric golf cart waiting for you at the start of the street to take you to the entrance...you can easily walk but in the heat you will jump right in that thing!

gem in the middle of the city. This is a must see house. Beautiful house and grounds, and historically genuine. Excellent tour. Easy short walk from sky train, though a free shuttle is actually available. We took it back to the skytrain afterwards.
Fab Silk House. We visited the Jim Thomson House and got to see how silk is made and woven. He lived in a fabulous house We loved all the rooms especially the living room looking out into the forest.

Interesting architecture. We visited the Jim Thompson house to see the architecture and antiques he collected and donated to the city. The house is very pretty and interestingly build. The story of how this American man ended up on Thailand and made a contribution to the city is interesting. The tour takes about 1/2 hour or so but it's a nice little tour if you have time.

Educational. great trip as they all are in Bangkok very interesting this guy was a great influence on the the silk trade but don't buy any silk here as very expensive, also be very aware of what you are buying elsewhere if you don't know about thai silk you will get conned !!!! All these markets and Souvenir shops selling silk garments are 90% linen mainly men's shirts ties and women's tops ,
Excellent guided tour. We had a french guided tour, starting shortly after we arrived. The guide was really good, knowledgeable and funny. The place is beautiful.

Well worth a visit. This house is a bit out of the way ( even our taxi driver got lost) but well worth a visit. Jim Thompson was an American architect who collected houses and their contents from all over Thailand and put then together is this collection of houses along with his silk products. The tours are in very small numbers so you really get a feel for the place. Some of the artifacts are superb. Also there's a very nice if slightly pricey restaurant on site

Our favorite site in Bangkok. A beautiful compound of a collection of restored vintage homes outfitted for a man of fine tastes and ltraditional sensibilities. The gardens, the structures, the tours, the restaurant --- all call for a visit when we're in town.

Quiet place in bustling city . Went there with low expectations but was pleasantly surprised. A little oasis of quiet in bustling BKK. Nice little garden and the houses were well maintained . The whole set-up is interesting though it is a pity the tour did not pay enough attention to the many different silk paintings The guide was charming and well informed

Great piece of Thai culture. At this house you can see much Thai art, dancing silk weaving and some history. Great stop in a day it should take about two hours but could be done faster. Guided tour is included in admission

Historical Jim Thompson House. This is not an easy site to locate as it is located on a small street/alley nestled between a hotel and busy shopping malls. Believed that we had crossed the overpass to the other side twice over before we ended up on the right side of the street. The tour in the compound of this complex is so busy that you are given an assigned # and when it is your time, a guide will lead you through this complex. It is not a big scale area but the Thai buildings were very interesting especially Jim Thompson personal space. You are allowed to roam on your own upon completion of tour. The gift shop has an excellent display of silk products all very high end. There is also a lovely restaurant area where you can purchase meals and refreshments. Overall, it was a worthwhile tourist attraction .
an interesting place. i wouldn't go to great efforts to especially visit this place but it is a lovely, quiet, cool oasis if you are looking for something to fill an hour or so.

Beautiful place. Jim Thompson house is a beautiful and peaceful place at the middle of Bangkok. The house is amazing the garden is beautiful and peaceful. Is a good value for money. You can't see the house by your own, you have to join a tour. We don't like tours but it was ok.
Enjoyable. Organized, peaceful and interesting look at a mystery man and his silk legacy. Classy silk products in the gift shop and a serene cafeteria make this a worthwhile destiny.

Nice outing. I took the train to the Jim Thompson House and it was a very nice outing. They have transportation that will take you to the House (I didn't know this) and transportation that will bring you back to the Main Street near the train. The tour of the actual house is very nice and informative. You must remove your shoes to tour the house. IF you are skidish about walking bare-foot like me, please wear socks.
