Fantastic. Really a must see in Bangkok. Great collection of oriental arts. Great comments from the tour guide, available in various languages.

Lovely silks interesting to look around and stunning. Interesting to have a wander around with your guide. The guides are very knowledgeable.
The quality of the silk and products made here is fantastic.
Well worth a visit.

Beautiful & interesting !!. The grounds are absolutely beautiful! The tour is given in different languages so we appreciated that they put you in groups based on that. Very interesting and educational, we really enjoyed learning about how the silk business was brought to Thailand! Must visit!!!

I love this place. The mysterious disappearance of Jim Thompson and the tranquility of the grounds makes for a mystery novel setting. The tour is mandatory and very interesting. The artwork, store and beautiful restaurant make this a must do destination. You can buy your silk here, at the Jim Thompson stores in the malls or the stores at the airport (the cheapest by a little).
History of the Legend. This house shares the complete history of Jim thompson. One can also buy good stuff from the boutique. Not to be missed.
Worth a visit. Jim Thompson house is well worth a visit. The guided tour is very interesting, with the ancient relics inside and outside the house included as part of the story.

Jim Thompson House. Full of history and memories, this place reminds me of Cameron Highlands. Cameron Highlands, Moonlight Bungalow was the last place on earth where Jim Thompson was sighted. He went for a walk after lunch into the jungles and never came back. However his memory lived on in the beautiful Thai silk products which he actively promoted for Thailand. A unique place to view the legacy of Jim Thompson

Interesting bit of history. . Nice tour that explains the Thai silk industry. Jim Thompson was a very interesting individual. The houses are full of beautiful items. Lunch at the restaurant has excellent Thai food.

Quiet retreat for a couple of hours. I went with a friend and we weren't sure what to expect, but we found the place easily and enjoyed the tour. This guy sure was a character and must have been collecting something every day of his life, plus there's the mysterious disappearance! We had a nice tea and dessert afterwards by the pond and can see why people keep coming back.

Cool, Calm & Comfortable. I visited there with my wife. There seems to be a different world than crowded, noisy, smelling big city Bangkok. At the entrance you will be asked your nationality. A smiling receptionist will let you know the tour time(several languages are available including Japanese, English…) For a while until the tour starts, you can enjoy Jungle in giant metropolis. Beautiful! The house is a kind of museum. There are a lot of Jim’s collections, ancient statue of Buddha, paintings and porcelain in traditional Thai style house. Amazing! After the tour you will feel tired and hungry. A tasty restaurant is waiting for you, please enjoy. You can purchase Thai silk products there, but I want to recommend Jim Thompson Outlet@Soi93. There’s a building filled with their products with reasonable price. Inside there’s a café. Also good!

Unique place, a master piece. Visited Jim Thompson house. Great work, truly depicting the culture. 40 mins walk through by the team Jim Thompson house is worth spending. Well maintained house. Love the restaurant inside the house. Would recommend visiting this place. One would get a very different experience in Bangkok vs typical places city known for.

Thai history in one buildin. Delightful.Gardens lovely, house full of stunning antiquities,stafff welcoming, Restaurant not to. E missed.
Prices in shop rather high, but goods beautiful .but it is a once in a lifetime trip fir most so go for it !

Worthwhile seeing. I think it is a bit over rated, but it is still very interesting to see the houses and learn the history of Jim Thompson's life.
Easy to find = walk 10 minutes from the Skytrain.
Nice gift boutique on site (rather expensive though)
surpringly quiet and peaceful property 5 min from Siam Square. it felt like travelling back in time. Interesting experience. Excellent guided tour in English or French. Good restaurant too !

Feel the Thai touch. As my first time visited here I gotta say this place is extraordinary. From the outside it may look simple but the details and the history makes it even tempting. Own by an American architect Jim Thompsons this house was preserved nicely and we'll manage under his foundation after his disappearance in Cameron Highlands, Malaysia back to 48 years ago.The house is truly Thai style with the decorations of the antiques Buddha images, Chinese porcelain and paintings. There is a Buddha statue 1200 years old. The tour of the house is amazing. The guide she was well informed and knowledge. We get to know all the informations of the house and the history of it. Some art pieces that I haven't seen before in my life and I get to know because of her. The restaurant is amazing. Especially Kati ice cream. It's a must try menu here :) we didn't have time for a la carte but for sure i will be back.The entrance fee is 100 bhts. But by June 15th 2015 the price will be increased to 150 bhts.How to get here : national stadium station (BTS) exit to Soi Kasemsan 2. Walk to the end of the alley and the house is on your left. Enjoy the exploration of Thainess :)

Unique attraction, intriguing story. Beautiful artifacts, free guided tour. Our guide was fun and knowledgable and kept us all interested. The staff showed great respect for Jim Thompson and his home. We had lunch a delicious, filling lunch at the restaurant on the property (my pad Thai dish could have fed three people!)

wonderful place. This was a very charming place. A Thai friend took me to this spot and was very pleased with it. I remember her saying that she learned some stuff about the Thai culture that she did not know. I would highly recommend this as a must do.

a wonder in the middle of the city. I took the sky train to this and walked down the lane to it. There is a Tuk Tuk that goes back and forth if you wait for it. The house its self is amazing. There is a restaurant on site with the most amazing food so be sure to stop and get some of the sticky rice and mango.

Restful typical Thai house in the heart of Bangkok. Situated near Siam station this is a lovely peaceful traditional Thai house, situated near a Klong the house is beautifully preserved. Well worth a visit and definitely stop at the shop to buy some stunning cushions, bags etc. Also grab some food at the very good quality restaurant.

Interesting. Interesting tour, don't get there before opening time as they don't open until 9! The shop is quite pricey but does have beauty things in it. I didn't get to stay for the restaurant but it looked lovely. I'll go back and check that out. If you are walking, walk right to the end of the Soi and its in your left
A must see in the city. The house is well maintained and the staff are well knowledgeable about the history of the place. It's a must see.

Great little place. It is a beautiful complex of homes filled with antiques. You must take a guided tour. It was a great tour. The tour takes about 1 hour and enjoying the grounds and gift shops takes another 30 mins-1 hour depending on your interest. The only draw back is that you can NOT take photos inside the home.

Interesting art & architecture; beware the touts. The museum easily accessible from the BTS and they do run a free shuttle from/to the station every 15 minutes. While the walk is short you may be accosted by con artists on the museum road; someone tried to run the gem scam on me. The onsite restaurant is quite good if a little pricey but a welcome respite from the heat. Admission is very reasonable at 100THB. Guided tour included.
Fun. I was surprised that I enjoy this as much as I did – – it's worth the trip. I expected a crowd in long wait but that didn't materialize
Just went for a look. Tour and house was interesting and my wife and daughter loved the silks. Peaceful and good for an hour out of the hot sun. We enjoyed it but once done would not go back

Excellent attraction. This place is a nice break from all of the other attractions in Bangkok. Really interesting backstory to the house with the tour it gives the complex a better understanding and appreciation. They have a very nice shop, although expensive for Thailand, they have really nice things to take home
Cool place. I didn't particularly like this place, but it's just because I'm not really interested in silk/clothing.

An Oasis in the City. The tour and the house itself are both excellent. And after the tour you can take home some Jim Thompson preserves or tea purchased in the Jim Thompson. I was surprised they didn't have any Jim Thompson beer.
Place of solitude. The structures give you a taste of Thailand as a whole. It's great to just wander in peace.If you are looking for somewhere a little quieter & away from the madness this can be it.
Nice house and garden. Worth a visit as may not be many houses like this.A 45 minutes tour around the house with antiques.As u exit,walk to your left,you will see a canal.
Eye Opening. Is an eye opening about the history on Jim Thompson. The translator gave us a clear picture how dedicated Jim Thompson was and i hope my children will learn from him too!!

Really nice house and beautiful complex .. A must when in Bangkok!. We visited Jim Thompson House in May 2015, the house was beautiful, it is maintained and kept in excellent condition. The complex also is pretty, very "green" and cozy, huge trees are everywhere. We took the guided tour for 100 Baht, the tour lasted around an hour (more or less), the guide took us to explore the complex and the house. We were not allowed to take pictures inside the house, all of our belongings must be kept inside the locker provided in the area, and shoes off (due to wooden floor I suppose). For those art and history lover will definitely like the tour. I am not either of those but still enjoyed the tour very much. This one is something different (not about Thai culture), highly recommended!Tips: wear something comfy as it can get quite hot inside the house, no air conditioning available inside the house. A hand held fan would be useful.

An Urban Place of Respite. Shady, garden, tours, pleasant and interesting house - in central Bangkok. I took the suggestion of the leader of my upcoming tour, and found this place. I went on my first (and second) day in Bangkok. I was on my own. Get clear directions before going. I took the sky train and walked toward the canal, went under the bridge (turning left). After walking a ways along the boat canal, I found the small sign - and I was there. I appreciated all that this site offered. I stayed for dinner by the fish pond. Everyone was very kind, caring and friendly. I returned the following day and took the tour again. I enjoyed the repeated visit. Much easier getting there the second time, and my knowledge of the history of the place was broadened. Take advantage of the complimentary ride from the site to the main road after your visit.

Do Not Miss. Close to the canal in Bangkok and easily accessible. Great tour guide who gives one an insight to this wonderful facility. Regular tours with English speaking guide.Be sure to use the cafe - friendly staff and great coffee!!

Tranquil Oasis. Step out of the hustle and bustle of central Bangkok and step back into a genteel time. At a very reasonable 100 Thai Baht exploring the grounds of the Jim Thompson House brought to life a time where sitting in the shade of a teak veranda, surrounded by green jungle/garden, sipping a cooking drink was the way to pass the hot afternoon in Bangkok. Jim Thompson was an architect, a spy, a diplomat of sorts, and a beloved business man who brought Thai silk to the world and then left the world as as an enigma, disappearing without a trace. He built the compound by dismantling houses from up country and bringing them to Bangkok to reassembly them into his main house and several smaller houses that store and display his vast art and antique collection. They combine elements of traditional Thai house with his own design. A tour is included in the admission price and after touring the gardens and structures enjoy a meal in the very nice waterside caffè and shop for some Thai silk souvenirs. There are also some simple displays to demonstrate how silk is made. This is a great way to spend 1-2 hours! To get the most out your visit a quick read about Jim Thompson on Wikipedia is recommended.
Time out from endless shopping. A beautiful house with a fascinating story. The guided tour was interesting also for our teenagers (11 & 15). Worth the time, cost and effort.

This hidden gem is well worth visiting, but you will not be alone.. Hidden in a sense that there are no big signs and you have to know which soi to go down. A lot of people do. The house and gardens are well preserved and interesting to see. The only way to get into the house is with a guided tour and they have really timed them well. Still you will bump into other groups on the way. For some reason photographing inside the house is not allowed. Nor are any bags or purses and you have to remove your shoes. However, it is rather nice to walk bear feted on the wooden floors. Well worth the 200 Bath per person.
Good to kill some time . It was a nice tour, of a nice (ish) house. But don't go out of your way to see it. If you're in the area go, if not don't bother.
Do it once. Tour the house, visit the shop and cafe. They also offer free golf cart ride from the house to the nearest skytrain station. (Great service to avoid the blazing sun).

Beautiful antiques in a lovely setting. Jim Thompson's house is a beautifully built wooden house made up of four/five houses. It has some very interesting antiques, statues and paintings. There is a shop selling high quality (and high priced) silk products and a cafe/restaurant. The gardens are a relaxing oasis in busy Bangkok however do bring mosquito spray!

unique and interesting architecturally, historically and culturally. Lovely experience. A guided tour of the unique house built from several old traditional Thai teak houses. An insight into the history of the region as well as the rebuilding of the silk industry. An opportunity to see silk production on a small scale and to purchase from a lovely, though expensive gift shop. The on site John Thompson Restaurant offers refreshing iced smoothies and the Thai Green Curry was second to none.
Nice quick tour. The tour takes about 40 minutes but there is a nice gift shop with A/C while you wait and afterwards a small café for a cool drink
Interesting. Enjoyed this place. Lots of history to learn from and the silk is amazing. This is worth seeing and spending a bit of time at

From cocoon to Thai Silk. When in Bangkok, a visit to the Jim Thompson House is a must. Sericulture is an art not just silk yarn spinning. Jim Thompson has made a great contribution to the Thai silk industry. The bags and other items are not only of the best quality but less pricey than those branded ones like Kate Spade!

Nicely maintained house of old times. The visit was nice and the place is very interesting. But be warned - they don't have AC in the tour so it is going to get HOT in middle of day especially in April and May. I should have taken the advise of going in first thing in morning... but at 2 pm in May, the tour was REALLY hot. interesting but HOT.

Interesting.. Well organised short tour of Jim Thompson's house & an incite into his life. What a shame that the mystery of his disappearance hasn't been solved. Every artefact has been well preserved & the house lovingly looked after.The gift shop is worth a visit too if you're after good quality silk & cotton garments. There's a good range of men's, ladies & children's clothing. The screen prints are very unique. Apart from the airport, you won't find any of these in the shops of Bangkok.
Nice house. It's nice to visit Jim Thompson's house and learn the history of silk in Bangkok. I enjoyed walking through the houses, having lunch at the restaurant and shopping for silk.
Exquisite. All the silk products are lovely: the scarfs, the clothes, accessories, the home decorations, and last but not least, the food was scrumptious!

Interesting. Not the usual Bangkok attraction but informative tour. The antiques and art work were lovely, the gardens were beautiful and restful. I know Jim Thompson was inspirational in getting the Thai Silk industry on the international stage and his background in architecture helped rebuild and sustain this interesting house but honestly I'm still not sure what all the hype is about.
Jim Thompson house. The history behind Jim Thompson, was very interesting , I'm a big JT fan and love his silk , the restaurant was also good would recommend going there

Sompol plianchaisuk. Jim thompson house is belong to one of an american designer who was born in 1906 deville in United State of America who traveled to Thailand & stay from 1950 - 1960 around southest asia. He also was a businessman to buy & sell thai silks by his own design that you can find easily from the corner of surawonge Rd, It's really beautiful . By the way,he lived in soi kasemson 2, Rama 1 Rd, just opposite National Stadium ,just walk about 200 meters approximately , then you can find Jim thompson house on your left hand side. It's really very beautiful of Thai architecture house . Now they opened a fine restaurant too with clean food and delicious. what 's a pity , he was disappeared from carmeron island in Malaysia Country in 1967. If you come to Bangkok , don't forget to visit The Jim thompson house. Thank you.

Worth a visit, good food. Restaurant is good, but very much western priced. The coconut ice cream was delicious.Short tours in good English take off every 30 min or so. Accessible by the klong boat, which i highly recommend. The boat ride is a bit terrifying and don't expect it to be gorgeous or clean, but worth seeing and experiencing.

A little bit of Thai culture.. I found the tour quite interesting. It was an insite into what thailand would have been like in the past century. If only I moved here then.The food at the restaurant is very good.

Inner city oasis with a glimpse into bygone eras. Jim Thompson's House is one of the most underrated attractions in Central Bangkok. A beautiful home and garden oasis in the middle of the bustling city. Stay for lunch in the cafe, but don't bother picking up any souvenirs here - head to the outlet in Soi 93.

The history of Thai silk by an American silk lover. The museum will provide you the history of Thai silk, which was not popular and expensive in the history, and this American founder, Jim Thompson, who fell in love with this business and run in with Thai community nearby to make Thai silk famous to the international market.

Well worth the visit. A beautiful and peaceful place. Jim Thompson was quite a character and his house shows plenty of it. An oasis in the middle of the usual Bangkok chaos. Lots to look at and learn about. An afternoon well spent.

amazing house in the middle of bangkok. we were greeted by a dancer in the middle of the grounds. the house/ gardens looked amazing. really well kept. the tour was great and very interesting. all the staff were very friendly and were great at explaining everything. we ate at the restaurant after the tour, and it was delicious. highly recommend!

classy museum well worth the visit. It is conveniently located from the public train stop. Walk one block to the street and they have a free shuttle service,Delightful tours in several language groups of small numbers. While waiting I saw some authentic Thai dancer, and two taking silk threads from live silk worms, and weaving the thread.Pleasant tropical gardens, and very friendly staff. Highly recommend a visit. Probably spend 60-90 minutes there. You can also have lunch there.

Definitely worth a visit. The Jim Thompson House is interesting to visit to see samples of traditional Thai Architecture and the collection of his antiques and art collection. Jim Thomson was an American entrepreneur who lived in Thailand in the 1950s and 1960s and invested in the silk industry. It is worth going on the tour.

Wonderful break from the high intensity streets.. A wonderful secluded old wooden compound that us cool to the skin and soothing to the eyes. If you learn about Jim Thompson's story you get transported back in time as you walk around the wooden houses.There are also a nice store and a place to get drinks.You may walk there - about 20-30 minutes from Erawan.

After the temples and the palace. I will not review the main temples in Bangkok because they have to be the first places any visitor to the city should go to . The Jim Thompson House is well worth a visit because it is quite unique and brings to life the story of this remarkable man . Excellent guided tour and perhaps seeing their shop at the airport when you head home will only tell you that you missed out on a worthwhile visit .

So worth visiting!. This is a must see in Bangkok! It's very easy to find from the SkyTrain and you get a guided tour of the house.There is a large store adjoining the property to buy Jim Thompson's silk products.

A very interesting place to visit.. The story of Jim Thompson is fascinating. In 1967, Jim Thompson went on holiday with friends to the Cameron Highlands in Malaysia. There he set out for a walk in the surrounding jungle but never returned. Thus began the Jim Thompson legend.

Ordiinary Museum. The garden was ordinary and show a few home he build what he stored. The main building was something he preserved for remembering him( Jim Thompson). Unfortunately we are not allow to take photos to show to friend back home of the Jim Thompson museum. The entrance fee 100 THB is to expensive to pay for it without taking any photos.
Visit if you have time. You can visit if you have time and the money for it though its not very great. I liked the structure but didn't find it very interesting.
Well worth a visit. Beautiful buildings and artefacts with a very informative tour. We both very much enjoyed our visit and would recommend.
Interesting but ... If you are looking for textiles I would recommend taking a taxi out to the larger retail store about 15min further out along Sukhumvit Road.

Very interesting - worth the visit. All about how Jim Thompson set up the silk trade and manufacture in Bangkok, amazing to walk round his house and see the memoirs, furniture, paintings, all as they were and learn about his sudden and mysterious disappearance

Worth a Visit. The Jim Thompson story is an interesting one. Visiting his house was a lovely experience. His construction and modernisation of the house is lovely. The man had style, that's for sure. If I had to go again I would probably visit on a weekend rather than a weekday. There were a couple of school excursions the day we went. Whereas the children were not a nuisance and were well behaved, it did slow down tour time. Early morning would be advisable as the house obviously isn't air conditioned so best to beat the heat. The gardens are lovely and in the cafe, try the mango tango. Yummy. The Tuk Tuk shuttle back to station nice gesture also. A nice tour and great way to spend the morning. Getting there: Take Skytrain to National Stadium. Once down on Main Street, walk past Ibis Hotel and turn right into first street you come to. Walk down road and house is at the end on the left. Easy :-)

I wish they still built them like this.. Jim Thompson house is worth visiting just to see the house. The (mostly) traditional Thai building is absolutely gorgeous and a great glimpse into traditional Thai aesthetics. Throw in the gorgeous textiles and the rotating art exhibits and this is a really pleasant place for a repeat visit. The area around the house is very interesting to walk and explore. I love the canal neighbourhoods.

Very serene. We were given mixed opinions about going there, but we are glad we did. Quite interesting...what vision he had! They have a free shuttle back to the sky train, but it is within walking distance.

A "must see" in Bangkok. Interesting and different. An intriguing back story.. An insight into a post-war US Ex-pat setting up the Thai silk export business. Good tour guide. A large residence built from combining a number of traditional teak houses, tastefully furnished by a collector of ancient statues and other artefacts.

A Must See. A beautiful and tranquil spot down a leafy street in Bangkok. A fascinating story and tour around a beautiful Thai home. Excellent tour and very friendly staff. Found the silk products on sale very reasonably priced.

Beautiful Architecture, interesting visit.. A beatiful house, cheap entry (100bht for adults and 50bht for under 25's) this price includes a guided tour of the house with an enthusiastic, English speaking guide. It was a lovely way to pass an hour or two and the house is very well preserved!

A Little History. I enjoyed the peaceful and relaxed atmosphere despite a good number of visitors about at the time of visit. Our guide was very good and told us some very interesting things about Jim Thompson and his handsome house.

good historical experience. Much of the Thai culture can be gleaned from this museum. I love the store although a bit pricey. Thai dancers also entertain guests who are having their meals/snacks in the restaurant.

Interesting tale behind this attraction. The story is varied as to what happened to the American owner of this wonderful attraction but it is interesting and worth a visit. They charge 100Baht for a tour that goes every half hour. The story of silk products is also interesting, but the shop is expensive.

Notthing excited. I dont see any interesting point here. Its just a museum which jim was built a thai house for him. And the house is just an old regular thai house, nice but not many interesting there. Seems people just overrated the place.
The silk is very expensive.
Overall, not recommend for this place.
Must go - Worth that 100B. 100b includes the guided tour which is very cheap for a 45 mins introductory tour. I am really impressed by the structure of the house. However, merchandise are not cheap

A morning at Jim's. What a wonderful morning spent exploring the beautiful grounds of Jim Thompson's house. Our tour guide was so lovely and knew exactly what she was talking about the whole time. The house was just magnificent and we learnt a lot about his love for Thai architecture and the Thai people. My partner and I had such a great experience and we certainly do recommend going there!

Must seeeee. We visited this place as a Thai friend's recommendation. Its location is close to our hotel. The fee to get in is cheap, especially if you are under 25. The staff speak English well. The house has been maintained quite good. If you want to know about Thai traditional house in a Western style, this is where you should start
Thai silk. very interesting place with a lot of history. Down a little side street so unless you pick a leaflet up about it you won't find it.

Very Interesting . We visited this yesterday and were delighted our tour guide spoke good English was passionate and explained lots of details regarding the house and it's grounds . we loved it especially as we had been to the Cameron highlands only a couple of weeks ago and fist heard of the J Thompson story and the mystery around his disappearance.His love of Thailand lives on and I'm glad this has been preserved.

A real gem to include in a Bangkok visit. This is a very traditional Thai house with exceptional artefacts and a very intriguing history, linked to the silk industry. I visited it 30 years ago and again recently, the way it has been developed and maintained is quite outstanding. Highly recommended if you want to get a flavour of Thai traditions, beyond the places where everyone goes. An oasis on a small lane beside a klong, but easy to get to.

An oasis. A must visit (along with the shop - which was the only place worth shopping albeit expensive its all amazing quality) -- hidden down a back street theres a lovely restaurant/cafe thats lovely food and reasonably priced. The house is so lovely but its also so sad that he didn't get chance to enjoy it for long too

A mysterious house. My hostel was so near of this place so I just walked few minutes to reach and when I reach I found out a mysterious house is just in front me. There were a peaceful environment and so many colorful things were used to decorate this wonderful place. I wish to visit once more in my next trip to BKK
A wonderful historic example. A wonderful historic example of Thai and Western architecture colliding to create an oasis within the urban jungle of Bangkok. Well worth a visit. Thank you Jim Thompson

Enjoy history peacefully!!. Most Buddhist temples & palace complexes are extremely crowded- but Jim Thompson house is totally peaceful & I will say must visit if you are in Bangkok for more than a day. They have timed tours for 40 mins duration & take batches of 10-15 max for 100 bhat per person. Starts with a Simple outside tour of garden, ancient collections of statues, silk designing equipment, etc. Later we move into the house & get detailed explanation for each part of the house, intricate cutlery, decor of each room & how craft fully jim Thompson designed it- it's maintained with the old glory!! Considering the artefacts are more than 200 yrs old, perfectly maintained to give a classic feel. It's not a boring museum, but an interesting journey into the father of Silk in Thailand. Do click pictures outside the house & you can try you hand in extracting sill from worm, just like they did in old days. Staff are extremely friendly & very helpful. The restaurant had good reviews, but not recommended for budget travellers -same holds good for their shop selling silk products.

Beautifully designed house. If you, as I was, are unaware of who Jim Thompson was and or his significance on the world, you will need an interest in design, art and decoration to enjoy this.If you're interested in any of those elements, this is a lovely place to visit. The home is impeccably designed and decorated and features some beautiful old art work as Thompson was quite the collector. Very easy to find and get to if you are staying in Sukhumvit.And yes, you do have to take a tour!

Enjoyed the Day. A great half a day trip for 100 baht. Included in the visit is a guided tour in English of some of the history and the collection of Jim Thompson. Also located on the site is delicious restaurant and a gift shop. Enjoyed the day.

God to see and know some more history. So close to BTS National Stadium that you shouldn't miss it.There's an entry fee of 100THB per person which includes a guide for your group.Was a nice stroll through a small piece of Thai history about the silk industry and what an integral part Jim Thompson played in it's foundation.Take the tour, have a wander around afterwards and check out the silk shop.They also have a free shuttle tuktuk back to Main Street as well.

Quiet Oasis in the city. A great way to escape the city bustle - this museum was around the corner from where we were staying. Stunning house set in an Oasis of beautiful garden. Entry is 100THB per person and includes a 30min guided tour.

Jim Thompson House a Must See for Everyone. The Jim Thompson story, it itself is quite fascinating, the house complex is right in the center of the bustling skyscrapers, on a side street, but when you walk in the entry, you feel like you are in a bit of tropical jungle. The tour is inexpensive and the restaurant serves excellent food, with both Thai and western fares, The shop carries every silk design by the Jim Thompson design group, so be be prepared to pick up some beautiful shirts, blouses, ties, and many other ammenities.

Amazing place. I hadnt heard of Jim Thompson until a friend told me the story and so a visit to the house was a priority. I was not disappointed the house, the grounds, the plants, the fish were all amazing and I loved being shown around and given plenty of information by very professional guides. This was, in fact, one of the hightlights of my trip
Boring for me. Boring for me but beautiful and expensive Thai silk products. Remember there are dozens of shops selling Thai silk products around the city and 200 selling copy products too.

Interesting, hard to find. Jim Thompson's house is unique, and the staory surrounding him is very interesting. The house is a little hard to find--it's not on a main street. Several locals provided well intentioned directions, but they were wrong. The cafe at JT serves great cold drinks, which we really appreciated after spending an hour walking.

Mystery unsolved!. What happened to JT??? Very beautiful compound with good, but fast and crowded tour. We lingered afterwards to enjoy the garden and the artwork. Took the complimentary tuk-tuk back to the main street which was a fun, short ride.

Story Behind the Silk.. Jim Thompson House & Museum is located 5 minutes walk from National Stadium BTS station. It is open daily from 9am to 5pm. Entry fee is 100 Thai Baht. This site is a very easy walk from BTS Station. There is also complimentary tuk tuk shuttle from Jim Thompson House to BTS every 15 minutes.The garden are beautiful and whilst waiting for your tour to begin, you can wander around. The house comprises six separate teak rooms that Thompson a prolific art collector, filled with and antiques and paintings collected on his travels through Thailand. The house gives a great view into Thai culture, architecture and the Thai silk industry. It is interesting to look into the life of Jim Thompson himself. A tour guide takes you around the house in a small group and provide lots of interesting information. Photographs are not allowed to be taken inside the house, although outside in the gardens is fine.There is a small cafe for the visitors to have breakfast or lunch and a souvenir shop for visitors to buy Jim Thompson silk products. Finally, there are demonstrations of silk making and weaving. I recommend visiting this house and museum to anyone interested in the history of Thai silk. The house provide fascinating glimpse of Thai vernacular architecture.
A little overpriced. its nice ,,green and peaceful place with a little history to add,, but i would like to add that the tour is a little overpriced..its also rented for weddings i guess.

Oasis in the city. This museum is a great place to get away from the hustle and bustle of Bangkok. An excellent tour and good background to the silk history of Thailand.Also recommend the restaurant / café for lunch or a cool drink, on the veranda overlooking the pond, very relaxing and calming.

A snapshot of history. We started off our Bangkok trip with a stop at the Jim Thompson House. The guides are very knowedgeable. The tour is about 30 minutes. Make sure you have applied your mosquito spray prior to heading out for the tour!

Favourite place in Bangkok. For a place that didn't sound very exciting in the tourist brochures, I was surprised that the Jim Thompson House was my favourite place in Bangkok. An extremely tranquil respite from the chaos of the Bangkok shopping district. The highlights are beautiful antiques and collectables, architectural composition of the buildings and a piranha in an open fish bowl. The restaurant also had great food at reasonable prices.

history. Fascinating bits of Thai and area history as Thompson was a prodigious collector of ancient art. The Jim Thompson company shop on site is less crowded than the main store, and the cafe has great upscale thai food. A can't miss activity if in or near Bangkok.

Unique experience. We both really enjoyed visiting this property. It was informative and you have a tour guide to take you round in a small group. You can see the gardens and house and there is a lovely restaurant there too. It was clean, friendly and interesting.

Interesting story behind it. Never heard before about Jim Thompson and his mysterious disappearance, so it was interesting to see his house, collection collected over years and to learn details about his life and disappearance. As he was passionate about silk and silk products, you will also lean about it. Research Jim Thompson story and visit his house, amazing green oasis and wooden house between concrete buildings in Bangkok.

Thai Silk & Textile and Souvenirs. The concierge directed me to this place for very good Thai silk , purses and other textiles. I was told that there were 2 branches in the city . I went to the Surawon branch. I was able to buy silk , bags , placemats. One can get a 5 % rebate at the airport for big purchases.
over priced. The selection is there but prices are too expensive., you can get a better variety and better prices at just the normal silk shops. this is more alike a tourist attraction

Stunning oasis in Bangkok. If you want a welcome respite from Bangkok traffic -take a trip along one of the canals (klongs) and reach Jim Thompson's house. You can also get there by taxi etc. It is in fact a number of traditional Thai buildings brought to Bangkok by Jim Thompson in the 1950's and 60's while he was building his silk business. The buildings now house a wonderful museum of South East Asian arts, again collected by him from Cambodia,Myanmar and Thailand. Sit in the garden amongst the orchids and chill out. There is a restaurant and gift shop (of course) but entry fees are very reasonable. Definitely worth a visit.

Really can't see what the deal is about. Went with the wifey - who loved it. So, this is my review. I really can't see the point of this museum except the fact that Jim Thompson built a Thai style house. The tour itself needs a lot of work; there is very little information on why he's considered so important.

gorgeous house.. Jim Thompson House can be located in the heart of Bangkok directly opposite the National Station on Rama 1 Road. Daily opening hours 9am - 5pm with the last tour at 5pm. Its strictly guided tours only & you have to take your shoes off when viewing the inside on the house. There is a small cafe & shop were one can have lunch or buy some beautiful Jim Thompson silk items. The gardens are gorgeous & so too is the house which has six typical Thai teak houses all joined together as one. The houses were moved from various regions of Thailand. The house is open plan & has beautiful teak floors & wooden shutters. Jim Thompson was an American who after the war decided to settle in Bangkok. he saw a future in redesigning the Oriental building into a hotel & also introduced the silk industry into Thailand. in 1967 Jim Thompson went on a jungle walk in the Cameron Highlands in Malaysia whilst on holiday & never returned, his body was never found.

Very interesting!. I had not heard of Jim Thompson, but the tour was very interesting. The house is quite unique and the gift shop has some beautiful silk pieces. There is a snack bar and the gardens are lovely.

Very interesting way to learn about silk. I was not eager to visit Jim Thompson, but decided to go and definetly dont regret it. I did learn more about the Siam culture, silk, you can watch the process, the garden and the architecture in the house is beautiful. Ended up loving thai silk.

The home of Silk. Jim Thompson house is a collection of authentic Thai houses constructed from older houses that were relocated. JT is regarded as the "architect" of Thai silk. The house and grounds are very atmospheric, Thai dancers are nice and it is well worth the visit. Get off the BTS at National Stadium and head away from Bangkok centre, on the right you are sure to see a free JT shuttle to take you down KasamSan 2 Alley. Only .5km or so walk in total from BTS to the house.

Don't Miss It. We arrived and watched silk being spun from silk worms prior to purchasing our tickets to see Thompson's beautiful house made of teak wood and no nails. The tour was informative and learning about this colorful man's life was fascinating. We stayed until closing time and then had dinner at their beautiful restaurant patio next to a large koi pond. Food and service was excellent and a perfect ending to our day. Highly recommend.

Absolutely Amazing Place to Visit!. It's an oasis in the middle of a huge city. It brings you back to a time many decades ago. Easy to imagine what life was like back then. The design is great and the furnishings bring everything together. A must see if you are in Bangkok.

A Unique Museum. I enjoy visiting this museum and it's really worthed. It's very easy to find this museum, just take the BTS and stop in National Stadium. The ticket is 100 THB and 50 THB for student, include the guide. The house was great, a wooden house with Thailand's style. As well as the collection, which were the art works and items collected by Thompson during his travel through countries. In this museum there are a lovely coffee shop and souvenir shop.

Really interesting - Great tour. The trip around the house was interesting and told you points you wanted to know ( didnt over complicate or go into too much detail) The house was very interesting to look around.We ate there and the food was very good but the service was a little 'slow' and laid back.Enjoyable experience

Great museum Great restaurant. A great informative tour on the life of Jim Thompson and how he helped the silk tade blossum.The restaurant is a nice little gem with great quality reasonably priced food.

Lovely to see but missing information about Jim.... The house was fantastic to see and the tour provided plenty of information about the construction of the house and the silk trade however, we felt it lacked some personal information about Jim - how he went missing, what was done to try and find him etc. A great sight to see if you have a few hours spare in Bangkok regardless.
A little insight to Thai culture. This will show you a little glimpse of Thai culture and easy to find from the BTS skytrain, fill in 2 hours with friendly staff to explain the exhibits.

Something different. If you are in Thailand for a while you may at some point feel like a break from beautiful temples and Buddhas, and this is a good one. Right in the centre of the city there is a big teak residence, created by joining several houses together. The guided tour is about half an hour and it's interesting to see the lifestyle of a rich man in Asia. There is a mystery about Jim that makes the story more memorable. There is a nice tea room/restaurant (but at european prices). Entrance fees support charity.
Interesting take if you have the time. A throwback to the 1950s before Bangkok exploded. This is nestled in between canal and high-rises. Learn about Silk and get tour of interesting house.
Heritage. beautiful surrounding making the house really interesting to visit. make you feel transported right back in time, where electricity was none. I did enjoy this house a lot.

Great Appeal for a Specific Niche Audience. Jim Thompson was an American entrepreneur who revived the Thai silk industry, beginning his work in the late 1940s. Jim Thompson house really consists of 6 small Traditional Thai houses that he linked together at his Bangkok site -- completed in 1959. The teak houses are filled with beautiful pieces of art and furniture reflecting Thai culture. There is an entrance fee of 100 Bhat that includes an articulate and very well-informed guide. Even if one could view the house without a guide (you can't!), one would ooh and ahh at the beautiful features of the house without fully appreciating it. The guide really brings the place to life. No photos are permitted within the walls of the house, but they are allowed outside the building(s), including the beautiful mini-jungle garden. Also, on-site are a decent restaurant, a live demonstration of some of the silk-making craft, and - of course - a shop selling a wide array of Thai silk products. A silk museum might not be for everyone's taste, but, if you are even considering visiting Jim Thompson House, then do go. It's meant for you. It's easy to find. Take the Skytrain (BTS) to the National Stadium stop. Jim Thompson House is on the opposite side of the street from the Stadium. When you exit the BTS, ask anyone where it is. Even those with very little English are used to pointing tourists in the right direction. It's less than a ten minute walk down the street, and a free shuttle service from the site will take you back to the Skytrain.
Amazing place. Go to this small place and come away amazed. Wonderful home of a great man. Wonderful staff and food. Good emenities all very clean.

just got curious. if you like to know about silk production in Thailand, how it started and how popular and big the industry right now, pay a visit. there's a fee of 100B, I think.. tour guides are multi-lingual they'll will form a group tourist according to nationality so that the guide can explain everything you can see there in the language you can understand. the main thing I went there, is to know where is Jim (hehe) which you can't find the answer.

A quiet haven admist Bangkok. An interesting place in the middle of Bangkok. A quiet haven amongst the city. Take the tour very interesting on the history of Jim Thompson and the building of this unique place.

A must visit and a must eat location. Jim Thompson house along with its associated gift shop (overwhelming choices) and restaurant (superb food, tranquil setting) should definitely be a MUST on any Bangkok itinerary. The Jim Thompson story, well told by the guided tour, is fascinating, as is the home he lived in. The area also features a gorgeous Thai dancer and a demonstration of silk weaving.The restaurant was among the very best we visited in Bangkok. The House is within easy walking distance of the National Stadium BTS station and the entrance fee is quite modest.

Good cultural visit. Good cultural visit. Jim Thompson was once the great silk trader in Thailand and in Malaysia. He disappeared without trace in Malaysia when he went to holiday in Cameron Highland Malaysia.

Must-Do in Bangkok. This was my favorite place we went in Bangkok! The house doesn't look that impressive from the outside, so we almost didn't take the tour. I'm so glad we did! The interior and artwork were absolutely beautiful!!! I actually got emotional about how beautiful some of the pieces were. It was so inspirational! Our guide was informative and very helpful with information about Jim Thompson, the artwork on display, and the Thai silk industry. The silk items in the gift shop were beautiful but very expensive. I would also strongly recommend a stop at the restaurant. Their Tom Ka Gai soup was possibly the best thing I ate in Thailand.

An oasis with lovely restaurant. I highly recommend visiting this museum. The museum is interesting and the house is lovely to visit in and of itself. What I loved is that this museum is located at the end of a very quiet street next to a canal. It's really nice here, and a great break from the madness of the city. Also, the food at the restaurant is TERRIFIC. I had a lovely meal here. The drinks are great too! I would recommend coming here and spending some time eating and visiting the museum. The gift shop is really nice and has some beautiful things but is certainly more expensive.

Quaint and worth a visit. When in Bangkok, my trip is not complete without a visit to Jim Thompson House and the revitalized silk industry. While at first glance, someone might think it rather simple but if you take the time to tour the house and grounds, you can appreciate what this person did to revive the silk industry. It showcases some of the art and traditional home structure for the area. I will visit, tour the house and sit in the gardens. It is an oasis amidst a busy city.
Excellent guided tour of this beautiful place. Must use the complimentary free shuttle from bts station to the Jim Thompson House Guided tour excellent - appreciate this beautiful place more

Great tour, beautiful house & interesting story. My daughter and I really enjoyed our tour through the Jim Thompson house. The 45 minute tour was interesting and comprehensive and gave us a really good appreciation for what Jim Thompson had created when he built his home, his business and his collection of art. A lovely oasis in the middle of bustling Bangkok - well worth a visit. Note: we arrived by boat and that's a fun way to get to or from there - only costs 10 baht too!

Exclusive site overpriced. The house is a typical Thai house near a canal which has been well preserved.The tours are with guides only who speak many languages.Before your turn comes for the tour you can spend some time at the air conditioned souvenir shop with overpriced items.The House is remarkable for the antiques and also attention to details. Most of the house is made of wood.The garden is beautiful and well maintained. The entry fee of 100 baht is for a tour lasting 35 minutes.After the tour you can spend sometime in the overpriced restaurant which has both air conditioned and non air conditioned seating.
Beautiful gardens. Beautiful house, beautiful grounds. We checked this one out because of the TA reviews and we were not disappointed. Interesting story here. Definitely check it out!

interesting. I didn't expect much and was stunned by the crowds. But it really is a Bangkok highlight, especially if you're then kind of person who fetishizes design magazines with lots of photos of retro colonial designs. I am.
Excellent historical tour. The historical aspect of this old mansion was amazing. We did some shopping in the gift store that was excellent in value and were able to buy goods duty-free.

A place to discover or chill. I have visited Jim Thompson house quite a few times the first time you go you have to do the tour to discover the history the story and the artifacts the guides take tours speaking specific languages so you may have to wait a few minutes for your chosen language to start. As well as being a fantastic museum with a great and heartbreaking story it is a great place to go to chill out it is totally unbelievable how you can be in Siam Square or shopping centers or MBK Tokyu and within five minutes walk you can be in the most peaceful and tranquil place. If you have visited the Museum this do-sent mean you tick the box done that as it is an excellent place to chill out you can have a coffee overlooking the pond and gardens or a meal in the excellent restaurant where the food is of good quality and value for money .
Interesting!. They provide a most interesting tour through the facility. The heirlooms and art are precious! The story of Jim Thompson is fascinating.

It was OK, I guess.. Have been to Bangkok numerous times and never ventured within this tourist activity so I thought I would take the leap. You are taken on a 35 minute tour around Jim's house and given a history of him and the house. My tour guide spoke fantastic English and was very helpful. My only issue with this attraction is that it seems to be a bit of a gimmick. It is essentially a rich man's house made famous because he oddly disappeared in the 1960s. Only attend if you are particularly bored and have exhausted other options.

A must place to visit. You won't be disappointed with a visit to his former home and shop . It is an oasis in the crazy and busy city of BKK . Close to MBK shopping centre and national bts station . It is a short walk down a lane from the main road . You can also enjoy lunch and refreshments at the facility. It is truly a wonderful experience you won't be disappointed .

Lovely oasis. A lovely teak wood house and gardens, with a very interesting and informative (short) tour that we and our childen all enjoyed. There is also a good restaurant on site, a shop selling some beautiful items. It's an oasis of calm in such a hectic city....until a boat comes along the river at the back of the house!

A Hidden Gem. Jim Thompson's house was a little oasis of peace, calm and shade in an otherwise hugely hot city. Every room was fascinating, as was the life of this man. It is extremely well run and a joy to visit and so close to the huge shopping arcades of MBK and the Siam Discovery and Paragon.

Thank you jim thompson. Due to jims for sight he was able in his short time preserve valuable artefacts for the Thai people. Unfortunately you can not take photos inside his home but you can buy postcards. You can spend a good hour or two here.
Peaceful haven. Wonderfully peaceful and historical haven in Bangkok. Well-run and informative tour, with a great gift shop at the end. Free tuktuk to and from bts skytrain National Stadium stop.
Jim Thompson's house . Incredibly well maintained and stunning. The restaurant inside is very good too. Must admit the heat and humidity were a killer!
Worth a Visit. This place is definately owrth a visit on any trip to Bangkok. There are wonderful things to buy and also there is a lovely little cafe where one can have a coffee and snacks

nice. This looks beautiful. Never been there, but it is top on my bucket list, I think you should give it a try. A family or solo trip would be very fun. Even friends! No one wants to get lost in a foriegn country!

A tourist "must see". Jim Thompson's house and his story are part of the lore of old Bangkok. His story is mysterious and unresolved, but he did leave his mark on Thailand by making the silk trade trade work which is important to Thailand to this day.Years ago Jim Thompson products were very special and unique. Unfortunately as capitalism tends to foster the brand has been franchised and can be found in "Jim Thompson" shops at malls all over Thailand. The one in Pattaya is the first I saw and it saddened me.Regardless, Jim Thompson is intertwined with the lore of Bangkok and is certainly worth the time to visit his house and ponder his story.

Beautiful, just go. Jim Thompson's house is definately worth a visit, the beautiful cared for cared for gardens are peaceful, the house is breathtaking. A lovely glimpse into perhaps what Thailand was like before the modernisation we see today. For those visiting it's worth mentioning that no cameras are allowed in the house. They provide lockers to keep you belongings secure St no charge.

top notch. I will add this to the "must see" list of all recommendations i give to folks visiting bangkok. Really professionally run which is a tad out of the ordinary for most of my tour experiences here. A blend of visually stunning art work and architecture explained with insight. super!

Interesting bit of history, tied to a BIG store. I enjoyed the tour, but others may not. I found the house itself and the location beautiful and interesting. The HUGE store on the grounds with the VERY high prices...not so much. Only go if you are very interested in seeing original Thai architecture that has been repurposed in an interesting way. And find a Westerner's story in Thailand interesting. OR if you REALLY want to shop for silk items.
Jim Thompson House. I liked the simple explanation given by the guide about Jim and who he was and how he lived and loved Bangkok

Fascinating, beautiful. Very lovely unique setting, with beautiful examples of Asian design: carving, painting, sculpture, landscaping, and interesting history. Restaurant was a beautiful place to enjoy a cold drink, looking over the gardens

A slice of history we had missed knowing. Jim Thompson House is on all the Bangkok tour "to do" lists for good reason. The houses (joined together to make one "house") are wonderfully interesting architecturally and from a Bangkok history perspective. Thompson's collection of art and Thai antiques is presented beautifully and the tour guides give a thorough story of the house and grounds. We were intrigued by the personal story of Jim Thompson and came back to our computer to learn more about his life and history. The gift shops have beautiful tempting items -- a little pricey but great quality so we succumbed.

Interesting Cultural Place to visit. You have to book for the guide who is humorous in taking you through the architectural and artefacts from a single-man collection and uncover the life-style to the ultimate disappearance of this renown entrepreneur & Silk businessman.

Small and pleasant museum. The Jim Thompson house is a well preserved house that used to be owned by a silk magnate. It is a peaceful place inside the bustling city, and very well decorated. The owner had a real knack for visiting neighbouring countries and buying local art. Tours are compulsory for visiting the building. It's pretty small overall, and the pronunciation of our tour guide lacked clarity, but it was overall a great experience.

Fun Short Visit in Bangkok. This is a nice little museum... really a house more than a museum. But it is great for kids as the tour is not too long and they will enjoy seeing the way that people were living not so long ago in Bangkok! This house is unique in Bangkok and there is a cute restaurant to go to before or after tour. The menu serves things that the whole family would like. The shop is also very nice, but it is a chain and you can find Jim Thomson shops across Thailand.

Beautiful Thai houses. We visited this house after visited Teak palace with the children. Our children LOVE this house. Personally, I frequently visited Jim Thompson House and never stop enjoying it. Do take guide tour as Jim Thompson did a lot to this house and you do appreciate and learn more after the tour. Afterward, visit the restaurant and shop. Might be expensive but worth the money.

Beautiful teak house. Lovely gardens merge with this beautiful teak house..or several houses put together? A real oasis of green and tranquility in bustling, hectic Bangkok.
.Escorted tours throughout the day. A shop selling silk clothes and souvenirs ( worth browsing but pretty pricy) adjoins the property.Shoes off while in the house. Relax afterwards in the garden.

A nice calm and peaceful place to visit. We was here after half day hot tour at grand palace. After under the sun for half day, being here was great because the place is so peaceful, calm with exotic garden. It cost us 100bath for entrance fees and they provided shuttle to and from the main road. They have group tour in english. The place was kept clean and peaceful.
famous brand from Thailand. bought few pcs of shirts for own & friends, famous brand from Thailand, quality was good. heard its more expensive in oversea.

Beauty full place in the otherwise loud city.. Cheap, serene and worth a visit. 100B fee covers the guided tour and entrance. The story is good and the legacy he left behind is amazing. Very nice artifacts covers his house. Precious Buddha images are plenty. Only wish the tour was a little longer. Go enjoy it.

Excellent Place to Visit. This was our last stop on our 1/2 day Bangkok tour and found it to be an excellent place to visit. Booked in for the guided tour of the house and the history of Jim Thompson. At the end of the tour we ate at the restaurant which was delicious. A must see when in Bangkok

Beautiful house, too commercial. The house and garden are excellent and our (compulsory) guide was very funny and cute, but that's basically it. Worth going only if you really have nothing to do as it is conveniently located. The shop is overpriced, but we heard good reviews about their restaurant

Well worth the visit. The house and it's history is really something. The guides were friendly and knew their topic well. It is a part of history that I was unaware of - very glad I went and most certainly recommend you visit

Time machine. For some reason as soon we started touring Jim Thompson house I felt so intrigued about how was life in Bangkok at that time, for me was easy to understand why Jim felt so deeply in love with thailand, every single object of his art collection is a trip by itself, not to mention his mysterious disappearing which nurturethe whole tour with some magic and nostalgic experience. One of my favorite in Bangkok.

A Pleasant Place. The Jim Thompson House was just a two-minute walk from our hotel hence we decided to drop by. The museum is a nice break form the shopping malls. The traditional houses and the furniture were well maintained. Our tour was conducted in English and the tour guide was pleasant and had a good command of the language. Got to learn about Mr Jim Thompson and how he has contributed greatly to Thailand.

A charming, cool oasis in the heat of Bangkok. Jim Thompson's House offers a pleasant alternative to the usual sights and sounds of Bangkok. It's small and very pleasant, and provides some welcome shade and cool on those hot steamy days that can make Bangkok such a difficult place to be. It is located very close to Siam, and as such it should be a 'must do' on any trip of more than a couple of days in Bangkok.As a side note, we ended up in the Jim Thompson shop in Silom, which the taxi driver took us to in error. If you're looking for wonderful quality (but expensive) gifts, that shop is well worth visiting. It is much bigger than the small shop in the actual house, and the quality of stuff they sell is excellent.

An Oasis within Bangkok. Very beautiful, picturesque and interesting. The short tour that's free with the ticket doesn't offer very much information but was okay. Ideal for a moment of tranquility in lively Bangkok. Beware if your sensitive to high temperatures. It's very hot in the wooden houses even though there are fans. One group member fainted because of the heat. Still, highly recommended if you're into Thai architecture, the silk industry and the arts in general. Nice shop that sells a variety of Jim Thompson merchandise (not only silk also cotton and wool). Free electric shuttle to the next Skytrain station even though it's nearby.

Very interesting - different Bangkok experience. if you want to go somewhere other than a temple this is very enjoyable and cooler than some of the other sights. Tours bit rushed and often difficult to hear due to the noise from the canal at the back. Interesting architecture and free shuttle to the main road on tuk-tuk!!
A nice place to see. Enjoyed listening to the history of the man who promoted Thai Silk weaving & seeing his residence. The store though is very pricey!

Great way to spend an afternoon. I found the tour very interesting and well run. It was a great insight into traditional Thai culture and great for something different. I wouldn't usually find architecture interesting but the tour guide's descriptions were great and it is a beautiful grounds. It is also very affordable! The restaurant offers beautiful Thai food if you feel like lunch there also!

What an interesting and enjoyable experience.. upon arriving in Bangkok to visit our son and his family, he suggested we take some time to visit the Jim Thompson House and have lunch before heading down to Pattaya for the weekend. We were very happy we accepted his suggestion.Learning about the history of silk production and how Jim re-introduced it to the Thais was fascinating. Having an opportunity to see many artifacts that he had collected as well as his house was really educational and enlightening. Would highly recommend a visit to his home which is now run by his foundation.

Jim Thompson house runs a free shuttle from and to the skytrain station. Jim Thompson house runs a free shuttle from and to the skytrain station but if you walk a little bit on the way to there's a couple of street food vendors. This came in handy recently as the cafe in Jim Thompson was closed for renovation. Spoiler alert: Jim Thompson House is actually six traditional Thai houses cobbled together. If your guide is as droll as mine was you'll enjoy the tour.I didn't expect much and was stunned by the crowds. But it really is a Bangkok highlight, especially if you're then kind of person who fetishizes design magazines with lots of photos of retro colonial designs. I am.

Interesting place, beautiful house - dont expect silk tour. I didnt read into the place much before I went as I knew about Jim Thompson as I study Sericulture (silk work farming & raising), the house is actually a compound of small houses and a pretty garden. You get a tour through his own house but just to look at the rooms with his art collections. Dont expect anything to do with silk or sericulture though, as there's nothing apart from a couple of baskets of cocoons....
interesting. free guided tour, interesting building with many ancient works of art. expensive silk items, you're not obliged to buy them....

Stunning & Silk. The Jim Thompson House in Bangkok is a slice of enriched and entrenched history in the Thai Culture. The house itself is typically embedded within the hot dusty streets of the city, however once you enter the museum you are welcomed by a cool shaded house and gardens.Pay for your entry and pay attention to your group number, when you are called, your guide will enrich you with the fascinating story of 'Silk' and how Jim Thompson discovered, settled and distributed Thailand's major export successfully. The restaurant serves very nice food - both international and traditional menus. By Thai standards the menu is costly, but by a tourist attraction the cost for food you won't notice the expense, Take your camera, travel by Sky Train (The National Stadium) and grab the shuttle Tuk Tuk back to the station. A memorable morning or afternoon.Thanks

A little oasis of calm in Bangkok. Went to Jim Thompson's house today. It was a nice visit for an hour. You can only look around with a tour guide, but it's not too much to get in - 100 Baht. It's has a nice atmosphere and is a lovely little oasis of green in busy Bangkok. It's really near all the mall after also, if you want to go there.

Good Historical place to visit . If you're into learning about cultures and history, I recommend you to visit this place. Its not much of a fun tour, but more like an educational tour. This house has an architectural value in it and you can see many historical art pieces collected by Jim Thompson. Lady guides are friendly. Good food in the restaurant too. Silk items they have are quite expensive but of good quality. They got a souvenir shop as well.

Has become a major tourist TRAP - rip off....free shuttle from main road/SKY TRAIN. Although the Jim Thompson house/compund is legendary, he too is legendary, and the grounds and the house are beautiful, please be warned that you're trapped inside. You pay for the MUST DO tour which is partially informative/somewhat instructive & it's quite well organized. The restaurant prices are a complete exploitation of tourists, although the food is good, we had 2 snacks and 3 smoothies, cost = 1560 Baht. Yikes! The gift shop prices equally represent the business values of the iconic place which are clearly to make money.If you're into the Jim Thompson thing then check it out but I can think of less exploitative ways to spend a few hours. They do offer free shuttles from the main road/National Center Sky train to the Thompson compound - which is only a 10 minute walk.

Good buy and easy to get to.. Jim Thomson house is not easy to find but the Skytrain to the station is great. The Building is quite far up the Soi but I found out late Jim Thomson House seems to offer free pick up and drop off for Customers. The items on offer are limited and not all sizes are available but if you find something it is very reasonably priced.

Very cozy history house with many Thai antiques. I like the house, many antiques decoration and you can buy some product from Jim Thompson shop there as well but too bad the main house isn't originally located there.The place is close to main shopping department stores.
Excellent. What an inspiring place to visit, all was perfect and the tour informative about the houses and the arts and crafts housed there well worth a visit

Nice little trip. For 100baht it was a nice little trip. You have to have a tour guide round the place and you cannot take pictures inside the house but it's a nice way of spending an hour or so.The house is interesting and the grounds are nice.It was right next to where I was staying so was an easy find but if you get off the BTS at the national stadium it's about a 3 minute walk.

Authentic Thai House. The Jim Thompson house is easy to get to via the sky train, but it's tucked away on a side street and away from the hustle and bustle. Admission is cheap (even cheaper if you have a student ID) with a streamlined tour process and knowledgeable guides. I liked that the house consists of authentic Thai construction and historical artifacts and artwork. The restaurant seemed nice but I didn't order anything because it was pricey and Thailand is known for great cheap food. There is also a store where one can buy silk ties, scarves, etc. Overall, I recommend a visit to the Jim Thompson House. I learned some interesting tidbits.
Worth a visit. Came here on my guide books recommendation. Easy to reach from the sky train. 100 baht each to get in guided tour of the house. It's a nice break from the crazy that is bangkok!

peaceful haven in Bangkok. we had a free afternoon before a tour in Thailand and we thought we'd give it a go. well pleased. a beautiful collection of traditional houses with some exquisite eastern artefacts. having just come from Hong Kong was very pleased to find the beer was half the price in the bar overlooking a carp filled shady pond

Haven of tranquillity in the Bangkok Chaos!. My friend and I went there on a Sunday late morning. Boy am I glad we did!!! There is a free tuktuk shuttle from the National Stadium BTS, however we didnt make use of it as it was an easy walk.You pay for a guided tour ( heard German, French and of course English) and get given a time to be ready to commence. Time passed quickly as there were two beautiful Thai ladies doing traditional dancing in their beautiful thai silk clothing. They also spin silk and there was a man boiling the cocoons and making silk thread. There is also a little museum, a shop, restaurant and bathroom facilities.The tour is done barefoot and you are not allowed to take photos inside the houses. They provide lockers to put away your valuables whilst you do the tour. The guide we had was very professional and spoke good English. The area around the houses is simply beautiful and the information provided on the tour is very interesting and also gives you a better understanding of Thai culture and how it relates to their architecture. It was like being in an oasis of calm after all the hustle and bustle that is Bangkok. Highly recommend if you need to find your sanity again :-)

Fascinating insight into silk export history. The equivalent of the national trust, a glimpse of recent history. Take the sky train and when exiting you almost have to double back. Jim Thompsons is down a small side street, they actually run a shuttle but it is only a 100m to walk. Well organised, actually saw silk being boiled , worms emerging and silk spun. Interesting guided tours and worth a morning to visit. Gift shop which is prevalent in bangkok and South , quite expensive .

superb and refined house. Thompson's life was interesting. His house is really beautiful and refined, and surrounded by a garden with exotic plants and trees. The house is by the river. It is easily accessible by taxi. Local guides are available for several languages.
Well worth a visit. Very interesting house. Tour is compulsory and worthwhile and is in English. Some very nice articles in the shop, but a little on the expensive side.

expensive price but average quality. the quality and variety they have is limited and just average. however the prices are a bit expensive. you can get much more variety at much better prices at the other places.

Favorite Place in Bangkok. The house and surrounding garden are a nice change from the hustle and bustle of Bangkok. You are required to take a guided tour of the house but afterward you can wander around the garden on your own. The tours are given in several languages. You may have to wait for your tour to begin but they have a nice restaurant and gift shop to pass the time in.

Calming break from the sun and some Thai history. Just 100thb for the half hour tour and it's an interesting insight into the Thai silk industry and Jim Thompson himself. The house also has some great artifacts, some of which are over 1000 years old.Obviously, venture into the restaurant afterwards and you'll spend a lot more, I know I did on just one cocktail and a dessert (nearly four times what I paid to do the tour). They also have a very pricey gift shop if you're that way inclined.

See how silk is made. We went to Jim Thompson House by taxi and they offered english speaking tour. Learned about the history of Jim Thompson and how silk is made. The house is beautiful. They have restaurant where you could eat and clothing store both a bit expensive but quality of clothes look better than other thai clothing store.
T Shirt Purchase. A very comprehensive selection of garments including Thai silk. It also has a small cafe for coffee and light snacks.
Enjoyed the visit. The gardens are beautiful and I really enjoyed seeing the house. This was a nice way to spend a few hours on an afternoon.

Legend of thai silk. had been a happy consumer of their silk products for years and the visit of his house(museum) just made me love it even more. Great visit of a different time period. Strongly recommended

An oasis of calm. This place has changed over the years, it has become more popular and now offers guided tours of Jim Thompson's house, a free Tuk Tuk shuttle to the National Stadium BTS. However what has not changed is the feeling of calm here alongside a relatively quiet Klong, a lovely restaurant by a calming fish pond, excellent staff and a lovely (if not expensive) shop.I enjoyed the tour but hanker back to my first visit over 16 years ago when you could just wander around the house freely, but understand why they have to have a little more organised these days.Staff were as charming as ever
Pleasant. A visit due to its history and the start of Jim Thompson, guided tour highly recommended so you can get the details of Jim's debut and life.

Love the serenity of Jim Thompson house. Fantastic to hear about Jim Thompson and the start of the "Thai silk industry". He was American and promoted the sales for thai silk. His house is traditional "Siam" style with pavilions surrounded by lush gardens and on a "klong". The tour guide was lovely and very informative.
Was nice to be back. It must be over 20 years since my first visit. Was as nice as remember it. What an era it must have been when Mr Thomson was alive.

A lovely house with a glimpse into Thai history and culture. I didn't know much about Jim Thompson, but my colleague insisted we visit it during our short Bangkok work trip. I'm very happy that we did, because I got to learn a lot about Jim Thompson's contribution to Thai culture. Plus, that tidbit about how he disappeared and how no one knows what happened to him until now is attractive for a mystery buff like me.The house is in the middle of Bangkok, pretty near the Arts and Culture Center and many of the malls. When you get there, you'll find a restaurant on the right and the gift shop on the left before the main courtyard. If all you want to do is go to the restaurant or buy stuff at the shop, you don't need to pay for entrance. But I suggest you get the full experience by paying for the tour. It lasts for around 40 minutes and costs 100 Baht.They have tour guides for the major languages. And the tour takes you through Jim Thompson's "house," which is actually a compound of several houses in the Thai style. Jim Thompson introduced his own modifications to the style, being an architect, and I learned much about why Thai homes were designed that way. Because Thompson was also a collector, the guide spoke a lot about the history behind some of Thompson's art collection.The house was lovingly preserved, airy, and stylish. It's wonderful if you're into art, culture, and bit of history. After the formal tour, they let visitors go around the compound freely. We went there an hour before closing, so we didn't have enough time to really relish everything. I'd suggest, therefore, that you get there early enough to both enjoy the tour and even hit up the gift shop.Regarding the gift shop, by the way, one thing we learned, though, is that you can actually get the Jim Thompson items for much cheaper at the airport Jim Thompson stall. So, if you want to get the items at the gift shop itself, for authenticity or whatever, go right ahead. But if you want to save up a little, I'd suggest you get them at the airport.

A little insight to Thai culture. This was not even on our radar when visiting Bangkok but we are so glad we decided to see Jim Thompson house. It was the first thing we did after arriving in Bangkok the night before. You could see his love of Thai culture through out the house. Was great to learn about the Thai Silk trade and some of the art pieces around the house were so nice. A great way to start our holiday.

Jim Thompson experience. This is a very interesting tour as it has many aspects of old Thailand preserved - artifacts and architecture. The tour-guides will mention Jim Thompson about 700 times during their tour but it is still a great attraction.

A glimpse of Thai culture through an occidental eye. Ok, so I wasn't very convinced to go here. I thought it would be boring, but actually it is fascinating because the man was a character himself. His love for Thailand is shown in every little piece of art he bought and what they've done with his house now -being open to tourists and with 30 min tours going all day- is fantastic. I think that if you don't know much about Thailand this would be a great starting point.

A BEAUTIFUL LOCATION WITH AN AUTHENTIC THAI RESTAURANT. We visited the restaurant for dinner and had an excellent Thai meal. As you enter, you will find that the restaurant is very artistically decorated with beautiful jars filled with lotus and flowers, and the ambience inside is cozy and comforting. The staff was so courteous, even though they were closing at ten p.m and had little time to take the last order. The chef personally came to check on our meal and we had the most authentic Thai dishes, which will always want to bring us back to this place.

Understand the History of Silk. A place where you can understand the history of Thai Silk, how it get famous and the place that Jim Thompson used to stay. I am quite impress of the architecture of Jim Thompson's house and his collection. The admission is 100bath which include a guided tour in multiple language which will help you understand more on the house. I saw English, Chinese, Japanese & Thai of course. The museum is actually quite small but if you have time, it is worth to drop by. It is very near to the MTR and MBK is just nearby.
Interesting but overdone. The buildings by themseves are interesting to visit . Having to wait and the way the visit is organised is overdone. In the end expenive for what it is..
Worth a look. Really peaceful atmosphere and lots of history about Jim Thompson and the production of silk. If you are interested in that sort of thing u will love it
