When I reached the VAT refund counter, miles away from the entrance, I was told I need to get Customs to endorse the form first!I raced back to the entrance.. only to be told I cannot exit to the public area where the Customs team is. How then? "Ask Singapore Airlines to help"I raced back to the Departure Gate, told the team there my problem. "Do you have the receipt for the purchase". Yes. Wonderful!Thai people are very patient. I can be, too. But I don't have Twelve Days of Christmas...not when I have a flight that is due to leave in 10 mins. After 5 minutes cackling over phones, they offered to buggy-ride me to customs and back. Fantastic!"Do you have the JT purchases to show Customs?" What?!!!! Its checked in ... in my luggage... its on the plane!!A few more precious minutes of ding-donging on the phone, they chorused.... "We will off load your luggage, help you get VAT refund, you take the next SQ flight out - 3 hrs later" (By the way, the next flight was due to leave half-full. My flight is full).Giving the embarkation Gate people benefit of the doubt, I thanked them - and declined to travel 3 hours later as I have commitments in Singapore, my destination, that could not be deferred. I had JT gifts to give as X'mas presents. How ironic!On reflection:It seems the Thai Govt is reluctant to give any refund. Why don't they locate the Vat refund counter near the entrance so that the Vat guy can stamp or endorse anything they wanted cause they have airport passes to go anywhere that we can't?Why don't the VAT guys, on my first encounter, mention to show them the items purchased in addition to just the receipt?WHY WAS'NT JIM THOMPSON's staff more savvy about this to help customers with proper and complete advice to get VAT refunds? Thanks to this nightmare, I will never buy big ticket items or spend on purchases when in Thailand. Hotels, tours, food - items I can't get VAT refunds are still "ON". Otherwise, I'll end up getting VATed again. No wonder Thais are always smiling.All said, I attribute my plight to the source .... Jim Thompson House's staff.They provide a free vehicular shuttle service to and from Jim Thompson House. They have a sign that says so. But no one is in attendance and no time schedule is shown. Queuing is not suggested, nor organised or recognized. But there are lots of staff at the entrance just standing around.When our chartered van came, strangers in the queue clambered on board in a mad rush. Its an embarrassment that could have been avoided. Beyond embarrassment, it is a shame that JT's staff seem to be as lost as Jim Thompson himself - may he RIP.And thanks to JT, it was Barely Xmas for me this year!But Singapore Airlines offering to offload my luggage and putting me on the next flight? Kudos!Here Comes Santa Claus!!! That is the kind of service even other airlines are talking about.

Beautiful Thai house tucked away in Siam district. Absolutely loved the Jim Thompson house. Although we are not big dans of tours, really glad we joined one as learned so much. Our guide was so helpful and sweet, with a great sense of humor. This made the tour quite exceptional and enjoyed it thoroughly.

Good place with a small history. It was a one and half hour visit to Jim Thompson house. The location is not far from Siam central/BTS National Stadium and also well connected by Khlongs.There are timings for the visit. Guide will take you to the each corner of the house and will demonstrate. You may need to wait for the guide sometime. The house is a simple house with garden at the front. You can see tortoise playing there. The whole area was neat and clean. There is free pickup/drop facility available till the nearest BTS/Bus Stop.
Come on.... More hype than expected. High quality good though. Watch out for the scammers that hang out around the street close by.
must see. great-- take the tour. you will learn a lot about Bangkok and Thai culture from the details. Beautiful to see too.
Second trip. Actually been here twice now and second time even better than first. Maybe we were in too much rush first time, this time we had more time to appreciate all the lovely pieces.

Surprising Delight. I was quite pleasantly surprised by this attraction. I don't care for joining tour groups, preferring to ramble about on my own, snapping pictures at my leisure. However, you cannot explore this house unless you are part of the tour, so I reluctantly joined.It turned out to be an enjoyable trip with a wonderful historical perspective about Thailand, rather than a tour about a house. The tour guide was sweet and engaging and clearly very proud of her Thai heritage. I learned a great deal about Thailand, their spirituality, and their national pride. In addition to the historical perspective, she pointed out many unusual decorative items throughout the house which added a bit of fun and corniness to the tour. Very cute. Be sure and look for the 'mouse house' while you are there.

Interesting history, good but slow lunch. The house is very interesting and gives great insight as to the early silk trade and how people lived in those times and what a significant roll Mr. Thompson played in early Thai economics.The house is popular so we decided we had enough time for a leisurely lunch at the restaurant. Service was so slow, we almost missed our tour.

Architectural Marvel in Bangkok. Tucked back not far from an elevated train stop, the Jim Thompson house is an elegant trip back in time. This marvel of architecture will absolutely captivate anyone who loves fine homes and the tour is splendid, detailed and satisfying. Take time to walk about afterwards through the amazing gardens (fish everywhere) and the outbuildings. The silk store is also very impressive and nice. Tired after all that? Jump on the little shuttle for a fast ride back to the elevated train. A gem!

Well worth a visit. This is a little bit out of the way and took a little while to find, but definitely worth a visit. The house is absolutely beautiful and so well maintained. The Jim Thompson was an American entrepreneur who was the founder of the world renowned Jim Thompson Thai Silk Company.
Very interesting. This is a very enjoyable place to visit. I found it fascinating. Very friendly staff and a great ice cream

Worth seeing. I knew that I didn't want to skip this attraction. When you see the pictures it looks so beautiful, but the pictures don't do it justice! They take you on a tour around the place and give you the whole background on Jim Thompson... which is very interesting!

Nice museum with good restaurant. Interesting to see the architecture of the traditional houses, especially Mr. Jim Thompson combined 6 separate houses into a huge mansion with lots of his collection. Should definitely join the 30-min guided tour (different languages are provided) which will give you a much better understanding. No shoe, camera or phone is allowed inside. We also tried the restaurant next to the house, which provide good food with reasonable price. The grilled chicken is the best.You can take a tuk tuk back to the nearest BTS station.
Tranquility in the city of craziness. It's worth a visit to see the old wooden home and beautiful gardens of Jim Thompson's house.I wonder what happened to him!

Well worth a visit. Really interesting to see the architecture of the traditional house and to hear a little of the history of Jim Thompson. Lovely shop selling all sorts of beautiful silk items and more on site too.

great, peaceful museum in the middle of the city. Loved this place - I would live here in a heartbeat.And if you can make your way to the house along the canal/river where there is some amazing graffiti art to be seen. This was a great excursion - I would highly recommend.

The history of Thai Silk. Jim Thompson is the guy that actually brought the silk in Thailand or at least gave it a great value for that matter! It is probably a quite in depth sightseeing to visit as most of the people will get stuck in the shopping centres before Jim Thomspon's house! But if you have some spare time, a quick visit to his house to learn his story and see the tick-wood houses will not harm anyone.

A lovely place to visit. This attraction is something different to see whilst in Bangkok. Considering the location is so close to the hustle and bustle of the Siam and MBK shopping centres it's a quiet and tranquil spot where you can spend a couple of hours. The food at the cafe is very good and the outdoor area by the fish pond is very pleasant. We had an excellent tour guide who was engaging and knowledgeable. Jim Thompson seems like a real character who played a huge role in boosting the Thai silk industry and leaves behind a great legacy as well as a beautiful home for everyone to enjoy.

Hidden Away.. To visit the Jim Thompson House in Bangkok is to realize how the city of Bangkok had changed for the past 70 years. When the house was built, it was considered to be located in the suburb next to a functional canal or klong. Then, Bangkok was the Venice of the East and canals were the thoroughfare. Now the house is in the middle of the city and it is difficult to imagine why it was built as it is. There are many collections within the Jim Thompson House that reflected the past century and well worth to spend few hours in appreciating it.

Pleasant attraction. This is a well run attraction with knowledgable and engaging tour guides and a well presented set-up. Do bring your mozzie spray with you though - I got bitten in the gardens and probably in the house too :-)

Worth to visit . Really an eye-opener tourist spot in learning Siamese silk heritage. This place also provides a solace from the bustling town of Bangkok. It's just walking distance from national stadium bts.

A bit disapointing. We visited here and to be honest it didn't amaze me. We were told by our guide How great a visit it would be and were left a little underwhelmed. Yes it is set in nice grounds and the house is beautiful but there is no real amazement about it as a tourist attraction.

Lovely relaxing place to visit in a busy city. Really enjoyed visiting Jim Thompson's House. Very interesting and peaceful house and gardens. We came back the next night to eat in the restaurant and it was one of the best meals we had while in Thailand. Certainly worth a visit

Love Siams history. And mr Thompson was a nice part of it. Beautiful hot hot (as in moist) compound. The tour is well worth the price and time, try to arrive by khlong boat, for us this added to the expierence. We bought some souvenirs that were packed in a beautiful little bag. Thoroughly recommended!

Why the big deal?. The history behind the location is of interest but the site itself was not particularly impressive. Audio video displays were rather amateurish and not at all informative. The most informative aspect was the people dancing and displaying the unwinding of silk. Although it's not far from a major metro station the signage directing people to it is easy to miss.
History came alive.. Great architectural and historical site in the midst of the busiest shopping belt of Bangkok .Cheap entrance fee , excellent and educational guided tour.
Must visit. Mustn't miss this place. Once you arrive, there will be people there to show you around and talk to you about the history of Jim Thompson. Meanwhile get some souvenirs there.

Such a lovely place. I am deeply moved by Jim Thompson's life story and his house. I think it is really well maintained and it is a must visit for any tourist who is interested in the history of the Thai Silk business and also for Americans who want to relate better to the Thais.

Jim Thompson House. Interesting part of Thailand history - Silk. Jim was an amazing man who sadly disappeared into the jungle. His house is amazing, Thai architecture - all timber no nails. Brilliant tropical garden. Nice shop with interesting things of relevance for sale.

back to the past. It quiet hard to find the JT place but it is rewarded when you reach there .It is like travelling across the time and going to 100 years ago at a time where Bangkok people were using the canals with their small boats.The house of JT is kept in a good condition , it is worth going there.A must in Bangkok.

Tourist destination for caucasians. Were the only Asian in my tour group, and I understand why. There wasn't much sights or information in this place that south-east Asians would appreciate. It was however a nice afternoon spent in a quiet part of bustling Bangkok.
Interesting. A very interesting if rather short tour. Knowledgable guide who spoke good English. Not loads to see but worth a trip if you have a spare hour or two. Reasonably priced too.

Highly recommended!. I've been twice to Jim Thompson's house and had an awesome experience both times. The small entrance fee is definitely worth it considering you get a fluent English (or French...and they offer other languages, too) guide to show you around the grounds and tell you the story of Jim Thompson and his house. This is a very nicely organized museum with a bit of Thai culture involved! It is very small, so the tour doesn't take very long.

Well worth the visit. It has changed a lot since my last visit 15 yrs ago. Back then it was more low key and a bit off the beaten track. No tours. Although I must say that I loved the tour and had an excellent guide.

A tranquil of calm amongst the chaos of Bangkok. As the title suggests upon entering Jim Thomson you quickly forget that you are in Bangkok.There is just a wonderful calm feeling when you enter the site.We had to wait a few minutes for the next tour, but this just gave you more opportunity to taken in the surroundings. The your guide was very good and explained everything. It is an interesting story hearing the life of Jim Thomson.The tour is only about 40 minutes but this gives you plenty of time to get an insight into the life and thoughts of Jim Thomson.Would definitely recommend a visit here.

Easy To Get To !. Take the BTS to National Stadium and follow the signs. When you get to the bottom of the steps double back on yourself then first on your right. It's at the bottom on your left. You can not miss it !
Its a good story. The story of Jim Thompson is very interesting and the house is as well as you learn how the Thai people live in their traditional houses

The most beautiful private home and garden in bangkok. This is much more that i thought it would be......very beautiful gardens as well as a stunning antique collection......very tasteful.......unlike any other in thailand......be sure to go to the little farmers market next door.....small but nice with live music and nice food

So near yet feels so far from the chaos. The Jim Thompson House is near the National Stadium BTS, maybe about a 10 min stroll through a nearby soi (street). Set amid lush settings, it houses many of Jim Thompson's mostly Asian art and antique collections. There is a compulsory guided tour on the main level of the house which require all to remove their footwear. After which, you may wander around the gardens and head to the store for some (window) shopping.Overall the house is pretty well restored and I found it interesting to learn of an American who was so into Asian culture. Once you are done, you may hop onto a buggy which would take you back to your hotel (mainly Siam@Siam, Holiday Inn Express or Mercure & Ibis Siam). Otherwise you will be dropped off at National Stadium BTS Station.

Better than I remembered. I went to Jim Thompson House once years ago. Besides the beautiful teak house, I wasn't too impressed or I didn't appreciate the collection.But this time, I enjoyed it very much: it was well organized from entering the place, buying tickets (Baht 100- adult, 50- children. We had a 9-year-old got in for free), then we were organized to a compulsory tour group. We could choose from English or Chinese. The guide we had was a sweet Thai girl, and she had good information on the history of the House and Jim Thompson. However I wished the pronunciation was clearer. Many times I had to guess what she was saying. I tried to listen to other guides' pronunciation and see if they were better, they also had heavy accent or strange pronunciation. Maybe the Foundation could hire a proper English teacher to help them?The garden was lovely, but we got bitten by mosquitos. Insect spray is necessary to bring!The restaurant is a good place to stop for a meal or refreshment. Moderately priced.

Impressive architecture. This house belinged to a american named Jim Thompson, who moved here and started silk industry. He went missing in a visit to indonesia and now his old house and all the collectibles are a museum. The tour if the hiuse is quite interesting and it costs only 100 Bhat.Visit if you have time.

Another Bangkok must see. What a beautiful house and vision JT had! How wonderful to live in a house like that with so many museum quality pieces. Of course his disappearance just adds to the mystery. Definitely go if you're in BKK.

10/10!!!. Beautiful sights, lovely guides, wonderful atmosphere and fantastic information throughout. Was initially dubious about looking round a random house of an american silk trader but was really interesting and what a wonderful example of traditional Thai housing. Also very pretty fauna and huge koi ponds :) Can't wait to come back and show my partner

A lovely place to visit for 1-2 hrs. What a lovely place, just a short walk from National Stadium BTS. You have to join a guided tour, and we were given a time slot about 30 mins after arriving, which gave time to look around the lovely gardens (and the large JT shop!). The house is so charming and the guide was very good. About 10 people per group and each group well spaced so you never feel cramped or hurried.

A peaceful location. The Jim Thompson house is a really great place to escape the busy centre of Bangkok. The guide telling the story was very nice and very easy to follow with a group of 10 people.Every part of the house has it's own story it's like walking in the dream of Jim himself and see him actually living in that beautiful house.
Nice place in center of Bangkok. Incredible art collection, very interesting Thai architecture (6 houses rebuilt as one) and peaceful garden, 5 minutes walk from BTS National Stadium.
Elegant Products. Brilliant products and of very high quality. Day to day useful and functional products but they are on a slightly higher side.

A touch of the traditional in the middle of the city. Jim Thompson's house is located on a canal in the middle of the city not far from MBK, so when you step into this oasis of lush garden and its traditional Thai style home it is a very pleasant surprise indeed. The restaurant itself has an excellent name in Bangkok, and there are also some charming demonstrations of silk weaving and dance outside. The short walking tours through the house itself are organised exceptionally well, with groups divided into language and friendly and informative guides - I have been twice to this attraction and both times my guides spoke excellent English. The story of Jim Thompson is fascinating, and on top of this his atmospheric home holds some beautiful old treasures. Entry to the house is very reasonable at only 100baht, and afterwards there is the opportunity to browse in the large retail shop selling this famous brand of silk clothing and accessories, as well as a smaller area with books and postcards. I always recommend this attraction to visitors to Bangkok who have any interest whatsoever in history, silk or would simply love to see a traditional Thai home and/or quiet garden with beautiful plants and flowers.

Would love this to be my house. Well worth a visit. The guided tour was done with excellent english and also very informative.
Positioned right on the canal with its lush garden gives you the feeling that you have escaped the "buzz" of Bangkok for a couple of hours.
Nice visit. The house is a Thai style house, greenery, peaceful, very nice atmosphere. If you have time, it worth a visit. However, it is not a must.

Awesome glimpse into 50's SE Asia OSS clique lifestyle, appreciations. LOVE the serenity of human scale living space (VS living large, ornate palaces/temples), APPRECIATION of calm tropical green foliage as a balancing visual peace to the jumble mess of Bangkok concrete jungle, GRATEFUL for the soothing shift of slowed down (s)pace & time into Bangkok in the late 40's and early 50's that we all fondly reminisce about and greatly missed......Definitely a meditation on lost lifestyles as interpreted by the special OSS Gay Clique of more elegantly fun, creative and dynamic bunch that brought into the eclectic mix of Bangkok then---Connie Mungskau's antique shops, Berrigan's Bangkok World first English daily, etc. that began to bridge Bangkok transition into covert colonies of US power in the SEAsia region.2. Restaurant lunch & diverse menu for my December 2013 Daughter's US family wedding guests visit was much appreciated as a cool respite midday break from warm humid Bangkok jetlagged first day.3. Frequent tram pick-up spot for visitors could be more clearly marked on the Kasemsan Soi sidewalk or English sign posted to help those arrived by BTS Skytrain or dropped off by taxi, van, coaches for less chaotic arrival.
Unique gem. Beautifully designed and preserved, excellent guide, good food in restaurant, beautiful but pricey items in attractive shop.

Upmarket. For the discerning traveler, not for the budget conscious. Good shop, real clean and neat, free shuttle, good shows, staff are friendly, restaurant is classy. Just too pricey for the average joe.

Excellent. I love everything about this place its magical especially if you have read William Warrens book about Jim Thompson. the staff are very helpful no shoes in the house (the correct way) its like stepping back in time wonderful don't miss this please.

An Icon of Thai Industries. If you ask people who have visited Bangkok a few times, which Industry stands out in your mind as iconic of essentially Thai. The answer is most likely to be "The Thai Silk Industry" and flagship is the Jim Thompson Brand. For this reason the Jim Thompson House is well worth a visit for the rich history that it holds. It is not only the residence of the reviver of the Thai Silk Industry but a good example of Lanna Architecture. There are many facets to the Jim Thompson House, the Restaurant, the Shop and the House. The Restaurant will give you a taste of traditional Thai Cuisine, the Shop offers the latest in Thai silk offerings. (Everything from ties & scarves to handbags & wallets) and of course the House is a rich finding of what a home in Bangkok looked like back in the '50's of the previous century. Easy access via the BTS Sky Train to the National Stadium and a short walk to the Jim Thompson House. The Jim Thompson Farm is also well worth visiting, but we can cover this in another article

Great place to visit. This is a great place to visit, Jim Tompson was the person who put the Thai silk industry on the map. His beautiful traditional Thai house is well worth a visit, there is a also a lovely Thai restaurant, I recommend making a reservation to avoid disappointment.

Quiet and Tranquil of the man who disappear. Located in quiet corner of the street, the Jim Thompson House which is now a museum is a quiet and tranquil place for those looking to knowing more about his life in Thailand.The antiques and artifacts he bought or donated to him are on display and the guide that comes with the entrance ticket will explain to you many interesting facts about this man who loved Thailand.Knowing that the money paid for the entrance ticket are all part of the Jim Thompson foundation which donates the money to charity organization makes you feel good about going back to this nice place to spend time relaxing in the small little garden.A nice place to visit, just need to squeeze about 1 hour (less travelling time to the place) in your itinerary.

One of the best attractions in Bangkok!. The Jim Thompson house is a must to visit in Bangkok! Tour visits are organized in French and English (since you cannot roam around the house freely). The house hosts beautiful antiques and artifacts collected by Mr. Thompson during his life. You will need to leave bags and shoes in a locker situated at the ground floor of the house. The athmosphere is very quiet and peaceful, which makes the house a corner of peace in the chaos of the city. The garden is beautiful! Don't leave the house without eating or having a drink at the cafe/restaurant, which has a nice setting and tasteful meals.
A good story. Lovley house just beautiful wonderful guides and truly amazing story well told and demonstrate worth going too

Good place to spend an hour or so. A little touristy, but still a nice place to spend an hour or so. Guided tour by the English-speaking guide was informative and interesting, especially the architectural bits of info. The house is well conserved and is a nice contrast to the modern urban landscape surrounding the house.

Interesting, but not outstanding. Our first morning, and venturing out from the hotel on the morning, discovered that this was the closest listed on the top ten must 'do' items in Bangkok. Easily found from the National Stadium station. Quiet and peaceful compound at the end of a side street. We paid our 100 baht, and waited ten minutes for the English speaking guide. To be honest we thought that we would see more about the gentleman's connection with the silk business, but we ended up spending a pleasant hour wandering round the house, historical it may be, and interesting, but it felt a bit of an intrusion into someones personal home. Maybe though, that may have been intended. Well worth a visit, but I wouldn't put at the top of the list.

Oasis in the city. Loved this place, green and shady, full of recent history and his antique collection, very nice cafe too. Gift shop lovely but pricey. Allow about an hour and a half. Close to big shopping malls.

quiet encounter near MBK. if you need some time to escape from all the shopping at siam square try to visit this landmark. Its a beautiful and calm garden about 5 minutes from MBK. From there you can even take a boat taxi ti kao san road.

Interesting.... This a nice quaint house to tour in the middle of the Bangkok rush. They have tours at set intervals where the guides take you around the house. Its lovely to see an American's Thai house and the cultural adaptation that must have taken place. Lots of interesting things to see in the house...don't miss the WCs in the bedroom made for men and women at the time! Also, there is a great cafe on the grounds that serves delicious food....we found the pineapple rice particularly good. And of course the Jim Thompson shop to end the tour with some shopping.

Nice way to understand this legendary Thailand designer. Situated at a easy walking distant after get off at BTS station. A nice way to understand the life and history background of this legendary Thailand designer. Nice half day event at Bangkok metro district.

Glimpse of the Past. As a Bangkok resident, the Jim Thompson House is always one place I take friends and family when they come to visit. The tour is very inexpensive and only takes about 30 minutes or so. It's a great glimpse of how the privileged lived in Bangkok back in the 1940's and 1950's.The grounds and house are impeccably maintained, the tour guides are very competent and help to make the tour more entertaining. They also have a restaurant and bar on the premises, but it's also very close to the MBK Mall and other malls such as Siam Discovery and Siam Paragon if you want more choice. I highly recommend the tour, everyone I've taken there has enjoyed the house and tour.

Interesting to see but not a must. It's interesting to see how foreigners lived in the old days, but there are many other sites that are a lot more typical of Thai architecture and life.The Jim Thompson cafe near the house is great!

A must. You have to visit it here it's a must. We really enjoyed our trip here and found it intresting. The tour guide very good full of info and great at answering questions. You can't believe this house is tucked away from the busy streets of Bangkok and how peaceful it is. The restraunt is also a must food is fab
Not a must. In my opinion, really overrated. Many more places that offer a much more authentic feel. This place is way too touristy.
Excellent example of Thai architecture. The six houses and gardens are beautiful and filled with quality artifacts of Thai culture. The history surrounding Jim Thompson is intriguing.

Interesting. The house is so lovely. I'm glad that i was able to visit the house of Jim Thompson. I'ts so interesting to know how he fall in love with Thailand and make it his home and of course, his contribution to the development of silk in Thailand is something remarkable. Worth a visit.

A wonderful site to see. So interesting tucked away. You have to be taken around with the guides and initially we were not too happy about this, however, the guide was very informative and the tour was so interesting. We learnt a lot about Jim Thompson.
Worth a visit.

So, glad I went!. So, I was totally not going to this attraction, because I just thought meh, but I happened to be in the area and thought why not, and I'm so glad I did. It is a beautiful, beautiful house and setting. So serene and peaceful and a little magical. Jim was also a very interesting Man and it made me determined to dig further into his life. Go !

Interesting tour of his house. After reading a little about Jim Thompson, it was interesting to see his house. I thought the guided tour did an excellent job of highlighting unique aspect of house, his artwork collection and why he built it in this area. The restaurant offers a nice respite from the afternoon heat why you hear the khlong boats race by.
Interesting. An English or French guide takes a small group around the lovely house every few minutes. It's tucked down a side street but not hard to find because of signage.

amazing agent. Inventor of Thai silk and a foreign agent.. The house is wodeen with automatic built in ac.. Something we can learn from today.. Loved the story behind the life of Jim and a fantastic day there

Worth the time ! Definitely go!. Great to learn about Jim Thompson and his life and experience his personal living quarters. Getting to tour his home and see the silk for sale in the store was a real treat. A nice restaurant on the grounds too. Enjoy.

Well worth it, haven compared to hustle and bustle. This is a must on the to do list in my opinion, it is a haven of peace and tranquility versus everywhere else. For your entrance fee you get a guided tour which is actually really interesting, plus you can walk round the albeit it compact grounds. Has a nice cafe also.

Pleasant Respite in the midst of Congested Bangkok. The Jim Thompson house is a pleasant respite from the congestive traffic and mobs of people on the street. The guided tour is offered in multiple languages and takes about forty minutes. Pictures are allowed only in the garden and from outside the house. Exterior pictures of the home fail miserably to capture the architecture and inside design of the house. The gardens are very small, but pleasant. My favorite part of the visit was to have a pint of beer in the restaurant, contiguous with the house. I was not hungry to eat, but the restaurant does offer dining in a nice atmosphere. I sat at a table next to the pool of beautifully colored fish, enjoying my beer while escaping the humid heat of Bangkok. The gift shop also allows no pictures, which is puzzling. It is a nice gift store offering some unique designed material. Jim Thompson is an interesting man leaving his legacy as a great entrepreneur who jumped started the Thai silk trade creating an industry in Thailand for exporting quality silk goods world-wide. I always find it interesting why authorities fail to pursue a DNA of the remains found in a shallow grave several decades later believed to be of Jim Thompson, identifying the remains to determine definitively if they are his remains and then proceeding to do the forensics to learn how he died. The mystery continues.

Stunning art and tranquil environment. Very beautiful and tranquil environment. Loved the garden and interesting architecture. The art collection was stunning as well! Wish I had time to eat at the cafe as well.
gorgeous and interesting. nice gift shop too. This is a must see if you are into history. JIm Thompson was a fascinating character. And the house is gorgeous

Aaaaah......the mystery of Jim Thompson!. The mystery of Jim Thompson still prevails today. He pioneered the high-design silk trade (east to west) and mysteriously disappeared in the 70's. His house is a beautiful hand crafted wood house (old vintage Thailand) and the restaurant, though pricing and a little touristy.....is a must see. Do it!

Superb. Recommended By friend To Visit And Really Glad We Did That. There's A Group Tour With Tour Guide That Will Give You The Information About Places. It is So Beautiful And Peaceful. I Would Love To Have The House Like That. The Tour Guide Is Very Good In English So You Will Get Clear Information. There's Also A Garden And Restaurant For Relaxing. iT Also Provides Tuk-Tuk Service To Drop You At The Main Road Next To BTS. Very Good Service. Would Recommend.

Worth a visit - but read up on the man before hand. After seeing the reviews, I didn't have great expectations, but really enjoyed the visit to the house. The 100baht entrance fee includes a guided tour, but did not say much about the man himself. Therefore, I would read up on him before you go jimthompsonhouse.com
Fabulous.. Worth a visit to see the house, hear about the history and soak up the atmosphere. Definitely worth taking the time to enjoy.

Nice, but nothing really special. If you don't have anything else to do in Bangkok, then come visit this old house. The entrance fee includes a 45 minutes guided tour. You get to visit the small garden and Jim Thompson's house. The house is not very big so there is not much to see. The art collections in house can't be fully enjoyed as the guided tour walk you around the house on a tight schedule.

Interesting visit. We decided to take the Skytrain (National Stadium Stop) to visit the Jim Thompson House. Well worth it, with an interesting tour of his main dwelling. You have to take a set timed guided tour of the building and photos are only permitted outside in the gardens and ground floor. There are a collection of old Thai houses brought together by Jim Thompson, an American who revived the Thai silk industry and later disappeared in the Malaysian jungle. We had a lovely meal at the restaurant there, with a table next to a delightful pool of koi carp

House of Seven Fable. The Jim Thompson House is a popular tourist attraction deep in the heart of Bangkok.The narrative promoted by the museum representatives is one of a dynamic, worldly, and dashing American businessman, World War II spy, and architect Thaiophile who saved the Thai silk industry from extinction. At the height of his industrial career, Thompson 'acquired' six antique homes from Ayuthaya and Bangkrua, unearthed and dismantled them, and sailed them down the river to their present location on a Bangkok canal.The six houses and living room that make up the museum are touted for their period and design authenticity. Yet a counter-narrative emerges that Thompson distorted (perhaps perverted) every design feature, tradition, and custom that supposedly define Thai architecture and design of any period. For examples, he added Western flooring, combined rooms with common 'walls', added Western-style windows, and inappropriately placed Buddhist religious art throughout the Thompson House. I'm no expert but the crooked and warped (re)construction seems deliberately exaggerated for effect. He introduced 'acquired' art work from all over South East Asia to make the interior of the house look distinctly un-Thai.As the tour progressed, I became more and more skeptical about the tour guide's narrative about the unique and authentic cultural significance of the Jim Thompson House.I suspect the historical truth is something a little more base and pecuniary, and perhaps lost to the sands of time in the Land of Smiles and No Straight Answers.

Pretty and interesting building. enjoyed the tour, although it was a long wait. the guide had lot's of knowledge, but how come she did not tell about Jim Thompson being a spy? Very nice gift shop. Super t-shirts in lovely quality, and got a great silk tie! ;)
An overrated tourist trap. Tacky and really just an excuse for the overpriced gift shop. Do yourself a favour and head to a small market instead.
Some good wood. Just went to this place before my flight, very peaceful place in the busy city. nice landscapes , good atmosphere , don't expect much to see , just a relaxing spot.

wonderful place, overcrowded guided tours. a beautiful spot in bangkok- unique art and history. try to arrange for a private guide, since the groups for organized tours are two large. nice cafe in the garden

Nice break from shopping. This was on our doorstep so felt it was a must. Quite a lot of visitors and staff let you know what time the tour is in your language we waited about 10 mins, plenty of guided groups leaving a couple of mins apart which works as they have the same drill. Glad we did tour because you would not have gained the same information about the man and his house and life. Only really touristy spoil was the shop selling silk items and handbags as ever all very nice but high prices. The carp and turtles in the garden ponds were amazing and for 100 baht was a refreshing two hours spent.

A Hidden Gem. Such a haven of peace in the midst of Bangkok's traffic-- both motorised & pedestrian.Beautiful house , showing a man of taste and money --plenty of which you will need if you enter the shop !!!The cafe / restaurant is well worth a visit and good value for money.Entrance is on a timed basis with a guide in your language, so be prepared to wait. There is a gallery which is worth visiting in this time.No photography is allowed in the house--understandable but a pity as there are some beautiful artefacts.

An informative history of the Jim Thompson House & Museum. A friendly and amusing informative tour of the JT House and Museum. The museum price comparatively high but enjoyable to see turtles walking around. An expensive shop.

Beautiful house and well worth a visit, despite the tourist crowds.... We never tire of visiting Jim Thompson's house, even though it's increasingly crowded. The old teak and the artworks are fabulous, the gardens are nice and the small secondary buildings have additional interesting art. We always snatch a meal in the restaurant, too, as the food is good and the prices are reasonable.

Slightly overrated. Interesting history, nice buildings but obvious commercial exploitation of a fellow who passed away almost 50 years ago. Overpriced goods, poorly maintained flora (I am an horticulturist). Not a waste of time but not worthy of a detour either unless silk is your thing.

Peaceful. I have to admit, my low expectations were helpful, and I still cannot put my finger on why I enjoyed this experience, but if you are in Bangkok, this is a must do. The tour is short but very interesting, the scene is both beautiful and tranquil in a city that is usually neither and the restaurant is shockingly good, who would have thought??

An oasis of calm. Nestled in a quiet street minutes away from Siam Square, Jim Thompson's house is well worth including in your Bangkok itinerary. The collection of buildings are intimate and beautifully arranged around lush gardens and ponds. The guided tour was interesting and not too long giving you plenty of time to explore the gardens and outbuildings. I had to admire the style and taste of this man. I wish I could imagine myself living in such beautiful surroundings!

Best attraction in Bangkok for me. I loved it here, everything about it was just great. Although Bangkok is busy, busy, busy, The Jim Thompson House is so calm, quiet and peaceful. At only 100 Baht entry fee it's a real bargain too. They have a very nice restaurant and a shop, obviously. We had a lovely tour from a very cute Thai girl, she knew everything about the houses, collection etc and delivered it in an informative and humorous way. They also had a demonstration of gathering silk in the traditional way.This museum was a real highlight of Bangkok and I'd say not to be missed.

Could be something to do. If one has seen & done most other touristy stuff and has an hour to kill, this could be a place to visit. Nice & luxurious architecture, different from it's time (when it was built), and interesting for its western/asian influences...Else nothing else too special...
Beautiful. Best activity in Bangkok. Great history, beautiful house! Guides provide tours in different languages. Souvenirs expensive. Restaurant with really good food but more pricy.

Nice looking but frustrating for us.... We visited this attraction at 5pm on a Saturday, and having paid for our tour (didn't realise you couldn't just wander around) we found out that the next tour wasn't until 6pm - too late for us... We did have a walk around the gardens which were very nice, and we did get a refund of our entry fee since we couldn't stay, but the experience wasn't great for us. Probably if you go earlier there are more tours and you won't have to wait so long...

Tranquility in a noisy city. The tour of the house is interesting but add extra time to your visit to relax in the tranquil restaurant. The food is wonderful and the setting next to the carp pond is an oasis of calm.
worth a visit. well worth the time to visit, gives a bit of last century history and has a good shop with lots of small and larger presents to take back home. Genuine Thai stuff

Great oasis in Bangkok. If you are wanting a quiet relaxing day in Bangkok full of beauty this is the place for you. The house is a snapshot into a time past in Bangkok. The best way to visit is to go on a guided tour where you will be explained the life of the extraordinary Jim Thompson and how he reinvigorated the Thai silk trade. After the tour spend time in the beautiful garden and then the restaurant to cool down.

Worth a visit. I had written Jim Thompson House off as a boring touristy attraction, but I'm so glad my mom dragged me there. The house in itself is really beautiful, and all the antiques and collectibles inside were impressive. We had a great guide who explained Jim Thompson's story but also made us understand the context of his life and time in Thailand. I definitely recommend a visit, you only need an hour!

Beautiful. It is a beautiful house, very well decorated, everyone must go in a guided tour (no extra cost). Our guide spoke English with very good vocabulary, but strong Thai accent and pronunciation, so very hard to understand. Anyways, the art in the house, and the gardens deserve a visit.

Nice. The Jim Thompson House is a lovely place to visit during your trip to Bangkok. Located not too far from the central areas of the city, you get a good look at an excellent home and can also get to buy lots of lovely Jim Thompson luxury silk products. The gardens are beautiful too.
Good for one time visit. When in Bangkok and you have visited all other the touristic places its ok to visit. Personally i think its good you visit but i don't think its a necessity.

Very much worth a visit. We were not sure what to expect here but - in the event - were very glad that we went. The house is actually comprised of a small compound of native buildings surrounded by beautiful mature tropical plants and pools containing fish and turtles. It is an oasis of peace and tranquility right in the heart of the city. It is compulsory to take a guided tour around the complex - the guides are charming and knowledgeable young ladies. The teak and ironwood construction of the buildings is fascinating - as are the internal furniture and objet d'arts collected by the unfortunate Mr. Thompson before he mysteriously disappeared. The complex is immaculately maintained and contains a bar/restaurant and toilet facilities - both spotlessly clean. There is a very interesting demonstration of the production of thai silk. A visit is highly recommended.

Well worth a visit. If you want a glimpse of traditionalThailand in Bangkok, Jim Thompson House is well worth a visit. Located on one of the many canals in Bangkok, it is a traditional stilted house. And of course he (mysteriously) claims a role in the rebirth of the Thai silk industry - or at least he is marketed as such. But a nice quiet place to escape the hustle and bustle of Bangkok - unless you arrive with a coach party !

worth the visit. I have to admit, I was skeptical about visiting as this was a recommendation from a friend of my wife - I loved it! What an awesome house in the middle of Bangkok - great tour and very fasinating history of Jim Thompson on his influence on the silk industry in Thailand. Better yet was his art collections and how he made his house. My wife made a nice purchase at the gift shop of his silk and we took plenty of photos for ideas to do back our home.

Worth the visit. It's a two hour activity including arrival to the location (-:Upon arrival a stuardes lets you know in which tour group you are, then wait for few minutes and a tour of 30 min begins.I enjoyed the house and artifacts, didn't go to the store and didn't eat at the cafe (-:Because Thompson was an architect, the house is quite unique in the sense it's not just the traditional houses as they were, but altered in a western way. Regarding the art work- it's a cute nice collection, I wish I had a book to read about them more.
Unique. Beautiful home. Interesting story. Not as hectic as Grand Palace or other sights. Nice way to end a day of sight seeing.

Wonderful. Easily accessible via BTS, 4-5 min walk from nearest BTS station, they even have free shuttle to and fro station.Guided tour was very informative, house and surrounding area is beautiful and is situated at the canal, you can hear roaring boat noises in the canal which is at the back of Jim Thompson house.And they have a wonderful restaurant too. Good prompt service and they serve a variety of thai food, food in taste and quality. As this is a tourist place prices are on higher side but worth.
Worth a visit. Interesting guided tour in English, French or Thai.Beautiful building & gardens.Shop & restaurant a bit expensive
The food was good.. Good food in an authentic historic setting. The additional touring of the house was great with very knowledgable tour staffs.
Jim Thompson House!. Jim Thompson house is one of those places we always pay a visit at while in Bangkok! Great stuff at good prices!!!!

Interesting Tour. After going on a Tuk-Tuk scam ride. (If you ask a Tuk Tuk to take you to the Jim Thompson house and they respond it is a public holiday and won't open for another hour, don't believe them and insist on going to the Jim Thompson house). We arrived at the Jim Thompson house and were immediately put into the english speaking tour group. Our guide was entertaining and informative, the house was interesting but the best part of the tour was learning about Jim Thompson and how he revolutionized the silk trade industry in Thailand. After the tour we walked around and spent 15 minutes watching an employee extract silk. Overall, this is an interesting tour and worth a go if you have a few days in Thailand.
Splendid real old thai houses. Jim Thompson story is fascinating and his house shows it clearly, a visit gives more info that anything else.

Nice little treasure hidden in the heart of the city. Very informative guided tour of the whole site. Got an understanding of what the fuss about Jim Thompson and his legacy. We all prayed for him as he disappeared without a trace. Pity that the restaurant is not open for dinner; it was a very nice place to chill and relax, with a couple of drinks.
Don't miss it. Be sure to visit. House and Garden lovely, but the story of Jim Thompson was amazing. Not difficult to get to via the train or cab.

Nice place, but unsatisfactory guide.. It was very well-preserved house with a lot of plants and lots of antiquities. The atmosphere was very unique and nice, but it was just tour-guide girl's accent, which almost none of our group could understand what she was saying, that distracted us most. Other than that, it is quite a nice place to visit and enjoy.

A tribute to an American who revolutionized Thai Silk Indistry. Visited Jim Thompson House and was impressed with the architecture of the traditional wooden house in typical Thai style. Also his collection of artifacts and the way Jim Thompson adapted himself to Thai culture. The guides are complimentary with the visit ticket and speak fairly good english.

Worth the visit to see Thai Houses.. The museum offers an insight into traditional Thai teak houses and a little exposure to Thai history and culture. It is certainly worth the time to visit and do the guided tour. It offers a small insight into some of the mysterious architect. His training shows through in the house complex layout and the ambience and features of the various parts of his final house layout. It is not expensive and, I think, better value than some of the temples.There is a restaurant included in the complex and it offers good food at prices slightly above other choices. Service is good cafe standard and friendly. However, I had a small negative experience when no change was brought back to the table after paying in cash. I queried this event as the change amount was well above any reasonable tip and a service charge had already been added. The explanation was a claimed misunderstanding that I had said the change was not required. In these circumstances I took all my change deciding that the service charge was sufficient tip.You can get here easily by BTS Skytrain (National Stadium station) and there are golf cart shuttle buses available at the beginning of Kasem San Soi 2 or you can walk the short distance.
costly silk dress and morden shop. Not selling Thai silk material and prices are sky high and seem to be high end shop not for value buy .

Not my favorite. We didn't know anything about the Jim Thompson House prior to visiting. However since the house was recommended in numerous travel guides and has high ratings on Tripadvisor, we decided to spend a few hours visiting one afternoon. The house is nice, the antiques are nice, the garden is nice... that is it. Why is this site so highly rated? We found the tour to be boring. Given how many interesting sites there are to see in Bangkok for us this one fell short.

Outstanding teak house and great resturant. Jim Thompson was American who revolutionized the silk industry in Thailand and decided to live there. His house is spacious, open and full of marvelous carved teak furniture of intricate design.The restaurant delicious foodAt first I was loathe to visit but my wife convinced me and I'm so glad she did. Truly one of the great sites to visit in Thailand.
Pleasant visit. Nice to see the preserved home with antiques and art work. Pleasant place to spend a few hours, take the tour and absolutely stay for lunch... The cafe is excellent!
Nice to visit.. This place is worth a visit. Esp. the guided tour gives one a nice impression of the older houses in BKK.

A walk into history. Beautifully reserved Thai traditional house in the middle of the Bangkok City. Very easy to reach by taking the BTS. The once upon the time residence of the Thai Silk King has now become a museum which show cases the various artifact collected my Jim Thompson also a demonstration of a life style at the period. Definitely worth a visit!!!!

Tropical paradise getaway in the city. If I lived here, I'd definitely hang out at the restaurant - it's such a respite from the bustle of Bangkok...sit next to the gorgeous koi pool with floating lilies and have their typical coconut ice cream served in a half shell. So creamy and good. Enough to share. Our guide was lovely and personable but not always understandable, but we could ask any questions. The gardens are inspirational - I'll want to try to replicate one of the floating gardens in a pot. It's a tropical paradise. Come prepared if you like unique and lovely handbags, wraps, scarves, blouses and tops in Thai silk..in the gift shop. It wasn't crowded - we went before noon. Interesting read on Wikipedia about Jim Thompson - and the mystery of his disappearance...and that he was consulted on the wear and designs of the times for the production of the King and I.

Make the effort to visit!. This is a haven of calm in bustling and crazy Bangkok. Don't be put off with it being called a museum - this shows what an imaginative architect can create and was his actual home. What a beautiful place to live in.

Interesting Thai Style Home. Very interesting insight into old Bamgkok from a westerners viewpoint in the early 1900's. Great architecture and lush tropical surroundings make this a good stop to visit.

Bygone time. Travel back in time by visiting this dream house. The setting and fine materials used make you dream of what Thailand was before the concrete jungle...The display is sober yet with historical value. The coffee house a convenient and pleasant stop from the heat. The shop, although expensive, give you an idea of the quality of the quality and variety of their products. Little museums, galleries or even restaurants help preserving what remains of Thai traditional houses.

Very impressed, def worth a visit. We never planned on going here but we were going to MBK and it was nearby. Definitely worth a visit! Can only go round via a group tour but it is a small group and tour only takes 40 minutes. Very informative and the Thai girls do a great job presenting it. The information and history was fascinating. Would definitely recommend to others

Interesting history. We are very interested in architecture and really liked our visit to Jim Thompson house. The tour is really well done and we loved the way the buildings were designed to stay cool (without air conditioning). I would recommend this to anybody interested in Thai history, art and architecture. The grounds were also lovely.
Sightseeing. Fascinated by the story! Staff not great and a bit miserable, restaurant average, but the actual house great, well done Jim!

Remarkable buildings. I had no plans to visit this house, but after my girlfriend told me about his backgrond I got interested.You must have some interest of history, architecture or art to visit this place to enjoy the guiding, but if not, maybe dependent on the guide, you actually can become interested. Our guide was very clever and spoke fluent English (well .. American).There are some nice stories, and the disappearance of Jim Thompson really fascinate me! But of course what he did for the countryside silk producers are remarkable!At the house a couple of people show how to make silk products from the solk worm and to the end product. And one local woman shows a traditional Thai dance. Very beautiful, both the woman and he dance!Average just because I am not 100% interested generally in silk, but for most people absolutely an attraction worth visiting!
Love Jim Thompson. The Thai house is beautiful. Tour is informative, restaurant beautiful and food was delicious. Don't get me started on the shopping. Love Thai silk!

Worth the 100baht!. Enjoyed my visit here. Had a good english speaking guide. Very nicely kept home, get to see the teak home where he used to live in. Very historical too as it contains lots of chinese and thai antiques. Very pleasant gardens. To get a feel of travelling by canal taxi, walk out of the house and go left and turn left again, this little lane takes you to a canal taxi stop about 5mins away. Hop on any boat and it takes you to Pratunam.

Very interesting. Quite easy to find from the skytrain and a really interesting tour from the English speaking guides. A very nice gift shop and also a very good restaurant but this is pricier than others. Free shuttle from the house to sky train is laid on outside by a golf buggy type thing.

a taste history, but not overload. jim thompsons house is somewhere that interested me as it does many others.it is easy to get to using the metro and skytrain and helpful people :)the ticket provides you with a 30 minute tour with a guide who speaks your language (in my case, english).lockers are provided for items including bags and accessories as you are encouraged to only bring water with you.no photographs are allowed inside the house but you can take them in the gardens and surrounding areas, where there are people showing you the spinning and silk worms as a displaythere is a restaurant, shop and book shop too.they supply a free ride back to the main road although its only about 5-10 mins walk if you are able to walktoilets are free i found it worthwhile.

Relaxing and Interesting. This was a great place to go to feel like you've taken a break from the city for a bit. We relaxed in the restaurant and watched the fish in the pond. We also enjoyed the tour and the house itself is quite interesting.

Unexpectedly interesting. This museum is very interesting and has a nice restaurant attached to it with a good range of food and some nice cool air conditioning! The houses have a range of antiques collected by Jim Thompson and an overpriced silk shop attached and a free tour in a variety of languages departs on a pretty regular basis

The charming home of the mysterious Jim. Three residences joined together make this a remarkable home and place for the collection of Jim Thomson. His oritental artifacts are varied and interesting. Adjoining is the showroom for the latest in Thai silk, cotton and linen for first quality in the lovely garden setting. Unique.

A Bangkok Icon. If you are interested in the romance of old Siam, I recommend Jim Thompson's house. Jim Thompson left his mark on Thailand by bringing Thai silk to the world. His covert role during WWII, his influence on renovations of the Oriental Hotel after the war, and his unexplained disappearance in the Cameron Highlands, all ooze mystique. And he created this beautiful home for himself; a place that is every expat's dream. Take a look, and lose yourself in the charm of old Siam, and wonder at the mysteries that surround the architect of this Bangkok icon.

Incredibly beautiful and worth a visit.. I had wanted to visit the JT house for many years now and was fortunate to go there when my host volunteered to take me there. We took the above ground train and it was a short walk. The house is beautiful. If you are into history and Thai architecture, it is certainly worth a tour. Our tour guide spoke good English and she was friendly and informative. The garden below was pretty and one has to let one's imagination loose to picture the high society parties they had there. Wonderful. Worth a visit for sure.

A must see in Bangkok. The complimentary golf buggy picks you at the top the street and takes you to the amazing house. The guide was lovely, knowledgable and interesting. Lovely gardens and we saw some local dancing. Such an interesting and intriguing story. We bought some silk but didn't try the restaurant which looked very nice.

more then I expected. This is worth watching because it is a very quite spot in this very busy city. The tour was nice as well. Nothing over-the-top, but after walking around in Bangkok for a couple of days, this will feel like a breeze of fresh air.
Not my thing. Was in the area and thought I'd check it out. Couldn't understand the guide well and while it's somewhat interesting I wouldn't go out of the way to see it.

It's a house, made of wood, it has things in it...... I visited the Jim Thompson house recently. I went mainly to have lunch there, as it was close to our hotel (lunch was pretty nice). Then decided to pay to be guided around the house, it was only 200baht for two.Basically, let me save you some time. - It's an old wooden house, owned by a rich, American (presumably dead*) and it has some nice ornaments in it. But not really enough personal artefacts to make you feel connected to the owner. I like watching house programmes, grand designs etc, so I am not devoid of being interested in architecture, and frankly, I thought this house was dull. I think if it was left how he left it, a living, breathing, working 'house', then I would have had some emotional attachment. And it would have felt more like a representation of Mr Thompson and not just a sterile, museum-esque building. On the bright side - the tour guide was nice and her English was good.Overall though, Jim Thompson House is nothing more than a shell of what I imagine it used to be in Jims time.I feel like I could have used the time to do some more interesting things in Bangkok. *The most interesting thing about the Jim Thompson story, is that he walked into the Malaysian forest one day, and was never seen again.....
paw great Art collection that's quick to see. Took an hour here on our one day tour of Bangkok. His house is the museum and the tour takes about 40 minutes. Easy to get to and worth the time.

Great little piece of paradise in the centre of Bangkok. It was my second visit, still very interesting. The life of this individual was really interesting and the visit provides a good snapshot of the development of the silk industry in the country

Worth Visiting. Great place to visit when in Bangkok. The entrance fee is very cheap, only 100thb, and you get a fully guided tour of the place. Was very easy to get to using the BTS skytrain, within easy walking distance of one of the stops. The house and gardens are a very nice sight, has a real peaceful feel to it. Highly recommend making this a place to visit for everyone.

Beautiful place. Jim Thompson house is a very special place in Bangkok. It is a gorgeous property with historical significance. Jim Thompson did not just build a house in the heart of Bangkok but he also revived Thai Silk industry after WW2. While visiting the property i expected to hear more about Mr. Thompson's involvement in silk industry but heard more about Buddhism. There was little said about the building and architecture of it and I really wanted to hear more. I also wanted to hear more about the silk production as well and unfortunately the gentleman near the entrance who was working the wheel could not answer my questions.The store on the property has really beautiful high quality products that came with the price.Worth visiting.

Great visit. I've visited the thompson's house during november, it was a great periode.It's a place full of history, you will learn alot about thailand there!After you pay the entrace 100thb, you will asked to join a visit group. The rotation takes 1hour with a guide talking in your language.That's a place to visit!

Special place in Bangkok. I studied Jim Thompson in college and have admired his creative textiles for many years so visiting his Bangkok home was meaningful.
What an oasis in the middle of the city. Even if you are not a textile enthusiast, you will enjoy this home tour and learning more about a very interesting individual.

Beautifully Maintained Home. JIm Thompson, an American who ended up in Thailand after WWII, loved Thailand and built a beautiful home. The home is in excellent condition and represents the traditional Thai home albeit for the wealthy. Jim Thompson aided the development of the silk industry in Thailand among other things and there are some silk production demonstrations at the home. There is also a JIm Thompson store which now is a brand of clothing and fashion wear. The quality is very good although not inexpensive. Look for the beautiful spirit house as you enter the compex!

Worth visiting. This doesn't cost much and is quite interesting. Pay for the informative tour, and see silk being pulled by hand from cocoons.The Thai lady in traditional costume will pose for photos as she dances in the beautiful Thai fashion.I suggest bringing a hand fan with you for the majority of this tour, though there are some fans inside the exhibit.Make sure your socks have no holes, cos you will take off your shoes before you enter the house.The cafe here is cool and the food and drink nice. Try a fresh coconut drink for a true Thai thirst quencher.
Guided tour. Got tour guide to explain to you about the history, the house not much things to see....but is a good experience

Atmosphere atmosphere atmosphere. Its not just the cute girl spinning silk. Its not just the greenery that fills your senses with a cool respite from Bangkok heat. Its not just the wooden floored rooms with breezes that lovingly caresses you as you listen to the stories told.
Waste of money. What a waste of money, time and effort. They make check yours bags and of like mine it dose not fit the locker.. You can't go in ! 100 bhatt waste of time !

Beautiful. This only costs 100 baht (2 pounds) and includes a guided tour. I believe Thai, English, French, and Japanese language tours are available, although there maybe more. The tour guides are very funny and friendly.The interior is lovely (some of the art collections are amazing), and the gardens are very peaceful (The fish ponds are wonderful). For such a small complex, it is well worth the trip.It is very easy to get to from the BTS. Goto National Stadium BTS, walk down a side road and it's a 5 minute walk (There is a shuttlebus service which gooes up and down the road every 15 mins I think).There is a restaurant which serves good food. The only negative is the attached shop - although the items on sale are lovely, and make excellent gifts/souvenirs- they are so expensive, even for tourists. Some items are affordable, but some are way overpriced for what they are.

Jim Thompson.... Shopping??. You should go to Jim Thompson if you have enough time . It is truly not a necassity if visiting Bangkok because firstly, you can find more variety in chatuchak and you can also find it for a much cheaper price. However, do go to JIm Thompson if you would prefer to buy more luxurious goods!

Time Machine. The houses were quite impressive.Feel amazing to walk from room to room,while listening the biography of Jim Thomson. The structure of the house is the most interesting part, and some additional compliment for its interior design by Jim Thomson himself.I even wish that i was one of his friends to be able to sleep on one of this beautiful room. The tour was okay, but i prefer to visit each room by myself (which is impossible). I stayed for another 2 hours only to sit in the garden and strolling around the house. All officers were helpful and offering to help us taking our pictures. Such a romantic and melancholic place to sit and read your book under the giant tree.Feels like we were back to the past, just after the second World War. My favorite souvenir was of course the silk craft and premium dry fruits (try pomelo skin!). I was having lunch on its restaurant but the food was not too great. But again, it was nice only for sitting in the bench in front of the big pond.

Jim Thompson. Loved hearing the story about a single guy brought the silk industry to Bangkok .a hidden gem . There is a lovely coffee shop inside that do light lunches .it is only a short visit maybe 40 minutes .
JT's Teak House. Great visit and guided tour with interesting information. Interesting use of Thai architecture adapted to western tastes.

Favourite place in Bangkok!. It was so peaceful here and an amazing place to visit. So cheap as well, especially because of the complimentary tour. Our guide was lovely, gave loads of really helpful information and had a great sense of humour. Definitely worth a visit if you're in Bangkok!
The must for Bangkok. It is one of the "must" to see in Bangkok, It has been already quite long time and been continuously improving. When i am with some friends visitors, i always recommended.

hidden lives. I enjoyed this visit. I have an interest in S E Asian textiles and appreciated the silk works on display. The house of Jim Thompson left me uncomfortable as his myth and prominence was built on the lives of the silk weavers, designers and dyers who completely disappear in this version of Thompson's success.

SUAY. We decided to go one afternoon and we're so happy we went. Not only is the entire place absolutely gorgeous but you learn quite a bit throughout the tour. If you bring an ID card saying you're under 25 it's 50 baht each, or otherwise it is only 100 baht. This includes a guided tour which is done in a few different languages. Here's our blog post about our day from the Jim Thompson house :)http://oywir.com/2014/10/jim-thompson/
Fun experience. This was a fun experience in Bangkok to get a little insight into the history of the silk trade and traditional thai architecture.

Beautiful Teak Houses. Jim Thompson's House and Museum at only 100 baht for a guided tour of these beautiful teak homes and gardens. Our guide was very informative and answered any questions that were asked. You are allowed to walk around the gardens after you finish your tour. They also have dancers and show how to spin silk.This place is like a little oasis in the bustling city of Bangkok. We also had lunch in the Jim Thompson restuarant and it was reasonably priced and the service and food were good.

A beautiful setting. I thoroughly enjoyed our visit to the Jim Thompson house. The setting is wonderful and everything is very well maintained. Our guide was very informative and happy to answer any questions. The house is beautiful and the tour was very interesting. It's a lovely bit of peace and quiet in such a busy and vibrant City.

Incredible architecture and great day out. Anyone interested in history or architecture should visit here. It was a less busy attraction in Bangkok than many of the temples and surrounding areas. Fascinating to walk around and made a pleasant trip to fill an otherwise empty day in the city.

Lovely piece of tranquillity in bustling Bangkok!. Fantastic and educational visit to Jim Thomson House. Staff and guides are lovely and the house itself is stunning. Would highly recommend a visit as an alternative to visiting the temples.

JT...there should be a movie about you?. Wow imagine life as an intrepid traveller through out Berma and Siam. Jim Thomson you did it in style and with such mystery?You're story should be heard more. I only hope that one day we would know more about you and the rebirth of thai silk.So lucky to have been shown you're home by the funniest Thai guide. Who was ever to know that the Thais have such a wicked sense of HUMOUR. The class and style developed in the early years of this industry is truly inspirational. So glad you neutered the life of thai silk to what it is known today. So much history and little do we know, Jim Thompson?
What a spot!. Small piece of heaven in down town BKK. A great place to pick up some upscale silk items. Beautiful place to chill out a have a light lunch.
Reminded us of Hawaii!. Beautiful, lush surroundings for their restaurant. Very pleasant way to relax after the tour, great coffee!

Interesting and pleasant. Not sure what attracted me to come visit Jim Thompson's house, perhaps it was the mystique or just wanting to see a piece of the 1960's preserved in modern day Bangkok.In this visit I got a little of both, a more in depth understanding of the man behind the myth and also to see first hand how Thai houses may have looked 50 or more years ago. It is definitely a worthwhile trip.

Historic place. I didn't know much or anything at all about Jim Thompson prior to touring his house. The 100 baht entrance fee is a bargain for a little taste of Thai history. I also was impressed on the number of different languages tours they offered. I also liked the free shuttle service they offered to the main road. Not only you get to learn about Thompson but u are taking a look at a snapshot on how they lived in that era.
Wonderful Story. The Jim Thompson House exceeded what we had expected as it has a very great story behind the building and to walk through it was magic.

Worth going here. I walked to Jim Thompson's from my hotel and it was well worth the walk. It is worth going just to see the fabulous old-style Thai houses. The garden is beautiful as are the antiques in the house. This is an organised our though the house and it is done vey well. Jim Thompson's story is an interesting one to hear. There is a shop and cafe here as well.

An oasis of peace.. Loved the beautiful art works in this house and the informative way in which we were shown around. I couldn't believe that, although it was clearly requested that we did not take photographs inside the rooms, some people totally ignored this. The gardens are beautifully tranquil. Very nice to get away from the hustle and bustle of busy Bangkok! Well worth a visit.

Worth a visit. If in Bangkok, this is a must see attraction. Well worth a visit. Seeing the origins of silk and seeing silk being spun from coocoons is fascinating. The tours are very informative, the architecture is very interesting and the ancient artefacts, paintings and statues on exhibition are all worth seeing. Jim Thompson House is located next to a Klong (canal) where you can access a long tail water taxi after only a short walk along the canal. This is also a must do activity as you get to see how life is on the Klongs and you get to experience another side of Bangkok life.

Tranquil & intriguing. A refreshing change of pace from the furore of Bangkok. Beautiful house with a lovingly cultivated collection of Asian artifacts, an insightful tour of the property & very gracious host.Definitely worth a visit if in need of a peaceful interlude in the midst of Bangkok.

A Gem in BKK. Absolutely beautiful Thai architecture and garden. Located right next to a khlong and to BTS. Very nice interiors. Smart guides that bring you into the world of Jim Thompson. Very enjoyable but a bit pricy.

When you're tired of Wats - check it out. The Jim Thompson house is just a bit down from Siam Square and is a nice change from the shopping centres and temples. The art and tour is great with an interesting perspective on the art, silk industry and of course Jim Thompson.
very cool. definitely worth checking out- fantastic structure and interesting history- do not miss- also do not get scammed into being dropped off at the silk shop-

More recent history of Thailand. It was good to see what a typical wooden Thia house used to look like, there were some very interesting artefacts from the bygone Thia era, very interesting and well presented well worth a visit, one has to wonder what it was like living in such a house although the guide said these houses still exist in rural Thailand

Great find for tourists. The Jim Thompson House wasn't on our radar for sightseeing. It was a great find. Lovely location, fascinating story, and high quality fabrics at affordable prices. Recommend that serious shoppers hunt down the Outlet Center too!

Great visit. Well worth a visit when in Bangkok. Easily reached from the BTS station which is a short walk away. I found this to be a very relaxed attraction and away from the noise of the Grand Palace area. The included tour guide was very friendly and knowledgeable.I also ate in the restaurant here which was very tasty and reasonably priced.

i really liked it!. an interesting place!so closed from the BTS!i liked this area!full of history, a red house with especial architecture!u will find guide who will make a tour in the house where u cann't take icture!but you will have all the informations!a wonderfull place!u can also try the traditionnal machine to make silk!u can eat there in the restaurant!and but some souvenir or silk which i fund so so expensive!

An urban haven. This is a wonderful example of adapting traditional Thai architecture to Western taste. Several houses have been joined to create one large one which is filled with beautiful treasures.The guides are very knowledgeable and it really is worthwhile the visit. You can either reach it by BTS or by the khlong ferry.After the tour one can stroll through the garden and see two more small houses by oneself. The bookstore and the general store have lovely merchandise and for once one can get postcards here !There is also a useful shuttle back to the BTS.

A must see!. This is a wonderful way to spend half a day, in a beautiful and tranquil setting. The mandatory guided tours are very informative and as always the guides delightful. It's well worth taking the public taxi boat back from the canal right next to the house. It's great fun, and watch out for the roof which lowers as you speed towards low bridges.

Mystery Dissapearance. This incredible story of the man that virtually engineered Thailand's silk industry and ultimately dissapeared in mysterious circumstances, his remains never found. Thompson's home reconstructed from several authentic Thai building he connected to form one house. Filled with his beloved treasures, and set in a beautiful location with lotus in abundance.

Little oasis in hectic Bangkok. Very well-keptet, green place in the middle of hasty, loud Bangkok. Good tour with interesting information about the architecture of the teak-houses, the silk production and the life of Mr. Jim Thompson. Also for kids not too boring. Beautiful silk products in the store. Tasty food in the restaurant at a pond with Koi-fishes and waterlilies. They bring you back to the BTS Station National Stadium for free. It was just a pitty that our tourguide has spoken an inarticulate "thai-english".

Perfect ! Don't worry if you don't know anything !. I'm been following Jim Thompson trail from Cameron Highlands to Bangkok, the story fascinates me. This place is a perfect to spend your afternoon and learn more about him. Even you know nothing of the story, you can start learn from this trip. The guide will explain it to you so you won't miss a thing. The house is very beautiful and the ambiance so perfect to just relax.

a must. I have visited this extraordinary museum every time I have passed through Bangkok and found something different each time. The house itself, made of hard woods, a series of traditional houses on stilts, filled with religious and antique artefacts; the gardens filled with exotic trees and flowering shrubs; the pond, fish and out-sized pots filled with miniature lillies and minnows. This time I crossed the klong at the back to find a small thriving village of weavers in the heart of Bangkok.

Very interesting tour. The story of Jim Thompson's life and accomplishments in Thailand are fascinating. Moving to Bangkok after WWII, he single handedly revived the dying art of Thai silk, and built a successful silk business around it. An American architect by trade, he journeyed around Thailand, selecting six traditional Lana style houses, had them dismantled and shipped to Bangkok, where he used his architectural talents to redesign them into one very beautiful home. The house is filled with Thai artifacts of historical and artistic significance. The gardens are incredibly beautiful. The restaurant on the grounds also serves excellent meals. This is well worth the time spent.
