Oasis. Located in the center of Bangkok, Jim Thompson's house feels like your out of town. The perfect escape from crazy traffic and noisy shopping streets. Getting here is no-brainer: it's 200 meter from the National Stadium skytrain station, there's even a free shuttle with golf carts (handy in case it rains) - so don't even bother to negotiate with tuk-tuksThe houses are filled with antiques - the tour is excellent (100 Baht) - the garden a true oasisOr you can just relax on the terrace and enjoy excellent food (count 150 baht for a great local dish - the white chocolate cake is out of this world). Service is probably the best in Bangkok.Merchandise store is premium - you get better stuff for your buck elsewhere. Let the mind talk, not the heart.A classic stop in Bangkok.
Beautiful Structure. Beautiful teak construction with exceptional antique Buddha sculptures. Restaurant was fantastic and gift shop worth a visit for silks and gifts. Tour was very well presented.
jo. I have read a book about him , it was great to visit the house , it has a great display of events and photos of the era , loved it .
Worth the trip. The tour of the Jim Thompson House is a journey back in time, when the Thai silk trade was re-started by American Jim Thompson. Worth the modest admission charge

Authentic. This was easily the most interesting and enjoyable part of our 3 night Bangkok stay. We had two hours there, close by the MBK shopping complex . Stunning gardens and architecture, the tour was well conducted and excellent, quality shopping at leisure, the silks were exquisite. All hassle free. We returned last night to the bar and restaurant, food was fantastic and affordable. Wine is expensive apart from the local varieties. The Jim Thompson story is fascinating, entry fee was minimal.

Make the effort to see it.. Situated by MBK Jim Thompsons house gives a chance to see Thai buildings the way they were before the high rise. Interesting rooms and some great stories about the man. Well worth a visit.
Fascinating story.. Very interesting tour, leaving you mind-boggled to what actually happened to him? Ended the visit with a lunch at their cafe, great Thai food in a charming old Thai house.

Average. Interesting place to visit in the middle of Bangkok. Free shuttle service was provided from Rama 1 road (main road) to the entrance of the Jim Thompson House. The attraction didn't meet expectations.
Beautiful buildings.. It is worth going early as by the time we left it was becoming busy. Beautiful old style buildings with lots of artefacts to enjoy. Well worth a visit.

A Short Pleasant Excursion. This short trip (takes about 1.5-2 hrs to complete the tour and look at the merchandise) was a welcomed changed from the shopping and eating that is bountiful in Bangkok. What a better way to experience the mysterious tale of the late Jim Thompson who kicked off the silk trade in Thailand and to enjoy the architecture of the beautifully preserved house he built. His collection of ceramics and other art forms (scultures, carvings) will definitely ooh and aah those who appreciate such things. The tour guide we were assigned had a good command of English and was delightful in rendering an explanation of each room and the articles in it. The guides also speak other languages...I heard a guide speaking Mandarin and another Spanish. Am not sure of what other languages are provided.
Wow. Extremely interesting historically. Jim Thompson's disappearance is still an enigma. Very pricey, but would not have missed it.

Interesting story!. The tour provided when visiting the Jim Thompson house was excellent, very informative and interesting with some good anecdotes, particularly about his disappearance. The gardens are also lovely for a walk around and the adjoining restaurant serves some nice food!
Nice selection of quality merchandise.. Visited this store and purchased a shirt and tie. Very good qualitymerchandise though on the high priced side. Nice store to shop at.

1 in top 10 to visit in Bangkok. Been there once . Easy to get there by BTS from Siam station. Good place to see how to make the silk . I love Jim Tomson ' s house . Really Make you feel very clam and relax . There 's have a guid to tell you about history about Jim Tomson as well. Only one thing that I don't like is walking with out the shoes on. But I do understand the reason why ( to keep it clean and more respectful )But like everyone to see how good and how interesting there
Nice house with a history. A liked the thai style and the story of Jim Thomson. The house is on a nice location. You get a very good impression how Jim Thopson was living in Bangkok

Easy access via Skytrain to National Stadium stop. Lovely but pricey gift shop. Great textile exhibition was on while we were there - it was superb. Away from the hustle and bustle of the city. There are ongoing demonstrations of silk weaving, silk thread making and Thai traditional dance.

Oasis inside Bangkok. A lovely retreat from the bustle of BKK. The collection of buildings that make up this attraction are delightful and a must for any art and architecture buff. The gift shop has lovely items (most of silk), but you can save quite a lot by visiting the Jim Thompson outlet store that is further afield.
Nice piece of history!. If you fancy a quiet hour or so finding out about some of the local silk history then this is for you.
Excellent history. My husband really enjoy this place , was very busy and hot but glad we went. Liked the history of this place

Fascinating. My wife and I love Jim Thompson products, so it was wonderful to be able to visit his home. Well worth the visit. We also took the opportunity to visit the JT outlet store on our recent visit to BKK.

View of the past. Great, if sweltering, visit to Jim Thompsons house. The guided, shoeless tour around the various rooms and buildings of the compound he put together after the second world war really gives an insight into life in post war Bangkok, abliet for an affluent expat.The various buildings have been very well preserved and give an indication of Thompsons eye for style and design. Add to this the mystery of his disapperance, it is well worth the stiffling temperatures in some of the buildings, very thankful for the huge rotating fans in most rooms. Beautiful collection of traditional Thai buildings in a very attractive setting. The shuttle buggie back to the main road is also a nice touch. Highly recommended.

Lovely and Interesting. We were in Bangkok for a family wedding. We had not heard of the Jim Thompson House, until we read a list of the top places to visit in Bangkok. The history of the Jim Thompson himself, his house, and of the silk industry was very interesting. Later at the wedding reception, to our surprise we were presented with items purchased from the Jim Thompson House, as presents for attending the wedding. Lovely quality items and very glad to know the history of these items.
Wonderful atmosphere. Wonderful old world charm and knowledgeable guides. The garden was very peaceful. More information on the small side collections would be useful.

Lovely home and garden. The Jim Thompson House was a great experience. The art collection is amazing and the guided tour makes these artifacts come to life. Lovely silk items are available in the arts center - we shopped.

Average Attraction – 2.5 out of 5 rating. Jim Thompson House is approximately a 30 minute shuttle bus ride from our ship terminal and is located in the downtown area surrounded by modern buildings and the canal at the rear.Upon arrival to the House via air conditioned mini-bus, the entrance had a display on Thai silk making and native Thai dancing.I won’t go into the history of Jim Thompson, other than he is credited with the revival of the Thai silk industry. It is sufficient to say that Thompson House is a collection of buildings including Mr. Thompson’s living quarters and collections of Asian artifacts.For the first 30 minutes or so, we were able wander around the tranquil landscaped grounds and some of the open structures. After that, we met our pre-arranged Thompson House tour guide. This young Thai lady had a good command of the English language and we had no problems understanding her.The guide basically led us through the various structures and gave us tidbits of information on the history of the structures and the art collection and treasures.The Thompson House tour lasted approximately 1.5 hours.I’m not into this kind of attraction/history. It was interesting. However, if your travel itinerary has time constraints, I personally would not consider this a priority attraction. You would be better off spending time going to visit the temples and other attractions.I would rate this attraction as average - 2.5 out of 5 rating.Notes and Tips• Inside the entrance there is a retail shop selling silk clothing, accessories and souvenirs. The prices, in my opinion, are comparable to Western prices.• Photography is prohibited inside the house.• Going through one of the buildings, we had to remove our shoes.• Thompson House is less than 800 meters (1/2 mile) from the MBK Center (shopping mall)• This was day 1 of 3 of our Bangkok tour through Wandee Tours. Our tour guide Wandee spoke fairly good English; good enough for us to understand.• After the Thompson house tour we visited the Golden Buddha, toured Chinatown and the flower market.• Days 2 and 3 included tours of the Grand Palace and temples, train market, canal boat tour and floating market.• Our ship the Azamara Journey has room for 700 passengers and because it is a smaller ship, it can dock “downtown”. The larger ships dock farther away resulting in longer transportation times to the downtown core.• The first thing I noticed while I was on the tour bus was the amount of traffic on the roads. Regardless of the time of day it appeared that “rush hour” was all day and evening. Furthermore, the shoulder of the road becomes an “extra” lane.

A must do. I have been to BKK about 15 time and finally got around to doing the Jim Thompson house tour. It was so informative and fascinating. I even went to the seconds place and bought up for other people. The items are such good quality and such an interesting story

nice house with good story. Nice and green house. The house is kept in the good condition. It is nice to walk in the green and well decourate house.I like the way they arrange a tour,nice presentation. I suggest to come there around 10-11 am, get a tour, then lunch and shopping at Jim Thompson shop.

Lunch and shopping at Jim Thompson House. Went to Jim Thompson house with a friend and had lunch in their restaurant. Very nice and a lovely shop to just browse around and purchase. Fabrics are just beautiful.
great food. fantastic atmosphere and superb thai food.Exhibition of traditional thai silk and other goods were really good. the Thal music on display was bery good

Good way to Know Thai traditional house..... Last time I visited this Museum is over 10 years ago. The house didn't change, but they offer more language optional. It's a very good way to know Thai traditional house if you don't have chance to visit the northern of Thailand.

Visited just to see the beautiful gardens. I wished I had actually taken a tour here, but we just visited the grounds (for free). The house is surrounded by lush greenery and beautiful, tropical flowers that are the perfect backdrop for photos. I wish we had spent an hour or two taking a leisurely tour though. I would consider this if you have several days in Bangkok.

Beautiful setting!. Have been here twice, first time was about 6 years ago and it's gotten more touristy but still beautiful. And now they have a restaurant with great food and wine selection with A/C if it's super hot! A really informative tour and beautiful Thai architecture to check out!
Thai silk romance. Wow, I never knew how the late Jim Thompson single handily revived a dying trade. Love what the foundation has done to showcase the rich history behind it all. Must do!

Great Place to Bring Guests. Nicely done, the Jim Thompson House and Museum is a great place to bring guests. The tour is fun and the staff is well trained and very friendly. There's a small silk shop for souvenirs, and a great (and air conditioned) Thai restaurant - the food and desserts there are really delicious!

Lovely place. Very easy to get to, just a short walk from the skytrain. You are guided around the house & the tour was informative & interesting. No photography is permitted in the main house - probably so as not to impede other visitors, which is nice. The house itself is very pretty & well worth a visit. There is also a restaurant which has a good variety of different dishes on the menu at very reasonable prices, it also has probably the most pleasant public toilets in Bangkok

What a selection. Spend some time in this great shop. The selection of superlby crafted silk gifts and garments were simply amazing. Loved the decor of the shop the Colors of the silk and the Prices were really a bargain. The Service very friendly but a bit to evident. You have someone follwing you wherever you go so that they are there when you Need them. This is a bit too much for me but other than that loved it and will be back.
Great place very interesting. Look round and see this amazing collection . Wonderful place ! It's well worth taking the tour with an interpreter .

Lovely place. Great place to visit, English your
guides, lovely gardens and easy to get to from the national stadium (sky train stop)....

a must visit. this is a terrific location; the wife can go for the tour of the house and you can sit in the restaurant enjoying a cold one, then a little shopping in the gift centre, and everyone is happy. this is a must see for all tourists to Bangkok. easy to get to, directly from the bts

Cool Story ... but Not that Impressive.. Yes - the structures are very classic Thai construction and history buffs will want to see them.Yes - the collections inside are interesting.Yes - the tour was decent, and they speak pretty much any language there for tours.but...You can't stick around in each room long enough to ask any thorough questions about the collection pieces. You can't take any pictures at all, except in the waiting area outside.This is basically a private house of a very famous man, who is interesting and great, but that's all it is. It's not his silk workshops, it's not a biography, it's a very nice house with a lot of backstory ... that you can read about in a guidebook or pick up the brochure for free. :-/

What a lovely surprise. We were taken to this 'museum' having known nothing of it and were pleasanty surprised. If I could have had a house in Thailand it would look like this! The story of an American expat that decided to live in Thailand and revive the Thai silk trade is an interesting and informative one. The the tour is brief +-45 min but they have several language tours available and the friendliness of the staff wonderful. It is worth visit if only to view the old architect dream come to life and enjoy a brief moment of peacefulness in the buzzing city of Bangkok. The price tag of the silk products though is steep.

A taste of the good old life. I want to live in Bangkok and have a house like this! The story of Jim Thompson is an interesting one and his death or disappearance mysterious. A great place to visit to get inside a beautiful expat colonial home. It's decor is simple but stunning. Def worth a visit to escape the whirl wind of the city.

Nice tour, great shop and beautiful sights!. I arrived with friends knowing nothing about Jim Thompson. The silk production outside and the dancing Thai lady were neat to go along with the setting. The property is very green and has tons of flowers and koi ponds. The tour cost 100BHT and took approx 45 minutes. The house was very neat with the artwork, sculptures and architecture. I am not a very artsy person, and still enjoyed this attraction,The giftshop sucked us in and although I didn't intend to buy anything, I did t leave empty handed.This site is a nice break from the hustle and bustle of crazy Bangkok.

Wonderful and refine escape from the city - in the city. Entrance is 100 BHT (adults) - and with that you get access to and guided visit of the house - in you preferred language (I heard French, English, Chinese...). In addition to access to gardens (not huge... but wonderfully tropical).By the canal, the house no longer has direct access but still is at the foot. all-dark wood house surrounded by tropical gardens and filled with centuries old Asian art and antiques, gathered by a very interesting figure to get to know. A bit frustrating: no picture taking inside the house... I recommend, if like me you like a break from temples and shopping ;-) On the premises also : bar/restaurant, JT boutique (silk et more) and a museum (not sure about latter - did not spot). 5 mns walk from National Station subway station. if that is your chosen transportation.
Silk at its best. if you want the best of silk this is the place to go for expert advice and high quality products. Any Hotel can arrange transport to the address.

FINALLY WE FOUND OUR WEE PIECE OF TRADITION/CULTURE IN THE CITY!!!!!!!. They probably are too, as I ended up buying things in their shop unintended!!!! We were staying at the Pathumwan Princess and just crossed using the skywalk and walked 200m along the main street's sidewalk - checking out little shops along the way down to Soi 2 and caught their courtesy shuttle down that street to Jim Thompon House. Very easy. What a beautiful setting in the midst of the big stinky city. Lovely gardens and I felt we finally got that bit of Thai culture that I wanted to show the kids (yes my fault for taking them to Phuket!!!) a traditional Thai dancer, and the silk production display to start with. You do the 45min compulsory tour with a guide and look at the gorgeous artefacts collected by Jim Thompson. It may have cost 250 baht for 2 adults and a teenager, young boy was free. Yes you do lock up your belongings before entering, but we at no time doubting the professionalism of this whole arrangement - 5 star service and staff. Very interesting - kids loved the turtle and croc fish in the pond. We had coffee and cake after, then spent some money in the shop (which I do believe is a little pricier than other shops, but hey if you are there just do it, I only compared to the airport version which was slightly less like say 50baht on a 1000baht item) Very very worth while if staying close by!!!!!

Interesting and instructive.. The house is so nice and the architecture is great. Thze guides are very good and all languages you can have support. I was so surprised about the life of Jim Thompson. he deserves a movie about him. A very unusual man with a great destiny. also so secret and misterious. It's a must if you go to Bangkok.

One of Bangkok's best. I went to Thailand lacking any particular knowledge of silk, but ended up visiting Jim Thompson's house not once, but twice. The information you get from the guides is so interesting and the history of the man behind it as well as the house. The structure is stunning, truly Thai. The shop next door is also incredible, and we spent a fair amount in there. If you are going to purchase silk, let this be the only place for it.

Beautiful. Well worth a quick visit, if for nothing else but to see the beautiful collection of artifacts that Jim Thompson collected on his travels around the region. A very peaceful oasis within the madness of Bangkok.The tour is brief, but the guide had a wonderful sense of humour, and was interesting to listen to. You are free to wander around and take photos in the gardens for as long as you would like, but no photos inside the house.

Nice place for bits of jim & silk's (his)story & thai's culture but products are expensive. It is a walk away from trains station so an easy place to stop by. Minimal time to spend in jim thompson's house tour since it's a small place. Suits for travelers who are interested in history&culture. It also got a shop of their products but prices are expensive and no photos allowed inside the shop.
Beautifull!!. Get there well on time! The name is well known so it's quite expensive... there are other brands you can have quality silk.

Nice Little Visit. Cute place. Nice to hear about the life of Jim Thompson.And being down a back road near the canal, the whole complex will instill a sense of calm in you after travelling the busy streets of Bangkok.

Limited Variety and expensive prices. Visited this place by recommendation, but not satisfied. The prices are on the higher side, but you can get better choices outside at other places. I don't think its worth going at this place.

If you have time to kill.. If you are already near MBK and you have extra time to kill, hen go see the house. Otherwise, I would not describe it as a must-see while in Bangkok. Most hotels also have a Jim Thompson shop if you really want to buy JT silk.
Very peaceful, great history. The gardens were beautiful, the house is amazing and you learn a lot of history and culture.The shop is nice to look in and its good to watch a silk making display.

A lovely place to unwind in the city. Very well organised attraction with a nice cafe/restaurant to cool down in before a tour of the property.The guide spoke excellent English and was very enthusiastic about the house. She clearly loved working there. I was taken in a small group of people though the property at just the right pace and with plenty of interesting information along the way. It's a beautiful house and well worth visiting.

Thai heritage. Well organised tourist attraction. You can only go through the house on a guided tour. No photos can be taken inside but once you are outside you can wander around the gardens and take photos. Has a shop which sells a wide range of silk products and a restaurant which has great salads. Try the lemongrass juice - refreshing on a hot and humid day. A fabulously restored house and it houses some great artefacts.

An oasis of calm. Beautiful gardens wonderful atmosphere, seems a million miles away from the city. It was quite a few years ago when I went but I remember how lovely it was there. Very lush tropical garden.
Oasis in the city. Loved the tour of the Jim Thompson House. Its an oasis in the middle of the city and great to get away from all the noise and people in Bangkok
A beautiful landmark.. A good example of traditional Thai architecture with very interesting history of the house and owner. Also a lovely restaurant and gift shop. A must see when visiting BKK

Beautifully preserved. A beautifully preserved piece of Thai heritage and architecture, the house features Thompson's own private collections as well as his eye for gorgeous artefacts. We really enjoyed this little historic piece of heaven in the middle of an otherwise busy, modern metropolis.

Very interesting . We came here due to all the good reviews and were really pleased we did. It's cheap to get in, if under 25 take some ID and it's half price, something we wish we knew. You are taken to a waiting area for the next tour. It takes about 40 minutes for the tour who takes you around the garden, in the house and it's out houses explaining various elements of the architecture and of jim Thompson's life and job. Very knowledgable, after the tour you are left to own devices can look around again. We were impressed and would come here again, good history and very pretty.

Interesting architecture, great collection of artefacts. I visited the Jim Thompson house on recommendation of a tour guide on a different tour. Within walking distance from Siam Square, this little sanctuary of history was not expected. After paying my entry fee (50THB for those under 25 - 100THB if over) I was warmly welcomed into the garden of Jim's house. The tour began promptly, the guide spoke English very well and was very knowledgeable about the items in the house, the architecture and Jim Thompson himself. I had no knowledge of the subject so was entertained and informed by the end. My only annoyance was others in the group tour who expressed their displeasure with the following: having to check your bags, having to take your shoes off and not being able to take photos within the house. These are pretty acceptable expectations (in my eyes) for a place of this nature, it protects the wood of the flooring, the delicate silk and the artefacts from being knocked over! Overall I was pleasantly surprised with my visit, it was very enjoyable and I would recommend it to anyone staying in I around Siam Square who is a little sick of shopping!

Must see when in Bangkok. A beautiful place to plunge into Thai culture and way of living by the river. A great chance to see the rare pieces of art collected by Jim Thompson. A 40 minute tour around the property presented by a staff with a good command of English. There is shop to buy Jim Thompson labelled souvenirs and restaurant to enjoy Thai cuisine delights. Don't miss the book shop (which used to be a garage) with some interesting read on Chinese horoscope. Have some Thai tea at the restaurant and enjoy the water taxis passing by.

A Glimpse into Old Bangkok. This wonderful teak built house. once the home of Jim Thompson, (he of silk fame), who disappeared many years ago whilst on a business trip in the region, is a treat to see. One of my favourite things to do in the City and good for adults and kids too!

Fun and interesting tour of Bangkok landmark. My husband and I visited Jim Thompson House on the first full day of our honeymoon. It was a decent walk from our hotel (Renaissance Bangkok) - maybe 20 minutes or so. My guess is that it would take a little less time, but we were walking in the middle of protest pop-up markets so it took us a little longer. Anyway, we got to the street leading to the house and were greeted with a golf cart that was shuttling guests to the house itself. We opted to walk the rest of the way, but I am sure it is very helpful for older guests to the house. The grounds are very well kept and very conducive to large crowds. We arrived without a tour reservation and only waited 20-30 minutes before our tour started. The grounds are equipped with a restaurant and a very nice and air conditioned gift shop. The gift shop is a little pricey, but we got a few goodies there for a reasonable price. The tour was very interesting and informative. The grounds are small so there isn't an incredible amount to see, but the architecture, furniture and artifacts in the house are beautiful. Our tour guide was very friendly and spoke very good English. Once our tour was over we were able to still walk through the grounds, which we liked a lot. We got to spend more time in the outdoor areas of the home, too. I think this tour is a must-see in Bangkok, but isn't as dramatically breathtaking as some of the temple tours, etc. Jim Thompson was an American so his house is an interesting Bangkok attraction. It was still interesting and added to my knowledge of Bangkok/Thailand history. One last tip: No photos on the tour, FYI.

Relaxing Side Trip. If you have a couple of hours to kill, and you're looking for an easy, low keyed excursion, this is the perfect place to visit. You'll pay a few THB for the guided tour, but it's well worth the money. As others have mentioned, it's a step back in time. You'll see artifacts from early last century to many hundreds of years ago, and our guide was great. If you want to get away from the hustle and bustle of tuk-tuk and taxi drivers, this tour is for you.
Interesting half day trip.. very good restaurant, interesting small museum and outstanding silk and gift shop. Definitely worth a visit.

Great surprise. We are not normally museum type people, however following the guidebook and other recommendations made our way to Jim Thompson's house. We took the sky train to National Stadium and it is about 5 mins walk from there along the canal. Not sign posted very well, but there is actually a courtesy tuk tuk from the station which is well branded. 100B entry fee, which included a guided tour. This was excellent, and our wonderful guide, Anne was very informative and offered the right level of humour to keep things interesting. The tour was only 35 mins long, so just right for us. Time then for photos in the garden and a piece of delicious cake in the restaurant. Definitely recommend the New York cheesecake.

Interesting place to visit. It's a nice tranquil part of town. I did the tour which is about 45 mins long and they take you through the gardens and house and explain the cultural history of the place all the old artefacts within. It's a nice change of pace in a pretty busy city and if your new to Thailand it's a great way to learn something's about the culture.
Time Tunnel to the glorious past. The house is amazing and the tour is very nice.Take the boat ferry and travel with the locals to get there - its quite an experience for few Bahts....

Nice Tour, worth a drop by. Very professional. Interesting to see the architecture and hear the life story of the man - not as boring as I expected. A little hard to find and not super well marked (a couple signs), but its a little different than the shopping/wat-ing of Bangkok. Gift store seemed fairly overpriced as well. Budget about 1-2 hours for a visit to this. Close to the BTS and major shopping districts, so can probably do if you're in the area.

Great Attraction. I have been to Jim Thompson's House twice now. Never heard of him before the first visit but after reading a book of his dissapearance, going a second time was a must. The guides are very knowledgeable and althought there was a lot of people there the wait wasn't long. A visit to Jin Thompson's House is highly recommended.

Nice atmosphere. We went to the one at National Stadium and great atmosphere, a combination of shopping, making of Thai silk, restaurant and nice landscape. Thai food we ordered were delicious, small portion and expensive. Looking around, we find more foreigners than locals dining there.

Good experience of Thai culture. Jim Thompson house gives a good flavor of Thai and western culture. The traditional architecture of the house coupled with the serene gardens is a good visit if you are interested in visiting some cultural places. The statues of Buddha and others dating back to ancient centuries is a wonder in itself. The place gives a good mix of architecture, culture, ancient treasures, lifestyle all included in one. Entry to the house is restricted through a guided tour only and you cannot take pictures inside the house. Though pictures can be taken from the outside and in the garden.
Art and Architecture. The forty minute guided tour takes you through Jim Thompson's world of beautiful Thai architecture and stunning Asian art.

So unique. Should you be looking for something out of the ordanary you should come here and enjoy the life style of a quite, wealthy, intellectual. You will not be disappointed in the grounds, the house and the buildings. You will be disappointed in the location so just ignore the getting there. This will be a time to take time and just be at peace with what there is there.
Jim Thompson. Has a lot of nice items to purchase. The only problem that I could see was getting your wife to leave the store without buying enough goodies to fill two suitcases.
The House of Antiques . The lovely museum near the Siam Square shopping area opposite the MBK Mall, a beautiful one traditional Thai house standing at the end of a quiet soi by the Saan Saab Canal.

Silks. There are so many beautiful things collected by the late Jim Thompson. His house is amazing and wonderful to see. There are many things to buy as well. The food in the restaurant is really delicious.
Good visit. The House / Museum is intersting - and the mysterious story about Mr. Thompson brings some sppokyness over the place. Good vist but the silk seemed a little overpriced, i would say?

Pleasant surprise within the city. We made our visit to the Jim Thompson House more interesting by approaching it from the back, by the Saen Seap water taxi from Petchaburi station (12 Baht only)We like the cocoon spinning demonstration at the entrance. We did not buy any silk product souvenirs though since we found them pricey for what we need (MBK was just across). The FREE electronic tuktuk is a thoughtful service.I posted a 2N/3D DIY Itinerary for friends which I blogged on http://dhappyretiree.blogspot.com/2014/09/2n3d-bangkok-d-i-y-itinerary-best.html#more. It is mainly inexpensive Bangkok sightseeing by public transportation.

Definitely Worth A Visit!. I had heard so much about Jim Thompson that I was compelled to go to the Jim Thompson House when I reached Bangkok. And I am so glad I did! What a lovely way to spend a few hours in what seemed like an oasis in a concrete jungle.The house itself is extraordinary, very well maintained and protected. The ticket price is 100 THB and includes a guided tour of his house. The tour was very informative and super interesting. Getting there was easy with the Sky Train. It's a 5-7 minute walk to the JT House from the National Stadium BTS on the Silom Line. The JT House offer a complimentary transfer service between the House and the BTS every 15 minutes which was good fun to take.The gardens were lush and beautiful and the cafe was a welcomed respite. I wanted to buy everything in the shop! Loved this Thai treasure :-)

A Beautiful Afternoon. I had been to Jim Thompson's House when I was in Bangkok in 2001 and so impressed then I had to take my friend there for adelicious lunch, tour of the house, and shopping in the store. We had a table right next to the Koi Pond so watching the Koi and the frogs playing in the water was certainly entertaining while weenjoyed lunch. We found the story of Jim Thompson to be quiteinteresting, and of course love the silk products we purchased from the gift shop.....It was a wonderful afternoon, then convinced my friend to take one of the motorized rik-shaws back to the hotel, and that was quite a ride.....bumpy, choking from fumes, but laughing all the way.....Hey you got to try everything at least once...........
interesting to know all about silk. If you want to know the story of silk from cocoon to yarn to fabrics and also visit the museum and collection of Jim Thompson you should visit

Tranquil. Well worth a visit, a little oasis of peace in a frantic city. Admission price includes a tour - multilingual guides. On site store worth a visit, expensive but quality you would expect.Minus - a little out of the way, our taxi driver couldn't find!!

History... Mystery and a Great Cafe/Eatery. The Jim Thompson House is a peaceful place away from the crowds. You can see people from all over the world. You will not see Jim Thompson unless you are the type to still see Elvis. He disappeared without a trace.
Go there to find out more!

lots more to see then i first thought. I was really impressed by this place, i only went their because my wife wanted to go but in the end i was so happy that i did its very historical and had a really good story to what Jim Thompson or whatever his real name was (CIA) up to over there but you could see in the story that he fell in love with the Thai people and did some real good. wonderful story and great silk shop, if your going to buy silk buy it here its not cheap but least its real thai silk not made in china.

Disappointed. I would have preferred to get more knowledge of Jim Thompson himself instead of the houses he lived in or how the garden looked like. In my opinion it is the story of why Mr Thompson disappeared that it is interesting as well as how you make silk.

A place worthy of your time .... The anticipation of reaching Jim Thompson House grew as we walk down the narrow lane ... that was interesting for a tourist like myself. The little side walk street vendor on one side and a modern cafe on the other ... going further were filled with beautiful greens and flowers along both sides of the road. Finally, the sign that read 'Jim Thompson House'. We were welcomed by an amazing of sight of traditional Thai red houses surrounded by a gorgoeus garden. Every bit of the place was lovely to the eyes and mind. There was such tranquility walking through the garden - fortunately, it was not a busy day. Whilst waiting for the tour to start, we took a walk to the beautiful garden and also browse through some of the exhibits on the ground level. Even the stroll was relaxing. The colors of the gardens with the light breeze gave a certain warmth.The guided tour was simple but informative. It has enough information to help better understand what a gifted and talented visionary Jim Thompson was. Even though he came across as a very intelligent man, his uncompromising acceptance of the Thai culture seemed to exult the power of the beauty of Thailand. From his collection of antiques, his clever ways of designing his residence compound by 'stitiching' different homes together by the river side to how he influenced the silk trade in Thailand, was nothing short of an amazing story to know of.After the tour, we went to the Jim Thompson restaurant. We ordered Massaman Curry and Basil Pork with rice. It was delicious. I would highly recommend to relax at the restaurant and have a delightful meal there to end off the tour before hitting the store. I would love to visit the restaurant and take a stroll through the garden just to get away from the hustle and bustle of the city for a moment.
Silk history. You see directly the making of silk. Fascinating! Though the weather is really hot, we enjoy surroundings with many trees.
Hidden Gem. Down a little side soi. Not huge but an interesting story and a nice peaceful oasis in the bustling heart of Bangkok

Nice and peaceful place. If you want to know what an ancient elegant Thai home and lifestyle was like, come here. Not only will you see a nice elegant home, you will get to know the history and lifestyle of the legendary Jim Thompson.

Worth a tour. Having been to Bangkok several times I have never bothered visiting this location. But a friend on this trip wanted to go and I am glad I went. Its not much a tour about the silk industry but a story about the life of Jim Thompson and the house he built which is now a memorial to him. Surrounded by Bangkok's concrete jungle this is a oasis. Worth a visit when touring BKK. It does not take long

Great attraction. The Jim Thompson House was only 15 minutes from the Hua Chang Heritage Hotel so I walked. Such an interesting place to see right on a canal. I knew very little about the silk trade or silk worm and learned a lot here. Jim Thompson's home and antique collection were beautiful, the gift shop had a wonderful selection of quality gifts. The admission price also included an English speaking guide who was very knowledgeable on Thai traditions and superstitions. I also had lunch at the garden restaurant, the food and service was very good and reasonably priced. You will want to learn more about this amazing man after visiting his home.
great place. nice food and great atmosphere!!They are a museum but also have a thai traditional restaurant. The restaurant is so good and you can't miss it!

Elegant and peaceful. No need to take the house tour if you're just looking for a cool, quiet, zen atmosphere for dining. The restaurant sits alongside the canal, is Clean and classy with a menu that offers very well prepared Thai fare and an ample beverage selection to include cocktails and beers. Portions are ample enough to share, though service could stand a little more attention to attentiveness. Located about a 10 minute, interesting, easy walk from the National Stadium BTS stop, opposite direction from MBK. Free golf cart type shuttle to the Main Street and from about every fifteen minutes if you want to wait. Shopping for authentic Jim Thompson label creations available on premises as well. Highly recommend.
Nice attraction.. It's wonderful to see the inside of this intriguing person's house. Beautiful art collection, lovely garden.

Calm and beauty amidst the bustling city. Jim Thompson, known for his work and love of Thai Silk, built this beautiful house as an homage for his love of Thailand and of their craftsmanship. It's a great place to learn about the Thai Silk trade and appreciate the intricacies that go into making silk. The silk scarves are popular and precious souvenirs.

Relaxing Day. It is close to National Stadium. You may need to ask for help once you get off the BTS because I was not sure which direction it was. It was a short walk to the House from the BTS but there is a shuttle option I discovered. Not sure where it picks people up though. I saw people arriving and leaving on the shuttle but I preferred the walk. Once you arrive, you buy a ticket on your right hand side. Then you check in and they tell you what time your tour starts. The tour is very interesting and not too long. You get to see all the rooms but no pictures are allowed unless you are on the ground floor by the gardens. Each room shows you a variety of interesting art pieces. I enjoyed admiring the furniture as well. It is not expensive either for the tour. It is totally worth a visit. They have a restaurant as well and a store where you can buy some Thai silk. It is an extremely relaxing thing to do in Bangkok.

A nice place to visit and learn, but not a must-see. This is a great site to learn more about Jim Thompson and the advent of the Thai silk trade. The house is nice and is worth seeing if you are into architecture. The grounds are beautiful and the various antiques in the house are beautiful. The staff are knowledgeable and our guide spoke very good English. There are regular demonstrations of traditional Thai dancing and some demonstrations of silk yarn spinning. The restaurant has decently priced meals and the service staff are very attentive and professional. I did not visit the gift shop as I visited the Jim Thompson store in Siam Paragon already. This site is worth seeing if you have additional time to spare in the National Stadium BTS station/MBK area and takes about one hour to explore. One thing to beware of: there are taxi drivers that will wait outside the gates of Jim Thompson House looking for fares. Only agree if they will use the meter otherwise the fare, while still cheap by Western standards, is overly inflated.

A stunning urban oasis. I was really glad that I chose to visit the Jim Thompson House. I wasn't sure what to expect, but it is such a beautiful urban oasis, and a place to experience a bit of history, traditional Thai architecture and art, via the collections of a Western orientalist and businessman. When you arrive you are assigned to a group; tours (in English, French and I think other languages) are conducted in small groups and last about half an hour, during which you'll see the house and antiquities Thompson collected. You are then free to spend a little longer in the lovely grounds, and there is also a gallery which when I visited had a fantastic modern East Asian art exhibit.NB there is a free shuttle tuktuk service from the main road. Also note that there are fans but no air conditioning in the house so it's better to visit at a cooler time of day.

The legacy of Jim Thompson, highly recommended to visit. We heard the first time about Jim Thompson during our second visit to Thailand.We were intrigued from the beginning about his mysterious vanishing and have read a few books about it.Finally we found the time to visit the Jim Thompson House Museum.We took a taxi from our hotel, the Four Seasons (Please see also review.) to the museum. Entrance was 100 THB per person or ca. 2.35 Euro (ca. 3.15 USD). The house and garden were an oasis of peace and quiet in the heart of Bangkok.Near the entrance were the cashier, the restaurant and the shop.There were also ponds with two turtles and kois. The gardens were surprisingly large and can be explored alone, but there is a compulsory guided tour, if you want to see the inside of the house.Meeting point for the tours was the central square. There are different languages on offer including English and French.Before our tour started we went through the garden. It was peaceful and romantic, until one of the groups disturbed us and we were in the way.Jim Thompson was more Thai than the Thai themselves, so he was fascinated with everything the country had to offer. Besides single handed saving the Thai silk industry, he also amassed a large collection of Thai Buddhist art, but after a run in with the government, he gave it up and started instead to collect Buddha statues from Cambodia and Burma - according to the author William Warren. There are some of the oldest and rarest in the collection.The house is made up of six traditional Thai buildings - they are from the 19th century -, which interconnect. There are some differences though, for example the external walls and decorations are inside as is the stair case. In a classic Thai house it would be the opposite.Upstairs are the infamous dining room, the living room and two bed rooms. One was Jim Thompson's. Even the mattress, where he slept on, is still there. Touching is not allowed, though. There was security as well, so there is no chance to wander off and search the house for clues what really happened.We enjoyed our visit and indulged in some retail therapy after the tour.Would we recommend this attraction to a friend? YES!Would we visit this attraction again in the future? YES!

The home of Thai Silk. Jim Thompson was an adventurous American who fell in love with Thailand, not too long after WWII. His home, of solid teak, is an architectural replica of upcountry life, being roomy and well lit naturally. Jim is accredited with being the father of the Thai Silk industry.

Highly recommend. You will be able to walk through old thai houses. This places has been maintained extremely well. Jim Thompson's house is surrounded by a lot of exotic plants and trees, It is very pleasant to stroll in the garden.
Jim Thompson. Who would have thought that down a side street you would find this beautiful house steeped in history. Beautiful artefacts and an amazing story. A must visit!

Great House,...but is this Thailand?. When you walk into the house you have the feeling of walking into a AD magazine. But if you think a bit about it, we are talking about a business rich man that was a collector and had money and he took everything he wanted from different parts and put it together, is that something natural in a place with such a variety and differentiations as Thailand?

Interesting place - worth a visit. We don't normally do this type of tour but I have to say I really loved the house. Jim Thompson had excellent taste and I found the tour of the house really interesting and informative. Glad we did it. Had lunch here too which was excellent.

Interesting collection of art and a great history. I went here my last day in Bangkok. It was located around the block from my hotel so was really easy to access. The grounds are so nice and cozy. The landscape architecture was perfect and surprisingly so for its location right in the centre of downtown Bangkok. I paid for what I thought was a 20 minute tour and ended up finishing after almost 45 minutes but had completely lost track of time as it was so interesting. I would definitely recommend this to anyone who is interested in the history of Jim Thompson or in architecture in general.

Mildly interesting. There are really two parts to this tour - the first is the historical aspect of Jim Thompson and his starting the silk business. Here there was some interesting information but not as much actual history that I would have expected.The second is the house and gardens themselves in terms of seeing a traditional Thai house. If you haven't been able to go into a traditional Thai house, then the tour here is worth it - it is a beautiful house and gardens. If you have seen it before, then you can probably give it a skip.Finally, the store is small and limited selection - and the prices for Jim Thompson are not what I would call a bargain (although the quality is very high). If you really want the JT silk - head to the larger main store.

A House in the Middle of Nowhere!. The title is in a way to bring realization to the visitor to the Jim Thompson House. When the place was selected for the location. There were open field and garden all around next to the beautiful klong (canal). The location was perfect being hidden in a shallow lane opposite the National Stadium and close by to the other palaces in Bangkok. After 70+ years! Bangkok had grew and swallowed the place and it became a stranger in the big city.Yes, the Jim Thompson House still maintain certain charm that the owner want to leave his legacy. However I wish the real beauty of the place can be brought alive for the visitor to appreciate. As is the place fall short of the expectation of Jim Thompson fan.

Worth a visit if you have time. This is worth a visit if you have plenty of time in Bangkok or have been to Bangkok before and are looking for other things to do. The entry includes a 30 minute tour of the house and there is an expensive silk shop on site.

A good place to visit. A beautiful different house in Bangkok designed by an American architect who combines east and west. He was an art-collector and without being a Buddhist, he has collected an impressive collection of religious art from all over Asia.It is interesting to hear, how he started the Thai Silk and how he was ahead of his time.But: Do not buy anything in the souvenir shop. The price is very high compared to other shops in Bangkok.

Could do if you have an hour to kill. Let me start by saying that the 40mins guided tour is very worth the 100B entry fee. The guide is knowledgeable and provides some interesting facts. They explain not only about Jim Thompson, but also a bit about the structure, the gardens and even Buddhism. The architecture is beautiful and Jim Thompson has managed to collect some beautiful Chinese pieces.However, I wouldn't say this is a must-see, especially if this is your first trip to Bangkok (save it for other spots). If you have been exposed to other Thai architectures or have knowledge about South East Asian cultures, this wouldn't be as interesting to you. Only go if you're a Jim Thompson fan.

Great story! Great House!. Be sure to show your student card to get in for half price - 50 baht! The place itself is fantastic. You get a nice tour of the place available in multiple languages. They tell the story of Jim Thomson - an early American settler who made his fortune in exporting Thai silk. He fell in love with Thai culture and built a house based on that style with a few western alterations. Inside the house there is lots of Thai art, pottery, artefact and rooms to explore. Once the tour is over be sure to explore the gardens and admire the review of the canal. Also dont miss out on the art centre which is free and on the second floor of the building just before the exit - if you look for it you will not miss it. There was a really interesting exhibition that was well worth a look.

Worth a visit. Very reasonably priced at 100 baht and a good break from shopping, though you can purchase beautiful silk products while there. You need to take a guided tour to see inside the buildings but there is no extra charge for that. Very pleasant and enjoyable.

American-Thai Relic. Jim Thompson's house is located a short walk from the Sky Train's "Stadium" station which is just a few hundred feet from Bangkok's major shopping district. This "house" is must attraction for both the man who built it, Jim Thompson, as for the house itself.First the man: Jim Thompson was an American CIA agent in southeast Asia who settled in Bangkok shortly after WW II. He became fascinated with Thai silk which was hand produced by individuals and was slowly dying out. He started a company to produce and sell the silk. He was so successful that the silk was even used for the costumes of the movie "The King and I" in the 1950's. He is credited with saving the Thai silk industry. In 1967 Jim Thompson mysteriously disappeared while vacationing in Malaysia. The mystery has never been solved.Jim Thompson loved the old style teak houses of Thailand which were being torn down to build modern houses. He managed to purchase several of these houses and had them reassembled to make his home on a canal and house his extensive antique and art collection. He also bought some crystal chandeliers from a palace that was being demolished. What you have is a traditional Thai house built to make a home for a 20th century western man. It's a wonderfully eclectic collection of Thai antiques and modern furnishings in this house.There is also a museum on the property which has exhibitions relating to the silk industry in Thailand.

Amazing thailand is here!. I was worried about: what if it's just a big store?But this place, was just.. OMG!It's not like a boring museum.Do you want to see unique chamber pots?What about peach shaped kettle for wine?You can watch beautiful ladywith exotic clothes,dancing thai traditional dance,and also the most peaceful smile of buddah's statue. Jim thompson house is the right place to experience thai.You should check their wonderfully decorated restaurant too!※Jim thompson restaurant made fantastic coconut icecream(150THB). Enough for 2 people.

Highly recommend!. It is a short walk from the National Stadium station, BTS and worth visiting. Entry price is great value as it includes a 35 minute guided tour and unlimited entry afterwards around the gardens. Staff are all very helpful. There are lockers to store your bags et cetera. There is a cafe which serves drinks, ice-cream and food. The gift shop is wonderful and contains a wide range of items. We enjoyed our morning here.

Mysterious Figure. Allegedly worked for the CIA during the Vietnam War era.Was probably into Heroin smuggling (best way to make cash even for the CIA operatives), in addition to his silk trade that was most legit.He eventually disappeared and was never seen again.

History at its finest. My second time in Bangkok but first time I visited Jim Thompson house. It is lovely and full of beautiful antiques. It has a beautiful garden. I didn't try the restaurant but browsed the gift shop. The patron of the foundation is one of the Thia royal family. The guides do tours in several languages.

Charming home. When in the business district of Bangkok, stop at Jim Thomson's house. You will be surprised by what you see and enjoy the tranquillity so close to the bustling city. I would love to have a home like this. Casual and open plan living, all made of wood. The story of Jim Thompson makes interesting listening, so take the guided tour. Beautiful works of ancient art are everywhere. Lush gardens to relax in. See the Thai silks and handy crafts.

English name, pure thai culture. Just have to love the conservation effort of thai heritage. Showcase of silk industry and thai traditional buildings equipped with ancient decor were awesome. The Buddhism influence were strong in every elements. Modern facilities like air conditioned and clean washroom made the place most pleasant. Staff were well-trained and full courtesy. You spend little on ticket and can buy some booklet or silk product for souvenir. It's a must visit.

an experience not to miss. the teak house is kept in beautifull condition & is full of the history of Jim Thompson,as well as the story of his strange dissapearance,you can also see silk being made from the coocoons & spun,but don't miss the shop,the quality of the clothing is beautifull,as is the prints,even down to the handkerchiefs.

Nice tranquil museum... I first thought of going there just because of its location, which is walking distance from MBK, but to my surprise it is very nice tour indeed. From the junction at the main road, there's free buggy service every 15 mins. On arrival, I paid tb250 (or so) and was placed into group B. The group tour takes about 35 mins in total. Pretty nice n professional.

Well Preserved. A good, tranquil little spot in the heart of Bangkok to have a little stroll and a taste of a silk magnate's home-stay - before being lost in his travels within Malaysia. The English tour takes about 40mins, which takes you through his house - which in itself, houses a few dated Chinese and ancient antiques. Additionally, there's a dance and silk-sewing demonstration at the entrance of the attraction. Also has an in-house restaurant, a small poster / postcard shop and a Jim Thompson's silk shop.

Beautiful original home, silk history and haven. A must see in Bangkok not only if you're interested in the history of silk but also just to see some beautiful antiques and gardens of the historic home of Jim Thompson. A nice place to just relax and get away from the hustle and bustle of the city. The tour was well worth it and very interesting but leaves you wondering what happened to this incredible man. Entrance is 100baht and includes the tour. Photos are not allowed on the tour of the home, so just admire and learn. There is a restaurant that looks very nice where you can get a drink or something to eat. If you walk left out of the entrance to the canal, turn right and go down about 100 yds to a dock, you can take one of the river boats at Hua Chang (going west-left) to the end of the San Sap canal and end up near Democracy Monument, which is then walking distance to Kao San Rd and many other tourist destinations. The boat ride is a bit adventurous (all locals) but fun and a good way to see dwellings on the canal. It costs about 30 baht on board, maybe less. I highly recommend the Jim Thompson House! Its also within walking distance to shopping at the famous multi level discount mall - MBK.

Historical look into the life - and lifestyle - of a legend. Learn about this fascinating 'farang', Jim Thompson, and his life and his gifts to Thailand (he's the single reason the Thai silk industry exists on the international market today). His former home is one of the most unusual and interesting things one can do in Bangkok. It's situated on a still active canal but is only steps away from the BTS Skytrain station of National Stadium, which is also at the popular, must-shop-at MBK Centre.
Art & Design. A very nice place to be.Nice building and environment with a historical story behind. Fill with the best material from its time.

pleasant and tranquil. The story of Jim Thompson is very interesting . His house is a beautiful teak house made of parts of older houses.beautifully restored it is a pleasant and tranquil place in the centre of Bangkok. They provide a shuttle from the main road close to the bts station.The tour guide was very informative, the gardens really beautiful. worth a visit which will take no more than an hour
A quick bite at Jim Thompson's house. Great decor, next to a pond and looking at Jim Thompson's house. Kind service. Good food. Expensive but the location makes it worth it.

sofisticated house and peaceful garden. Before starting the visit I stopped at the restaurant in the premises. The food was delicious and the atmosfere quite tranquil. I strolled through the garden enjoying the shadow and just feeling relaxed.The guided tour took me through an intereting and somehow misterious house decorated with all kind of wonderful pieces where the refinement and good taste were the key.Don't miss a visit to the shop.
This is a very interesting tour site. I recommend it to everyone who goes to Bangkok. Jim Thompson, a mysterious and interesting guy built this house that appears to match his persona. .

It's a good half day and cheap. Well preserved house, good tours (although I think the man himself is a bit oversold) but very impressed with the price and they lack of any hard sell for the Jim Thompson brand. A deservedly good reputation.

Beautiful house and garden.. An oasis in the centre of town, the garden setting is very tranquil.The tour is good, and the house it self, and the artefacts inside are very interesting.We stayed for a delicious lunch in the on site restaurant, before heading into the shop, bought quite a bit of stuff, for myself, husband and the kids, plus a few home wears and gifts. Beautiful and timeless patterns.

Do not miss this!. I was recommended by a friend to visit the Jim Thompson house and was not disappointed by the recommendation. Easy to find and breathtaking as soon as you enter the grounds. A lovely piece of history in the centre of a busy city. You pay 100THB for a compulsory guided tour in English or French and they last around 30mins. Beautiful antiques are dotted throughout the house and grounds, and you can buy some of the infamous silk products in site for a medium to expensive price, but the quality reflects what you pay for. Overall a wonderful breather from the hectic Bangkok world and the crowds of the Grand Palace etc!

Nothing much to see in all honesty.... unless you are really interested in seeing the history and the production of silk. I was interesting but would I pay to do it again probably not. They also have shops if you actually want to buy something.

Little diamond. My favorite spot in Bangkok. Wonderful, peaceful garden, impressive building given that the teak house is made of many individual farmer buildings (still jealous for the fantastic living room).

Pleasant, friendly, but in the end, not so much to see. We visited this on the 10th of july. Were welcomed by a very friendly staff, which led us to the ticket booth. Bought tickets and 20 minutes later we received a very nice tour around the place. The house is really nice, but in the end, there's really not that much to see. Do this if you got time to spare in Bangkok, don't do this if you have other things to visit.
worth a visit. For the chance to see a traditional Thai house, beautiful artifacts, and a history of silk, don't miss this. And plan to stay for lunch - the fried rice is YUM!

Very decorative and interesting house. We enjoyed looking around the house, it was very well decorated and furnished with lots of intricate detail. The whole story of Jim Thompson is intriguing, but... It was quite expensive for what it was, and a little bit out of the way. I wouldn't make a special trip to go back, but if you happen to be nearby, go and visit.
Wonderful. A. Ice place to visit in Bangkok, the old Thai style house is already worth a visit without even having stepped into the Thompson house , we loved it
Love the decoration. Nice Thai style decoration recommend to visit if you like Thai style house & silkWe love to buy Thai silk there as it is a great quality & great design :)

Average overall. The price was a bit expensive I felt. It was my boyfriend and myself and we found the architecture was really beautiful but we won't be doing it again on our next trip back. This is more a tour for older people not teenagers.
Full of history. Full of history and worth the effort to see it. Loved understanding all about beautiful silk. Very peaceful.
Go there! An oasis in the middle of Bangkok. Take a break from the shopping and go there for a lunch, it's a restful oasis in the middle of Bangkok. Don't miss to see the garden.

Peaceful.. Was a very pleasant and tranquil residence but not really much about the man himself.
Alot of beautiful artwork in and around the grounds along with the mozzies.
Tour itself was ok, tourguide was lovely and spoke english very well but again there was more talk about buddah's and thier travels instead of JT himself.

Tranquil Respite in the Middle of the City. Great tour guide and an amazing oasis in the middle of Bangkok. History of Jim Thompson is what movies are made of. Store has great quality items to take home. Love this place!

Top sight in Bangkok. The Jim Thompson House is fabulous. Its beautiful and its story is fascinating. It is unmissable for any ocidental traveller. The House provides free tours in english.
There are free shuttles.

Worth A Visit When in Bangkok. I actually visited the Jim Thompson House back in 2006 on my first visit to Thailand. It had some great historical information on Jim Thompson which I admit I did not know much about before this visit.
I would recommend it on your visit to Bangkok.

A pleasant oasis in the city and free shuttle service. The story of Jim Thompson is fascinating. The entry on Wikipedia is really worth a read before you even go. Do not confuse his life with another Jim Thompson. This is different to most tourist venues. To start the wrong end of the attraction, even the toilets are the best in Bangkok, although for men there is the regular Thailand surprise of the female attendant cleaning around you. Entry is very cheap for an attraction at 100 baht each and as the house(s) is tucked down a side street there is a golf buggy shuttle service, navy blue in colour, taking you to the main road junction.Cheap to enter but they make money from the luxurious silk shop and the cafe/restaurant that overlooks a delightful Koi pond. We can recommend the cheesecake and the chocolate cake looked good too. There are more substantial meals too.There is seating to eat inside or outside.The staff are all very elegantly dressed throuout the attraction and you learn the story of silk making from display boards and from actual demonstrations of weaving.The artefacts around the buildings are worth a look and there are free guided tours. To go upstairs you leave your belongings in lockers that are a delight in themselves and there are racks for your shoes. The gardens are also a delight, wonderful shade in the city but of course not cool shade. Perhaps there could have been more places to sit amongst the flora and fauna but the garden is not so big. So Jim, your life was fascinating and so was your disappearance and thank you for the opportunity to visit your house. You would be amazed what they have done to it.If this review was helpful, please vote accordingly

Special universe of colours. The Jim Thomson policier story is a good pretext to enjoy this unique combination of traditional architecture and spectacular combinations of colours in the fabrics presented. One can buy a unique hand-made tie or scarf or blouse... They are special!

Nice peak into recent history. The tour of Jim Thompsons house is really good. Our guide spoke good English. Her tour was informative, humorous and knowledgeable. Tour takes about 30 minutes. Take the time afterwards to view other parts of the property at leisure. Gardens are superb. Requisite shop pricey, restaurant nice by the Koi pond.
Eh.. Mildly interesting. House is beautiful. The silks are very expensive here. We did have a very good lunch in the restaurant.

Worth a visit but .... Yes I agree, the beautiful and interesting Jim Thompson House is worth a visit and the entrance fee is only 100 Baht. But … it was hardly impossible to understand the English of our guide, taking pictures is not allowed and the prices in the restaurant and the gift shop are too high.

All the silk my heart desires. No trip to Thailand is complete without the purchase of at least one silk item and Jim Thompson is certainly the place to visit. Everything your heart could possibly desire made from silk is available here. A visit here will certainly dent your wallet but the trip is worth it. Hand painted silk scatter cushion covers were well appreciated as gifts.

Decent at best. I remembered the tour vividly, the guide spoke excellent english and was knowledgeable about the house's history. The house was well maintained. I would recommend this attraction if you have time, otherwise, skip this, there are more interesting attractions worth travelling for.

Just a house with a filling tour. We read so many good reviews about this house, so our expectations were high. We got here as a part of a city tour and I can just say this is the house of a rich man who become richer in thailand by making silk and disappear in the jungle. Nothing else. The whole tour is just bla bla trying to make something out of nothing. I live in Chile and I can say Neruda's houses are far more interesting.

Very interesting and calm place. Entering the house and gardens we immediately felt very calm. The upkeep of the property is very well done and the staff are friendly. The tour was informative and we'd definitely recommend it if you're in Bangkok.

An oasis in the midst of Bangkok. This is one of my favourite places to bring friends visiting Bangkok. The gardens are not large but are beautifully laid out and are a calm oasis away from the hustle and bustle of Bangkok. The tours are informative and the guides very knowledgable. The restaurant is in a beautiful setting and the food very nice but there are plenty of less expensive options close by.Easy to find from the BTS and the shuttle service back down the Soi is a nice service.A lovely way to spend a couple of hours.

Tranquil place in the middle of a bustling city. We loved our visit here, so peaceful & serene. The gardens are beautiful, the guides informative, the antiques priceless. A lovely place to spend an afternoon away from the heat of Bangkok. The complimentary shuttle was really handy too.

Nice place, nothing more.. The place is nice, if you have seen almost everything in Bangkok it's nice to spend one hour here. Be carefull because you cannot take pictures inside and the only reason to go there is... to take a couple of nice pictures!
Beautiful, amazing!. Very nice, large though gift store. Good demo. of Thai dancing. A brief walk from the public transit train stop.

A must see place!!!!. It is so peaceful amidst a clamoring city. The voyage through the house is educational and gave a genuine feeling of the past, I had food in the restaurant which was great. The costs in the shop are high contrasted with different shops/road stalls yet there is an extraordinary reach and they are quality things. I used a large portion of a day and it was an unwinding serene break from the hurrying around of the city. Worth a visit.

a glimpse of life in Thailand before economic boom. it is very nice and relaxing to imagine how life used to be in Bangkok when the only roads were rivers and canals. Beautiful art collection and great guided tours in all languages

Lovely to visit but very hot. Great to see this place. It was a bit hard to find, but we had a bad map!!its isn't too expensive for the tour but be warned it is unbelievably hot inside and only fans to cool it down!! you also can not take pictures inside the house so don't worry about carrying a camera when you go to see it.Interesting if you like this sort of thing!

Lovely setting, wonderful food presentation .... This is traditional Thai food, and it's good. Nice wine. Not inexpensive, but worth it to be in this lovely, quiet compound in the midst of Bangkok's unending cacophonic environment ...
not easy to find. it was an interesting experience visiting his house in Bangkok. a lovely small museum, definetely worth a visit!

all lovers of silk. not only for lovers of beautiful silk, the shop itself worth the visit!
Typical thai house, do not miss to visit!

Jim Thompson House-worth seeing. I liked seeing the wooden buildings and the grounds. They had a demonstration of taking silk from boiled silk worms and spinning it into thread which was interesting to watch. I would need to know more about Thai art and culture to really appreciate the art on display. The place is worth seeing but it is not on my list of "must see" places.
Peaceful and beautiful place, full of charm. The tour to the museum is top, the restaurant is good, the shop is full of qualified things, my eyes are resting here :-)

30 minute tour filler. Visited July 2013 on a tour. Quite interesting to hear how Jim Thompson changed the silk industry here. I like Thai silk which is the only reason I went but time is precious on a 7 day holiday and there are far more interesting things to see. The outlet shop was a better quick trip for me.

Very interesting life and home. We loved learning about Jim Thompson and his estate. The tour was very well done and educational and the gardens are so beautiful and tranquil - hard to believe you are in the middle of Bangkok.

Jim's house is but a house. The Jim Thompson house is near the downtown Siam area, so it is easy to reach. I got a little bored a little into the tour...the house of a rich man who disappeared did not seem to interest me much! Perhaps not suitable for kids... Feels like a very imposing structure in the middle of Bangkok, and waaaay to saturated with tourists at ALL times!However, the service provided is excellent, and very value for money. Also a Jim Thompson shop which did not interest me :)

Best valued tour. My wife and I enjoyed our visit to Jim Thompson's house a lot. The tour guides here are fluent in English, Japanese, and Mandarin. It would not surprise us if they also knew other languages as well. The tour ran 30 minutes long and we learned a lot of the silk making process and how Jim Thompson changed the silk industry in Thailand forever. His house and what you learn about his life make this tour a worthwhile experience.

Great shopping, beautiful story and beautiful house !. A tourist attraction but with wonderful shopping as they have lovely prints. The story of Jim Thompson´s life is fantastic but the place does not offer anything worthwhile besides the shopping..

Interesting site. Tours are by appointment and you may have to wait a little there. There is an interesting silk shop on premises and a man sitting and demonstrating how the silk thread is made. Though the parts of the house are not too big, the tour was a bit long, felt dragging a little in the massive heat wave and with no a/c in most rooms, we managed to keep up for a long while, then we quickly scanned and left...

Very Interesting Man ...... We loved visiting his house. He is a fascinating man with multiple conspiracy theories to his demise. A must if in Bangkok. There is a shop that sells quality product but it is not a hard sell as in other tourist attractions,...but it is nice to stand in the air conditioning.

Love the place!. I love the place! It feels like entering into someone's life. The tour is nicely arranged. Our tour guide speaks excellent English, very polite and knowledgeable. Beautiful houce filled with tasty collections. Nice coffee house and restaurants, and nice quality products to bring home -- I wish I can buy everything! :)PS: if you bring small children, they may get bored with the house tour, so better leave them at the coffee shop munching pastries.

Serenity. The place oozes serenity - the beautiful Thai houses, the water lilies and water pools everywhere. Just a step away from noisy Bangkok and you imagine yourself in a village retreat. On arrival, you will be given a time for the guided tour (all languages seem available) where you get a potted history of why Jim Thompson is important to the Thai. Well worth a visit.
Beautiful House. Very nice house filled with collections of tapestries and statues. Wonderful to see how silk is made as well.

Oasis of silence inside the bustling Bangkok. I absolutely loved this place. It is incredibly beautiful, quiet and well taken care of. The house is extraordinary and in good taste and the tour is very comprehensive and insightful. Congratulations to our guide, she was very knowledgeable and polite!There is a Jim Thomson store inside the courtyard and if you're hungry you can have lunch at their restaurant. Also in the courtyard there were several bowls filled with colorful cocoons and a Thai girl dressed in a traditional costume who pretended to be working with silk strings. She was beautiful and smiled for the camera, as expected. I would definitely pay a second visit to this place if I were to return to Bangkok. And this time I might actually buy an expensive silk bag from their store!

Lovely little history lesson about Thai Silk. This is a lovely little place where the history of Thai Silk is explained and shared. I would think it would be a one time only place. I will not go on the tour for the subsequent visit.

Really love visiting this place. Beautiful house and silks, interesting piece of history and the reinvention of the Thai silk trade. After going here if you want to buy fabric their are several material shops, including a Jim Thompson outlet store which I highly recommend, it has 6 floors of fabrics and clothing..... It's a must visit each time I am in Bangkok ( all the curtains in my house are from fabrics bought in the outlet stores, cannot recommend enough) the staff are very knowledgable and they offer the tourist vat return system so take your passport and air details as it needs to be completed at the time of purchase!

Charming and intriguing. The story behind the creation of the house makes it worth a visit alone . It is in reality a collection of traditional Thai houses which were transported to the site and then re-assembled . The houses are set in lovely gardens and their is an excellent restaraunt where we enjoyed a relaxed lunch. The story off Jim Thompson and his life is fascinating but Iwill say no more asit will spoil your visit!!

A must. This place show you the life and times of Mr. Jim Thompson. Although not really that important of a historical figure in Thailand, Mr. Thompson did lead a very interesting life, and the place is really beautiful. Also do stop by to try out some of the food at his café - really nice
Beautiful and inspiring. Lovely place where you can learn a lot about Thaï traditions and Silk production. Great testimony. Benne ther twice and would like to come back again. Avoid rush hours.

Definately worth checking out. Only a short walk from National Stadium station and very interesting. You get a tour by a guide included in the price. Make sure you have your camera ready as the gardens are small but fantastic. No cameras allowed inside though.

very interesting house and man. the house of this mysterious American architect, or spy, who lived in bangkok in the '50. Very well maintained and relaxing. nice to spend a couple of hours. downtown, easy to reach
Traditional Thai House. The Jim Thompson house is a great way to see a traditional Thai home, and understand Jim Thompson and the Thai Silk production.

Worth it. Beautiful,very interesting,walking distance from MBK stop. Lovely garden , place is peaceful except when some tourists misbehave . Tourists should me a bit more culture awarded and respectful of places they visit

Calm oasis in the city. This visit was definitely the highlight of my visit to Bangkok. The city can be overwhelming and to find this lovely place with its interesting story was great. The tour is lovely and the story behind it fascinating. Also loved the shop with its expensive but quality gifts. The restaurant is nice too-highly recommend a trip here.

Take a Break in a Tranquil Environment. Friends recommended that we visit and we are so glad that we did. It was so tranquil in the middle of a bustling city. The tour of the house was informative and gave a real sense of the past, we had lunch in the restaurant which was good and we bought all of our gifts for family back home in the shop. The prices in the shop are high compared to other shops/street stalls but there is a great range and they are quality items that family back home were happy to receive.
