We spent half a day and it was a relaxing tranquil break from the hustle and bustle of the city. Worth a visit.
Great Historic House!. Jim Thompson House is historic and well preserved. The guide is good. I like the old style Thai house. It is a good break after shopping at the MBK and Siam Paragon.
Oasis. A great source of history. The guided tour was very informative. Very nice gardens set on a busy working canal. Has a restaurant and gift shop attached.
Worth a visit. Ticket is cheap and not limited in time. The numerous guides will give you a nice free tour. Spend 2 hours there is good enough

A good story. Decided to visit even though I had never heard of Jim Thompson before!! Good story and a great insight into what a westerner did for Asia in general. Free guided tour will answer any questions you may have, best to let your imagination take over whilst walking around as the area does lack any atmosphere.

Well Worth a Visit. Have a few hours to spare while in Bangkok? Then don't miss the Jim Thompson House.
Very easy to get to (there's an MBK Station close by). You can hop on the free shuttle from the main street (or walk it, it's not far).
Beautiful grounds, well-run tours through the house.

Really cool. This place is so interesting. We got a guided tour and the tour is like half an hour so enough to keep you interested but not too long to get bored. You learn so much and I would definitely recommend the restaurant too!

Loved this Traditional Home!. Seeing Jim Thompson's home was one of the highlights of my Bangkok trip. His story is fascinating as was his love for Thailand. The home is lovingly preserved and the tour was informative both from a Thai architectural perspective and the treasure found inside.

Interesting to see. If you are over by the shopping centres (MBK or Siam centre) then this worth going to have a look at. We (wife and I) had no idea who Jim Thompson was before we went, but it was good to see how the rich lived back in the old days.

awesome "hidden" gem. i couldn't believe the peaceful jim Thomson house is located near the MBK, one of the busiest parts of Bangkok. a definitely must see/visit for locals and tourists as well, the history is quite fascinating and the house itself very intriguing. The restaurant is quite nice as well, the coconuts and tom yum were excellent.

Must be your first thing to see. The Jim Thompson house is a beautiful architecture piece amongst the big city. It's art and architecture teaches you a bit of the Thai culture and customs. You also get to see how the silk Trade affected Thailand. I traveled throughout Thailand and Southeast Asia for the past three years and if I went to this place before I would have learned some helpful explanations that would've helped me understand the ancient temples a bit more. This is definitely a must see on your trip to Thailand

Go To Outlet Stores If You Are Looking For Massive Buys & Savings!. Pricey stuff but in season. I love the brand and love to buy their bags and accessories as gifts, soft furnishings or gifts to friends. Head to outlet store if you are not picky with must have in-season stuff. Located at Sukhumvit area. Ask this store for location.

Surprisingly Great!. This stop was one selected by our wives and the men folk had low expectations. But the house and tour were interesting and informative giving real perspective into the man and into traditional Thai upper class living. The gift shop was, needless to say, pretty awesome.

What a greatexperience. Sunday the 27th of July we really enjoyed the tour with all the History and our guide was wonderful well versed in the history of the silk industry and the items in the store were expensive butmy wife said well worth it because of the quality and uniqueness of things. It is a must do if in Bankok 5 stars from us.

a nice afternoon. A good attraction to visit in Bangkok.
I had lunch there after we toured the house. Was nice, the house was really traditional and the staff gave lots of interesting facts and information.
Easy to get to from BTS National Stadium.
Worth a visit. very interesting place to visit. They give you a tour at first then you can have a look around. The whole Jim T story is fasinating and what he did with the house is amazing.

Excellent insight into Thailand's cultural heritage. This is a must for any visitor to Bangkok. Tucked away down the end of an alleyway near National Stadium Skytrain station, the museum consists of a series of ancient wooden buildings brought in by Jim Thompson from rural Thailand, and turned into a beautifully furnished home packed with antiques. The setting is lovely too, with lush plants and trees around a series of ponds and narrow winding paths. But the real point of the story is his fascination with Thai textiles, especially silk, which he gradually discovered after settling in to live in Bangkok from 1950 onwards. He single handedly created a new US market for Thai silk and helped the country to build its economy while preserving some of its finest traditions.The compulsory guided to our is excellent, and the site is very well managed. There is also a terrific shop selling silk products and a very pleasant restaurant.

great place!. Its an interesting place about an American Explorer, about his life, interest, art and craft and how one day he want to Malaysia and never came back....its cozy, its nice and creative, worth visiting...It also gives you good idea about Thailand craft industry, it is well kept, a Museum, galleries, live boutique and a cafeteria.

Interesting Site in the Heart of the City. This attraction is relatively inexpensive (100 baht/$3), and includes a look at traditional Thai houses and 18th and 19th century artwork. The collection of ceramics, paintings, and wood carvings is very nice and unusual. When I visited there were silk weaving and Thai dancing demonstrations as well. This is a worthwhile way to spend a few hours.

beautiful and peaceful place between city. I went to Jim Thompson house and i found its so beautiful and peaceful. i can't imagine a beautiful and peaceful place in the city. they have tour of house .
Urban Retreat. Very well worth a visit. Tranquility and peace. Charming guides. Excellent (if pricey) gift shop with high quality Thai silk
Very interesting. Probably not worth going out of your way for but if you are near Siam Square it is worth a visit. Beautiful building and interesting artefacts

Nice museum. The place is a mini museum, not specific for Thai history only as it contains pieces from different places in the world and tells a story of a fascinating cultural mix.Well maintained and very organised, the tour guides are very knowledgable.

Return trip - still good. We've been here on previous visits to Bangkok. We returned with our toddler as we thought she be interested in the karp pond at the bare minimum. We had a great time as the staff as great - all of the staff wanted to play with our daughter and so we were able to tag along (somewhat distractedly) on the tour. Such a beautiful house and you can imagine what the old Bangkok would have been like before A/C, BTS etc. Perhaps not the best place to take a toddler that has a mind of her own, but still very managable and fun for all.

Lovely museum, great store, awesome restaurant. I loved everything about this place. It's gorgeous, very well organized, the tour is interesting and not too lengthy and the store is a perfect place to buy classy souvenirs and gifts.I stayed for lunch at the restaurant and I enjoyed the food and the atmosphere very much. It's a little hidden on a back street so ask your way around from the subway station. It's not even a 5 minutes walk from the station.100% thumbs up!

Historical place in mid-town: little bit of everything: shopping, history, & culture. If you don't have much time in Bangkok and you want a little bit of everything, especially shopping, history and culture, well, this is it. This house located in Bangkok on of the most famous shopping district, very close to MBK and close to Siam Paragon. Before you go shopping there, you can take time enjoying the tour in Jim Thompson house. The house is important for two main reasons. One, it was a tradition thai house, adapted to fit western culture, so if you do have the luxury of visit the normal traditional thai house, this is a good enough example. Second, it was own by The famous Jim Thompson. Also the stuffs he collected is pretty interesting and rare even for Thais point of view. After the tour you can enjoy the lunch at the Jim Thompson coffee house, food here is nice, atmosphere is relaxing, value for money. (If you are lucky, you will see the thai wedding ceremony performs there, since lots of thai couples love to use this place for wedding ceremony.) Before you leave, don't forget to buy some silk product back from the Jim Thompson shop, the quality of silk here is divine!

Traditional Thai Living. Jim Thompson's house is beautiful. A collection of Thai homes that were rescued from demolition and combined to create this unique living experience. Walk among the gardens, check out the gorgeous fairy house, antiques and statuary. Jim Thompson had quite the history in Thailand and is responsible for reviving the Thai Silk Industry and many other disappearing Thai art forms. Be sure to watch the women carve fruit, I wish they offered a class when I was there.Worth the admission price.

What's all about this place?. Just a nice little teak house, where you gotta wait for a mandatory (!!!) guided tour. We're french speaking, and our kids speak french only, so we wait for the french tour... OK. Thompson was some kind of a gay spy, trafficking silk to get rich. Then he disappeared under mysterious circumstances. He left silk tradition heritage back to Thailand and Thais. Now, Jim Thompson house is all about the business of selling overpriced silk to tourists. Nothing much to see here, this site is totally overrated.

Brilliant. Loved the informative tour of the home of the enigmatic Jim Thompson. The house is truly fascinating and the antiques are fantastic. Restaurant served a great lunch,even though on the expensive side. Nice and close to the sky train. Defintely worth the visit.

An overview of Thai culture and architecture. A great place to visit. The house has been built based on the traditional Thai architecture and the furniture and paintings in the house are amazing. The guide is also well versed in English and the explanation is adequate.

Oasis in the city. So glad we went to visit the Jim Thompson House. It's a shady quiet oasis in the middle of the bustling city. My 9 year old daughter was fascinated by the live demonstrations in the courtyard on how silk is made. We all enjoyed the guideed tour of house.

Tour and food. The tour of the home/museum was interesting. You feel like you have stepped back in time. We had lunch overlooking the fish pond and the food was good in taste and cost. The best non alcholic drink I had in Bangkok was the watermelon, passionfruit and lime smoothie.

Interesting history. An impromptu visit was very interesting and worth it. Shuttle bus from the main road is available.The house holds fabulous history of the silk trade and his lifestyle. Worth a visit when in Bangkok.

Definitely worth a visit. Visited Jim Thompson House on our trip to Thailand in December 2013. Loved the architecture, artifacts and interesting tour. The gardens / grounds are a lush sanctuary in the middle of Bangkok. Easy to get to via public transportation. Inexpensive admission and overall pleasant few hours learning about the genesis of the silk trade in Thailand. Gift shop with high quality silk products among other things.

A beautiful space nest in the centre of urban city!. Whether you have heard of the legendary Father of Silk Jim Thompson, one should not miss exploring the house of the late Jim Thompson, a talented gentleman that revived the silk industry of Thailand.

Very nice!. The story of Jim Thompson is an interesting one. His house is a beautiful teak house made of parts of older houses. There is a nice restaurant there with good food and a store where you can buy Jim Thompson silks. It is a short walk from the National Stadium sky train stop. Follow the Jim Thompson signs. The house sends a small open car to carry people who don't want to walk.

Great traditional place. To come there by klorng taxi was the first great experience and very fast. Shadely, quiet place to come in contact with local history, silk production and architecture ... also a great place to have delicous food in a gorgeous ambience.
skip this. boring boring boring. We left the tour halfway through because it was hot and boring. Do not waste your time. Beautiful house but not worth the time.

Oasis in Bangkok City. I've been to Bangkok many times, and I always visit Jim Thomson House. Anyone interested in local history, or the history of Thai silk should visit. There is a tour with a guide if you wish to look inside the house which is filled with antiques and prints. Tours are conducted in many languages. I always visit around lunch time so after the tour we can eat at the cafe which offers great food and drinks. There is also a lovely upmarket gift shop, which is quite expensive. If you are after copies of the prints you see in the house, they are available in a small shop near the area you wait for your tour. Be aware that the complex is located at the end of a dead end lane (next to a canal), there are scams where locals will tell you that the house is closed......it's open 7 days a week, don't believe them as they just want to take you somewhere else.
Average at best ~. went by the house - saw it - it is just a house, ok a big house, where the owner has gone missing for many years and is there. He was a huge silk trader and disappeared years ago.

Home of a legend. Lovely Thai architecture in this home of Jim Thompson, a legend in Thailand who revamped the silk industry for which Thailand is famous.It helps to do a little reading about Jim Thompson before visiting as he was an American who mysteriously disappeared.The home, artefacts, garden and fishpond are all delightful.As you'd expect there is a Jim Thompson store and a cafe on site .
Over rated. It is a nice place to visit and see. It has an excellent shop.and restaurant. you acn buy the same products at teh airport for less price

Classic Attraction. Its a good old classic attraction. You need to know a little about Jim Thompson before you visit this place, its not mandatory though, but it will help you understand better the importance of this place, just to give you a brief intro he was a spy who disappeared mysteriously. There is a shop inside, from where you can buy silk gifts for friends and family members.

A silky slice of old Siam. Jim Thompson House is a must see when visiting Bangkok. The site is reasonably well located, a 5 minute walk from the National Stadium BTS train station. The architecture and antique collection alone is highly impressive, as was a silk making demonstration in the court yard entry. The visit of the house is done as a guided tour, and the guide was gave a very good overview of the life of Jim Thompson and the significance of various rooms and objects in the house. The only thing lacking was an explanation silk making, although there are a series of (kid friendly) display boards, showing the stages of silk production on the ground floor. If time permits, the Jim Thompson cafe/restaurant is well worth a visit, facing back to the house near ornate fish pond. The thai pomelo salad was zesty and yummy!
Beautiful. Beautiful place, lots of history! The guides are so welcoming and knowledgeable. A great day in Bangkok!

Beautiful home and worth the visit!. I'm not big into textiles, but there is some beautiful cloth here. Jim Thompson was a bit of a local celebrity, and had this beautiful home here along the canal.It's a beautiful spot both if you're into textiles and if you want to see a high-end traditional Thai home compound.I'd move here in a second for a place like this!

A must see in Bangkok. This is a fascinating attraction right in the heart of Bangkok. It is a wonderful place to spend a few hours learning about the development of the Thai silk industry and about the colourful man responsible for it. The house is a museum filled with interesting Asian cultural exhibits. There is an excellent restuarant with reasonably priced delicious Thai food.Highly recommended!

A must do in Bangkok. This is a must do in Bangkok - I can't exactly remember when I visited this place but it was one of my trips during the past 2 years - As others say worth the visit - Interesting person & history.The shop is well stocked & reasonably priced but nothing much to keek the little ones amused.

Private home of wealthy entrepreneur. The Jim Thompson House is right in the middle of downtown. Beautiful architecture and important artwork. Watching the silk being made by hand at the front entrance is a highlight (and something you do not have to pay for. The entrance fee is reasonable for what you see. Basically, this is a rich guy's house--it's nice but it doesn't give you much insight into Thai culture or history.

A quiet spot in a busy city!. One is able to take the Skytrain fairly close to this site. Jim Thompson was a complex person - he revived the silk industry in Thailand, collected antiques, combined several old local houses to create a beautiful home for himself, and was head of a spy agency. He disappeared mysteriously while visiting in the countryside and was never heard of again. The house, furnishings, and gardens are lovely and peaceful. You must take one of the guided tours which leave regularly.

Well organized. Thompsons, accustomed to marketing offer an interesting, quick, tour of the beautifully built complex and into the mind of an enigmatic former secret agent, who, as you would expect, disappeared mysteriously into the highlands of Malaya.

Beautiful space set in the centre of the urban space!. i followed my heart once when i was walking underneath the national stadium BTS and found this beautiful space where i was introduced to the lengendary Father of Silk Jim Thompson and learned his mysterious yet beautiful stories on how he revived the silk industry of THailand and his misterious disappearing when he was last seen in Malaysia Cameron Highland. An amazing space where you get to see the heritage and culture side of Thailand within the urban surrounding!

Interesting but hot/steamy. Don't think the day was any different to others but boy it was hot there ! Great to see the house and gardens and as others say it is an oasis. We took the short cut a la Nancy Chandler map after catching the sky train and then use the free golf cart back to the main road. Ate lunch there in the a/c part and took the free guided tour. Worth a visit. Need to take shoes off and bulky bags locked up safely in a locker with a key. Interesting koi fish and water lillies !

Very lovely place!. Every time when I go to Bangkok I go to Jim Thompson house.First time i visited in 2006.As for me this place is very interesting.There is nice shop inside.So I always buy silk things such as scarves,bags,handkerchieves and another.Very modern and colorful design.Products of JT are very nice for present.The most of my friends ask me buy something at this shop.I also visited museum-home where lived Jim Thompson.There is very nice furniture and tableware.On the whole tour you can hear about Jim Thompson life.I would recommended this place to anyone!

Great experience!. The whole experience was so informative and done with a good dose of humour and great interaction withthe group. Questions were answered easily and with surety. They even have a free shuttle service that takes you toe the main road again and assist you to get a taxi to your next destination.
Interesting. Very interesting man and his house is beautiful very we'll worth a visit I was pleasantly surprised. The guide we had was also very we'll informed.

Good hour trip. Me and my mate did this tour while other half went shopping,
Beautiful buildings and surrounding grounds. Our guide was very informative and it was an interesting interlude from shopping or drinking!!!

Nice home museum to visit. Visited here in april 2014. Well done small home museum well worth at visit in Bangkok. Jim Thompson house bit hidden in a local neighborhood and not very easy to find. make sure you have written down instructions how to get there

Interesting day, short tour. I had heard about the Jim Thompson house from others who had visited. We did a tour, which was interesting, but, it was shorter than I would have liked. That said, there was not much else I think they could have showed us around the property. I did end up buying some decorative silk pillow throw covers, which I love in my home, but they are also very pricey (most items seemed to run 100+ USD). However, this tour was easy to do. We made no reservations, walked over from the MRT, and were able to fit it into the day we used the water taxi to take in a lot of sights around Bangkok.

Fascinating. Well I started off the day at the Jim Thompson Outlet store so arrived laden down with shopping excited to learn more about Jim Thompson. The tour takes 35 minutes and I loved learning more about his life and house. What a wonderful spot - not to be missed!

Nice to see, some other experience. A nice experience next to all the temples. The Jim Thompson house is not so known as you might think, so bring the address. The tour takes 30 minutes, the restaurant is great. The shop is very expensive. The gardens are great. It's a nice thing to do.

Nice Tourist Place. If you are a typical tourist and a little afraid to try authentic local food, then this place is for you. The food is pretty good, but toned down for the tourist palate. In other words, you can try Thai food, but it is similar to that you would get in a typical Thai restaurant in the U.S.They also have a nice store with Thai items. However, the prices are like those you would find in an American department store. The selection is nice, but prices are kind of high.I think that this is a place to visit one time, for the experience, however, if you are a little more adventuresome and a little more travel savvy, I would skip it entirely.

Serenity in Bangkok. I had never been to Jim Thompson House on previous visits to Bangkok. So glad I finally paid a visit. A nice oasis surrounded by the chaos of an incredibly busy city. Beautiful gardens with unusual flowers throughout the grounds. Interesting architecture. Fascinating history. I usually avoid gift shops but this one is worth a visit. A wide variety of silk products. Wish I had bought more. I recommend taking time to visit this low-key attraction

Historical, beautiful and relaxing!. Located a very short walk from the National Stadium BTS station, the Jim Thompson House is a peaceful oasis in the midst of a chaotic city. This is a remarkable example of classic Thai architecture with a western slant. The home is completely constructed of teak. The home and the gardens are breathtaking. After the tour I ate lunch at the restaurant on site overlooking a peaceful Koi pond. It was a very relaxing and insightful way to spend a morning.

A Glimpse into an Elegant Past. The Jim Thompson House is certainly worth visiting if you would like to be transported in the early 1900s and feel the elegance of the past. I would advise you to first read the history behind Jim Thompson to give the visit a rich contextual experience. The series of houses are set in lush gardens on a canal. The elgant understated beauty of the buildings and the furnishings give you glimpses of what it must have been like to have undertaken an exotic adventure during Bangkok's early days and what it must have been like to live in luxury in an exotic location. You certainly feel as if this was a place of peacefulness and contentment. There is also a relaxing restaurant where you can refresh yourself in the garden and enjoy the coy pond before heading back to the frenetic pace of the city.
Jim Thompsons House. Beautiful setting, nice gardens, pay about 100 baht and you get taken around and shown his house nice to see, Jim Thompson help revive the silk industry in Thailand.
HIDDEN TREASURE. The museum is seen in small tours led by a knowledgeable tour guide. This is a small museum but well worth the tour. There is a silk store on the premises.

Beautiful Shop. This is a beautiful shop in an old house, not far from the Patpong area of Bangkok. If you are going there to shop be prepared to pay alot more for what you are buying than you would in other parts of town eg MBK.

Beautiful house & gardens. This is a must visit for any resident or tourist. The enigma behind the Man who totally revived the Thai silk industry and then vanished so completely that today there are still theories as to what really happened. There is a guided tour around the house and the interior is so wonderful and the story surrounding it fascinating. The gardens are a joy to sit in and relax after the tour and there is a shop selling a lot of products. You will not be disappointed in making a trip to this oasis of calm among the bedlam that is Bangkok.

a true blast from the past. Explore Jim's house as it was before he left to disappear. Everything is how it was when he lived and designed there. They have a good shop, and a great restaurant on the grounds, so go for lunch

elegant design. the story of Jim Thompson is intriguing and his house reflects an elegant eye for detail. The grounds are small but the garden is beautiful, the house is impressive, and the guides are happy to tell the story of the silk exporter who influenced a fashion revolution. if you like the products of Jim Thompson, make sure to travel to sukhumvit soi 93 to the outlet where you can get high quality jim thompson products for half of the price. They close at 6pm though so get there in time to shop the factory's 3 retail floors.

Worth a visit. Lovely house set within the madness . Only 100 bht for the guided tour what lasts around 40 minutes . Very informative on the history of the house and the man himself . Nice to see a different side of BKK

Been there & done that at last. Having heard and read so much we decided that on this trip it was a definite go place and we were not sorry. Not only was the tour very interesting but the gardens are beautiful. Thoroughly enjoyed Jim Thomson House.

Truly beautiful and a must on every visitor's list. Its kind of a pity, that after living in Bangkok for nearly 2 years, I have only now managed to sneak a peak and I was blown away by its sheer beauty. I have totally fallen in love with the Thai Style house. Staff is extremely knowledgeable and friendly, of course one of the amazing traits of the Thais.

beautiful. Nice place with a lot of trees, and gardens in the middle of Bangkok
The only way to see traditional architecture

Worth a visit. An interesting place. The house that he assembled is fantastic, but even more interesting is his story, he helped rescue the Thai silk industry, had CIA links and then mysteriously disappeared! Easy to spend an hour there, tours go for about 40 minutes.

Absolutely fabulous. For those with a passion for interior design, this place is a must. The Museum provides fixed guided tours, there is a restaurant and a lovely shop selling the beautiful array of jim Thompson silk (but if you have time, check on-line for the jim Thompson outlet which will provide you with silk at much reduced prices.) I would recommend reading Jim's biography, widely available in Bangkok and a good read on how he built his "silk emporium" whilst simultaneously giving you a taste of Bangkok in the early days. Less known and less fancy but nevertheless equally interesting are the nearby Suan Pakkad, there is also the house of the former minister and the Kamthieng House (showing daily life of farmers).
Different. A different place from all the attractions in bangkok , interesting information and a journey into the history of bangkok and old traditions

The home of Thai silk. What an amazing place, and one we always visit when in Bangkok, and just next door to the large department store (get there by MTS).Its full of amazing antiquities, and the building are typical villages houses. The guides are very knowledgeable, and enjoy a refreshing tea in the cafe at the end. A must see for tourists.

Ok to kill half a day. Jim Thompsons House in Bangkok was ok if you have a spare morning or afternoon to kill. You get a guided tour but it's not a huge place. Fairly interesting but you need to be interested in the History and culture. JTs is better known through its retail outlets and restaurants.

A tranquil escape. This was a very pleasant way to spend a couple of hours. Our tour guide was extremely friendly and answered any questions that came her way. The property itself is a stunning example of Thai architecture and very well maintained. A very worthwhile excursion and a welcome break from the hectic streets of Bangkok.

Interesting information of Stories from the Museum. i have been this MUSEUM with my friend , it's make my first time very excited with many stories from the Guide whom bring us seems like back to the pasted as we used to really leave in that time of the histories .in front of the Museum before you starting to go in side of the Museum they also have Thai handicraft is one thing to make us , ahh ok, do not touch the thing of the Museum if you dont have approving from your Guide before go back don't miss out to buy the MAP of SIAM for your memories

an oasis in the city. We visited Jim Thompson house on our first day in Bangkok. What a wonderful cool oasis in the middle of the city. Fairly easy to find once you get off the sky train, and they even run a golf caddy to get you to and from the main road. An interesting house, a good tour-guide and a great shop!We enjoyed a cool drink in the cafe too.

A trip into the past. Not having been in Bangkok for 40 years, I was overwhelmed. My visit to Jim Thompson's house was unbelievable! What an amazing man he was. There is currently a cafe attached at. The "new" ground levelThe gift shop has a massive array of scarves- large and small- to fit most budgets.I went alone and was delighted with the food from a street cart almost outside the entrance. there was a great juice/ stand as well.There is also a Jim Thompson "outlet" somewhere in this huge city. I would have checked it out had my days in Bangkok been running out.

It's different. The house is amazing, and so is the story of Jim Thompson. The Thai love this guy. Great for history buffs, and there is a shop there, but you can get Jim Thompson silks elsewhere for cheaper. It's hot; and I mean hot, though.

Cool and different. The Jim Thompson House was a great place to spend a few hours on my last day in Bangkok. I enjoyed an iced Thai tea and super-yummy coconut ice-cream at the cafe, and then joined a complimentary tour of the houses and grounds.

Worth the time for a visit. I'm not typically excited about tours like this. The Thai English-Speaking guide that we had added so much to the visit; she had an incredible sense of humor and really made the visit lots of fun. There's an interesting story behind this place and seeing it for just the workmanship of the home is worth the 100 baht entrance fee. Done expect to get a lesson in silk making, although there is a small demonstration area set-up. This is one of many places very easy to find from the BTS.

Almost didn't go: mistake!. This seemed a little too touristy - but it was SO worth the time. The story of Jim thompson and the reason for the house - so interesting. The gist shops were top notch if that's what you want. A VERY good experience!!

Unexpectedly awesome. This gorgeous house in the middle of the city yet in the middle of what appears to be jungle is a very pleasant surprise. Unfortunately you can't take photos but the house architecture and design are outstanding. The restaurant food is nice too.

Some good info and shopping (if you are into it). The place was house of the famous Jim Thompson. Its interesting and informative, but it is about Jim Thompson and not silk. The shop outside sells some good items. Worth a stop by.

average quality with expensive prices. Been there for a while but just left after only 15 minutes. they have large variety but the prices are expensive. same quality you can get much cheaper at the outside shops

It tells a nice tale with a nice estate to explore, but that's about it.. The guided tours in english is great for tourists, and it brings you around the various part of the estate while going through the story of Jim Thompson and how his fortunes was tied to silk trade and the mysterious ending of this famous character in Thai history. Its a bit of adventure to walk around the actual place of a historical figure, with the teak furniture and antique tools of the silk trade. The entrance fee is not expensive and it is a short walking distance from a BTS station in the shopping area, so it's worth a visit when you are in town in Bangkok.

a great intro..... to the silk industry and the architect of south east asia. I learned quite a bit from this tour. The house sits on the back side of a river so you also get a taste of how much life really takes place on the rivers in these countries. I also learned about spirit houses and why the houses are built the way they are! Lovely wood and other artifacts made tho an enjoyable tour.

Quaint teak houses. Jim Thompson house consists of teak houses , Siam artifacts and beautiful furniture that have been transported from elsewhere and assembled here... It is an extraordinary piece of architecture set in a very beautiful and well maintained little garden ,with guided tours every 30 minutes( if I remember correctly). The tour is very interesting and the young guides give a lot of informations ,but sometimes if you get a guide with a strong Thai accent it is very difficult to follow what they say because they must follow a time schedule and they go very fast....I had lots of problems understanding mine...get your information before you visit ...just in case..no pictures allowed inside the houses.There is also a nice little restaurant and a silk shop,but the silk items on sale are very expensive .After my visit I jumped in one of the local boats just in the canal behind J.Thompson house.....there is a stop just a few steps away....what an experience..go for it!

Home of a legend. We were able to catch a wonderful tour at the home of the legendary Jim Thompson. The tour helped us understand the culture and design of the home and gardens. The guide added a little humor as well. An enjoyable experience!

Different. This is a really interesting place, obviously created by an interesting man who loved Thai culture and the Thai lifestyle. The tours are informative and interesting and it's in a really calm spot, despite being right bang in the middle of the city.

Worth your time. The house is amazing and well-preserved. The shop is fantastic, and the restaurant was good. All tours are guided, which is mildly annoying, but I did learn some interesting information about Mr. Thompson I wouldn't have otherwise.

Some real history. A wonderful piece of real Thai history - Jim must have been a great fellow but who knows what happened to him. He was a real pioneer in the east and the fabric industry is much better as a result. The prices of the souvenirs are a little on the high side however I am assured that the quality is great

Wonderful. A lovely place to visit and feel some of the old Thai atmosphere. I am fascinatedvby the Jim Thompson story and have visited the house several times. There are many beautiful pieces to look at and teak houses are very rare now. Some f the hoses were dissassembled and brought down the river to be built on the site. The garden is also lovely. I wonder what he would thinknof modern Bangkok?

A walk down memory lane. My 3rd time to visit Jim Thompson.I love the beautiful architectural design of this charming red house and learning about the history and the life of Mr Jim Thompson. The tour is very educational and good for all ages. It is still a mystery of Mr Thompson's disappearance but surely he has left behind a rich cultural legacy ....

Beautiful House with great shopping opportunities on site. We had American visitors on our trip who told us about this little gem in the middle of Bangkok. A wonderful house and furnishings, in the most beautiful grounds. We had a booked tour which was quite splendid. Jim Thompson the original owner sure had great taste. The shop is full of high quality goods, I could have spent a fortune and some of our American fellow travellers did!!There is a shop at Bangkok airport also. I prefered the ambiance at the foundation but then I wasn't spending big time!Also a very good cafe on site.

Very interesting house. You get an experience of living in a Thai house although, according to the guide, it is a collection of several houses that Jim Thompson transported to the area and put together to make a large living space and filled it up with more modern furnishing. What makes it interesting as well are the impressive artifacts and antiques JIm Thompson collected. The structure is made of teak and some of the doors are part of his collection as well.The shop sells beautiful handwoven products. You get to see how the silks are collected. It is a short tour, just 30 minutes.

Spectacular Architecture!. I absolutely loved this gem. I did not know who Jim Thompson was until I came to Bangkok. The house is so beautiful and is full of ancient treasures of Siam. To appreciate this house is to understand how rare Teak houses are now. You also can’t move teak wood from the area that it came from, so this house would not have been possible today. The houses are over 200 years old, the wood is amazing! You have to understand this house was designed in 1956 and was unique for it’s day. Nothing is built like this in Thailand today. If you have the opportunity, do some research before you go to help understand and appreciate how unique this is. The grounds are beautiful, and today are surrounded with some not so beautiful buildings. If you appreciate architecture, you will like this.The gift shop is small, I saw larger JT shops at the mall. The small restaurant is charming and I had the BEST coconut cake I have ever had! I was surprised! While I waited for my tour, stopped for a quick snack, boy was this cake delicious, fresh coconut, fresh cake, it was amazing!

Jim Thompson House. This is an interesting architectural museum with beautiful gardens. There is a nice, air conditioned restaurant on site as well as a bookstore and shop for silk textiles. The shop is expensive and unless you find something you can't live without, you can shop tax free at the airport where there are Jim Thompson shops in the International duty free area.

Relaxing and beautiful. Jim Thompson House is incredible. It's located down a laneway off one of the main streets of Bangkok which is quite easy to find, and once you finish the tour, you can choose to be driven back to the street by a free shuttle service. The house itself is just beautiful and it was lovely to hear of the history (and mystery) behind Jim Thompson House. We also bought some lovely silk items from their well stocked store. Gorgeous gardens and lily ponds situated within the house area. A worthwhile and calming experience.

Jim Thompson - Really ?. That was one of the worse disappointment for me. Sorry i may seems very rude and blunt but the fact is i am sharing my experience. I saw lots of good review and went their with effort to have a glimpse of this nicely decorated and guarded place. inside i found big single boutique which showcase silk material in all possible form which human can buy. Catch is only at what price ? I saw the price and wondering myself is from India where different kinds of Silk available and was not able to differentiate too much in term of quality specially BANARAS & KANJIWARAM SILK. any way if you just want to go for the sake of flaunting go otherwise better go to chiana market which is so vibrant in colour.

Interesting. A lovely home with lovely grounds. Interesting history about this person. The gift shop was very large with very nice clothing etc. There are several so give yourself time to visit them all.
Definitely worth visiting in Bangkok. What an enjoyable half-day trip this was. Easily reachable by Skytrain. Peaceful haven in a bustling city. Informative tour of the houses. Great lunch, too.

Nice place to know the history of Silk making. Nice place. A good place to hang out for a hot afternoon. Learnt a little more about the silk industry and the layout of a westerner in an Asian society. Guides are a must to bring you around for 100 Baht. They provide shuttle services that runs 15 mins each time from National Stadium BTS. Food was tad overpriced but what can you say when it's at a tourist attraction. Love the overall experience though. :)

Historical place. There are guide person who can explain in Japanese and English. It is very convenience for foreign tourist.And you can buy authorized silk products.You can go to here easily and watch historical stuffs.

Interesting Museum. A spent a nice rainy couple of hours at this beautiful property. A little pricey but if you are interested in unique architecture this is a must see.http://diaryofanordinarytraveller.blogspot.ca/2013/08/bankok.html

Unmissable. The architect and textile designer Jim Thompson loved Bangkok so much that he built himself a house. It is very special and well worth seeing, you can only visit it via an excellent and informative 40 minute guided tour (in english if required). There's a fantastic shop - but if you can bear to wait until leaving prices are cheaper at the airport shops.

Finally found this place!. This place is not easy to find (before the time of Google Maps) but I finally managed to visit the place. It's tucked away at the end of a soi near National Stadium BTS.All trips through the property are guided by tourguides who speak a variety of languages. We have the fortune of having a guide who spoke excellent English and has an exceptional sense of humour. Her punchlines and witty anecdotes kept us laughing away throughout the 35-min tour, which took us through the few different stilt houses that Jim Thompson combined to become his palace in the tropics.Felt the tour's a tad short but still a very fulfilling experience.

Tour guide Jim Thomson's make fun to my ear :(. While I'm deep with Jim Thomson house The tour guide point to me in front of another tourists. She said I have big ear and she laughing??? She said my life was long or short it depend on my ear and try to make everyone continue analized what she just said with my ear! Next room I keeping quiet and keeping space to her but the room was tiny so still not to far from her. Then she bring it to me again she call everyone and start story with my ear again c'mon what a manners I was so up set. I really want to disappear why she did it to me? I told her " I'm sorry I'm not your friend please stop playing with my ear I knew I have big ear but I don't want you to mention it I am your customer ... Please stop and continue your job." About 20 tourist was silent some are looking at her and walk away. This is very bad.

Fascinating Story. We didn't think we would have time to visit Jim Thompson's House but I am glad we did.The house is situated near the National Stadium & is a short walk from the Skytrain station. Everyone has to go on a tour & you have to wait until the next tour in your chosen language. If you do have a wait, check out the grounds which have lovely ponds with Koi Carp & turtles as well as flowers & silk buds. The tour guides are very well informed, providing a detail insight into Jim Thompson's life & where/how he acquired the mass of antiques within his home. It is a beautiful building & I would thoroughly recommend a visit!
Jim Thompson House. Very interssting house with a good story well worth a visit. Very close to MBK Shopping centre and Skytrain. Has a nice restaurant on site as well.

An hour of serenity. I work nearby and always wanted to visit Jim Thompson House but got a free time recently so I decided to visit the House.It is located about 5-10mins walk from BTS National Stadium station (exit 1). Head west towards Soi Kasemsan 2, then walk to the end of the alley.The ticket is THB100 and that includes roughly less than an hour of tour around the house with a guide. You can choose language of the tour guide as well.I love this place not because of the beautiful Thai silk, but the house & garden is really pleasant. I enjoyed it very much and would definitely recommend if you have an hour of spare time and in the area.Restaurant and souvenir shop are also there, but I have not been in those.

Tranquil haven of peace. Thoroughly enjoyed the moment of peace and tranquillity that the Jim Thompson house and lush gardens offered in the middle of crazy Bangkok. Not only was Jim Thompson living the ex-pat dream but he had an eye for beauty and helped to revive the Thai silk industry. The dark teak of the house combined with Jim Thompson's impeccable taste in architecture, antiques and all things Asian make this an exceptional place to visit. The tour was informative and fun and just the right length. After the visit, spend some time pondering the giant mutant goldfish over a drink in the bar. I had some kind of delightfully refreshing iced smoothie involving lychee, lime and mint. Here's cheers to Jim Thompson, who mysteriously disappeared without a trace 8 years after moving into the house...

Very interesting, a must see.. I admit I wasn't really sure what this place was about, but it was well worth going to. The staff even gave us a ride from the skytrain station to the house and it is tucked away and very serene. The house itself is beautiful and the tour was very informative.

Beautiful Silk. Jim Thompson was famous for reviving the Thai silk trade. There's a mystery surrounding his disappearance while vacationing in Malaysia in 1967. The house is a little hard to find because when you get off the sky train it's not clear which direction you should go. Look for the little free golf cart shuttle. You really don't need it because the walk isn't that far, but it's a nice little service. You can buy a tour of the house or wander the grounds on your own. The tour guides are very knowledgeable and ours had a great sense of humor. The house you're touring is Jim Thompson's actual house and all the artifacts, furnishings and furniture are his. You get a little lesson about his history and of course there is the shop. Take a peek - if only to get a litte air conditioning. I purchased two beautiful scarves about which I receive multiple compliments every time I wear them.
Stunning piece of architecture. The complex was beautiful and our tour guide was informative! A little difficult to locate - take a map!
Lovely house and surroundings. The house, history and surroundings were great as was the tour. Watch out for people on corners trying to deter you from going there.

Something different to do if you're all tempted out.. A nice interesting place to visit. It does get quite hot because you are outside and obviously the house isn't air conditioned.Relax before the tour by siting next to the fish pond. The restaurant has the best orange juice I have ever tried.
Great piece of history. Very interesting, you get a guided tour as part of your ticket entry. Beautiful buildings and artifacts with the added mystery of Jim Thompsons unsolved disappearance.

Worth the quick visit. If you find yourself near MBK mall for some shopping, a quick visit afterwards is totally worthy.
It is not that the museum will make a big difference in your life, but you will learn some interesting and fun facts about Asia in general and see some really beautiful and rare asian artworks.

Beautiful garden. Guide escorts each tourists. Big rich house buildings and well decorated gardens. They make threads from cocoons with traditional skills. We bought one scarf made of silk in the shop there. Best quality with best prices.

This is one of the hidden Jewels of Bangkok. A spectacular "personal" museum showcasing historic Thai architecture and beautiful art. The history of Jim Thompson is the stuff of legends and many books have been written about him. He single handidly brought back Thai silk making so all of that beautiful silk you see is due to him.Thompson was also one of the first Westerner to appreciate historic Thai and Khmer art and was collecting long before anyone else. Some of those amazing pieces are in his former home which is now the museum. I have been to Bangkok more times than I can count (my wife is from there) and I tell every visitor that they must not miss this beautiful little place. It can be hard to find but it is well worth it.

Lovely. This was very interesting walking round with a guide explaining all about Jim Thompson and what happened to him. There was a man sat weaving silk from caterpillars which was fascinating to watch. It takes approx. 1-11/2 hours to look round.

Hidden Oasis. My second visit to Jim Thompson's charming house won't be the last and was as enjoyable as the first. You need only a passing interest in architecture and design to appreciate this little piece of paradise in the midst of the chaos that typifies much of Bangkok. The guided tour lasts only about 30 minutes but you will want to spend a little longer enjoying the tranquility of the grounds...and lusting over the beautiful, but largely too expensive, items in the shop.
Thai traditional house. It is a must for Thailand-fans. Try to go early in the morning to avoid many tourist and try the restaurant at the museum.
The lost man. Wonderful museum of thai silk history. However I went for the architecture which was magnificent, so many buildings brought together with so many styles.
Interesting Story. The presentation of the house and guide tour was good. Too bad we couldn't take pictures inside. Be ready to take your shoes off

Well worth a visit. If you're finding modern Bangkok too hot, noisy and busy this is the place to go. On the grounds are historic houses that you can visit, modern silk products you can buy and food to eat.The tour is informative and good value for money. The silk products are beautiful but unfortunately very expensive. I didn't have a meal in the restaurant but I can confirm that the Lychee smoothies (with mint or ginger), coconut ice cream and chocolate cake are delicious.

An Oasis in the City. Arriving by water taxi I was unsure exactly where the entrance was as there were tall buildings and shops everywhere. Entering the house grounds I was, however, a world away from the chaos of Bangkok. Tropical foliage and serene walkways snaked through the property. The houses were immaculately restored/preserved. The teak wood was well cared for and maintained to a high polish. The furniture was incredible. The tour guide was excellent and I really felt a sense for what Bangkok was like in the mid 1900's.

Silk Man Ahead Of His Time. Get the free electric took took from outside the Nissan building to save a long walk then marvel at how this guy constructed his house way ahead of it's time.Still a booming Thai industry years after his strange disappearance

A little piece of history with a nice cold Singha. This is a little historical tour meets museum meets art gallery meets restaurant with a tiny whack of gift shop thrown in.I was a bit reluctant to go initially as my only knowledge of the Jim Thompson branding was at BKK airport on numerous trips.Seeing the house and compound area and understanding more of the history of modern Thai silk making and of Jim Thompson the man was a real eye opener. Had lunch at the restaurant and was pleasantly surprised that it was not the average fare of the tourist trap...and service was very brisk and efficient.The bonus for me was buying the Jim Thompson cookbook at the gift store...and I do not often buy at tourist attractions...but living in the region I flicked through and found a couple of recipes that really hit the mark...was worth going just for that :)

Tranquility discovered. If you are planning to visit, do so after a tiring day of seeing the typical Bangkok attractions like the Wats as this place will help rejuvenate you. I found JTH to be less of a tourist attraction, and more of a place to escape to and relax in to escape the noise of the city. It is tucked away at the far end of a narrow street, and everything from the house, the restaurant, and the free exhibitions outside (silk weaving demonstrations for example) brings a sense of zen that is surprisingly hard to find elsewhere in the Buddhist city.

Absolutely stunning. The gardens and house are simply stunning. A lovely way to spend an hour or so and escape the city heat and at 100 baht per adult it's great value. Our guide was terrific and had an infectious enthusiasm for the house and its history. She was, we think Chinese/American and had a very sharp sense of humour - very entertaining and really glad we had her as our guide. Unfortunately I didn't catch her name. Took so many stunning photos. The giftshop has some gorgeous items, sadly I'd need to rob a bank to buy anything there.

Interesting Place. This place is basically a house built by Jim Thompson and converted into a tourist attraction. Located close to the National Stadium BTS station and offers free shuttle service to and from the road where the station is located.Buy a ticket to avail the well conducted tours in different languages. Did not visit the cafe but bought a few mementos from the store.

A must see place for nature lovers. Visiting the Jim Thompson House at Bangkok will take your breath away and take you to an time which has been a part of the Thai culture for century. Has a reach history of silk production and processes. The museum also comprises of the interesting and also upsetting tale of the life of Jim Thompson. Anyone who loves nature and silk must go and see this place.

Interesting man and home. Jim seems to have lived and entertained in a western style in a house made of Thai houses. He leaves an extensive Asian art collection. The house and gardens are exquisite and worth touring. I enjoyed touring gardens alone both before and after the house tour. The young ladies who give the tours are well trained and very sweet. There are lockers and an area to leave your shoes. Bags,umbrellas shoes are not allowed up in the house. The restaurant was not open during my morning visit. I did enjoy looking in the shop

A must see in Bangkok. The Jim Thompson House is a must for anyone interested in silk production, architecture, and history. Such a calm soothing oasis in the middle of a crazy urban space. I really enjoyed getting there down one of the many canals in Bangkok as well. Don't miss this Bangkok hot spot!

Back into the last century. If you don't know from where silk is comming - go to Jim Thompsons ground. Very cute guides show you the house and the history of this enterprise. I recommend also the restaurant with perfekt lunch dishes to smart prices.

An authentic Thai living atmosphere in the center of Bangkok. Nice set of wooden country houses surrounded by abundant plants and trees. Houses are fully furnished with Jim Thompson's original furniture. Visit include guide.

Relaxing, and informative about the Thai Silk Industry. This is a great place to spend a few hours and take in the history of the Thai Silk industry and the mystery of Jim Thompson's disappearance . The area around the house is very quiet and the tour guides are great. The complex and the artifacts that Jim Thompson collected are very beautiful.

House of the legendary Jim Thompson. One thing that made me really interested was the suddenly disappearance of Jim Thompson and how he embrace the thai culture. His home was a fusion of American and Thai aspects of a home. There are many languages of guides available including french, chinese and english of course. In fact, you need a guided tour in order to visit the house. And i would very much recommend the tour because there are totally no signs available to describe each place you are viewing. After the tour, I headed to the restaurant for a meal. The food was good, ambience was great, and the price unbelievable for such an atmosphere. Back home in Singapore, you will probably have to pay $30 sgd at least for each person for such ambience and meal. So go ahead and try!

Great expeience!. We loved the guided tour. Our guide added humour and lots of anecdotes to keep us smiling throughout the 30 mins of the guided tour. The cosy café had limited menu but great food. I loved the watermelon cooler. The property is tastefully restored into a tourist spot. The retail shop is good too. But I would rather visit the factory outlet to get the same stuff a bit cheaper. But the experience was very good.

Lush, relaxing and informative. We found Jim Thompson House easily after a short walk from the Pathumwan Princess Hotel (attached to the MBK Mall) where we were staying, and it's also a very easily located to the National Stadium Station of the BTS.We hadn't yet eaten the morning we went so we had brunch at the Jim Thompson Restaurant. The food was awesome and the gardens surrounding the seating area are beautiful.The tour of the Jim Thompson House itself was fantastic. Our guide spoke very good English and emphasised the key words to ensure all the group were following. The tour was a great insight into the Thai silk industry, traditional Thai houses, and the life of Jim Thompson. We loved the architecture and antiques.No photos from inside the main buildings are allowed, but after the tour you are welcome to browse the gardens and take photos from outside.The gardens themselves are amazing, and are a great escape from the hustle and bustle of Bangkok.We highly recommend this attraction to any visitor to Bangkok

A different aspect of Bangkok. This is a calmer deviation from the routine of Bangkok temples, palaces, boat rides and city chaos. And for us it was just a short walk from our hotel (Asia Hotel).Jim Thompson was an American who post-WW2 developed the silk-weaving industry here. This is the story of him and his house, but I thought more could have been made of the arts and industry of silk-making (the silk is in the shop!). Bar and restaurant attached.You get a language-specific tour guide for a very reasonable entry fee, but then the prices in the souvenir shop are rather high. (You will see there are are also at least three Jim Thompson outlets in Bangkok airport).
Silent and cozy. Don't come during summer, it's very hot even though they put fan in every corner in the room.The Jim Thompson cafe is nice, the food served is also good.The toilet is very unique.

small, enjoyable, and worth doing. My wife and I visited the house/museum in April during a 3 night stay. We were looking for something to do during the middle of the day to escape the heat, and we hit on Jim Thompson House. This was an inspired choice as we both found it genuinely enjoyable to hear Thompson's story, and to tour his house. It was all just the right size for us, and we also enjoyed our tour guide who was informative
Very interesting meander through the house. Informative visit, nice gardens, interesting to see inside the house and hear the history of Jim Thompson.

Great for everyone!. I was not really excited about going to this museum, but things changed when I saw the amazing architecture of the house! Jim Thompson was really an interesting man! The tour will take you through his life, and the mystery of his disappearance! You will be amazed at the rooms, the decor, and the colors and collectables! There is a really nice gift shop where I bought some friends some really nice silk souvenirs that come specially wrapped. The wrapping envelopes will just amaze your friends because of the special designs and intricate bindings!Have some nice cake and coffee at the cafe as well!

Worth a visit. Walk-in distance from National Stadium station. Only got to spend a hour to finish the whole tour, a good gateway in the city center. A better understanding about Jim Thompson's contribution to silk and life story about end up missing somewhere in the end. Great touring guide leads every 30 minutes.

Bangkok of yesteryear. Ah, Jim Thompson, better known for reviving Thai silk, best known for disappearing. Thompson loved Thailand and he had a great eye for beauty - evidenced in his house, a traditional Thai house with western touches and in his antique collection. The place is located in a small street, tucked enough to make you forget about Bangkok's bustle. A guide is compulsory for the house, but you can explore the garden alone afterwards. The guided tour is very informative and lasts about 35 mins. There is a restaurant and a gift shop that sells exquisite silk products in the premises.

Guided tours available. Guided tours are available and included in the entrance fee. Very enjoyable guided tour and improved my understanding of Jim Thompson and Thai culture. Have free tuk tuk shuttle from Jim Thompson House to BTS station.
Nice traditional architecture. This is a very nice place to visit in central Bangkok. Walking barefoot on those nicely polished floors was a delight.

Scrumptous. A huge part of the attraction of this homestead is the mystery around the disappearance of Jim Thompson, the man who 'introduced' silk to Thailand. But for me even more so was the beauty and absolute tranquility it has in this busy BUSY city. One has the chance to explore the garden on your own but the tour of the different original Thai buildings one has to do with a guide. In these one is not allowed to take pictures. These are some beautiful artifacts and the stories surrounding them are rich. There is also a restaurant and shop on the premises. The latter sells really exquisite clothing and gifts, something unique for someone special.

Tranquility in the heart of Siam. Loved Jim Thompson House because I love his work. There are compulsory guided tours that leave every 30 mins or so. My local Thai guide was very entertaining and spoke very good English and the tour was actually very useful and informative, so I am glad it is compulsory. It is not that long and then you get time afterwards to go back through his house at your own pace.It was interesting to see how a foreigner took a group of traditional Thai houses and turned it into one home. He has some beautiful pieces in his house.There is a coffee shop there - but I didnt use it.I spent a fair amount of time and a good few baht in the shop (it is the same prices and goods as to what is sold in the mall shops).There is a little free shuttle at the top of the main street that will take you down the Soi in which the museum is to the entrance.

A Beautiful House. There is free shuttle from National Stadium BTS. If you wish to walk, its about 5-10mins walk from the BTS. Admission is 100bath with free tour which is about 25mins. Last guided tour at 5pm. Very detailed and good explanation during the tour to know the history of this house.

have a look!. Only spend less than an hours there, its ok to have a look for a history of the silk master, the staff there explain very well in english and chinese as well. Good to see when you tired for shopping in Bangkok.

Visit with Sons (3&1). Had a great experience. Can take golf cart ride provided by the J.T. House from the BTS station to the house. I suggest you make reservations to eat before you start the tour or call ahead. Tour went fine with young boys, but tours of the home are done in a group and are geared towards adults. So depending on your children's attention span/jet lag you may prefer to just tour the grounds on your own with the kids and have the adults take turns going on the indoor tour of the house.

Paradise. This place is stunning. The gardens are beautiful and like nothing I have ever seen before in a private house. The home and antiques are beautiful too. The guides are friendly and informative, but the garden is simply stunning. There is a restuarant also to sit and enjoy the surroundings in also. In my opinion a must see in Bangkok.

A lovely retreat in the city center. The Jim Thompson house is a beautiful oasis in the heart of Bangkok. It is cool, leafy and a wonderful reminder of some of Thailand's most beautiful art forms. It doesn't take too long to see, but is a nice stop on a hot day.

A brilliant mishmash. The much touted "authenticity" of the Jim Thompson House is a bit off as you listen to your tour guide explain away staircases, balconies, and indoor bathrooms that were never part of traditional Thai houses. And the art collection is equally parts "Asian" (Chinese, Burmese) as it is Thai. But all jumbled together, like the six traditional Thai houses that Thompson crammed together to make ONE traditional house, the overall effect remains a richly tropical beauty in its own right. Have been on the tour (guided tour is mandatory, but you can go back to the gardens on your own) years ago,and always wanted to return. Glad I did. It just feels good around here, and the old, oiled hardwood makes the place SMELL good too.

Lovely restaurant and a nice oasis after a hard day sightseeing. Brilliant restaurant, interesting house of Jim Thompson. Could have done without the 25 min wait for the guided tour which was not that interesting or informative really. Nonetheless, if you're in the area, do pop in for eats here, relatively cheap and excellent Thai cuisine.

A Real Surprise. A very enjoyable and detailed escorted tour. One should not miss this on a visit to Bangkok. One of the most interesting surprises, especially the explanation of how silk comes about with real silk worms and the spinning of cocoons.

Stunning. Stunning homes, lovely garden, some beautiful pieces of handicraft (ceramics, sculpture; Thai, Chinese, Burmese...).The compulsory guided tour for the interior of the main house is interesting too.Very special.

Somewhat interesting. Jim Thompson was a Bangkok-based silk entrepreneur from the early-mid 20th century, famous for reviving the Thai silk industry. His house, made from several old-school Thai homes, is a good example of traditional Thai architecture and the trinkets/ antiques around the house are pretty unique.It must be noted that I have no deep seeded interest in silk, entrepreneurs or people named Jim - but found this a pretty decent tour at 100 baht. It's just a short walk from National Stadium BTS station, so worth a quick stop over while in the Siam area. Recommended.
Worth the visit. Lovely grounds and buildings - very tranquil. You have to take a guided tour of the interior of the buildings and can't take photos inside, which is a shame

well worth a visit. tranquil setting yet in the middle of the city, great cafe, have been many times over the last 20 years and have seen it add a larger gift shop,cafe and restraunt yet the house remains in its origional condition as it was when jim thompson left it. his is a very interesting story and would urge anyone to read the book before visiting the house.

Not to be missed. Our second visit and its much better, very good restaurant attached too. Good shop though some new designs and colours would be welcome. Another shop in the shopping plaza but it is difficult to find.

Peaceful Oasis. Beautiful pace to visit and tour. Also lovely to escape from the hustle and bustle of the streets. Here you will find beautiful silk scarves but they are very very expensive. Worth a visit

Little too expensive. I visited this place when I was in Bangkok last time in August last year. The variety is there but the prices are alittle too expensive. You can get the same thing much cheaper form the shops in the other area. However they have got a large variety of silks in their store which makes them pop[ular.

very interesting and highly recommended. a very interesting place to check out whilst in bangkok - the hidden gem is the cafe - you can get some great thai food there while relaxing near the beautiful house, garden and ponds.
WORTH A VISIT. Something of an oasis in busy Bangkok. Interesting traditional domestic architecture combined with a wonderful collection of Thai artefacts and beautiful gardens.

Serenity in Bangkok. Down a lovely quiet soi minutes from National Stadium BTS. Lovely gardens and house in a serene pocket of Bangkok. You get a guide in a choice of language and they make the house and its contents that bit more interesting and heighten your curiosity about the mystery surrounding Jim Thompson. If you have a spare 100 baht and an hour to spare its definitely worth a visit.

Not my favorite. The house is beautiful but if you're on a short trip and have only a few days don't waste your time. The guides don't speak english so well so most of the time I couldn't understand what she was saying. The silk and other souvenirs sold there are extremely expensive, the restaurant is ok and the visit is worth it only because of the beauty of the house.There is a golf cart that takes you in and out the house but it drives you only a couple of hundred meters.There are no cheap restaurants around so if you're on a budget eat before going, otherwise there is only the restaurant from the House available and it is a bit more expensive.

Thai culture from a Western's prospective. This place is wonderful! From the knowledgable tour guides, to the house itself!! Such wonderful artifacts and the house itself is phenomenal!! This is a must if you are in Bangkok!!

A haunting and charming time capsule. The decor, air of mystery and the insight into a very interesting person. You have to take a conducted tour inside and around the house but the guides are well-informed and you go around in small groups and can wander around the grounds later. Nice cafe overlooking the pond but take mosquito repellent. There are even golf cart shuttles to and from the main road. Ignore nearby con-men who tell you it's closed but offer you a trip to a really nice jeweller's instead!

Small but interesting.. The guide spoke good English, though she smiled a little too much which muddled some pronunciation (I know, I'm so picky right?). But this place is interesting and has a cool history. There was an art exhibition that day as well which was worth a look. This place is small, but does teach you a bit about Mr. Jim Thompson and also a lot about Thai architecture.

Small but worth a visit. The garden, architecture and antique collections at the house are very nice. I took quite a few nice photos at the small garden. Too bad that no photo is allowed inside the house. Admission is 100baht. The inside of the house is actually upstairs. So, if you have problem with stairs don't go.On the way back to the BTS station (if you take their free shuttle golf carts), there is a nice new cafe, name "Cafe at Ease". Quite nice there.
Worth the visit. A guided tour is good. The house is very pretty and well preserved. After a walk around the house, try iced lemon grass juice, it''s really refreshing.

A little gem in a big city.. The tour may only be 20 minutes and you can't take photos inside the house, but so what. The guided tour is an interesting look at Jim Thompson's house and life. There's plenty of chances for photos outside the buildings and in the garden. I wouldn't bother about the gift shop. There's a free courtesy shuttle to the train station. Well worth a look. It's not a traditional Thai house, but a great adaption.

SPECIAL TRIP - NOT. Jim Thompson house tour, retail shop, and restaurant are not worth a special trip. Do visit if you're in the area. Tour will take about 20 minutes and it is interesting to see how a wealthy man lived in the 1950-60s. He collected some antiques from China which are prominently displayed. No photos are allowed in the main house and you must stay with the tour guide who keeps you moving at an easy pace. The retail shop pricing is commiserate with Neiman Marcus. Selection is very limited but the quality is good. Why play $100 US dollars for a scarf when you can pay 100 baht (32.2 baht to the dollar)? If you're willing to pay $100 for a scarf Neiman Marcus will have a better selection and you don't have to carry it home in your luggage.

Lovely visit. My wife and I went to Jim Thomsons house a couple of days ago. This is my fourth visit to Bangkok and I'd not had the time before but this time I was determined to go and visit. I was not disappointed. A collection of traditional houses that have been beautifully kept, (including a house that was dismantled and brought from Ayuthia) and an interesting collection of antiques and statues. Some of the collection is damaged but each damaged piece has a story that is as fascinating as the man himself. I would also like to say a thank you to the lady who gave the guided tour for us in English on 1st May 2014 at 10:35. I'm sorry I can't remember her name but she was so good, very funny and informative. Oh and proceeds from the house go to a local charity.

Nice traditional house with garden. Located in a quiet street just off the bustling main avenue this traditional house offers a peek into a not so distant path with an eclectic collection of statues, porcelain and other houseware. I was expecting to learn more about the owner and the silk technique but it ended up being a tour of local culture which was enriching.

Very interesting. We stayed in Siam just round the corner. You need to walk down a laneway and you at first think you will never get there and just when you feel you need to turn around, you are there. Maybe a bit more signage? It is a paradise there. There were people spinning the cocoons, but no-one on the looms. The house itself is interesting and the grounds lush and tropical. The guides there are informative. Well worth the effort to go. The souvenir shop is expensive and we bought our silk at another centre in Chiang Mai.
What a mystery. An interesting home and makes me feel that I need to shop at his stores to keep his name alive. Such good quality products.

Very Interesting. A nice way to spend a couple of hours is to visit Jim Thompson House. The place is just a short walk from the Stadium BTS. JT House even provides a golf-cart ride from the main road but really it just takes a few minutes to walk there from BTS. The group tours are not too large and nice enough so that you can pick up everything that the guide is saying. The story of Jim Thompson and the house is truly very interesting.
Jim Thompsons house.. Beautiful house and garden and an intriguing story behind the whole history of Jim Thompsons time in the USA and Thailand.

wondeful. wonderful house. wonderful story about this mysterious architect and ... secret agent?! We had a French speaking guide, that was great because our english is not good. We had a coffee and cake after the tour. very lovely. doesn't seem to be in bangkok.

Worth it. The Jim Thompson House is a worthwhile stop. It's a building style that is missing in the vast majority of the city, and the gardens and grounds are a nice juxtaposition to the ultra modern Ratchaprasong neighborhood where it's located. I would've liked to learn more about Jim Thompson himself, but the house tour was very good.
great example of thai architecture. Helps if you understand a bit of the incredible Jim Thompson story. Tour is about 25 minutes. Store is decent. Restaurant very average.

Little gem in the mad Bangkok. Such a peaceful send well set place to relax and enjoy in the middle of the craziness of Bangkok, very well set up and very educational! The tour guides are very knowledgable and take their time to explain and answer questions. Although there is a charge, it's very minimal and well worth it.....very enjoyable and should been done if one has time! Found it very relaxing and peacful!

Wonderful oasis in Bangkok. This is a beautiful time bubble. Sadly Jim Thompson disappeared whilst on holiday but his house remains as a testament to his love of Thai culture. The house is a blend of Thai and Western designs and the garden is gorgeous. We also had the best Pad Thai I've ever tasted at the restaurant.

Great gardens but not overly impressive. If you are wanting to see a piece of Bangkok history, this is the place for you. The gardens are simply stunning. The rooms are traditional Thai style on the river, so it is very interesting. You can't take pictures in most the house, which is a little disappointing. Tours leave in many languages, so it's worth it.
Interesting place to visit. Nice place to visit, old thai style house. Shop is nice but overpriced even for silk products.Restaurant is ok but food was not fresh... This is why i gave 3 for overall.

It was ok.. This was an interesting house but not worth the effort. It was very hot when we visited and there was no airflow. There is a tropical garden in the center which makes it even more humid. You have to walk around with no shoes on and the floor is very slippery - wood.

A museum of historical importance. This museum itself is the house of Jim Thompson, who disappeared later in his life. The silk company was once the most wealthy one. With excellent English tour explanation, the museum is worth at least 2 hour stay. The mixture of western and Thai styles. However, we went to the restaurant in 2012 and went back again in 2013. The prices at the restaurant not only doubled, the taste was not as good as the original one. The restaurant was cheap and excellent but now I think just OK.

What a beautiful Surprise!. I knew zero about Jim Thompson but on the suggestion of a fellow traveler, I visited The Jim Thompson House. I was simply in awe of the beauty of the house itself and the surroundings. The guide spoke good English was very informative. It is well worth the $3.00 USD admission charge.

Cool place in mid of Bkk. Definitely have to see! Close to metro station, great house and garden in heart of bkk. Big store with bags, silkscarfs and other high quality souvenirs. Tour guide for free!
Great attraction. Well laid out, beautiful house, good information and an interesting story. Guides speak excellent English and know their stuff.
Beautiful place. A nice place that people should visit. Green and beautiful garden , leave your soul free and enjoy the time here. You will never upset when you get here.

Enjoyable. This was a very enjoyable 90 minutes. The tour guides (guide is compulsory) know their stuff and ours was very entertaining, with lots of amusing anecdotes about Jim Thompson, Thai people and the houses & antique collection.

Quick and lovely visit. Worth it. . Located between the canal and National BTS stop. 100 baht entrance fee which is great considering you get a short (35 min) tour included. We waited just five minutes for next tour. Guide was knowledgable and professional. Didn't eat at restaurant and yes, gift shop a bit expensive for me but had many pretty things to check out. Recommended! 1 hour out of your day and only one stop from Siam Center.

Great value!. We walked here from our hotel, sort of by accident, and what a wonderful accident it was! It's very inexpensive. The tour is about 30 minutes, and they let you wander around on your own as well. The garden is absolutely gorgeous!
