It gives a glimpse into the life and times of American Jim Thomson at a time when Siam was just becoming known to the general outside world. By the way, the restaurant is excellent.
The tour lasts about 45 minutes. The house itself is very nice and interesting. They of course have a store there where you can buy the silk. Lovely items. Worth a couple hours of your time.

Beautiful house, interesting story. Well worth a visit, just step off the BTS at the National Stadium and it's a short walk. It's a compulsory guided tour around the house which is set in beautiful gardens, very tranquil. Only 100bht for adults, 50bht for kids.

A glimpse of another Era. The house is in excellent condition and gives you an insight into how some of the wealthy lived in Thailand. The gardens are pretty and provide an oasis in this busy city. I liked the Thai dancing which was on display and the traditional method of weaving silk being demonstrated. However if you a looking for a bargain in the silk shop you may be disappointed.

Peaceful oasis in busy centre of Bangkok. Wonderful old teak building nestling peacefully at side of a klong in the busy centre of Bangkok. Excellent restaurant overlooking goldfish pond and greenery. Great place to relax and explore in the heat of the day.

Wish it were my home!. The Jim Thompson House was so interesting. I knew very little about the famous owner before visiting but our guide soon fixed that. When you arrive and purchase tickets, you will be assigned a time for your tour to start. They try to keep the tours somewhat small-around 15 persons. We only waited 20 minutes for our tour to start and that gave us time to look around the gardens and gift shop (pricey silk items). There is also a restaurant on the property. The teak house is beautiful with many antiques purchased by Jim Thompson and the guide gave us background on the owner and previous guests at the house. This was one of those excursions my hubby and son did because I wanted to but they ended up learning a few things and enjoying themselves too.

should be seen. This is one nice area of huge city of Bangkok where you will see old traditonal houses mixed with western style, The lace works as a museum, the entrance fee is cheap and they have organized tour in different languages where a guide will tell you some of nice interesting stories

Tranquility. It brings you back in time how Jim Thompson lived and his passion about silk. I love the flow of the traditional wood house flowing from one room to another. Very convenient to get to by the BTS. Highly recommended.

Always Interesting. I have been to Jim Thompsons house a couple of times now and I always enjoy it. The gardens, the beautiful houses and antiques ... such an enviable collection. The business is very well run and a great way to pass a few quieter hours in Bangkok.
A Must-See. A lovely house in luscious green surroundings. A lot of flair in an area otherwise flooded with faceless shopping malls.

A cozy mansion can be consider for a visit at Bangkok. I visited a attraction at Bangkok during my shopping trips. It is Jim Thompson mansion near the National Stadium BTS station. It is a short walk from the BTS station to the mansion along Soi Kasemsan 2 opposite MBK shopping center.Here is my review on the mansion: - Attraction Highlight: The entrance fee is Baht100 including free guide on the mansion. It has a very good guide around the mansion and explanation on Jim Thompson lifestyle at the mansion. The mansion is inside the compound and near to the garden after the restaurant.Attraction Tip: There are free shuttle to and from the mansion to the National Stadium BTS station. You may try to take note on the shuttle at the mouth of the Soi to get a free ride. After buying the entrance ticket with the receipt, then heading to the garden and you need to pass the receipt at another counter at the back left corner near the garden for guide allocation. The counter will provide you a number or alphabet and a time schedule for your guide. There is waiting time where you can walk around and take some photos around the mansion because photos and footwear are not allowed inside the mansion.

Worth the time to see. This is a lovely house to visit and very interesting. Considering where the house is in Bangkok once you enter the property its so peaceful and learning about what Jim Thompson done for the country is worth putting on your places to see in Bangkok.
A must!. Lunch at JT House is a highlight of staying in BKK. Food is very good, service is great, location and surroundings are beautiful. Fantastic.

Good Day Out. We visited Jim Thompsons house and had a great day out. The tour is very interesting and the guides offer detailed explanations regarding the items and artifacts in the house. At the end of the tour you can wander around and take pictures outside. There is also a restaurant where you can stop for lunch or a drink.

Really professional, friendly and interesting. Having never heard of Jim Thompson before I visited his museum and was blessed about its perfectly maintain, the extremely professional and friendly staff and it was really interesting to see how he lived and planned his home. It also gives you some good inspirations to design your own home. Really nice visit. International Student Cards holder will only be charged 50% (50B).

Unexpected. Extraordinary history to this house and the story of Jim Thompson. Enjoyed both the tour of the house and walking round the tranquil garden. Great silk scarves for sale in the shop attached to the house. All down a narrow side street off a busy main road, quite unexpected! Oh, and the restaurant has a great setting and excellent food.

Very interesting culture-trip close to downtown. The ticket price includes free tour-guide! (which rarely happened in other tourist spots). And believe me, the tour guides are really good in what they are doing. They also have big discount for visitors <25 years old.

Must see in Bangkok. The house is really pretty, in a quiet soi surrounded by the busy heart of Bangkok, very easy to reach and worth spending some time enjoying the atmosphere after finishing your visit. The restaurant inside has some decent food option.

Simply amazing. The detail and work that Jim Thompson put into making his dream home has culminated in one of Bangkok's most beloved treasures. Though some visitors might expect to find an Americanized house with minor exotic touches, the reality is that there's hardly anything "Western" about this gem. From rooms decorated with salvaged stone Buddhas to a dining room filled with luxurious yet authentic Chinese porcelain, Jim Thompson's house is a rare glimpse into the architectural history of Southeast Asia. The only disappointing thing is that Mr. Thompson, who disappeared without a trace in Malaysia in 1967, cannot be here to witness the effect his brilliant silk business or preserved house has made in Thailand.

Very charming house and delicious Thai food restaurant. The house is quite beautiful and calm and it has nice Thai cuisine restaurant right next to the house.They have 4 or 5 stories building with parking lot nearby and the library has not a few art books.
peaceful oasis in Bangkok. facinating chance to see a well restored and maintained piece of old bangkok. You can take the Saen Saeb canal taxi to the house or walk from National Stadium skytrain

Well worth a visit. This is an interesting place. Jim Thompson combined several old houses into a residence and grounds which are Thai, but fit his New York view of a comfortable home. Give it a couple of hours and walk through his world. You'll enjoy it.

Interesting, should go!. I didn't put the Jim Thompson House in our initial plans, as being someone quite adventurous i thought this was going to be boring. We went as it was a 5-10minute walk from Siam Paragon. Turned out to be a very good experience with lots of information. Would definitely recommend.

Worth a visit. Tucked away down a side street, there is a lot of history here, beautiful gardens. Guided Tour times are allocated on arrival we only waited 10 minutes or so for an English tour which then took about half an hour.

A smart shopping opportunity. The compulsory guided tour was efficient and interesting. Jim Thompson constructed a beautiful artistic house with a tasteful collection of carvings, Buddhas and paintings. There is a very good restaurant and a tempting shop.
Intresting. Very Intresting and easy to get to form BTS National Stadium. A nice shop with a good choice of Thai Silk products. Nice Garden but make sure you wear Mossi repellent !!
Nice atmosphere, but not a must. The house is a Thai style house, greenery, peaceful, very nice atmosphere. If you have time, it worth a visit. However, it is not a must.

See a Thai style house if time is limited. This is a classic visit when in Bangkok. Lovely traditional Thai home with a beautiful collection of antiques; a Jim Thompson boutique on site; and a cafe/restaurant overlooking a Koi pond with moderately good Thai fare. A good place to see all things Thai. However, if you have more time and want to see a greater variety of Thai architectural masterpieces, try "Ancient City"; for other first class antiques, see Suan Pakkad Palace.

Serenity in a frantic city. We were taken here by a friend who lives in Bangkok. The tour of the house was very interesting and the grounds well kept. The meal in the restaurant was slightly pricey but excellent and the staff were very attentive. If you have a spare hour or more, we had to wait 45 minutes for the tour, then head here for peace and quiet.

Very interesting place. The history of Jim Thomson is pretty interesting. His house is wonderful example of Thai architecture and Thai art. The house is worth seeing. On site you can find a very nice restaurant with good thai food and a shop with silk of high quality

Surprisingly interesting. I wasn't quite excited when I heard about the Jim Thompson house. I mean, a cool looking house where some guy kept stuff from his travels, and silk. How much fun could that be? Well, it was pretty much as expected. A very large house, with a lot of ancient stuff. The guide made all the difference. It's one thing to know how old something is, but it's completely a different thing to hear the story of what the item is, and how Jim came to get it. The attention to detail on the grounds is astounding, and definitely worth the hour that you're there. It's very close to the mall, so you can hop over when you're done.

Special. Break up you busy shopping in this beautiful house. The tour lasts about 40 minutes but the gardens are worth exploring. The restaurant's good too. It's worth eating there. Don't miss the modern gallery above the shop.

Changed But Still Pleasant. Our second visit to the Jim Thompson house after many years and, surprise, surprise it has changed and is now even more commercial. There was a very pleasant cafe with good food which is now a restaurant but I am sure it is still good, however, not for those of us who want just a small snack. We did stop and have a coffee and smoothie and they were excellent. The ambiance is wonderful and the peace and quiet just what the doctor ordered to renew your batteries. We wanted to wander in the garden, not to visit the house again, but you now have to buy a ticket for the house to do this. A great shame as it is still an ''oasis of peace' in this manic city.
Oasis. Well worth the visit to this Oasis in bustling Bangkok. Guided tour is quick and informative. Lunch in the restaursnt was relaxing and tasty.

Great stop in Bangkok. We hit the JT House on our last days and I was pleasantly surprised. The house itself is spectacular and the decorations are well worth the nominal fee it cost to take the tour. They have a bar and restaurant for if you want to grab some food or drinks afterwards and you are a few steps from the Siam Square if you want to go shopping afterwards.

Very interesting. A little enclave of peace in Bangkok. Take a tour which lasts only 1/2 hour and then have lunch there overlooking a small pond with waterlilies. Interesting teak buildings all representing different parts of the house. There is a small shop on site selling silk scarves etc. but if you want to buy silk stuff from Jim Thompson wait until you are at Bangkok Airport where there are two larger Jim Thompson stores. (No difference in prices).

Wonderful place. This place is not so far from BTS National Stadium. I show my passport because there is discount for people who are 24 (mm, if i am not mistaken) and yes, they give me the discount price. The tour guides speak in various language beside English such as French and Japanese so don't worry if you do not understand English well. They are also very informative and like to joke. At this time, it was a rare hidden Thai jewel in the jungle of Bangkok skyscrapper.

A good learning experience. Our guide spoke good English, and the attendants were extra nice and helpful. The house itself is awesome, well preserved, and worth the visit. I learned a lot about old Thai houses. Free shuttle is provided from the corner. The free postcard is a nice touch.

Beautiful house with a garden in the center of Bangkok. The Jim Thompson House is situated in a quiet and beautiful garden and it is hard to believe that your are in the center of Bangkok (not far away from MBK shopping mall). We had a tour in French language and our guide spoke very well French; We learned about Jim Thompson and what he did for the silk industry. In the garden there were demonstrations on how the silk was made and also a traditional dance demonstration. In the shop you can buy t-shirts, scarfs, bags, ties etc... at a reasonable price we thought.

Beautiful house, good guided tours!. I already visited the house twice, 5 years ago and now, the place is still very beautiful and well maintained, the guides are very clear. Though I am fluent in English I was delighted to have tours in French as well. There are some small animations organized in the house to show you how silk is made and how Thai classical dance looks like. There was also a modern stitching exhibition above the shop, I did not like the styles but the theme was interesting.To people who find the shop overpriced, well for me it was still half the price as in my home country for the same quality and we got the VAT refund in the airport, so I guess that sometimes if you want silk or pashmina you have to pay for it or you will end up with fake products. We chose some cushion covers, purse, hat..To finish we went to the restaurant and enjoyed the meal fully!For information there is a free shuttle from and to the BTS station (National Stadium), though it is totally a walk able distance if you miss it!

Not impressive. It is just a couple of traditional buildings with some antiques. I had to wait 45 minutes for a less than 30 min rushed tour of the place. The guide was very knowledgeable and funny. Photos are not allowed inside the houses. Very close to the MBK mall and BTS National Stadium station, so it is easy to get in/out.
Nice change if pace. Touristy but old time Thai feel, Jim Thompson house has museum. A Cafe (overpriced) and a gift shop. It I worth a one time visit

very interesting. The story of Jim Thompson and how he developed the silk trade in Thailand was very interesting. The speculation on how Mr. Thompson disappeared is equally fascinating. His house is a testament to his good taste and respect for Thai Culture. He was an avid collector and the beauty of the house and gardens are a welcome oasis.
Interesting place but rather commercial . For the 100 Baht it is interesting if you look past the commercial things. Tour could be a bit longer.

Very nice museum hidden in Central Bangkok. The JT house and museum was very well maintained and was a great gem inside central Bangkok. The staff are friendly and have good commands of English. The only downside was because we visited this at one of the most peak period, hence we had to take turns to go into the rooms with other tours. However, overall experience was very good.
Great place to visit and Eat. very interesting property with a great story and great art pieces. Also had a great meal here in the restaurant. Bit more up market than lots of the sites

Well worth visiting. Having visited all of the main tourist sites on a previous visit to Bangkok, I wanted to visit somewhere we had not been to before and I am so pleased we decided to visit Jim Thompson House. It is easy to get to by using the sky train and then following signposts in the street. Jim Thompson actually run free shuttle golf carts to and from the sky train station to the house but we didn't realise this when we came out of the sky train station.The house and gardens are a little tropical oasis situated up a side street in chaotic Bangkok. The tour of the house is very informative and interesting and the gardens are beautiful. There is a lovely restaurant where you can sit and take in the beautiful surroundings. There is also an excellent shop with an extensive range of silk products where my daughter and I treated ourselves to a beautiful silk scarve each. Prices are quite high but the products are of a very high quality and we could not buy anything similar at home-Infact we wish we had bought more!

A Piece of Thai History. My Jim Thompson scarf will always be my favorite souvenir from Thailand. I am so happy that this man took it upon himself to breathe life back into this traditional industry, helping to preserve history and helping artists to be appreciated for what they can do.

A pleasant oasis. An interesting and pleasant experience. After spending a few days in the bustle of the city, Jim Thompson House was a quiet, cool reprieve. A tour comes with the ticket and I was surprised by how interesting and lovely the house was. I was unfamiliar with Jim Thompson textiles before this visit, they are really lovely (and priced accordingly, unfortunately for me!)

Oasis in the middle of a crazy city. The house & gardens are lovely & quiet. The tour itself is very short (30 mins) and the whole visit only lasted an hour. Our guide was lovely & gave us lots of information. We stopped at the restaurant after the tour & had some delicious food sitting by the fish pond. There is a free shuttle back to the BTS station, but you can walk it in 2 minutes. From there we walked down to the Siam Discovery Centre & MBK in 5 minutes. Highly recommended.

Good story - nice house. Of course - the story about the man who commercialized thai silk and the mysteriously disappeared in the jungle is interesting, but there is not much more. Also, his self designed house is nice with an amazing garden and some interesting details, but it wasn't more than that. Worth a visit if you like silk or architecture. The restaurant serves decent lunch.

Never disappoints. I visited the Jim Thompson store in Singapore and when I came across the Bangkok house it was certainly a must for me. Indulging in the history of Jim Thompson and the fine quality products.

Beautiful house and garden. This was the last sight I saw in Bangkok having had it recommended by a friend and it being just a 5 minute walk from my hostel. The house itself is pretty nice and there's lots of old art and statues to see on the way round. You have to have a guide to take you around the house and ours was really informative about everything and answered everyone's questions really well. It would have been nice to have been able to have a more leisurely stroll through the house as we kept getting moved from room to room quite quickly. You do get as long as you want to wander around the outside of the house and the garden is quite pretty.

Interesting!. I wasn't sure I was interested in the Jim Thompson house, and was skeptical upon finding out we had to participate in a guided tour, but it was very well done and interesting! Great to see such a beautiful Thai style home.
Still a lovely house.. I was completely ignorant of Jim Thompson until I went to Thailand in 2006. It is an interesting story and a lovely house. Nothing to get excited about but worth a visit.

Great little gem. I was slightly hesitant when my husband suggested that we visit "an expat's house with lots of art and things". I was very surprised and pleased when we arrived though.Beautiful, traditional Thai home with an extensive collection of art pieces and furniture from Asia. For what we paid for entrance fee, it was worth it. A great way to spend an afternoon.

Neat place to visit for an hour or so. I last visited the Jim Thompon house about 15 year ago. It was a self-guided tour place. It has transformed itself into a lot more, with guides a restaurant and a store. Worth a couple hours of your time as it is near the MBK mall, Siam Center, etc.

Add to your Top 5 in Bangkok list. A great change from the various wats, the enormous Royal Palace, and all the wonderful sights, sounds, and smells of Bangkok, I highly recommend a visit to this beautiful, atmospheric house. Educational and worth the entry fee.

Interesting place to see. If you have some spare time why not stopping by this place. While located right in central Bangkok, the house appears to be very traditional and has kept its authenticity. We spent an enjoyable hour visiting the house. The entrance fee is very reasonable and they have tour guide in many languages.

Nothing special. Nothing too special apart that you have to take your shoes off and leave them in a place that smells not so good due to the fact that everybody leaves them there. After you sweep all the house with your bare feet.

A really enjoyable visit. This is a very popular attraction in Bangkok. On purchasing a ticket, you are assigned to the selected language group and given a time when that tour will begin. In the meantime, you can walk around the garden, admire the demonstrators ability to reel the silk off the cocoons, shop for gifts in both restaurant and gift shop, have a drink or something to eat, visit the free textile art exhibition, sit and people watch or take photographs of the turtles in the pond, goldfishes or lotuses. I spent about an hour looking at the current textile exhibition but then I like that sort of thing. The wait for my tour was approx. 30 40 mins. Bags and shoes are stored (bags in a lock up locker) prior to the tour of the main house. The english speaking guide was very good at all the explanations and answering questions. No photographs of the interiors are allowed.Tour group size is up to 15 people. There are many groups being toured throughout the house simultaneously. A couple of tuk-tuks are provided to take you back to the main street (as the house is down a side street).

Average. The house is a few minutes walk from National Stadium or Siam stations of the BTS. When you get there you have to wait for a tour, we had a 45 minute wait so make sure you aren't in a rush when you come here.Most of the information the tour guide gave was on the leaflet handed out with the tickets. The house is interesting and Jim certainly had a good eye for design but it was a brief walk around his house with little background information as to both his life and the architecture of the house.I know he singlehandedly rebuilt the Thai silk industry, but I have no idea how. It would have been far better if we were told what he did, how he did it and maybe even why.

Fantastic, best site in Bangkok. Wonderful place, restaurant was a welcome relief and we enjoyed cups of tea and rice crackers before beginning our tour. The staff guided us round with care, and were delightful.

Interesting & Great Textiles. We enjoyed our visit - architecturally interesting and JT's life is also interesting. Shopping in the store for textiles was also worth the trip. Didn't try the restaurant - wish we'd had the time as it was very nice looking.

Very interesting!. What a cool place to visit. Beautiful houses reconstructed and moved into Bangkok. Lots of antiques, gardens, interesting side notes from the guide. Easy to find right off of the BTS. Don't buy at the store there, instead make the trip to the Jim Thompson outlet store.

a oasis of tranquility in the city. To start a visit, it's Always with a guide. She telles about the history and some things of the house. After you can walk outside the buildings and drink a tea (expensive) or buy some tissue (also expensive).
OK. Really nice place with an interesting history but think it's really more for people who have an interest in silk or fabrics.

A great visit while in Bangkok. My wife and I visited the Jim Thompson House while on our honeymoon in Bangkok and it was definitely a highlight of our stay in Bangkok. It was great to learn about Jim Thompsons legacy and his unfortunate and mysterious disappearance. We were taken back by how beautiful and peaceful this large house was, in the middle of Bangkok. Once you enter the premises, you feel like you have momentarily escaped the busy city of Bangkok and entered into somewhere far more peaceful. The tour guide was very informative and funny as she showed us the house and all the priceless collection of Thai artefacts.A must see while in Bangkok!

It was ok and interesting. but it could have been skipped…nothing spectacular that was a must see. Just for something to do ! it has a shop. did not try the restaurant inside. There are so many great places to eat in Thailand so it was not on our list.

Really Cool Experience. I must say I was a little apprehensive at first in going to the Jim Thompson House as I figured it would be just some plain old Thai house but when I got there it was pretty amazing. The price to get in (100 BHT) includes a guided tour in either English/French. The tour guides speak very well and explain all the details of the house. It's pretty impressive.

Cool Place in amongst all the chaos. Just happened to visit thus house as it was around the corner from my hotel. Would love to have stayed the night but that wouldn't have been allowed. Feels very authentic in the drenching humidity. Loved its calmness and serenity.
Oasis of calm in the middle of Bangkok. We were escorted round the complex by an excellent guide who was very knowledgeable. This is a must visit during your stay in Bangkok
A nice little tourist spot to visit. An interesting experience - beautiful garden and a nice store. I bought some beautiful silk cushion covers.
must see. not a waste of time, great tour guides (40 mins), the house is beautiful and kids and adults will enjoy it.

Beautiful oasis in middle of bustling city. The original house is quite small and very beautiful, with lovely gardens and vistas. The story of Jim Thompson is interesting as he more or less revived the Silk industry single handed. There is a lovely gift shop, well worth buying some souvenirs there.

Nice informative tour. The Museum was walking distance from our Renaissance Hotel,The tour guide was good at explaining details of Jim Thompson s life in Thailand and his influence on the silk market. The store on the first floor has very nice merchandise.

Jim Thompson's house!. Always wanted to visit. Made it this time around. Took my husband with me who was just as impressed to see the house. Enjoyable and guide was very knowledgable as well as answered all questions that our group asked.
Informative and distinctive. A small museum with a great tour. Allow an hour. Gives a great insight into how the legendary Jim Thompson lived. I've been twice and the quality of the guides can vary.

Oasis in Bangkok. This is a bit different to most of the other tourist attractions in Bangkok, great restaurant for lunch. They run a little buggy transfer to and from the Sky Train which is helpful as it is a little tricky to find.

Beautiful escape from a congested city.. This home and gift shop which was created by Jim Thompson, who brought the silk trade to Thailand is a beautiful home and a nice alternative to the many Temples and Buddhas. Merchandise is costly, but beautiful. There are stores at airport and other locations.

Not what I expected. 100baht to enter. Then you must wait for tour. Tour was interesting but nothing to do with silk making....more about Jim Thompson and his house. No photos while on tour then you can take photos afterwards.
Not end of world if you miss this attraction.

Not to be missed. Excellent attraction! Our visit to Jim Thompson house exceeded expectations. It was a delightful house with an interesting history. Our tour guide was excellent. A must visit when in Bangkok!

Something different. We spent an hour or so visiting Jim Thompson's house. It was something different to do instead of shopping! We found it very interesting, and the guide very friendly and informative.
Nice tour of traditional home. It was a great English tour of the house. The house itself is a lovely tour of a somewhat traditional house with some western influences. Nice gift shop too.
very good silk shop. good service, good price, good quality. staff is very helpfull, ask you if you want taxrefund etc. collection is very goog, much to choose.

a must. yes a must this Jim Thomson House. Take a guided trip, admire the fine art, enjoy the garden, visit the textile museum (wow) and, afterwards, take the alley north, cross the bridge and stroll through Baan Crua north with its Moslim inhabitants where the silk business started.

Worth the visit. This place offers interesting history of Jim Thompson and his house is beautiful with many his collections reflecting his love for Asia culture. Food was pretty good as well. It's a nice way to spend a few hrs in Bangkok.

Disappointed. I was expecting the tour to include a little about how silk is made, dyed and produced but it was only about the life of Jim Thompson. The tour takes bout 40 minutes but could be done in 10. For me it is a tourist trap with extortionate prices in the shop, not really worth the visit.

Jim Who?. Western ignoramus that I was, I had never heard of Jim Thompson, let alone his significance to Thai culture. A trip to his house and museum sorted that out. An extraordinary hideaway in high rise modern Bangkok. The graciousness of the tour guides exemplifies so much of Thai culture, and the insight into Thai architecture and one man's role in recording and restoring that aspect of the culture is inspiring. The silks are amazing, even more so when we later visited the Jim Thompson outlet store.... five floors of silks and silk clothing.the varieties and patterns are mindblowing... which I think is an extraordinary statement coming from a man! Worth a visit. Be prepared to just relax and take it all in.

Pleasantly surprised by the tour and the house. I have to admit, this was not high on my list of places to visit in Bangkok, but we had an afternoon to kill in Bangkok so we trekked over to the house and signed up for the tour. The guided tour was actually super interesting and informative, and the house, art/artifacts, and grounds are all really beautiful. This is definitely worth the detour.
Very interesting place. This beautiful place is really worth to visit. Teakwood houses in a wonderful garden. Interesting stories behind the place.

Beautiful Silk variety and very high quality. Must visit for all foreigners , huge variety of Ready made garments as well as material , scarfs , gift items , souvenirs and very high quality of Silk material everything is quiet expensive but if you are looking for quality then you have to pay too .

Very interesting house. The house is fascinating, pieced together from different Thai homes. We also enjoyed the restaurant, and a fantastic gift shop (spent too much $, but everything was so beautiful). Also interesting display on the life of Jim Thompson. Why did he disappear?
Lovely food, beautiful setting. A cool haven from the midday sun. Delicious food, great attentive service, reasonable prices - we go for lunch every time we're in Bangkok.

Relaxing, beautiful and educating break from crowed shopping malls. Just a block away from the busy street you will find a beautiful and peaceful garden with traditional thai houses. The restaurant served delicious food.

Peace and calm in the heart of Bangkok. This is my third visit and it never ceases to disappoint. Born in 1906 in USA and posted to Thailand during war, he fell in love with the country and people returning after the war and decided to revive the hand weaving of silk. To be true to his concept he built his home joining several original houses together. These are beautifully maintained with much of his belongings on display. Guides are fluent in most common languages and types are grouped together the guides giving a very knowlegible tour. Sadly Jim Thompson disappeared mysteriously in Malaysia in 1967 but his story remains together with beautiful silks available in the on site shop. There is also a very good restaurant and toilet facilities.
wonderful place!. people visiting BKK have to go to this place! one of the most attractive old house in Bangkok! beautiful garden, beautiful houses

Interesting place, funny tour guide!. Since this place is near to our hotel and the National Stadium BTS, this is the 1st attraction we visited in Bangkok. The place is so interesting. You'll learn a lot of things not just about Jim Thompson but there are also a handful o trivia about thai culture and everyday life. There is a minimal fee to enter though at 100 Baht for adults and 50 Baht for anyone less than 25 years old (happy I got the 50 baht entrance fee). The fee includes a guide which starts every 15 minutes. We got an english speaking guide and she was funny! haha! This museum is quite small but packed with a lot of things you might wanna see.

Fascinating place. Located right in the heart of busy Bangkok .... an oasis of calm. Fascinating insight into the lifestyle of Jim Thompson..... nice silk souvenirs for sale too. Worth it (for me) just to see traditional silk spinning ...

Not to be Missed!. Jim Thompson House was not exactly #1 on my list of places that I wanted to visit in Bangkok. But after a day of visiting beautiful Wats, river cruising, visiting more Wats, etc, I wanted to try something different. Our guide suggested the Jim Thompson House. The idea seems kind of blagh, but I said, what the hell, let's try it. So we jumped on the Sky Train (fun!!) and went over there. Well worth the trip and now I've added it to my "must see list." Amazing house, fascinating story about the real Jim Thompson, and a great place for lunch within the grounds.Also, at their store, purchased the most beautiful scarf for my wife that she's ever seen, so she's onboard with this as well. (probably even more so!)
Interesting and informative. The tour guides make this place. It's beautiful in itself, but they bring it to life with the stories and tidbits about Jim Thompson. Worth an hour or two.
Old Bangkok. If you can block out the commercialism, you get a good idea of what the homes or old Bangkok were like. there is a charge to enter and usually a waiting line.

interested visit. It was a good and interested visit but the guide talk so bad english it was not possible to understand.
It was a relax and calm enviroment.
Must see museum. You can't go to Bangkok and not visit here. Great place to visit just to get a bit of tranquility in the bustling bangkok

excellence. The house is great, the tour interesting and the tour guide was superb.I bought a shirt, had a problem and emailed them. The reply was immediate with no excuses, only concern for my complete satisfaction. I applaud the timely replies I received from both Acharee Lee and Ms Angkanan.This is a company you can believe in and never have a second thought about what you bought or what you paid.We are going back tomorrow to enjoy spending more.

Nice and interesting, great tour guide. Nice and easy, informative, lots of antiques, great gift shop with tons of silk and higher end gifts. Clean and attractive home with cool history behind it. I would recommend this

Silk Manufacture. The historical influence this man had on modern Thai lifestyle.Envious of his life in Bangkok, with adaptation of modern housing styles using the available actual Thai structures.It would have been a very peaceful environment and garden.
Well spent afternoon. We went to the Jim Thompson House not knowing what to expect. The tour was beyond our expectations and is well worth visiting.
JT House. Well worth the timeGreat stories and what a house!!There are many fascinating rooms and the property is on a canalA very special place

Definitely should spend some hours. We did not plan to come here but then we had a free afternoon and were recommended by hotel owner. A unique house which is impressive by not just outside with beautiful garden and strange appearance but also amazing treasures inside. The guide gave us informative talk about Jim Thompson. The gift shop nearby has some nice things to buy. Recommended

Worth a visit. Quiet oasis with charming atmosphere.. Entrance fee is only 100 THB and includes a 30 minute tour. The place features the traditional wooden home of Jim Thompson in a green setting. Not exceptional, but worthwhile and very easily reachable near the Siam BTS station. Beware of scams and do NOT go with a tuk tuk driver waiting outside!

Better than expected. I wasn't sure if I would enjoy this but it was better than I expected. Our tour guide was funny and did a nice job. The gift shop looks like a Coach store and is priced accordingly.
Beautiful teak house and silk collection. Definitely worth visiting, to see the teak structure and the silk products. They can be very expensive though.

Well worth it. A relaxing place to spend a few hours. Just a short walk from the Stadium BTS station down a quiet lane. It is located at the end of the lane on the left just before reaching the canal. Quite fascinating the way he reconstructed the Thai house with the wooden walls and floors. It has a real cozy feel to it and at least for me, a fascinating mix of ceramics and Buddhist statues and paintings throughout. I'd like to live there! The garden is quite lush. You must go on a guided tour inside the house but it is worth it as they explain a lot of things you would not have known. It takes about 1/2 hour. And its only THB 100 (a little over US$3). Had a nice lunch of a Thai salad on the outside terrace facing the house next to a sleepy fish pond. There is also a shop as well as another gallery with changing exhibits upstairs. Bathroom was very clean and you can smoke in a special place right by the entrance.
worth a visit. I loved the traditional wooden homes in the jungle-like garden and the tour explains the life of Mr Thompson very well. It was worth a visit!

It's ok but......... For a start there is a compulsory guided tour,which we are not keen on. The guides clearly have a script, but are happy to answer questions, but we did find it all tiresome. Jim Thompson's collection is impressive and worth the visit alone but we left feeling it was just too commercialised; not, we suspect what Jim would have wanted.

wonderful architecture. I have an interesting tour when visiting this House.I came there by Tuk tuk and It make me more excited. At first, I was deluded by the red which cover the whole house. It was designed by unique and perfect style. The inside also displayed some ancient items. I spent a long time on visiting rooms. Each of step, I should stop to take a picture because It was beautiful. Beside that, the house was covered by large garden. It made the peaceful atmosphere. It really a worthy place to visit.

Historical house full of treasure in the centre of the busy city. A place to spend your time in leisure. Tour guide is provided and entrance fees only 100 baht. A leisure visit beside all day shopping. The house is full of treasures. No photos allowed when we entered the main house. Photography is only allowed at maid house area. The tour guide will guide you around the house and you will be stunned with all the treasure inside! Jim Thompson can be said the "Indiana Jones" of the modern day. The house is kept very well under the custodian of Thailand Royal Family.

Beautiful House. Nice visit and very informative. However, the best shopping for JT silk is at the main store across the street from the hotel Montien downtown Bangkok location. This location has multiple floors of products. The JT House store is very small by comparison.

Good place, they over-stuff the tour groups though.. The history of this place is stunning. the houses are beautiful and the tour guides were very knowledgeable. However, the actual tours were stuffed to the brim, with some people not being able to get in the room that was being spoken about and we had to wait around while the previous tour was finishing in the room before several times. We also could barely hear our guide over the other guides that were talking in the other rooms around us. I understand that the group want to make money, but in a place like this, they should be more mindful of quality rather than quantity especially as its a hefty fee to get in.
Iconic outlet. Superb collection of all the favourites ogether with new lines and products not previously encountered at other Jim Thompson outlets

Really fun and great gift shop. The gift shop is pretty amazing first off…very unique gifts but the tour of the house was fascinating and I had a really nice 2 hours spent there. It's quiet and also close to a really nice walk along the canals if you want to see local Bangkok

good attraction in Bangkok. Spent today's afternoon in this place. A very affordable sightseeing tour offered for as little as 200 THB. Tour takes you through the buildings with a local guide. The tour takes about 30 min and give a good insighht how James W. Thompson has lived before he disappeared in Malaysia.

Worth visiting. Jim Thompson was the person who started Thailand's silk trade. This compound is what remains of his house, plus a good restaurant and very interesting prints. The gift shop is a bit pricey, but offers quality pure silk products. The museum is worth a visit if you are in this are of town and have already seen all the major sights.

A nice little break from the city, in the city. I was surprised by this small museum to an unheard of but remarkable character. It's essentially the preserved house (or collection of houses and art) of an American architect, OSS operative and ultimately Orientalist and investor in the Thai Silk industry following the second world war. Given credit for revitalizing the industry and bringing to prominence in the wider world. The houses are beautiful traditional wooden houses on stilts, rendered in beautiful teak and other dark hard woods and a beautiful synthesis of Thai craft and western tastes. One of the most beautiful houses I've ever visited, set in still lush oasis in the heart of Bangkok. The guides are well informed and well spoken and the museum is well developed and obviously well funded. Take the Skytrain to Rathachewi station and walk across the bridge and down the canal side to the right to get there. Be sure though to check out the great selection of little restaurants on the station side of the bridge after Jim Thompson's house, beautiful curries, tom yum soup and pork and basil stir fries.

A nostalgic tour.. Even if you know nothing of the mystery of Jim Thompson, this is a worthwhile attraction. It would be even more entertaining if you study or know anything of the legacy and mystery Jim Thompson left behind.
A must go!!!. The house is absoultely beautiful!It got the best of thai style houses and the best of western houses!Beautiful private art collection!

interesting collection of art. As you know, Jim Thompson was a CIA agent who fell in love with Thailand and decided to live there:he collected a great quantity of artworks and heaped them in his house in Bangkok.The visit is enticing, there are guided tours in English/French included in the entrance price , There is a shop that sells the house products, shirts, tablecloths, dresses, etc.Nice but pretty expensive .They also provide a free shuttle to the nearest BTS station.Last visit is at 500 pm.

Interesting History, They'll Explain Lots Of Interesting Thing Here. Went to this place 3 of us, my brother, myself and my older sister. The entrance fee is either 50 Baht or 100 Baht. So yes its cheap and worth to see. Everyone will know the location of this JT House. Once your in the main road just wait for the Tuk Tuk pickup and the Tuk Tuk itself comes with clear writing: JIM THOMPSON. So you dont have to walk or yes you can walk too.This JT House have their handicraft store, restaurant/cafe. When you enter please pay at the right side of the entrance for entrance fee, then walk further pass the JT shop and there you will see lots of tour guide using their traditional Thai uniform. The tour is for free (included in the entrance fee). Please also choose your language for the tour. There will be: Japanese, English and Mandarin.They will explain the reason for the house architecture, they will explain why they have statue of Headless Buddha. . .to me this is very very interesting. I think its a must to see JT House if you're in Bangkok. . .Cheers. . .

Great visit. Excellent interlude from the concrete and heat of Bangkok. A welcome bit of flora and fauna in the beautiful gardens of this stunning Thai house. Short but informative guided tour, interesting story of Jim Thompson, his achievements and mysterious disappearance. Yes the shop is expensive but the products are good just to look at. Had desert and drinks in the excellent cafe, recommend the sticky rice with mango. Finished off our trip with a walk and boat ride along the adjacent canal. Would recommend as a way to see how people really live.

Excellent for a laid-back tour, then proceed to do some serious shopping at the boutique!. I'll be honest - before I went to Bangkok, I didn't even know who Jim Thomson was. I was attracted to go to the museum because I read that it was a combination of history and a walk in a garden. The garden was not how I imagined it to be, but it's not necessarily a bad thing. If you are into architecture/art/design/interior, you'd enjoy a visit to the Jim Thompson House. The house is gorgeous, and I admire that they've managed to preserve so much detail from the past. When you arrive, you can purchase your tour tickets and then wait for your turn. They divide visitors into groups by language - there was English, of course, and Japanese. I'm not sure what other language they may offer. For me, the tour around the house itself wasn't that long, but it wasn't a rushed one either. I was able to really admire and take in the surroundings, and our tour guide was more than happy to answer any questions we may have.After the tour, drop by the boutique for some shopping before you leave or watch how Thai silk is made. Pretty fascinating.An excellent place for a laid-back tour.

Ancient Thailand preserved. Fascinatingly preserved look back into old Thailand. Dark, serene and calm spaces where visitors respectfully keep voices low in slightly over-organised guided tours in only French and English. In the extreme heat, this is a lovely cool visit worth the effort.
Nice tour guides, short tour. Not that exciting. It is just an old house. The tour guides are nice. I wouldn't go out of your way to visit it.

Nice place - but do not look for adventure.... This house is definitely nice. Beautiful surroundings and knowledgeable guides. But - you can do far more interesting trips/sightseeing in Bangkok. A trip Down the river, Damnoen Saduak (the floating market), Weekend Market etc. However if you have 1-2 hours to kill this could be an option ...

Lovely and interesting house to visit. The Jim Thompson story is really interesting and if you don't know it (I didn't) you will learn about it on your guided tour of this house (tours are compulsory but well organised and different languages are offered). The house itself is attractive and full of fascinating antiques and the the gardens are a beautiful oasis in the city. There is a restaurant on site although we didn't try it, and a gift shop (prices are extortionate by Bangkok standards though). A free shuttle golf cart runs between the house and the nearest Skytrain station which is the National Stadium.

Impressive house. I read the book before the trip so I knew the story which made the visit more interesting. Mr. Thompson was clearly a collector of impressive art work and furnishings. The house is worth seeing and seems almost like you are no longer in the city due to the location. We read that the shop offered inexpensive silk items but that seems to have changed as everything was very high end and priced to suit.
Haven of peace. Great visit to this site, well worth the effort to get to. A little haven of peace in a very busy city. Great story behind the man

Beautiful and mysterious. A nice house and garden. Mr. Thompson had a good taste and eye. Mystique settles around you when you walk in the garden or inside the foul taste furnished house. It's easy to fantasize about how he disappeared. Who knows what happened.

Beautiful place and wonderful lunch. After shopping in MBK, we walked a short distance from the National Stadium BTS station to this oasis in the city. We joined a group with an english speaking guide and she toured us through the grounds with a charming flair and expertise that we all appreciated. The Jim Thompson items in their store are outrageously priced so we drooled and left to eat in the lovely lovely restaurant.
Worth visiting. If you have a few hours to spare, it is worth visiting this place. The house itself is so impressive and it feels so nice to be there.

Oasis in the middle of the City. A wonderful experience in the middle of this frantic City. Beautiful traditional Thai houses created by Jim Thompson who clearly had a great love of Thailand and its people. We had a wonderful Thai guide who obviously loved the place and informing visitors. She was a delight. Of course it is a commercial venture with the cafe and shop. Be warned that the silks in the shop are top top price but quite beautiful.

Interesting but .... We enjoyed learning the history behind this place but we only toured to fill some empty time in one of our days. In addition, it seemed like the items on sale were extremely over-priced.

First Stop. This was our first stop after arriving in Bangkok and it is a must see. The story of Jim Thompson is extremely interesting and his home is an oasis amid the city. He had astounding taste and his love of culture and beauty is obvious as you make your way thru his personal home. What treasures he collected! Every group is accompanied by a guide (English could have been a little better) and ours was very shy but when we asked questions, she was happy to answer them. Make sure you add this stop to your itinerary.

An expanding Thai brand. Jim Thompson silk products are as good as it gets, but expect to pay for it. The store has that extra cachet of mystery surrounding the strange disappearance of the Thai Silk King, Jim Thompsonin the 1960's. Every time we visit here the line has expanded. Now, a few doors away, they are building the Jim Thompson Restaurant. Food products are already for sale in the store. So it becomes a tourism experience as well as a shopping experience.

Expensive. We found the tour very interesting but we all had a hard time understanding the English-speaking guide so maybe do some research before you visit so you know a bit of what they are talking about. Also, a note to parents - this is not a place for small children to roam freely. We were on a tour with a woman who was not watching her child at all and he was crawling all over Thompson's priceless antiques, picking up statuettes and offerings in a spirit house. It was very stressful for the group and the Thai tour guide who was too polite to ask them to leave. The Jim Thompson shop has very beautiful things but they were 2 - 3x more expensive than things we found at a silk factory store outside Chiang Mai. I'm sure there are similar factories outside Bangkok if you are looking to buy a lot of silk as gifts, etc. The restaurant was quite good but also very expensive for a meal in Thailand.

an interesting piece of history. it's quite central and easy to get to by BTS, the tour of the house and garden is quite informative and the property itself is very interesting from the architectual point of view but also as a piece of broader view on living in Thailand in the early 20th century

Jim Thompson's House. Having only learnt about Jim Thompson quite by accident a week before my trip to Bangkok, I quickly added a visit to his home to my itinerary. As an architecture/interior design/fashion (all things design really) lover this was a treasure trove of delights! A fascinating house and life expressed in one man's private collection of artifacts and art. Make sure you take the tour to find out the interesting details of his self designed home, a collage of traditional Thai buildings transported to one location and stitched together to cater for western comforts. My adrenaline junkie of a husband wasn't as impressed, but for the small entry fee even he thought it was worth a tour around the estate. If you are interested in design this is a must!

Very interesting place to visit.. Fantastic guide service here where you will learn everything about Jim Thompson ( apart from where he dissapeared to!)The Thai teak buildings are facinating and well worth a visit.

Classic Thai architecture. Beautiful Thai house(s) and grounds, with artifacts and Jim Thompson's story, accommpanied by one of his signature silk stores. A great insight into the past and an easy walk from Siam BTS (skytrain) station.

It's ok. Houses from Ayuthaiya transported to Bangkok owned by Jim Thompson, a Western legend in Thailand. Inside there is a small art collection and you know how he lived. In front at the same area is a huge Jim Thompson brand clothes shop. Nothing too special. Go there if you have enough time to dispend, if not there is a lot of more interesting places to go in Bangkok.

Everything there is my style!. I love this house, its garden, ambience, setting, store, and restaurant. The restaurant and cafe there is so nice, look over a fish pond and a beautiful house by the river. The food, drinks and dessert was so good. Jim Thompson brand has its own unique style and culture in everything it does.

A very pleasant afternoon. We visited the Jim Thompson House as a stop on a private day tour. My friend and I were so amazed by this place. The visit is provided by staff at the Jim Thompson house which made it that much more informative. This is a beautiful example of traditional Thai style house but with a few 'western' additions. The house is full of impressive asian antiques. This is a short tour but definitely worth while. We also had lunch in the restaurant - a great thai meal. And save some time to spend in the shop. They have beautiful silk products, prices to satisfy all wallets.

Oasis in a crazy city. Get here first thing in the morning before it is crowded. This man was into thai silk and lived in this house which he created by linking old houses already there with other old houses in the thai style which he transported there from other parts of the country to make the large home in which he lived. As an architect by profession he did a really tasteful job and further enhanced the place by furnishing it with wonderful old thai objects and furnishings sympathetic to the thai way of living. The only exception to this was his dining table. He eschewed dining on the floor thai style and formed his rectangular dining table by placing two antique mahjong tables side by side. The house is seen by a formal tour which was excellent. There is a wonderful shop in which you can purchase the silk wares - irresistable.

Beautiful examples of Thai houses. We did not see more than a handful of these types of old structures in Thailand during 3 weeks of travel and were glad to have visited the Jim Thompson home to get an appreciation of what Thai houses look(ed) like. The complex is surrounded by beautiful gardens and the tours through the house are well organized.
Good short tours. Interesting place, and tours were not too long-around 45 mins. Make sure you buy ticket first and then go to tours area to get your allocated tour time.

Great insight on the silk industry of Thailand. The tour of the Jim Thompson house was an unexpected plus for our trip. It is down a soi, away form the main streets in the area. The tours are offered in many languages and the history of Jim Thompson's influence and impact on the silk industry in Thailand is fascinating. Well worth making trek to find the site. Be confident, it is worth the humble approach.

Oasis in Bangkok. Recommended to see: a step back in time in otherwise crazy Bangkok.Fantastic ambience, wonderful tranquil setting and amazing architecture and antiques.Buy the book about the Jim Thompson mystery by William Warren here; a worthwhile memento.

A change from the bstling madness of the Big Mango. Bangkok can be truly surprising. Here is such a place, the 'house' is actually made up of several traditional wooden Thai houses. The gardens lend a sense of tranquillity and you begin to wind down almost immediately. You are taken back a few years and get to see what sort of 'taste' the man had. It always makes me appreciate Bangkok and forget about the traffic, noise and general cityness of the place. Well worth a visit!
Oasis in the middle of the city. Absolutely worth visiting. The guides are knowledgeable and speak really good English. The place itself is stunning as well. So many plants and really funny fish.

A lovely detour from temples and palaces. While I knew very little about Thai silk and Jim Thompson, I decided to visit in order to see the way he integrated Western and Thai approaches towards architecture. The tour guide explained the ways in which he tweaked traditional Thai building practices, such as connecting the rooms in the house and turning window panels inward so that he could enjoy the intricate carving. It was fascinating to look at all of the items that he collected before his disappearance, and the garden was beautiful. After the tour, you're allowed to wander the garden and first floor at your leisure and take photographs. No photography is allowed in the rest of the house, nor shoes for that matter.The restaurant is reasonably priced, though the products in their store are quite costly. Of note, their woolen, modal, and rayon scarves are all made in Kashmir; I'm not sure about the linen. The place accepts credit cards, and the staff will fill out VAT forms and explain how to get your money back at customs. I finished the bulk of my Christmas shopping in the span of 30 minutes.If you're strapped for time, this place isn't necessarily a must-see. Still, for 100 THB, it's well worth a visit if you have an hour or two to spare. It's super accessible--the shuttle from National Stadium to the House is superfluous if you're willing to walk for three minutes or so.

A little oasis in BKK. Once you find it, it looks like you fell out of the city and into the jungle (relatively speaking). The history is amazing and as a Jim Thompson fan, they had every type of JT knick-knack available. What an amazing life JT had and well done to the store/foundation for detailing his history. BS: You can never go wrong with a JT pillow case for gifting purposes back home. Best gift and easy to pack.
See an old Thai House. A wonderful and charming old Thai house that is full of memorabilia and antiques, and Thai paintings.

Nice Escape from busy Bangkok. You don't have to be a fan of Jim Thompson's designs to appreciate this tour. It is really an oasis in the heart of Bangkok. Jim led a truly fascinating life and an equally mysterious death. The tour of his house lasts about 40 minutes and it's not too costly. There's a nice gift shop and the restaurant looks pretty good. After you leave the grounds take a walk to the MBK mall a few blocks away. If you need to pick up some inexpensive souvenirs or gifts, this mall has hundreds of small merchants. Well worth a visit to the JT House for a quick history lesson.

Interesting piece of history. The tours at the Jim Thompson are pretty informative, and the house is very well constructed. The place itself though, is a bit hard to find; the nearest station is the one at National Stadium, however I walked from a different stop. There is a shuttle service out as well, so if anything it does make it easier to access. Tours are in several different langauges, do check up on tour timings. I was lucky to get there on time, and enjoyed a 45 minute tour that explained about Jim Thompson's life and his influence revitalizing the Thai silk industry. Definitely a must visit for those interested!

Fascinating history and appearance. The Jim Thompson house and tour are interesting from several viewpoints. First, he was a (if not THE) major influence in the development of interest in Thai silk. Second, he collected an amazing set of furniture, decorations, etc., for the current house. Third, the construction and arrangement of the buildings and rooms is very interesting. It is just a short hop from the Sky Train, with free golf-cart transportation from and to the National Station stop. We did not try it, but the restaurant is also highly rated and busy.

Excellent Food. This is a restaurant I would definitely go back again. My friends and I love the Thai food they serve there. Nice ambiance and relaxing place after long day of shopping. Nearby MBK it is very easy to find and they do have free shuttle transport to take you out after a heavy meal.

How to reach Jim Thompson's House from Sukhumvit Line BTS. We stayed in Sukhumvit Soi 4 ( Ibis Nana ), so our home BTS is Nana (E3).From Nana BTS, the cost is around 38 or 42 THB per person. Exchange your Baht (THB) bank notes into coins in your BTS station, read guidance in the wall to determine your distance and fee, then Insert your coin into ticket vending machine. Insert your trip card, search for "To Mo Chit" sign, go upstairs and there you go to Siam exchange BTS station. In Siam BTS, get off from your Sukhumvit Line train, search for National Stadium sign and get into the Silom Line Train the platform. In National Stadium (W1), take the exit 1 ( actually you can read it in the sign direction ), from the stairs, turn left, walk past Mercure Ibis Hotel then you'll find Soi Kasemsan 2 on your right side. Walk on, then you'll see the house at about 200 meters from the main road. Charge : 100 Thb, with english speaking guide. Souvenirs store, cage is available. To store your belongings is mandatory, including taking off shoes. The house is nicely built from wooden; actually there are several houses in one complex, combining traditional Thai and western influences. There are so many collection to see in this house, unfortunately, taking pics inside is prohibited. If you have three days to spend in Bangkok and you plan to go to Siam/National Stadium area, DO NOT skip this spot. There is a shuttle car to bring you back and forth from Jim Thompson’s house to the main road, near National Stadium BTS.Nearby, you could visit MBK Shopping Mall or National Art and Gallery. Nice addition to your itinerary.
Interesting and fun !. This house is really great and beautiful, the guide we had was really funny. It was an interesting visit. Nice thing to do in Bangkok !

Beautiful traditional house captured in time. We very much enjoyed visiting the Jim Thompson house. The architecture, garden design, furnishings and artwork were all so elegant and ornate. The complimentary tour was concise and helpful. Afterwards, we sat and had an iced coffee in the cafe watching the koi carp. You couldn't believe it was in the heart of chaotic Bangkok.

Oasis in the heat of Bangkok. As soon as you step from the soi, you are transported to a sub-tropical paradise of luscious trees and plants,a koi pond and welcome shade. Then you see it, the red painted house that Jim built. Actually it is not one house but a combination of six teak buildings which all represent Thai traditional architecture. What I found intriguing was the story of Jim, an American architect,who not only transformed the Thai silk industry but also left this house as a heritage to later generations. The mysterious disappearance, even today there is no clue about this, adds to one's fascination. The paintings, sculptures and ceramics that Jim collected, are tastefully displayed throughout the house. Your experience is enhanced by a knowledgeable guide who speaks understandable English. After a tour of the house, you can relax in the attractive, efficient restaurant and enjoy Thai traditional dishes. This was a morning well spent.

Not quite what we expected. I wanted to buy silk material to make dresses and was told to make my way to Jim Thompson House as there would be ample of selection there. We took a taxi from our last stop but walked the last 900m due to bad traffic (the taxi driver just pointed us the direction and suggested we walk as it would be faster).There is actually a free shuttle service from Jim Thompson House to the BTS station located at the main road. Since we were not aware of this, we walked right up to the house - not much traffic and there were other tourists walking with us too.They have an English tour that costs 200 baht per person at specific times. We paid for the tour and only later was informed of the time. As we had time constraints, we skipped the tour (we did not ask for a refund as we were not sure if they would entertain our request) and headed to the retail outlet and the restaurant instead.The retail outlet had quite a range of products available from household to clothing. However cut fabric is not available here (to my disappointment). The restaurant was full as it was lunch hour. We needed to wait a bit. If you come in a big group, the wait will be longer. They had a nice selection of Thai dishes. It is a bit pricey but you pay for the ambiance of the place. Service is a bit slow but then again, perhaps they do not expect tourists to be in a hurry.We will go back again for the tour if we have the time in future. This time we shall use the train and get that free shuttle ride.

Interesting architecture. An excellent place to visit, the tours were very well organised and informative. It was interesting learning about the man himself and being able to walk around original thai homes was fascinating. We enjoyed the traditional silk manufacturing process very much, as an Australian parent who had to find Mulberry leaves for school silk worm projects it was good to see the other end of the process.The restaurant was a little disorganised but the food was great in a really pleasant setting overlooking a carp pond.

Worth the visit...but not a must-see. The grounds are very beautiful but the tour can get a bit monotonous. The staff is very gracious and tours are held in various languages...our guide's English was perfect!If you're on a tight schedule you might want to skip this sight and concentrate on others.

Such an interesting stop in such an interesting city.. Jim Thompson was an interesting person and to see how he combined his obvious love of Thailand with his sensibility as a Western architect was intriguing. The grounds are lovely. Gift shop was enticing if a bit pricey.

very interesting collection of houses. you have a great place to walk around and see a lot of Thai history with a nice cafe to relax and have a drink and some food. Thompson had the houses brought to Bangkok from different locations and then mixed traditional and more modern facilities.

Nicely maintain house, a must visit in Bangkok!. Jim Thompson house is unique and has a very big garden. The wooden house is well maintained and the ticket is reasonable. Worth the visit in walking distance from the BTS National Stadium. A tour-guide explains details of Jim Thompson background and the history of the house which is very informative. A must visit place in Bangkok.

History lesson in Bangkok!. Recommended by friends and well worth a visit . Didn't know about this important and influential American who had a major impact on Thailand's silk industry post second world war . Very reasonable price to visit this tranquil oasis, house and gardens in the middle of the hustle and bustle of Bangkok .

Jim Thompson - interesting house, interesting life. I had certainly heard of Jim Thompson on my trips to Bangkok. He is somewhat iconic and quite well known here - there is a Jim Thompson silk store at Siam Paragon, he's been used in Thailand ad campaigns, a line of fabric collections uses his name - and the list goes on. However, I had not ever had the opportunity to visit the Jim Thompson House. There are just so many "must sees" in Bangkok and with my work schedule, time was limited. I don't think this is a "must see" on a first trip to Bangkok if you are visiting for just a short time - but it is very, very interesting - both for this insight about Jim Thompson's life, as well as for the architecture of the house and gardens. Jim Thompson was an American architect who was a military intelligence officer in Bangkok - he returned to Thailand after he left the service. He was known primarily for two accomplishments. First, he focused on reviving the silk industry in Thailand and was instrumental in creating worldwide demand for Thai silk. Second, he is known for the construction of this house which follows and respects the principles of Thai architecture. The house is actually a collection of houses that come from all over Thailand and were reassembled as one house in Bangkok. When the house became the focus of interest, he opened it to the public and donated the money he received to Thai charities that emphasized preserving Thai culture. Jim Thompson disappeared while in Malaysia - there have never been any clues about what happened to him.If time permits, this is definitely worth a visit. It's a lovely, interesting home in a peaceful, serene setting - right in the middle of the bustle of Bangkok. Very easy walk from MBK and/or National Stadium stop on the BTS.
Enjoy browsing. It is fun just to watch it because there are a lot of products except the tie silk. The good hat of the sense is unmissable.

Nice cultural experience!. I've been reading that some had a hard time getting there but thanks to the 'get directions' from trip advisor I was able to follow that compass and easily get there! And yes. It was worth it! It's like a small jungle in the middle of the city! Our tour guide was very very polite sweet and most importantly funny! I had never enjoyed a tour as much as I did that day! Other than the art collectibles and architecture to observe, the gardens are really nice with fish and water turtles around! In addition to that observing the process of silk making was really interesting, and I dunno if we were just lucky but there was also an exhibition on the top floor near the entrance. It was silk and contemporary art! Def was worth it!

he was definitely a great man. the house is worth the visit: we can get the feeling about a gentleman who liked the good life in Asia. The house is just superb, full of nice piece of antics of the best quality. This open house on a very nice garden is exactly what I am looking for !

Elegant and Exotic!. What a beautiful, exotic home in a jungle of sorts... and interesting slice of history. The tour is great...The restaurant is really stunning.
We liked the shuttle from the top of the street too.

A must for visitors. I always take visitors there but having been around a few times I sit in the very pleasant cafe whilst they do the tour. The house is spectacular and living in Bangkok I always wonder why I cannot have a house like that.
A well guided tour. A very well guided tour. The guide has great knowledge on the understanding Jim Thomson and the architecture he built his house.

Must visit if you have 2 hours and like history. Loved the ambience of the estate and the Thai architecture . Very well maintained . If you like architecture and history I suggest you make a trip. Takes you back in time. It is a little gem of a place.

Seek out this amazing place. Don't be put off walking down the back streets of Bangkok to find this little paradise and ignore touters who say its closed and come to my shop instead!! Absolutely intriguing visit. Coffee shop for lunch was good too.
Interesting History. It was an interesting place to visit with the house layout, artefacts, and history of this entrepreneurial man.

Is a must for all tourist!!!. Walk to the Jim Thompson house after shopping at MBK,it is quite confusing at first but thanks to the friendly neighbourhood whom tell us the direction.Jim Thompson house was home to the famous Jim Thompson whom mysteriously disappear in Cameron Highland, Malaysia while he was on holiday and his legacy just left behind like this. But with a guided tour with us, one can simply feel so 'pampered' by the friendly guide who always smile with us and also to answer all of our questions (of course being from Malaysia!). There was a cafe at there as well as a boutique.Recommended for anyone whom still looking for an afternoon slot for their Bangkok trip and it is really worth it. Salute to the management and staff of Jim Thompson House.Not to mention free shuttle for those who wants to get back to the BTS.

More than you expect. We weren't sure what to expect in visiting Jim Thompson House and were pleasantly surprised. The house is amazing, well worth paying to get on a guided tour. The gardens are magnificent. The fellow at the entry that explains the process of extracting the silk was really informative and happy to answer our thousand questions. The store is amazing, boy you could do some damage to the credit card in there. Overall, a lovely way to spend a morning. It's really interesting.

Worth The Visit. If you are like me and don't know much about Jim Thompson I found this tour very interesting. Even the kids really enjoyed the visit. The house and all the items within are very historically interesting and the history of Jim Thompson is interesting as well. Must visit when in Bangkok.

Small but might. Us rum. Part of the joy in this visit was the enthusiasm of the guide . Set in a beautiful garden, the house is an oasis in the city. Accessible by the water taxi. A lovely cool restaurant next to a koi pond. Yes, the items on the shop are expensive, but they are top quality.
Great History and fantastic outfits to buy. You have to be taken round by a guide - all very knowledgable. small cafe there as well to have a drink. Well worth a visit when in Bangkok

Great visit to Jim Thompson House. We booked a trip to see Jim Thompson's house with our representative, I must be honest and say that I did not know what to expect, but when we arrived I thoroughly enjoyed it !!! The house is absolutely gorgeous and the guide was very knowledgable and friendly, would highly recommend.

Interesting - yet less than expected. Jim Thompson is certainly an historic and important person to the Thai silk industry. His home can be viewed under strict limitaions and very limited time schedules. Left me a bit underwhelmed. Main attraction is the store -- where many baht can be spent.

Very Interesting. It's located up a dusty old side street that looks like it would have nothing interesting down it, but when you turn the corner and see it you'll be amazed. It's like a little oasis of green and beauty in the middle of the city. The history is facinating, the garden is a jungle paradise, and the architecture and antique collections are amazing. There is also a nice little shop and cafe and the staff there are lovely.

Worth seeing. We only had one day in Bangkok to explore the sites, but I'm so glad we stopped here. Easy to access from sky train, though it was a little confusing on the maps to find once we got off the train. We ended up grabbing a taxi only to find that we were only a couple blocks away! Luckily, tuk-tuk's are cheap :) The Jim Thompson House feels like an oasis in the city. Very classy. We didn't eat at the restaurant, but it looked delicious. Really interesting to see a traditional home (albeit very high-end). I would recommend a visit!

An oasis in the city. I had read the book about Jim Thompson so we were quite keen to have a look around the house while we were in Bangkok.There is a very minimal charge to join a tour and you can walk around the garden while you wait for it to start. The house really does seem to be an oasis in the hustle and bustle of the city.The tour itself took you through the house and explained more about Jim Thompson. Personally I would have liked more information about the silk process but we were early in the day and they did look like they were setting something up as we were leaving. Worth a look around.

Very beautiful house (but not accessibe). This is a well kept and very beautiful house. On a sundaymorning,around 10.30 it was not too overcrowded. It is well worth a visit, back into romantic time! Unfortunately the house is not accessible with a wheelchair, but still it is enjoyable. Beware of the taxidrivers if you come back, they don't want to put their meter on, so make good statement before you get in!

wonderful artwork and building. was well run and great short tour of this wonderful house with western and eastern influences. people dancing and spinning silk a bonus along with the lush cool gardens. for a thai experience take the local canal trip just jump on when it arrives as quickly as possible and pay the person with the hard hat on, u will see why they wear them as the boat takes off, great fun, we used it regularly in our 3 week stay getting off and on at places outside of the tourist tours.

Beautiful complex but very much a tourist trap. This museum is quite beautiful - the grounds are lush and peaceful, and it's a pleasant respite from the Siam and MBK malls on the next block. They had two traditional dancers and music in the garden today, which was interesting to watch. I was very surprised to see how touristy the complex is though and the prices for the silk products are very high, especially by Thai standards. We were glad to have stopped in, but disappointed at the very commercial aspect of it.

I don't get it. This was okay, but I really can't gush like many of the other reviews. It's a decent sized old wood house but I was not especially wowed by the building. I am sure Jim was a great guy, but he is not going to be there. I am an amateur Asian decorative art collector so I have some knowledge about the subject, there is some valuable pieces in there but unless you really appreciate antique scroll paintings, dinner ware etc you may find it a tad boring. The best pieces from his collection are long gone. You must follow a tour group through the house which we found boring at times. Our guide said "Jim Thompson" in every sentence often several times. It just felt a bit "dumbed down", it reminded me of school group tours. My wife and I were wearing sandals so that meant bare foot on the tour as you must take off your shoes, which we find kind of gross. How this country avoids a foot wart and atheletes foot epidemic is beyond me.
