His garden is soooo serene i wouldnt mind reading my book there during late afternoon siesta. His bedroom and guest rooms, were superb! Its worth looking for, especially if you are planning to have an oriental home.
Beautiful and instructive. We enjoyed very much the guided tour of the house. The French speaking guide was extremely competent and the house itself is beautiful.

Worth a visit,maybe.... If you know of Jim Thompson you might be interested. Be prepared to remove your shoes once again to visit the house. It is cheap to visit and the paintings and architecture of the house are interesting as well to some people. I would not recommend unless you are really looking for something else to do.

A lovely visit. Maybe a smaller attraction than Vimanmek Palace, but this traditional teak house is lovely to visit- beautifully made and furnished, with a nice restaurant on the site and beautiful gardens. The story of Jim Thompson is also interesting and they sell the luxury silks on site. Also is it quieter and more tranquil, so I much prefer it.

Learn a little about Thai history. This was a tour around the shady, breezy Jim Thompson house. Strict tour numbers avoided overcrowding and the bar next to the canal was a lovely place to kill half an hour with a beer, waiting for our tour to start! This tour shows you aspects of traditional Thai buildings and also teaches you about Jim Thompson, a crucial part of the Thai silk industry.
Good. It's not expensive and if you appreciate art and architectural design you'll enjoy it. They have a nice restaurant and it's fairly interesting. It wouldn't be something everyone likes though.
Definitely visit and take the tour. WWell worth it to visit. But if you want to buy silk clothing or fabric, head to the Jim Thompson store two BTS stops away.
Jim Thompson House. Every time I'm in Thailand Bangkok or Phuket I visit :)Love to shop there:). Great quality, great designs and lovely things :)

The Place You Should not Miss!!!. Get off Siam BTS and then a short walk to Soi 2. This is one of the hidden treasures that Bangkok has to offer. A guided tour (for about 100 Baht) followed by Lunch at the Cafe (very reasonably priced) and some retail therapy at the store is a perfect way to spend an afternoon

One of the top ten attractions in Bangkok. An interesting place to visit, fantastic buildings, museum and a nice restaurant. You must have a guide when walking around in the houses, included in the ticketprice. Jim Thompson was an American who developed the silk industry in Thailand. The story about him is facinating. Very nice shop where you can buy lots of things of high quality, I really recommend you to buy gifts here. Everything is priceworthy.
Worth the trip. Interesting tour that only lasts about 40 mins. In a very accessible part of city. If you are an architecture or design freak this place Ida must see.

Pretty estate. Not sure it's worthwhile though.. The tour focuses on the house and not the silk trade. If you're hoping to learn about silk you'll be disappointed. - No wireless internet- half price if under 25 (normally 100 THB or $3.33 USD)
Must visit. Always a favorite stop whenever im in Bangkok. I love all the products of Jim Thompson and what a great bonus that their restaurant is equally delightful!

Such Style. There's a history to his house and of course Jim Thompson. The main reason for Thai silk entering the world market. What a beautiful house filled with some of the most beautiful 17th century Thai and Chinese art. Tours run for about 40 min and are very informative and if love shopping the silk shop is filled with gifts for friends at home.

Very Interesting and lovely grounds!. We enjoyed our tour which we had to wait 30 minutes for. The tour was informative and not too long. We enjoyed the beautiful garden and gift shop while we waited. After the tour we did spend some more time going through the buildings. There is a nice restuarant and bar on site as well. It was a little pricey compared to other places we had enjoyed a cold smoothie and snack but is a lovely spot and the food was good.

Gorgeous house. The house from Jim Thompson is beautiful and a great example from a Thai house. You can not walk through the house without a guide and will go in groups. The garden is nice to have lunch in. An escape from the sweaty busy city.

Mysterious man who lived in beautiful house. Wonderful teak flooring and beautiful old ceramics, silk paintings and many more. Must place to visit if you are interested with handycrafts and Silk Pashminas. Super Silk design. And quality in super surroundings. English speaking guide made it special day.

Interesting character, fabulous architecture. I would have liked to have built or lived in a place of this--a collection of thai traditional houses connected intelligently together to create a more westernized, compartmentalized space. But so well done (ok, he WAS an architect before becoming THE thai silk entrepreneur). The entrance includes a guided tour of the place, quality here varies from guide to guide -- ours was competent but I overheard another who really delved into the details of Jim LIVING in the space, which sounded better, But worth a visit, for sure!

Secluded little paradise right on a klong. This is Bangkok's number one tourist spot. It can get quite crowded, but still has a lot of charm, conveys some of the atmosphere of the old days. They only let you into the inner sanctuary on guided tours. While you wait you can have a snack or a whole meal at the restaurant or visit the gallery, where they had very interesting contemporary art on display during our visit. The Jim Thompson shop is also worth a visit. Those who find it too expensive can pick up a folder, where all the outlets are listed.

Out of this world. A definite visit. Jim Thompson House has tours for 100 Baht and they are great, only about 35 minutes, and then you can wonder around yourself to enjoy it after the tour. Shop and restaurant are great, and the restaurant is a la carte, serving anything from cakes to main Thai delights. Put it on your list. Free JT Tuk Tuk from near National Stadium BTS.
The rebirth of silk. I was fairly ignorant about silk and was impressed to find out more about this american silk pioneer in Thailand.The museum is very well organized and a delight.

Well worth a visit. Jim Thompson shops are numerous, especially at Bangkok airport. It's interesting to learn the story behind the man and to see where he lived. Guided tours only, but very good ones.

Colonial style house to see one time. The house and garden is well maintained and it's nice but honestly, there is not much to see there. Around the house there is nothing to see except walking around.
Great piece of history. Great museum that teaches you about the silk process and a bit about the industry. Beautiful grounds and we thought the silk extraction demonstration was pretty neat.

Historical & Thai Silk. Beautiful house in an amazing setting. True history of a man that had a simple but luxurious lifestyle. Amazing Thai silk products. I bought a beautiful silk top and love it to bits.

House Museum. The Jim Thompson House is like a museum. The house is made of teak in traditional Thai style. He mixed the Thai spirit with Europe house layouts in his house. And all of his collections are precious from China and Asia area. The most I like is a pair of teapots without caps. Turn the teapot upside down and fill in water from the bottom. When turning back the teapot, the water don't come out. It's awesome!

Loved it even on my second visit. What I love so much about the Jim Thompson House is that although it's rather small it offers so much. Architecturally its just beautiful, Jim Thompson fused traditional Thai elements with his own sense of style and it is my dream house. The gardens are beautiful and he also had a beautiful collection of artifacts which collected from all over the place. His own story is fascinating, if somewhat mysterious. Even though this place gets very busy, they run the tours smoothly so as to get everyone through efficiently. I recommend going early and beating the crowds. We did the 9.30am tour and by the time we finished there were so many people coming, but it was xmas day so perhaps it had something to do with that!The restaurant/cafe is beautiful and serves refreshing and delicious food and drinks. Upstairs is a space which I assume you can book for special occasions as I saw a Thai wedding happening in there.The souvenir store is great. I'm not a fan of cheap token souvenirs, but they have high quality and beautifully designed products which are a legacy of Jim Thompson and when we were there, there was also a gentleman demonstrating the process of working the silk from the silkworm cocoons.

Frank Lloyd Wright meets the King and I. This is a facinating place - a tribute to SouthEast Asian culture as appreciated by a westerner. The gardens are lovely and it is easy to imagine going back in time in the house. WE had a great lunch here too.

Clean, friendly and lots of tourists. Very friendly staff. Our 1.5 year old could sleep in his pram next to the counter while we got the tour. There are quite some tourists around (we were there at 10am), but the tours are short and efficient. Nice getaway from busy Bangkok streets.
Silk history. We loved learning how silk is made and the history of the house. The store had beautiful silk garments at decent prices. A peaceful place to walk through with nice gardens and charm.

A must see when in Bangkok. Our guide was very entertaining and balanced perfectly between the story and life of Jim Thompson to small anecdotes about the house. This is a perfect way to learn about an important part of Thailand's heritage and enjoy a more quiet side of the bustling city.

An Oasis Of Fine Taste. I loved the Jim Thompson House. The staff have done a fine job in creating an environment in which it's easy to imagine Jim's life in Bangkok. The teak houses are exactly as Jim left them, and the tour guides are knowledgeable and well-informed. She even took timer at the end to spend some more time with me and answer my questions. The only slight negative point is that the main house can only be viewed as part of a tour, and photography even without flash is not permitted. But overall, this is a fine museum, carefully preserved and with a fascinating history. Toilets are extremely clean and well maintained, and the gift shop has some very nice items reasonably priced.

Great stop!. Almost didn't come here because we weren't sure what to expect, but so glad we did! It was a beautiful oasis in the middle of hectic Bangkok. Gorgeous artwork/architecture and interesting history. Had to wait about 1.5 hours for the tour because we came on a very busy day, but didn't matter because we spent the time in the gift shop, the garden and watching the demo of silk weaving (very cool!). Definitely recommend this. Walking distance to MBK.

Very Interesting Man and very interesting House. First - Everyone at the House speaks very good English. So if you have questions - it is a good place to go. And the restaurants on the premises are excellent. Jim Thompson is responsible for introducing Thai silk to the world. He was a retired OSS agent who found himself in Thailand in WWII. Lots to see and learn.
Very Impressive!. The silk is super expensive, but the tour is worth the money! The story and history is interesting, also take a break and have lunch in the restaurant, very good!
A restful break. A lovely way to spend a few hours away from the noise of Bangkok. Reasonable price and informative guided tour. Easy acccess from Stadium BTS sky train.

how to buy liquor. The jim thompson I used was close to the charoen Rat Rd. I was looking for some alcohol. What is interesting is that they had a whole isle of different varieties but you cannot purchase any until after 5 pm. That goes for the 7 11's as well. Viva La difference.

An island of tranquility in Central Bangkok. A tranquil spot that allows you a glimpse of what old Bangkok was like back in the 1960's. The ambiance of the house and gardens harks back to a time when the pace of life was slower and less stressful. Guides were knowledgeable with the tour taking 40 mins or so....but such was the captivating atmosphere that we were there for almost 3 hrs!! We were also very impressed that there was absolutely no compulsion to get us to purchase anything although we bought quite a bit in the end!!

A fascinating bit of Bangkok history. We've been to the Jim Thompson house a couple of times. It is always interesting, his story is a fascinating piece of Bangkok history and Thompson clearly had a discriminating eye for art and antiques: it shows in every room of the house. But be aware that it's a fairly small place, and it's busy: after you've paid your (reasonably hefty) admission fee, you'll have to wait for your tour time - typically around 30-60 minutes if you come at a peak time.

Expensive. There have tons of small little things that are very pretty and fairly unique; a lot of great ideas of what can be done with silk; but everything is quite expensive as Jim Thompson is not a brand name by itself.
Must do. I coem here every time when I'm in Bangkok - I visited a house and museum when I was first in Bangkok, well worth it, but now I go back for a great shop for presents, nice cafe and garden

A little oasis amoungst the bustle of Bangkok city.. A visit to Bangkok isn't complete without visiting the home of the silk industries founder. Although you must take a compulsory tour the wait time is minimal and the guides very knowledgeable .The tour takes about 45 minutes .For those of you wishing to buy Jim Thompson products there is a huge store onsite.After your visit don't forget to walk a log the canal behind the house and cross over the water to see the original silk factories in action.

Beautiful design and interesting story.. After taking the tour of Mr. Thompsons home, I was left very curious as to what really happened to Mr. Thompson. His love of the Thai Silk and Thai people is evident in what he left behind.The large store in the city has more shopping items, but if not purchasing large amounts of silk, the house is a more interesting visit.
brilliant collectibles. Great for collectibles and antique lovers like me to drool on his collection. The store has more items than at the airport

Jim Thompson's legacy. Thompson was an ex-spy who settled in Thailand after WW2. He and the Queen brought Thai silk to the world. This is his house built according to Thai traditions. Must see: his antique collection, includes a broken statue straight from the 1200s.

Everyone has to do this including you..... To anyone living Thailand - mention JT's House and you'll get a sigh of exasperation cos its the place everyone gets taken and there is a good reasons for that. This is a lovely Teak House with a stunning gardens. Built but the famous JT and housing some of his collection it gives a glimpse to what Bangkok was like before it became the city of light. The tour is good, the gardens lovely and the cafe is Excellent. Go enjoy - I still do after visiting at least 10 times and so will you

Lovely place, well worth the visit. Jim Thompson house is actually six old Thai houses dismantled and brought to this site. They are beautiful buildings, furnished simply but wonderfully. The whole setting in the middle of Bangkok is very tranquil.

Good browsing spot, excellent place to sit, grab a coffee of some good basic Thai food while she.... shops. A great resting place / watering hole on your way round Bangkok's staple stopping points with the family. A good spot for some late lunch in nicely air conditioned surroundings with good basic Thai food, other menu options for those off the chili and a good pot of coffee or tea.

A classic not to be missed. Tired of tacky tourist traps in Bangkok? The Jim Thompson house museum is a must. Carefully preserved by a foundation, the house offers extraordinary sculpture, fascinating architecture and a remarkable story. Did the tour 6 years ago and the second time did not dissapoint. Have lunch at the JT restaurant on site. Excellent food in a sophisticated surrounding. Note: you may have to wait up to 40 minutes for your tour guide (groups are limited to 15 and assembled on the basis of tour guide language).Suprisingly, many taxi drivers don't know about this museum or its location. Direct them to the National Stadium, a couple of blocks from the Jim Thompson house (and serviced by a golf cart by JT staff)
Well worth a visit. On my list of the top five places to visit in Bangkok. Besides the history and intrigue, the house, decorations and gardens are beautiful

Something different.. Something a little different to the usual attractions in Bangkok. It is quite and green as well which is really different! If you have the time and are in the area it is worth checking out. I wouldn't cross town for it though.

Lovely house and good restaurant. The house is very interesting and inside is a great collection of Chinese Porcelain and other antiquities. There is a small, cool garden and a restaurant which serves a very acceptable lunch. You get a guided tour - expect to have to take your shoes off

Could have been better. Nice house. Interesting story. But now a tourist trap seeking a purpose.To be honest this place is not sure what it is. A homage to Jim Thompson? Perhaps. Educational about silk? Not really. Fun? No.We felt like sheep being led around a house... but it was very impersonal. By that I mean there were few if any personal possessions of the late jim Thompson and what we were told by the guide is printed verabtim in the handout at recception. my advice: don't pay for the tour. just get a leaflet, walk into the courtyard, take some pictures then leave... You'll be just as well educated at the end.
Interesting visit. The guided tour is very well done. Some interesting artefacts, but the architecture wasn't as interesting as I thought it would be. The shop is expensive.

Very interesting insight in an interesting man. Great house that gives you a feel for what sort of man Jim Thompson was, whilst allowing you to see great works of art and better understand traditional Thai architecture

Lovely Piece of Modern History. Take the skytrain to National Stadium, across the road there is a side street where there is a free shuttle by golf buggy to Jim Thompson's House, I'm so glad I finally took the time to visit, the architecture is lovely and it was interesting to learn of Jim Thompson and life. Highly recommend.
A peaceful retreat and great restaurant. Pad siew eiu was excellent. Gorgeous ambience, great place for lunch. The tour is really interesting as well, great afternoon in Bangkok
Interesting place to spend a couple of hours. Quiet spot with interesting tour around some traditional buildings with a Jim Thompson twist. Interesting place to learn something about silk.

1st Day in Bangkok. A great place to tour and have lunch! Well organised and chilled out. The shop is v stylish and we wanted to shop there but we felt the things inside needed a refresh to be attractive

GREAT HISTORY. A group of old Thai Teak houses reassembelled and put together to form a house compound is a must see while in Bangkok. The ceramic and period furniture is unique and great. Only takes an hour. The back story of Jim Thompson disappearing adds a touch of mystery to it all.

Something behind the brand. Have been buying Jim Thompson in the last 15 years every time visit thailand. To visit Jim Thompson house is qiite cool to know something behind the brand. Nice to see his collection and legendary disappearance story..

nice place to get something genuine and in good quality. if you dont have time to go to the house itself, you can alwyas go to paragon and shop there, they even have membership card so if your are a regular visitor to bangkok you can have better bargain

Good for us oldies. If you know of Jim Thompson Silk this place is worth a look. The house that Jim built before he disappeared in mysterious circumstances has turned into a tourist attraction of its own.THe house is located 200 meters from the sky train station National Stadium and is also on one of the few remaining klongs (Canals) of Bangkok. The house was completed in the late 50's and is adorned with relics and antiques that Mr Thompsom collected over the years.Very little effort is required to walk around the house and if you are interested in antiques the house and garden are well worth a couple of hours. You don't have to take the guided tour. However, if you want to venture inside the house you will need to. The cost of the tour is 100baht. Well worth it in my opinion.There is also a restaurant and cafe on the premises although I did not eat here.A tip - if you wait at at the beginning of the street (Kasem San Soi 2) special Jim Thompson golf buggys will pick you up free of charge and take you the 200 meters to the house.

Visit only if you know about Jim Thompson.. To be frank I wanted to visit the Jim Thompson house on one of my visits to Thailand as I had been reading the book about his disappearance only a few months before. Both aware of his legacy in Thailand my fiancé and myself both enjoyed this little trip in his house in the Siam area. The tour is always guided mainly because of the artifacts still original in the house are collectables and old, probably would be invaluable to them. The pictures can only be taken from outside the house which is one of their policies. Shoes to be left outside. The tours are done in various languages but yes as commented before this short tour is not very detailed and the knowledge given by the guides is very short at times so people who do not know about J.Thompson will probably not enjoy the visit. There is also a Jim Thompson shop on site, a cafe and a restaurant.

A very nice mix of Thai and Western design. Check this house out. It's near a BST station and a relatively cheap entry fee. They also have a golf cart shuttle near the BST station to the house.This house is lovely and peaceful and if you appreciate a bit of Asian art, you should visit this place.

Awesome teak houses/architecture & interesting story. Wasn't my first choice of places to visit, however, my mom (61 years) seemed interested so we decided to check it out. What a pleasant surprise as it was quite an interesting story about Jim Thompson's life, influence in Thailand and then his disappearance (still a mystery today). The houses were beautiful (teak wood) and the grounds were gorgeous, especially for being right in the midst of Bangkok. Tours in English, French, Japanese and Thai left about every 15-20 minutes. There was also a really unique special exhibit (included in admission) about globalization, natural disasters, etc. on the second floor...definitely visit it! We also had lunch in the cafe and although it was a bit pricey the convenience and location were perfect. Even if you're not interested in silk (which I'm not), I highly recommend it.

Don't Go Here. Came to the house not knowing what it was. Could only enter the house on a guided tour. The guide was good, but the things said were so banal I was not sure if it was a joke or not. Why would I care about how some guy used his living room, for example? To me, they might just have taken any house and any houseowner and told me about, I could see no difference. Impression level: zero.

Very interesting to go. Jim Thomson house is a very nice private collection. If you have a couple of hours after the shopping in MBKK center, it's worth going to see this caratheristic and calm place in a cahotic city
Pleasant surprise. I really enjoyed this tour. Pleasant surprise in the heart of Bangkok. Entire tour was not more than 45 minutes and the setting is very serene and calm. Would highly recommend.
Love this place. This is a lovely place to take time out from shopping or sight seeing. Lovely old house in the middle of the hustle and bustle of BKK

A worthwhile stop. The Jim Thompson house was fascinating and educational. I loved the traditional Thai architecture and the knowledgeable tour guide who taught us about both the house's design and Jim Thompson's life. The souvenirs in the shop were very nice, although pricey.

Tranquility in Bangkok. Beautiful quiet setting in this noisy city. Interesting and informative guided tour and a lovely house with attractive furnishings and gardens. Shop quite pricey for souvenirs. Nice to relax in the cafe afterwards. Worthwhile place to visit.

An oasis of calm. This is a real little treasure in the middle of Bangkok. Knowledgeable, good humoured guides. Fascinating history and a mystery thrown in for good measure! Easy to get to - just get the Skytrain to National Stadium.

Am I missing something?. Firstly let me say how relatively easy it is to get to this 'attraction'. Just get the sky train to the national stadium and it is within walking distance from there. Our first impressions were great, a wonderful hidden retreat setting, surrounded by traditional thai buildings and a leafy green backdrop. Restaurant, workshops and the obligatory gift shop somewhat over shadowed the actual reason we went. The tours are very well organised and clearly well planned, in various languages. Maybe we just got a new girl or someone who is relatively timid or shy, because I could barely understand or hear a word she said on the entire tour. We walked from room to room in the uniquely constructed thai house and around the gardens, as I strained to hear just exactly what it was all about. I didn't want to upset the tour guide by constantly asking: "could you repeat that again please?" or "I'm sorry, I didn't quite catch that?" So by the end I was simply bored and confused. To be honest I know the gist of the story, but can't really fathom why this has become a tourist attraction, intriguing story or not. I reckon I would've had more fun queuing for Thailand V Malaysia tickets at the National Stadium!

Intriguing. interesting for several reasons - a chance to walk through some traditional teak Thai houses that were brought down to Bangkok by silk entrepreneur and CIA station chief Jim Thompson, who later disappeared mysteriously into the Thai jungle. Also an educational respite from the Bangkok heat.

Better than expected, restaurant is a nice break from the heat!. Great pit-stop after doing shopping madness at MBK, it's only about 4 blocks down the road from national stadium stop on BTS. The house is cool and you can check out the canal boats zipping by with loads of people in them. The restaurant and cafe with the coy pond and lotus flowers is perfect for a cold drink, good meal and break. TIP: The open air cafe is more relaxed and a little cheaper than the restaurant inside, food is really good too.

Beautiful with a fascinating story.. A haven of peace and calm in a busy and frantic city. The lovely Thai lady guide was both highly knowledgeable and very amusing showing us around old buildings and detailing the obtaining of silk. Beautiful silks and products made from silk are on sale and reasonably priced both here and in other stores throughout the city. Well worth a visit even if it is just to get away from the hubbub that is Bangkok.

Traditional Thai house. I enjoyed the tour of Jim Thompson House as it is a traditional thai wooden house. Don't go here expecting it to fill your day, but it is worth a visit for an hour to get away from the madness of the city and walk around a peaceful garden and house.
Pleasant. This is a well organised tourist attraction. The guides are knowledgable with tours (compusory) in both English and French after which you can wonder around to your hearts content.

One of my favourite places to visit. I visited J T house for the first time in 1987 oh soooo long ago. I read the book and just loved everything about the history and Thai silk making process. I still have the Chinese horoscope pictures I brought all those years ago. It has developed a lot over the years but it is a very special place. Full of antiques and history worth a visit
Love the shopping. Lots of choices to choose from and the people are extremely friendly. Don't be afraid to try anything you like before deciding to buy them.

History and beauty. I love Jim Thompson designs! The old house and the history of the man behind it is well worth investigating. Every time I come to Bangkok I have to go to one of the stores but above all I love the original house with the garden and beautiful old teak buildings.

don;t miss it. An oasis and a reelaxing few hours going back to when Bangkok was old teak buildings by the rivers and the place to be in Asia.Jim Thompsons sense of style and love of all things thai is the essence of his houses and garden and if only it could be done without an organised tour it would be complete bliss. You really need to be able to linger longer than the tours allow even though our guide was incerdibly friendly polite and helpful.Stop at the cafe afterwords for fantastic thai food that isn't to westernised
An oasis of calm. A very interesting place to visit - a wonderful house and a facinating story! The tour was just right!

Ver interesting tour. If you happen to be unlucky enough to be in Bangkok, then this tour is definitely worth doing.Really interesting bits of information and lovely antiques.Well worth a visit. very easy to find, just take the sky train to the National Stadium and you should see signs for it. About ten minutes walk from the station.

Over Priced. I just don't get why tourist would to go this place looking for silk materials or gifts. Everything here is over priced and only catered for upper class shoppers,i think. Just for a simple minor thing could cost quite a bit and i don't think you want to go in browse around. They have outlets in expensive malls by looking at it only. Some of this things you could find it at some local shops with better price.

We look at the silk and buy the lunch. Jim Thompson house is well worth visiting for the museum and to look at the silk products. I have done the tour twice - once with my daughter and once with my wife on two separate business trips some years ago. Now we return every year to escape the hustle and bustle of Bangkok for a tranquil (but expensive) lunch. The best seats are outdoors beside the pool teeming with fish and surrounded by tropical greenery framing the buildings that one tours. To us the place is almost magical and the food, while not strictly Thai, is interesting and the beer is cold. The latter is a definite requirement in the heat of a Bangkok noon hour.

Interesting. Nice house and nice tour around - a very interesting story about Jim's life - worth having a look if you are in Bangkok for a few days, although it wouldn't be top of my list for a 1 or 2 day stopover.

A very pleasant visit. The Jim Thompson House is a haven of peace in the midst of a beautiful garden.The site visit accompanied by a guide in impeccable French was very interesting, but a little too fast.We rather regret not having had more time to enjoy the charm and tranquility of the house.Jim Thomson's house is a good idea to visit "zen" in the middle of bustling Bangkok.

Very interesting. Good value for your money. There is an awesome collection of ancient art from across Asia, and the house is a beautiful piece architecturally. The gardens are quite lovely too. It is easy to get too as well. I'd really recommend it to people.

Well Worth It. Really interesting, beautiful place, and the price is reasonable. I'm very interested in fabric, but even if you're not there's lots of interesting Thai sculpture and artwork and the house is beautiful.

Food and Silk all under one roof. We ate lunch in their cafe and it was quite nice. Went to the store and they have a beautiful (although not inexpensive) collection of goods. Their prices are high enough to merit tax refunds at the airport, but then, at the airport we realized that the tax authorities take a flat amount back (service charge) from your tax refund, so we'd have been better off getting our Jim Thompson 'goods' at the Duty-Free Jim Thompson store at the airport before departing!

Oasis. This is well worth a trip and provides a tranquil oasis in bustling Bangkok. The authentic Thai buildings are beautifully preserved, the grounds are beautiful and calming, and the tour is interesting and not too long winded. Stunning artifacts are on show, plus a taste of the lovely fabrics Jim Thompson created. The shop is quite small and pricey, so a seperate trip to the factory store may be best for shoppers.

Bangkok Highlight. My Mom and I LOVED this place. The grounds are beautiful and the story is so fascinating. We had a great lunch in the cafe before the tour. Slot of the silks are quite pricey, but I was able to get some prints and cards for framing. I don't see how anyone could think this place was boring!

I want his house.. His devotion to Siamese architecture and culture are evident. I love his house so much, I want it!The guides are really good, many language options. They speak fluently, warm helpful and knowledgeable. The shop is great too. I love a book I bought there, a children's book about solving a missing vase at Jim Thompson's house.

This is worth the visit. I loved this place. Spent loads of money buying things for family and friends. I like the merchandise on sale. The items are generally more expensive but the quality is what matters. I love the handbags !!! Just my style. Highly recommended !!!

Great history and view of early SE Asia.. Very low key attraction after the crowds of other sites in Bangkok and the tour guides offer lovely insight into what the region was like as the world discovered Thai silk.

Well worth a visit. Jim Thompson was certainly an unusual chap but this is an essential place to go to. His house is lovely and well worth a visit. Tour guides in your language are provided as part of the entry fee.

Good place to visit, with time for lunch. Visitors to Jim Thompson House can take a tour of his Silk merchants original home set in a lovely garden setting. Plan to stay for lunch as well as the restaurant serves good Thai food and has a lovely outdoor deck which is set in the garden beside a pool of carp. Very peaceful setting. Some (expensive) silk items are available for sale within the store.

Loved it!. It is a beautiful edifice and a blend of cultures. I could imagine it full of life, and the people who were fortunate to visit during its prime. We felt we "knew" Jim Thompson after visiting his stunning and somehow quietly elegant and peaceful home, and would love to return. My personal favorite was the dining room. We loved Bangkok, Thailand as a whole, and loved the Thai people.Betsy Williams, Lenoir North Carolina.
not so interesting. very touristic location nut nice too see if you have nothing else to do. house of JT is not far from Siam and easy to reach with sky train

Jim Thompson's house in Bangkok Thailand;. Jim Thompson's Is interesting it has a lot of extremley old artifacts and collections. It is very tourts centered now. I am sure it looks nothing like it did when He resided there. It is full of history and tourest prices. Take it as a experience and look to make any silk purchases els where.I feel it is a good information and history stop. but beyond that get out and find the real silk makers and workers. But as a educational stop it is good. He kind of robbed a lot of Thai history but if he didn't some one else would have.

Interesting tour. We quite enjoyed our tour around, seeing the things he collected and fitted into the design of the house. I must admit we still felt at the end that we didn't understand the celebrity / veneration of the man, but the collection and the house is very nice, the guides are very good and it is worth a look.
worth a visit. Take the guides your, which takes about an hour. Knowledgable staff make this an interesting insight to how this house has become a tourist destination when in Bangkok.

Worth the visit!. ...even the taxi driver had a bit of trouble finding this place, but once there we thought it looked very quaint. The architecture is amazing and the grounds very nice. A 35 minute tour in your language gives you the whole story about Jim Thompson and his love of Thailand and silks. A walk through the gift shop is nice to look at but didn't see many wallets come out. It's pricey.

Jim Thompson. Spy or not a Spy? Was he eaten by a tiger when he disappeared on his walk? Jim Thompson had a fasinating live and an equally interesting disapperance. His house is an interesting place if you have time but not a place to go out of your way to see if you have other places on your list.
amazing place well worth to see. JT is one of my favorite brands, what they do with fabric and use in ties, pillow case and handkerchiefs is one of the gems of bangkok and his old house is as unique

Nice spot to explore. We had a bit of confusion finding the Jim Thompson House, but once led in the right direction, was very close to the skytrain station. Very nice little tour. Silk clothing and scarves are a bit pricey, however.

Too expensive, there are similar places with the same product quality and cheaper..... They used to be the Lonely ones, with no competion, but there are too many copy cats who are just as good, they have to bring their prices down and diversify.

Its ok... Guys, if you like the cultural stuff you can do it, there is a tour in all languages, for about 35 mins, where you get to see his house, but for me it was just ok. and the last thing I did before i left the city. there is no reason to buy any silk scarfs from there, get them from the market, so much cheaper!

See this place!. I had read about this place and decided to try to see it. It's about 200 meters off the main road. I walked from Siam BTS station, we should have walked from Siam station, which is closer.Lots of history here; the re-vitalization of the Thai silk industry, recent geo-political angle and Jim Thompson's espionage background, and the preservation of significant examples of Thai traditional architecture.The museum site also has a great bar and restaurant, and we thoroughly enjoyed our meal there.In all, a very good visit!

An Oasis in the middle of Bangkok. This place is well worth a visit. It is an oasis of calm amongst the craziness. Very interesting tour and then time to wander round by yourself and take photos etc. Beautiful building housing some very interesting artefacts, and a couple of ponds with big fish and tortoises.

My very favorite tourist trap. I am very interested in architecture and felt that the Jim Thompson house was a must-see even though I knew it was a tourist trap. You pay 100 Baht for a 40 minute tour, but what they really want is for you to spend much more at the gift shop! Yet the tour and house were both truly fascinating. I was floored by the beauty of the architecture and the interiors. Our guide spoke very good English and was highly engaging. You were free to wander the grounds after the tour (but you could not go back inside the main house or take any photos inside). There was something beautiful in every corner you looked, both within the house and in the lush gardens.This is a very worthwhile trip. For anyone who is worried this experience isn't somehow "authentic,' well, you may be right. But it is extremely interesting for anyone interested in architecture, landscape design and interior design.
Very interesting trip. We had an English speaking guide who took us round the complex of six teak houses - it is only a half hour tour but is very interesting, worth a bit of a detour.
Interesting. A perfect place for beautiful ideas for souvenirs and gifts, an interesting place to visit with some history. I would happily visit again.

Nothing interesting other than the fact he dissapeared.. Spare yourself the trouble. Sure it's a nice house, but the story behind Jim Thompson is not interesting at all. This place is a must skip. Just a waste of time.

Stunning oasis in bustling bangkok. A great place to visit, the house from the late jim Thompson is absolutely beautiful and gives a feel of what bangkok houses were like before the onslaught of concrete.

NICE, BUT NOT THE WOW! I EXPECTED. Every guidebook said this was #1. We went there, it was nice, but nothing too rah rah. Visit the compound of the American who came to Thailand, loved Thai silk & virtually created the industy that exists today. Cool if you are into that. It's just a restored house, the story of him & a giftshop. Skip it if you are not a historian.

A hidden paradise in the Megatropolis. My Aunt suggested we go here as she is a massive fan of Bangkok and knows it really well.This place is really beautiful and amazingly tranquil. You get off at the Stadium Skytrain station, the same as you would for MBK shopping mall. However just a few hundred meters down a side road and you arrive at Jim Thompsons House. They run guided tours in English and French (and Thai probably) which are obligatory and well worth paying attention to.You may never have heard of Jim Thompson but he pretty much revived and popularised the Thai Silk market.The house is a collection of 6 traditional Thai buildings turned into a mansion. It's really quite amazing that such a tranquil and beautiful place sits in the middle of such a massive, busy and polluted city.Well worth it.

One of the great houses in the world.. Ultra sophisticated, particularly for it's time. JT house is a must visit. Also his stores. Greatly styled merchandise that seems like major brands at half the price.

Great architecture. Jim Thompson House is actually a combination of several houses dismantled and rebuilt into one home along a canal. The teak wood and relics are true eye candy. Just visiting the grounds is nice but the tour is better - learn more about the silk industry and Jim Thompson's impact on it. Thompson, himself, is an interesting character and it shows in the design and details of his house.
Interesting place. Unexpected attraction near centre of town easioly reached on Metro with free shuttle for final 250m. Interesting buildings and artefacts with guided tour included in price.

Interesting and easy to find. Aside from seeing a peek into the life of Jim Thompson through his house , one can see the lovely hand made silk products and you can also sample Thai treats at the cafe. If you have extra time , do drop by for a visit and then just walk all the way to MBK to resume your shopping !
Always fascinating. No matter how many times one visits this house-museum, there is always something new to discover and learn.

Great insight in to the olden times. This is a nice little quiet place, and quite different from the other touristy sites. Down one of the side streets, it's a little oasis of calm. Great guides who'll talk you through who Jim Thompson was and what legacy he's left behind. Nice place to visit.

Wonderful museum. I enjoyed the visit very much. Unfortunately it is only available with a guide. I wish I could wander around the rooms and have a closer look on Mr.Thompson's treasures. The house is beautiful but there's no signage at all, so all you learn you learn from a guide. The guide was a very nice lady which did her best but sometimes it was difficult for me to understand her English.Entrance fee is 100 baht for adults, 50 bahts for under-25 and students which includes the guided tour. Also they have a nice shop and restaurant.

An Interesting man with great taste as shown in his house.. Any five start hotel across Asia will have it's Jim Thompson shop selling Thai silk. Interesting to look up his story on Wikipedia before visiting to get some background information.You can get to his house easily by Skytrain. Just take the train to the National Stadium, keep to the right when you get off (sign posted) walk down the steps and turn back on yourself when you reach the bottom. You then take the next turning on the right which is signposted Jim Thompson House. Walk to the end of this road and you JTH is the last one on the left. Go early as it does get busy. Good restaurant attached for drinks or meals.You walk around the house and gardens with a guide which will give you a time when your tour begins. The whole experience takes about an hour probably longer if you find yourself in the shop afterwards. The house itself is traditional Thai which is interesting and decorated with some beautiful Asian objects. Well worth a visit.
An oasis in the middle of Bangkok. Beautiful old Thai house, with a great garden. Love all the Thai and Burmese antiques inside. Very cool!

Jim Thompson shop. I did not go to the museum as my fellow traveler was only interested in shopping for silk. Jim Thompson has many shops around the city but the museum shop is one of the best. Mall shops keep limited stock.they also have a factory outlet which we couldn't find due to limited time.The scarves at Jim Thompson are outstanding design and quality. as it is a brand, they are expensive but if you want to indulge, this is probably the place to go.You can also find cushion covers, shirts, tshirts, ties and material per meter.

Don't expect to see the history of silk. The house, it's designer/owner and interior adornments are all fabulous. Jim Thompson was clearly a visionary but, since he is the person who, single-handedly revitalized the Thai silk industry, I really would have liked to hear a bit about that and the processes involved beyond the 'he figured out how to make coloration of silk waterfast'. Flipping an entire wall was genius; I wish I could find some of those antiques. Alas.... The store is great but go to the MUCH larger one, also downtown, for the best selections. No change in price.

The very best of Bangkok. The house itself is beautiful, luxurious and very stylish, which is enough to make it worth a visit. If you add the history of an American native who fell in live with Thailand and created this place and you imagine his everyday live with the help of your guide (guided tours are compulsory and included in the price of the ticket), it become an even greater experience.

One of the 'Museums' in Bangkok you must see. My wife had read a book about Jim Thompson and a visit to this location was high on her agenda. It's a wonderful little oasis in the city. Kept in pristine and original condition with delightful gardens and a coolness which is welcome in the humidity of Bangkok. Entry fee is very reasonable [which includes a guided tour 30 mins - english or french speaking from what I could see] 100bht 25 years and over, 50bht under 25 [I think I've recalled this price correctly.]

Informative tour. I visited the place only on my fifth trip to Bangkok as I was passing anyway and I loved it. The entrance fee - guess it was about a hundred baht - included a guided tour which was very professional. Good impression of a rich man's paradise, you can avoid the shop and the restaurant anyway. Get there from BTS National Stadium and continue with a canal boat on Klong Saen Sep.

Wow.. Incredible history, knowledgable staff, incredible food and a sense of absolute wonder about the whole place.We're lucky that It was not very busy when we went and had a fantastic time. A Bangkok must see for sure.
high quality right price. If you want quality silk Jim Thompson is one of best shop in thailand.I have visited many times this shop in bangkok.don't miss.

Well worth a visit. Easily reached by the Sky Train this tranquil museum is so worth a visit. A fascinating glimpse into a bit of Bangkok's history as well as somewhere peaceful to sit afterwards with a refreshing drink.

exquisite haven with excellent facilities. The gardens of the JTH are simply glorious, using carp pools, fish bowls, ponds, and shrubbery to create one of the most beautiful ambiances you can imagine. The assembly of teak houses is a delight, and the facilities (restaurant, toilets, shuttle, etc.) are beautifully executed. Even the staff uniforms are a treat for the eye.

A tranquil Oasis right near Siam Square. I really enjoyed the tranquil and relaxed feel of this place. tours are compulsory and are in English and French, but the guides are very knowledgeable and add to the experience.

Interesting collection of buildings. If you go to Bangkok, a big, noisy (and fun!) city, this is a must. The buildings are beautiful and pretty tranquil and you come away with a sense of what Bangkok might have been like in a slower and quieter time. The mystery surrounding Thompson adds to the interest of the visit.

Silk spinning. The story behind Mr. Thompson is fascinating. The location of his home is worth seeing. The shop is very expensive and while nice quality I felt it not worth the cost. There is an employee who sits in the courtyard and spins the fibers.

Very interesting assembly of Thai buildings. This site has an interesting history because if was constructed by Jim Thompson, the Thai silk magnate, as his home. He later disappeared while on vacation in the Cameron Highlands of Malaysia in 1967. To this day, nobody knows what happened to him. His "house" is actually a compound containing a number of buildings decorated with many Thai artifacts and pieces of Asia art. There is also a Jim Thompson Thai Silk store located there.

Quiet and small-scale in a city known for neither!. There are better places to see Thai artifacts in a small setting, but Jim Thompson remains important and his home is wonderful! The San Sap Khlong is right out back, the gardens are wonderful, even the Spirit House is cool! Guides vary in their expertise and English skills, so listen to them talk before deciding which tour to take. The whole experience is a cooling, quieting, relaxing, and intellectually stimulating time, amidst a wonderful collection of Thai culture. A high-priority stop!

I found it!. Our conference group toured the Jim Thompson House one evening. Was fascinating place really. The restaurant meal afterwards was fine (starter was amazing), but kinda went down hill after that. I suppose catering for a large group isn't the easiest, so the main was quite cool when it arrived. But nice location and venue - but it is at the far end of the Soi. My previous attempts followed the signs, but I never even though of walking up to the end as the tourist maps I've got mark the house at the entrance of the Soi, not 500m away. There are golf carts available to take you the length of the Soi, but obviously I never saw those on my previous attempts to visit.

Meh. If you want to passively digest a tourist attraction, this is the one for you! Where else can you have a golf cart drive you from the main road down the side street to the front gate so you don't have to actually walk. Where else can you marvel at an American who built a traditional Thai house, only to furnish it with Chinese art. Don't forget the over-priced restaurant where you can enjoy air conditioning. Okay, sarcasm aside; I'm sure you'll enjoy this attraction if you're over the age of 60. However, I do not think it's worth the trip; there are a lot more interesting things to see in Bangkok.
Lovely Thai house. Didn't want to take compulsory tour but glad we did. Interesting. Beautiful house and garden setting.
Worth A Visit. Jim was lost in the bush many years ago. But his house and cloth items and paraphernalia is on display and purchase at this pleasant place to visit.

Cool!. Jim Thompson House was actually much cooler than I expected it to be. The silk-processing demonstration was interesting as was the Jim Thompson story - literally good enough to make into a movie. The house itself was beautiful; a bit of an oasis in that part of the city. We stayed for a snack after the tour just to hang out on the patio by the fish pond.

An oasis in the midst of Bangkok. Hidden away from the hustle and bustle of downtown Bangkok. It is a few minutes walk from the tourist mecca of MBK and well worth it. If you are a fan of Jim Thompson shops then a visit here is a must especially for a bit of history lesson. Excellent in-house guides and a cafe to rest your weary feet before you descend on the other mecca - Paragon shopping mall. Good access by Skytrain.
Oasis. It was lovely seeing a bit of history in the middle of this busy city. Easy to reach by skytrain or taxi. Would have liked a bit more about his actual life and the silk ndustry

Exceeded expectation. Thought this was a 100% tourist trap at first. We needed to fill our time with something more interesting than more buddhas. The tour was highly educational and interesting, and the collection very eccentric and unique. Overall very impressed and would recommend it. The gift shop is highly overpriced, but that's what you get with brand names...

History and Beauty. A look at old Bangkok with lovely guides in a home museum, and education on silk weaving. Shop is expensive, but beautiful. Thompson was an American who restored attention to native silk production.

An Oasis in Bangkok. You have to make sure that you are correctly dressed to enter this site, check out the advice on dress codes for tourist sites and temples in Bangkok, it is quite confusing as it sometimes appear there are different rules for different people but if you do your best you will get there. The house was magnificent and we were in time for a tour in English which was free of charge, well worth a visit if you are interested in Thai history and architecture and culture. There is lots to see at the site and you can fill a morning or more here. It is out of the way of the main attractions so you will need to get a taxi, it is easy to get a taxi back if you go outside of the gates there are usually some waiting.

Intereresting and informative. We visitied Jim Thompson's House in Bangkok this November. It is very near the Sky Train station. There is a shuttle service that takes you from the top of the road to the house, but it only takes about 5 minutes to walk it.You are greeted by a member of staff, and are taken to the front desk, where you are given a ticket and time, uusually within 30 minutes or so. At the appointed time, you are then given a tour of the house.It is quite unusual, in that Jim Thompson, being an Amercan, who fell in love with Thailand, has bough in quite a few modern conveniences to a very traditional setting. The guide will point out these points to you. For example, it has a a modern WC. It also has a table setting for guests, whoch tradional homes don't. They eat on the floor, or a very low table.The collection of art work and silks are beautiful, and if you take the time to go to the shop, and browse the book about the house, you will see that his mysterious dissaperance in the jungle, only adds to the mystique and charm of the house.Worth a visit, just to get a idea of how much influence he had on the silk trade.Also has a lovely cafe in pretty surroundings.
Ok place. Nothing great to say. If you really wish to see a thaihomes interior, then yeah. Can see many antique displays there. Guides are very friendly there.
Loved the house & tour.. The gardens after the noisy Bangkok streets, the tour guide was excellent & I love the TShirts I bought only bugbear they had very few larger sizes.

East meets West in Bangkok. This is a great change up to the hustle and bustle of touring Bangkok. The Jim Thompson house is a beautiful time piece shocasing the charm of Thai style organized by an international American expat.I am glad I went. I wish I could have taken more photos. There is a lovely restaurant and a museum store with many fine silk products.The history of Jim Thompson's life would have been enough of a draw for me, but the beauty he saw and collected around Thailand really makes this a must stop destination, especially for those with a flair for interior design.
Fresh cafe within museum. Much better than expected area to sit down and eat after visiting the museum. Freshly choosen dishes with nice surroundings like water springs and lots of flowers.

Very nice place to visit....... Very interesting place to visit for a couple of hours. We took the BTS to National Stadium station, just walked down the steps and found complimentary shuttle buggy that takes you the 150 yards to the entrance.100 baht entrance fee that includes a guided tour lasting approx 45 mins which is very interesting and highly recommended.Great photo opportunities on the ground floor and gardens but no pictures allowed inside the house.Restaurant, snack bar and silk shop within the grounds.Overall a very pleasant way to spend a couple of hours in Bangkok, don't understand why I never did this before now !!!

Journey back in time. Although I travelled to Bangkok about 8 times during the last 11yrs I somehow never fancied to visit Jim Thompson's house despite it being one of the the top-10 sights in Bangkok.This November I finally went there, mainly because I have already seen most other sights in the city, and I must admit I understated the attractiveness of this beautiful estate.While being on the ground it's hardly imaginable you are in downtown Bangkok.The estate consists of one main teak-building and several smaller side-buildings, located in a beautiful, lush jungle-garden. The entry fee of THB 100 is (partly) used for the Jim Thompson foundation.

Insight into Bangkok's past. Jim Thompson (of Thai-silk fame) created his home by combining a number of traditional teak Thai houses into a grand residence alongside one of Bangkok's canals, in which he showcased his collection of Thai cultural antiques. It is necessary to take a guided tour which lasts approx 30 mins, with different languages rotated throughout the day. The guide on my tour was reasonably fluent, and certainly charming. The house includes tropical gardens which provide some relief from the humidity, and there is a restaurant, but not a less formal cafe, as well as a Jim Thompson retail outlet. The house is easily accessible (walking distance) from National Stadium skyrail station - take the exit closest to the end of the line and which gives access to the footpath over the road from the stadium. Visiting this attraction is a worthwhile thing to do in a visit to Bangkok as it provides insight into how the wealthy lived during a bygone era, and also for the quality of the artifacts on show.

Very interesting. Jim Thompson's House was just near our hotel so it was just a quick stroll. Quite beautiful in its architecture and interesting in that it is eactly as it was when Thompson lived in it. The gift shop houses fine quality silk and cotton items at good prices. The house is located just near the MBK centre so a shopping day can be planned around the visit.

High class and well preserved. Before visiting the jim Thomson House, I suggest to read about his story, but if you have a guide, it is also fine. The House is unique and the exhibition of silks fantastic.Prefer opening hour or later in the afternoon, sometimes there are many tourists in the same time.

Must do in BKK. Worth a trip to this place to be inspired by one mans vision plus educate yourself into Thailands silk industry. You must do a guided tour here. You can not walk around in the house by yourself. However my tour was very good and the guide was wonderful.

A place for Thai architecture, garden and antique. This is the second time I visit Jim Thompson House and still feel great about it. The house shows the elegence of Thai house architecture, Thai garden and full of magnificent antiques.
Worth the visit. Beautiful old teak house in the heart of Bangkok a lovely history with the house love to take friends they are always impressed.

Relaxing place to spend a little time. Enjoyed the half hour tour, our guide did a very nice job and was able to answer any questions that were asked. Beautiful architecture and a wonderful collection of antiques. Jim Thompson story is an interesting one full of intrigue! We really enjoyed strolling around the gardens and house after the tour was completed as well as the display on making silk and the history of the Thai Silk industry. An interesting location right in the city. If walking there from the sky train station, you may have trouble finding a sign if walking on the right side of the road heading west as the signs for Bahn Jim Thompson are on the left side of the road; because of bus traffic we missed them, but did see the ones for east bound traffic when we turned around to walk back. The soi is right across the street from The National Stadium.

So that is how silk is made.. We went to the Jim Thompson House on the last day of our trip before flying out of Bangkok the next day. After spending the previous two weeks in Thailand, I didn't have high expectations for seeing any more antiques. The best part of the visit was that I was able see several of the steps required to product silk fabric. The house is beautiful and the on-site restaurant was good, but the 'how-to' was the thing that I took away from my visit.
Charming authentic Thai house. Great place to take visitors and best of all you can eat at the marvelous restaurant in the grounds .. and also do your JT shopping ... always beautiful things to buy.
Amazing few hours. Lovely time spent in a mansion from another era, shop is full of nice well priced silk products, lounge and tea room lovel.Well planned and set out for tour.

Interesting side visit after shopping, good lunch location. The Jim Thompson House is right down the street from MBK, Paragon, Siam Square and a day of shopping. After battling the crowds and running up the tab on the Visa, come here for a bit of history, a bit of tanquility and a good meal. Jim Thompson was one of the characters running about in SE Asia - his history and disappearance are tied up in the battles with Communism, colonialism and the post-WWII world. His company's silk creations are some of the best gifts you can bring home. And the restaurant has excellent Thai food in a lovely peaceful setting. Worth a visit, before jumping back into the scrum.

Delicious. Nice house, with history and atmosphere, owned by an intelligent and handsome American man. I m a picture addicted so I didn t like that it s not allowed to take pictures inside the building. Anyway, i don t conplain, the visit is amousing.

A must see, old original house with a history. Take Skytrain to national stadium, follow sign wait at the entrance of teh Soi (street) a golf cart will pick you up ;) Thai service as usual, guided tours in English French etc fabulous old house in the middle of the buzzing city, also recommend to eat or have a drink at their restaurants excellent food at reasonable prices

Really well-done and a must-see. I've been fascinated with the Jim Thompson story for years, and have read just about every book about the guy. This was prompted by my first visit to the house about a decade ago. I thought it was time to re-visit the house, and I'm very glad I did.It's beautifully preserved. The antiques are wonderful, and the site itself is an oasis in Bangkok's urban jungle. The difference between this most recent visit and my first one 10 years ago? It's a lot more commercial. But that's to be expected. We had lunch at the restaurant and the food was really top-notch. While the tour is just 30 minutes, we ended up spending a couple of hours here. I highly recommend the Jim Thompson house to any visitor to Bangkok who is interested in the Bangkok of old.

A beauty to see. It is beautiful and he sure had a taste for nice artifacts. Very well decorated. Nice garden. You can also see how the produce silk. Dont miss it. We got there by taxi-boat. the canal is right behind the house.
Wow expensive !. That is the clothes etc but the house is well worth a visit to imagine what a wonderful place Bangkok was 70 years ago !
beautiful. wow what a beautiful, peaceful house this was. amazing history from the man who invented thai silk. the tour is highly recomended and admin was 100bht which was very reasonable

Very interesting. The tour through the house is just 30 minutes...the house it self is amazing and beautiful...those interested in Asian architeture, this is a must visit place...also the store on the location is amazing selling all Jim Thompson brand products.
Thai silks must see.. The best and most exclusive selection of Thai silks and products anywhere. Superb! Must visit. Exquisite ambiance.
amazing. Very attractive place for peoples. Incredibly amazing, beautiful trees scenery and also a Jim Thompson Building. I really enjoyed it with my wife. Really this is heart of Bangkok.

small oasis in center of bangkok. one of my surprise favorites in bangkok - beautiful trees, shady - even on a hot, humid bangkok day. the guided 35 min tour was excellent - we had a tour guide that spoke impeccable english. must take off your shoes during the house tour. decided it was worth the $60 expense for a great quality Jim Thompson original silk tie for the husband. even enjoyed the separate limited special arts exhibit upstairs. enjoyed a relaxing meal at the cafe - great view. we spent a leisurely 2-3 hrs here

This is a must if you are in Bangkok and love homes and gardens!. We had been to this place before but took friends for the first time. they lived it and said it was the highlight of Bangkok. Get off the Sky Train at the National Stadium Exit 1 but then turn left at the bottom of the escalator and you will see a complementary shuttle bus to Jim T's house. Once inside the grounds you are given a time slot for your tour. You can spend time in the lovely air conditioned shop while you wait. The air conditioned restaurant is well worth a visit too.

Overhyped. The place is OK. The place is built in a traditional Thai style but there is nothing unique about it other than it is well maintained. The entry price is expensive and the store sells all high end items.In case you are short of time you can skip this place.
Thai Silk, the best souvineer.. If youre searching for a great gift to bring home Thai silk is the way to go and Jim Thompson is the place to get it.

Loved this place. I absolutely loved this place it is truly amazing the mystery of Jim Thompson is fascinating and the silks etc are lovely I purchased a few things to bring home and a book on the history of the building you step into this little oasis and you are next to a canal that runs of the main river it is cool, clean and extremely quiet a fantastic 1/2 day tour ...they provide tour guides for you and they are very well versed in the house will go again
Definitely worth a visit. Really interesting and the guide (included in the price) was superb. A little oasis in the heart of Bangkok.

Must see. I was more fascinated by the story of the man, who become famous by his hard work and wit. Museum is interesting to discover traditional Thai houses setup. Jim Thompson shop holds good quality goods , though prices might seems high by local standards.
An American in Bangkok. But not just any American. Jim Thompson's taste was exquisite. Every oblect, every aspect of the house pleases. This is quite simply my Number 1 place to see in Bangkok

A Must. A great way to spend an hour or so, good story, and great building. You can take the Sky Train almost right there, the old Klong (water street), is really cool, the old Muslim Village that used to do a majority of his Silk weaving is just behind the home of Jim Thompson......is a must, I always get my 80 year old Mum some lioves her Silk hankies

Historical Bangkok. This is probably more of a destination for gals. There is a lot of history tied up in Jim Thompson and the silk trade. I found it fascinating. Even better was the shopping at the end!!

A PLACE TO VISIT, JUST A DREAM IN A BUSY TOWN. it's just a dream to visit this place, where J.Thompson lived when he was alive in Thailand.his house is actually a museum that you have to visit it. You have no right to miss it.This place is just in the center of a very busy town, with pollution, traffic jam, noise, and you feel been like nowhere.The wood house is just amazing, with many antiques and so beautiful pieces.You can have something to drink or eat in an little nice place and of course you can buy different items most in silk very nice and well designed.But year after years prices are becoming more and more expensive and we really think that me made a very good deal the first time we went in Jim Thomson shop in Bangkok

Not much to see and not much to buy besides some overpriced silk!. A bit disappointing as it is not really a historic building from my point of view. Located near Patpong it is just a rather small building housing a silk shop originally owned by Jim Thompson, he was a silk dealer and he masterly disappeared and was never found hence it has become a "famous" building. The silk is overpriced and one can buy similar quality much cheaper in other malls or local markets.
Oasis. loved this oasis of calm and relax down a side street of busy Bangkok. The tea shop is refreshing break from the heat

My Favorite tourist Attraction in BKK. I did the Grand Palace and all the big Wats once, years ago, and have never felt the need to go back, but I go to the Jim Thompson house again, and again! I love the peace and serenity of the garden, even though the house is now surrounded by high rises, you still get a sense of what it was like to live in Bangkok 60 plus years ago. I'm also absolutely in love with the house itself- this is what I want to build when I'm ready to retire somewhere warm and tropical!!The guided tour is well done (usually let by Thai students, for whom this is an "after school" type job and a chance to practice their English, but they clearly receive thorough training). and takes about half an hour. Jim Thompson accumulated some really wonderful and unique art, and it is a pleasure to see it up close and in a house (rather than stuffy museum) setting. After the tour you are free to wander the grounds at your leisure and contemplate the life and mystery of the man who helped build the Thai economy and then disappeared without a trace so long ago. there are some nice spots to sit and relax tucked away from the rest of the tourists, and the restaurant is nice (if relatively pricey). I always end up spending WAY too much money in the gift shop, but they do give you directions to the Jim Thompson outlet if you are so inclined.
Delightful. the perfect lunch in a great setting....food very authentic at reasonable price.Not To be missed as part of your visit to the historical house

A Must. This was a highlight of our trip. The tour of this house, located in an upmarket lane in the centre of the city was fantastic. Jim Thompson was an amazing collector of all things Asian and the house and gardens are a delight.

A peaceful, calming tour in a very busy City. Visited Jim Thompson House as it was highly recommended. House is beautiful with amazing Thai antiques and designs. Gives an insight as to how this influential man lived. We went on one of the tours which was given by a charming tour guide who was able to answer our groups numerous questions ranging from Jim Thompson's personal life, architectural design and what she thought had happened to Jim. Amazing!

Average visit.. I took the BTS to National Stadium station and from there it was a 10 mins walk. You need to take the scheduled tour around the house which takes about half and hour per session. The house is nice with wonderful antiques collected by Jim Thompson throughout his travels. I find this place quite average though, there's not much history associated to it apart from the antiques. The only thing good is the quality silk they sell at the gift shop but even then, Jim Thompson shop is available at most shopping complexes in Bangkok including Siam Paragon and Don Mueng International Airport. Go only if you have time to kill.

nice. Down a small Signposted alleyway near mbk mall lies this oasis of a traditional Thai house. Nice architecture and some interesting items inside. Guided tour by good English speaking guide. Entrance fee reasonable. A nice getaway from the madness of Bangkok. Restaurant looked good but we did not have time to eat here. I must admit I had never heard of JT or his silk, but I gather it is pretty big brand in Thailand.

Jim Thompson's House. It was easy to walk to Jim Thompson's House from our hotel, The Novotel at Siam Square. We did a guided tour of the house in English and our guide was excellent, very informative and funny. The shop has beautiful items for sale, especially the pillow cases.

Great for the Architecture & Antiques. I passed this by on previous trips to Bangkok, thinking it was too "touristy", but when I mentioned to a local colleague my interest in Thai teak houses he told me I must go see Jim Thompson's house. He was spot on. I was enthralled by the history of the house and of teak houses in general, by his collection of antiques, and by his personal story. The tour is only 30 mins but then you can look around the grounds and lovely garden on your own. Yes, it's a tourist destination with a gift shop and restaurant, but it's nicely done and frankly charming. Not everyone will enjoy this attraction, but if you're interested in architecture or antiques I think you'll like it. The fee is only 100 baht. I recommend getting there early to beat the heat and the crowds. Afterwards you can enjoy a cold beer or smoothie by the koi pond and soak up the ambiance.

An experience for the first time traveller to Bangkok. This place has quality silk with a wide variety to suit different occasions. The history of Jim Thompson's house is fascinating and travellers need to remember that many other major towns in Thailand have this outlet.

Superb house. The house was superb, a great place to view and see how Thai (or other historical) elements can be combined with modern living. It does help to go early, as you are only allowed via a tour and they schedule them by language. Or, send someone for the tickets and then come back later. Otherwise you'll be waiting at the store or cafe, which the latter seemed a bit expensive. Also, don't bring too many bags and such since you'll have to leave them in lockers along with your shoes.

Nice tour. I have been to BGK several times and never really wanted to go to this place. This time I was visiting on my honeymoon and so my wife wanted to go, so you know what that mean, I wanted to go now too! We went via cab to that part of town and enjoyed it very much. The tour was run by a beautiful thai woman in traditional dress who spoke very good English. It was very informative and I had no idea about the life this man led. The gardens are beautiful and the shop was full of really well made Thai silk items. I also had no idea about the branding the company has done with its Silk wears. The quality is top notch though and I enjoyed my visit very much.

Cannot miss. Jim Thompson was a mith and an art collector. His house in Bangkok, actually six teak thai houses together,are very worth visiting. A lot of artifacts and a beautiful spot. Do not miss it.
Interesting and worth a visit. Really enjoyed visiting. Traditional Thai house. Inexpensive. Well myaintained. Guides are good. Thompson death mystery adds allure. Highly recommended.

interesting, but would like to learn more.... This is a very good example of old Thai architecture and decor... the story of Jim Thompson is very unique but they need to update with some multimedia presentations or some thing... I wanted to know more..

wonderful house. You can feel all the passion of a traveller in this house, very well decorated and built. If you chose to take the guide you will learn a lot about this person and his adventourus life in Thailand, in an age when travelling was not so easy like now
You just have to go. Read a little about the fellow first,its interesting am I have been several times.The silk is stunning and the history of the man is really fascinating

Interesting. Never really been into history but advise from friends we went and I actually really enjoyed what I learnt and saw. The house and items in it were fasinating, loved the design, would love to be able to build simular and set up a silk farm. Inspiring
So Thai by Thomson's view. This house was built by Jim Thomson. He is not Thai but he love everything about Thailand. This house will reflex Thai culture and combination of the foreigner taste.

Beautiful Garden. Lovely house to visit during the rain. We had a tour around the house (waited for an English tour - about 20 mins) and the tour went for about 40 mins, it was very informative. We took our shoes off and left our bags in a locker, a great idea as you would not want to knock into any valuable vase or statue while you were walking around
Nice Tshirts and handicrafts. Nice place for visiting once..the JT house is a good museum, their shop sells their excellent silk products and tshirts. Their restaurant serves excellent food as well.
Must see. I honestly did not know that to expect from this site. However, it was educational and the scenery and house is absolutely beautiful.

great house and gardens. This is a lovely house to visit, we had a tour around the house (waited for an English tour - about 20 mins) and the tour went for about 40 mins, it was very informative. We took our shoes off and left our bags in a locker, a great idea as you would not want to knock into any valuable vase or statue while you were walking around. Great history - very sad as Jim Thompson disappeared in Malaysia in 1967 and he was never seen again. HIs house is now a museum. The house is perfectly preserved just as he left it. It is an oasis in the middle of Bangkok. Lovely gift shop (very good quality items on sale) and a great book/card shop. The gardens are nice to stroll around in. All in all a lovely visit.
TIME WELL SPENT. We wondered why security was a strict until we saw the value of the collection. Beautifully preserved, guide was low key. Situated beside a busy klong.
o.k.. Don't be very disappointed if you don't see this. It's O.k., but kind of boring. we left the tour early

interesting architecture and lovely products. They conduct tours and has English speaking staff to share information about Jim Thompson. Lovely products made of Thai silk and is a must visit rack time I am in bKK

Very interesting. What a great place, right in the city. Beautifully preserved and an amazing house to visit, really gave us an insight in Jim Thompson and how he was important to Thailand. Recommended. Great cafe too.

Great touristics place. I visited there with my family and a young kid. They liked house tour provided several language translator, and we still have enough time for exploring gardens, fish pond, eating at their restaurant and shopping Jim Thompson skirf or tie. A kid was having fun to see turtles in the pond.

Lovely tranquil spot. Visited here several times over the years. The little attached cafe does a beautiful lunch overlooking the koi carp pond. Well recommended. The tourist shop is expensive and better prices available at the Jim Thomson factory outlet.

A lovely display of traditional Thai architecture and relics. A must visit. Had a lovely time visiting Jim Thompson's house. The traditional Thai architecture was interesting to see, and even more interesting to see how 6 small Thai houses had been compiled to make one large residence. The antiques scattered through the house and the gardens were very interesting. A nice way to spend an afternoon in Bangkok.
